LeBron James had big shoes to fill left behind by Michael Jordan, but I feel like he did his best even if his fictionalized self does come off as seemingly obnoxious compared to a chill Jordan those years ago.The things this movie did succeed in was its amazing visuals, animation, and performances (Don Cheadle did great as the eccentric villain Al G.), but fell short on the story. Lebron's son is kidnapped and must venture into the studio's computer server with the help of Bugs Bunny and co. To save him. You can place all kinds of TV and film references or characters in one movie for a cameo, but it's not enough if you can't get a great story working. A great family distraction for the kids, but looking at this sequel from an adult's perspective? It could potentially put them to sleep easy. Some audience members in my theater dozed off during the animation sequences, but finally woke up during the basketball scene, which I find hilarious than what was shown onscreen. Anyway, it's flawed, but in no way awful.

Review title: Ok sequel that doesn't capture the spirit of the original
Review_body: This is by no way a better movie than the original but Im watching Looney Toons play Basketball again but with upgraded animation. The story is simple but its a kids film, Dad has to save his son from an evil computer AI by playing basketball. The original former basketball player has to help Looney Toons after their world gets invaded. Both are so simple but people expect character development from a bunch of Cartoons and a Basketball player. We know who Lebron is and the Toons aren't going to change.The positives of the movie is that the Don Cheadle is goofy and a likeable villain who just wants to be human and appreciated. No one can deny the toons aren't likable same as Mickey Mouse just transcends every generation from their first introduction. As mentioned before the final game makes for great animations and shows how far these animators have come! Feel like a true video game not just Toon World. There's far to many cameos and nods to other films throughout the movie, recurring the Toons is just fun for old and young! Never thought i'd see Mad Max and a Clockwork orange in the film film let alone a kids animation!Then this is where we get the issues with the movie, no matter how simple the film is it doesnt hold you throughout the middle section of preparing for the game. Never really bought the father/ son relationship but didn't land. They tried to re-create Wayne Knights characters in Khris Davis but its the same script just played by a different person but not as well! A positive can also be a negative when having such adult characters being apart of the movie but changing Lola bunny for no reason for being to adult but keeping them involved, you literally have Pennywise next to the group that coined the phrase "Ultra Violence" just an odd choice from the WB execs. Flintstones, Yogi and Booboo, all DC characters and Harry Potter are all perfectly fine for kids but imagine having to explain what Game of Thrones is to a 4 year old!Overall its simple fun with some good laughs but can see why people arent happy with the remake and being disappointed!

Review title: The best film with the Justice League in I've seen all year.
Review_body: Similar to the first film; NBA superstar plays in animated environment against a team made up of copied and toonified NBA superstars, to ultimately learn a lesson about how he should treat his family. Oh, and his kid does some wild tapping on a keyboard/scanning stuff with his phone and there is a risk with giving AI too much control. Fun in places, nostalgic in others, but ultimately too much crammed in for one film.First of all, LeBron may be (I don't follow the sport) a great basketball player, but he never appeared comfortable on screen. There was basically zero chemistry between him and Cedric Joe, who's playing his son, and even the emotions associated with being toonified - like the crux of the film - looked pretty underwhelming to him. At first, this fits with the films message about family, but his best scenes come when he's turned into a toon and the animators cut loose. Why they didn't use his real family for the brief live action parts and increase the animated parts, I don't know.Secondly, this as a montage advert for a studio that's trying to gain new audiences (or other studio to buy them) for their back catalogue. With the number of films/shows/characters they've shoehorned in, it's worth a second watch; from Harry Potter to Batman (animated and live action) and the Justice League. From the Flintstones, Jetsons, Animaniacs and the old aliens from the first Space Jam, through King Kong, Game of Thrones, and - weirdly for kids film - the Matrix, Mad Max: Fury Road, Austin Powers, and Casablanca. They even had the Wizard of Oz and Clockwork Orange characters. Most of these made no sense to my under 10's, and the film executives - Sarah Silverman and Steven Yeun - scene was so meta it completely lost their attention. The Harry Potter parts got their attention, but I couldn't see them leaving going "I really want to watch Iron Giant" because of this film. Could see WB making a series with crossovers like this, sure, but here it was too fast to fully appreciate but too slow for the action of the film. Who were they actually supporting?Even the bad guy seemed derivative. An Artificial Intelligence; Al G. Rhythm! It's a name that made me think of the Animaniacs space episode where Al Gore is Al-5000 (2001: A Space Odyssey take off). They could have at least had him dance a bit more? For Don Cheadle this is easy money; he doesn't have to move much and after his years of Marvel CGI he's probably very used to acting to nothing, in front of a green screen. It was all very clever, but, again, why they didn't have a fully animated bad guy, I don't know.That's what saved this film and made it enjoyable; it's toon craziness. In a world sick of lockdown and Covid, job worries and family crisis, and where film goers are still asking who can pick up Thors hammer or why can't DC find enough light bulbs so their films aren't so dark, seeing an animated duck with its bill on backwards or randomly blowing stuff up with a truck load of dynamite is just fun. The Toon Squad training, the animated physics of falling, and simply all those cameos of old characters made me smile. It's just annoying they included so much annoying live action to get there.

Review title: People need to stop being so boring!
Review_body: People are slamming this film for being 'lousy' or 'not good' but this film is just fun as hell. It's insane with crazy call backs to the original and insane cross overs to other Warner bros properties like Batman and even Rick and Morty. I just had a fun time watching this film and that's what it's all about, some people just need to loosen up and stop being so boring. Yes the acting is pretty shocking from Lebron and even Don Cheedle surprisingly but it's still a good and enjoyable film. The animation is great and the scenes with the tunes are easily the best in the whole film. The end basket ball game is just fun and actually hilarious at times. I'm not saying this is a good film by any means this film has its flaws but all in all it is good fun. So go and get it watched and have a good time. Enjoyed it!
Why they decided to make this a remake is beyond me. Loony Tunes have pretty much died off and Lebron acting??? Don't know where to begin.

Review title: Not As Looney As The First Film
Review_body: Space Jam: A New Legacy is weaker than the first film, but it's still decent. It does have problems with a predictable story, pacing that feels way too long and the fact it would rely more onto LeBron James. But it can also have some fun moments with fantastic mix of visuals and 2D animation, impressive basketball powers and some likable charm from Looney Tunes and other Warner Bros properties. Of course, I could recommend this for those that grew up with Looney Tunes. But just like the first film, I would mostly recommend this if you're a basketball fan. The movie could use better ways with the writing, but at least it was decent after years from the first Space Jam. And at least it's better than the Tom and Jerry movie that came out earlier this year.

Review title: Slam Dunk or a Technical Fowl?
Review_body: Is this movie a Slam Dunk or a Technical Fowl?"Space Jam: A New Legacy" is fun!Sure it's impossible to top the original, but for the most part this sequel 25 years later works.Whereas the first one was on two levels for children and adults this new edition is more for the kids.Which is probably why my two offspring who loved "Space Jam" in the 90's are not warming to this latest incarnation.Congrats to all involved in this project on and off screen especially King LeBron James and Don Cheedle who is having a ball as "Al G Rhythm".The soundtrack is not as strong as the Michael Jordan version.The effects are a bit hit and miss.The storyline is not very original.But the ball game between the Toon Squad and the new Monstars is brilliant.I loved how so many of my fave Warner Brothers cartoon characters, whose voices I've been mimicking since I was a child and now I get paid for it, are filtered throughout this movie.Also loving the references to other WB movies in the audience at the big game.But let's leave well enough alone and NOT make a third instalment after Brisbane host the Summer Olympics in 2032.

Review title: A wonderful movie for all the family / LeBron & Bugs are so cool!
Review_body: Space Jam: A New Legacy is a wonderful movie for all the family. Take your kids to the cinema and enjoy & laugh with LeBron and all the Looney Tunes gang. There are very cool cinematic surprises too. I especially loved Don Cheadle's performance! The movie is funny, super entertaining, and cool. But, remember, it's a movie for kids & teenagers; so relax, don't criticise so much and enjoy! 10/10.
Wasn't expecting expecting much.But this is horrible.Animation was great but that was it.Hardly any major celeb cameras like the original.Not y recommended.

I can see why some people actually like this movie knowing how hyped up it was in the trailer with the cameos and action-packed elements this film wanted to provide. But I genuinely cannot like this movie. The first Space Jam didn't rub in this much of a cash grab like the sequel does. Space Jam, like many people have said, is basically a good movie because of how it was produced for its time when basketball was popular and animated commercials were always worth watching since they were very creative with what they would come up with in the making of them. Space Jam was definitely not a perfect movie, the only thing oscar-worthy was honestly the animation, but I still liked it for what it was from its time. But this sequel didn't need to happen. Instead of Michael Jordan we have Lebron James in the cliché father and son bonding plot which actually would've worked okay atleast with this movie if this was the only flaw. But this movie makes Lebron unlikable to his son manipulating him to be an athlete instead of what he wants to be which is a video game creator. Which is annoying to the audience. Michael Jordan never appears in this film which would've been forgivable if this movie was atleast okay. But since MJ told WB he didn't want to, WB hypes us up with Michael B Jordan in this movie instead, some people find it funny but I find it disgusting to anyone who wanted to see MJ. Atleast don't talk about him at all if he doesn't want to be in the film, seriously. We're focusing on someone else this time. The villain Al-G, who is also a live action character, is cringeworthy who plans to make the world his own game. The acting is noticeably bad unlike the first film. Lebron isn't just too chill, he's usually too awkward at times and so are many of the other live-action characters involved in the story. And this is a common problem with live-action animation hybrids but here it's a lot more noticeable since the Looney Tunes don't appear until later. And of course speaking of the Looney Tunes, even the Looney Tunes are a problem. Yes, I'm not kidding. The stupid controversy desexualizing Lola Bunny is honestly a sexist thing to do with a character. Compare Lola Bunny to Jessica Rabbit from Who Framed Roger Rabbit atleast, Lola wasn't even sexualized in the first place. But anyway, most of the Looney Tunes hardly get any roles. It's mostly Bugs Bunny and sometimes Daffy, Granny, and Sylvester. Pepe Le Pew was not even in this movie at all because of another dumb controversy about him sexually harassing women. This is the Looney Tunes like what do you expect? They were from a time when cartoons got away with a lot of things that wouldn't be allowed in cartoons nowadays. In the first Space Jam he was just teaming up in the basketball tournament like there wasn't even a joke about him chasing Penelope Pussycat who doesn't like him. And the animation is also problematic. Not only is the CGI too furry and realistic on the Looney Tunes but the idea of it makes no sense. They enter the live-action world hand-drawn but are "turned into" CGI and will be released back to 2D if they win the game, like what sense does this make? I mean yeah the CGI looks unsettling but still, this doesn't work. And even though this movie brings back traditional animation as well, the traditional animation in the first film did an outstanding job with the Looney Tunes, here it's noticeably downgraded, overly saturated, and less fluid as if Warner Brothers didn't make the budget. The only animation I was fine with was the robot that helped Al-G Rhythm. The only thing I can really like from the Looney Tunes is the voice acting (except for Lola) and maybe a few creative jokes in the Looney Tunes world that actually feel like the Looney Tunes. And no I am not talking about the Big Chungus joke where he apparently becomes canon. And of course, the cameos in this movie are all a lie. They all stay way back in the game's crowd blurred away doing nothing but spectating. And the movie's soundtrack is just too cheesy with constant rap and pop songs. This sequel was truly a mistake, I'm sorry.

Review title: Are you kidding me with these low reviews?
Review_body: This movie was a real surprise. I have no idea why so many people hate it. LeBron is a much better actor than MJ, and the jokes in this movie are great. Don't get me wrong, it's not a perfect movie, there are some bits that drag or that I'd change, but overall this was a great time. People need to take their nostalgia glasses off and view this movie by it's own merit. The acting is better, graphics are better, writing is better, it's a better movie. Ease up on it people, and allow yourselves to have fun.

In short, Space Jam 2, is what it was expected. A modern, colorful, chaotic kids' movie following the legendary vibe of Michael Jordan saving the Loony Tunes by playing basketball to an unforgettable soundtrack. You have everything, from nice graphics, kids oriented jokes, a modernized story using the streaming and social media universe instead of the old hole on the golf court and the hint for the parents in the cinema, that big data algorithms making entertainment might not be the preferred future. Next to a lot of marketing for the Warner Bros movieverse, you recognize that it was really tried to catch the never aging charm of Bugs Bunny and co within a faster changing world. You even see in the senseless story, that today's kids are expected to have less attention span, hence everything must be in a hectic and fast pace.But well, it will entertain kids and it will earn its cost. What it can't be called is a worthy sequel. The original is timeless as it caught the perfect timing. Michael Jordan was on basketball cards in every kids' room from wherever to even Vienna and Chicago Bulls were heroes without having seen one game. Cartoons were on the edge of dying out but still accepted in cinemas, and with "Believe I can fly" we have a song that is still played on parties today. Now we have a lead actor that only a few will know around the world (not talking about US), the hype is over, we have other major sports and trademarks to follow and with all the cameos and references, there is not one charming connection to the original, despite disappointing comments. In summary, a nice kids movie but a poor tribute to the legend of Space Jam.

Of course, it had the same boredom and lack of substance like the first one, but... from the half point of the movie it started to have meaning, message and getting looney, like they said. Yeah, they kept that and made it better. I laughed more at this than the other and Bugs motives and acts meant something, almost cried at the ending. I really would want one day to see my childhood heroes and hug them, I miss them. I'm really hoping to see more of these ideas and why not, another sequel with the next legend with my kids. Well done!

Review title: All the toys, none of the creativity
Review_body: Ohw boy... I tried to find it entertaining, but they just lost me at a certain point. At least they showed how WB used to be great with their classic movies. Just makes it more painful to see where they are at the moment. I don't even Blain LeBron. I understand the message I think that they wanted to convey, but the execution was poorly. All the toys, even made the Looney tunes 'real' to remind us that they could do that( Pikachu etc..)

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a movie that starts with Warner Bros dropping their IP like Lebron James dunking baskets. The pacing seems fast in the beginning but it gets slowed down in the middle so that Warner Bros can show off their properties correctly and perfectly. Don Cheadle looks the most polishing one when it comes to acting, LeBron James have done it ok but Michael Jordan did a really good job when it came to getting mixed with the cartoons. In terms of story you can summarise it with just two words which is showing off IP's and making you a little emotional like it's hundred's of predecessors. In terms of fun there is loads of fun in the whole movie. Every scene of this movie is filled with characters that we cherished through our whole childhood and teenage years. Warner Bros did manage to make this movie a watchable one with your family on a weekend with their IP's but they definitely failed to catch our eyes with the story and the other stuff. Overall if you have time on the weekend and if you love Warner Bros characters, otherwise there are other films to watch on the onlineverse.

I don't like the Luney Tunes, Basketball or LeBron (I dont even know the guy). But I liked this movie. The first half was boring, as we see LeBron and his family trying to find an excuse to get to the toon world. But once they get there, the madness begins!To me this was like YuGioh. They play a silly game, with high stakes. They have to combine all kinds of styles one way or the other. So we have live action, then live action and 3D, live action and 2D animation, live action with 3D and 2D animation... every combination is there. Just like in YuGioh the monsters are real, or they get sucked into the game and so on and sto forth. So in my book this is fine, even if it has been done over and over in various media.Many reviewers complain about this movie being a big advertisement. But that was Batman the Lego Movie, Ready Player One and Ralph Breaks the Internet. They all have product placements, King Kong and Iron Giant. But they don't have Rick and Morty!Some others complain about the 3D Looney Tunes. I was fine with that, as the movie explores and experiments with a bunch of different graphical styles, like Into the Spider-Verse. My fav style was Wonder Woman/ Lola Bunny.The story is stupid. But the premise is stupid to begin with. What is the challenge of competing with a pro in their own game? If the protagonist was a soccer player that was forced to play basketball, then I can see the challenge.But yeah, it's a silly cheesy movie. What do you expect? It's the Looney Tunes. Check out common sense outside the door and you should have fun.

Review title: two hours long promotional poster for warner bros roster of characters
Review_body: The actors are not to blame. La Bron James, Don Cheadle, and others do a reasonable job.The characters are not to blame, although it doesn't do the classic toons any favor being mixed with more recent and much less iconic.ones.The technic is not to blame, the special effects and animations are good.But one can't make a story of a catalogue. And this is what this film is, a catalogue of WB franchises, rather than closing credits it should end up with streaming and blu rays price lists.This is a little disheartening, the original holds great memories of watching it with my children.

Review title: Not as Atrocious as the Ratings And Responses, But It's Strangely Fun!
Review_body: A sequel to Space Jam?, who asked for this?, well it's here so I dunno what to say other then Space Jam is actually kind of a bad movie, it's overrated unfunny strange junk that I do not get, but with this new sequel, maybe it could be better or worse?, well I saw it today and... wow I was pleasantly surprised by it, like it was actually kind of weirdly entertaining but not exactly solid good.The comedy is much MUCH better then the first movie, it has the right tone and right kind of jokes to support the feature, I did laugh more then once which is more then what Space Jam did, the animation in 2D is quite spot on with the Looney Tunes and I love the Looney Tunes design, it's quite wonderful and rather smooth, along with strong movements and big expressions along with extraordinary different worlds Bugs and LeBron go to, the 3D animation is pretty good as well as looks good enough to be decent and stylish, the Looney Tunes themselves are just themselves but with tones of personality and laughs which is more then enough for me to like 'em, even Lola is better, LeBron himself is kinda charming and the villains are fun too, the voice both from the voice actors and the physical actors are great!, the story and sequences are more fun and entertaining then the first film, along with a pretty dope soundtrack.However with all that said, a few things stop this from being great, as funny as it is, sometimes it does get cringey like the use of dabbing and a strange rap by Porky, which really makes this really insufferable at times.., which doesn't help, also the movie is quite predictable and very dull, but thanks to the execution it did work for the most part, also the first few minutes with James' family is boring and unspecial but not as boring and Jordan's in the first movie, speaking of, James is good in the movie but can be awkward in his deliveries but is mostly pretty good, sometimes the 3D on the Tunes can be cheaply odd but that's only the real complaint I have with the visuals.So yeah..., this movie was.., surprisingly passable, I liked it more then I disliked it, it's a visual treat with the animation and special effects, it's funny and super clever at times, the Tunes are fun along with great acting and a surprisingly easy to listen to music, but it's still not quite perfect since it's dull, a bit boring at the beginning and it can get frustratingly annoying fast along with James being too awkward, but it's a perfectly weird fun time that I definitely had, also there are camos that are both unexpected but also super awesome too, like I was kinda surprised..., so yeah, go watch it, I know it's been slammed (pun intended) but it's really not awful it's actually much better then the first movie in my (possibly unpopular) opinion, kids will enjoy it but they may need explaining of the references and camos since some of them aren't for kids.., you'll what I mean when you say it, it's not the best Looney Tunes movie, Back in Action is the best one but this is a close second, but waaaay better then the last Warner Animation Group live action movie with a certain cat and mouse...I'm happy to give Space Jam: A New Legacy a 6/10.

Review title: A kids movie that is targeted at adults?
Review_body: The film, itself, isn't having any fun, and its barrage of nostalgia, easter eggs, and WB franchise cameos is basically the filmmakers asking us every few minutes "Are you having fun yet?"

Review title: This shouldn't be named space jam
Review_body: There's only one Space Jam and it's the one with Michael Jordan. Too many useless remakes nobody asked for and this is one of them.

Review title: Great Effects, Good Animation, Boring Storyline
Review_body: Rating movies one star is purely stupid. Movies have several elements: storyline, casting, acting, sound, effects, directing, camerawork, etc. Though 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' is not memorable as the first one, has poor acting, and the storyline is cheesy, it's definitely not a one-star movie.It's easily a three to a five-star movie. It's a three-star movie because it did not live up to the first one, which is still my favorite but has some of the amazing effects and animation a movie has to offer. Kids aged 6 to 12 may enjoy this movie. But LeBron needs to stick to balling. Acting is not his strong point.

Review title: Mediocre stuff buoyed by great animation sequences.
Review_body: SPACE JAM: A NEW LEGACY is pretty much what you'd expect for a film of this kind: it's little more than a commercial for Warner Bros. Property. At the very least it's still superior to the awful RALPH WRECKS THE INTERNET, although that isn't saying much. Still, this film does have its assets. The concept of being trapped in some kind of virtual service world gives the film some vibes of the likes of TRON and even SWORD ART ONLINE. But of course the real highlight are the 2D animated sequences. Bugs Bunny and his co-stars are always a pleasure, and while the animation here lacks some of the 3D shading in places, these scenes are still a delight, particularly in sequences like a chase through DC City and a MATRIX scene. That said the film did lose me a bit in its last hour when the Looney Tunes turn into CG characters (in all fairness, though, at least there is context to it). Going in with low expectations I liked the movie more than I expected to, but it can't be elevated to anything other than mediocre at best. Even so, the audience in the theater seemed to really enjoy it, and you could do a lot worse.

Review title: Movies so bad, they should pay you to see it instead. LeYawn Lames is terrible.
Review_body: I had no interest in this movie. But my friend said it couldn't be "that bad", so he took me to see it and paid for my ticket. After about 30 minutes we walked out and a got a refund. First off, LeYawn Lames is a terrible actor and it feels forced. The story of the movie felt cringe as well. This movie is an insult to MJ who was in the first. That man was a really great man, LeYawn Lames is good at basketball and thats about it. He is no where near as humble or kind as MJ is. Ashame because the Looney Tunes themselves are great, even some camoes of other properties. Sadly I'll never know how it ends because we left. I don't care how it ends either. Save your money and brain cells.

Review title: It's not funny, it's not clever, it's not interesting, it IS NOT ANYTHING
Review_body: I mean what was the actual point of this movie. There is absolutely no story. There is an idea - maybe. More of a saying -"you get what you put into it"?. I mean it's said a bunch of times, sooooooo yeah.I wanna say if bad acid trips are your thing then go for it? Even thenIt was a ridiculous Hodge podge of trailers for old movies that Disney ownsThe only thing I can see this movie being was a way for Disney to tell kids what movies Disney owns that came out before they were born???Oh dear lord!!!!!!! What on Earth did you do to Bugs Bunny's voice? Run over it with a truck??????Only plus is it's visually appealing. Part of the time. Nothing special mind you. And LiL Rel Howry was consistently good. And Marvin the Martian made an appearance so it gets a 4.

Review title: A bombastic mess with great animation
Review_body: Computer animation and special effects sure have come a long way since '96 because this movie looks fantastic. Unfortunately that's all folks (for the positives) because this '21 sequel is a bombastic mess, void of anything new and aside from the "server-verse" angle, it's not good.The original was never a masterpiece but it was just that - "original". The six writers decided not to actually write a movie and instead just copy "Ready Player One" by scouring and unloading the entire Warner Bros intellectual property catalogue on the audience to overload the senses and mask how unoriginal, unnecessary and contrived this all is.Lebron James and the cast put in a solid effort with what they've got to work with, especially Don Cheadle as the villain.The trouble with "A New Legacy" is that there isn't a story to warrant a sequel, let alone the whopping 115 minute runtime. The original was a swift 87 minutes which served as a celebration of Michael Jordan's return to basketball at the height of his popularity - it was lightning in a bottle!Kids and basketball fans who love LeBron James will surely like this movie. As previously said it looks great. It does hit the funny bone more than once, it has a soundtrack too and for some people that might be enough to call this a good time. If this were original and the first one I'd be more flexible in my rating but it's not. I've seen this movie before - it was better the first time.Bill Murray, you the real MVP!3/10.

Review title: I'd rather be dealing with the worst "Paper Jam" in a printer than watch this ever again.
Review_body: It's the equivalent of Wreck it Ralph 2, mixed with Ready Player One, The Emoji Movie, and Space Jam 1. What more can you get out of this?Had any returning characters, even one, get character flanderization, I would have given it a flat out 1/10.This movie is more shameless with the self-advertising than even Wreck it Ralph 2. Enough said.Just pirate it, watch the first one, or the original Looney Tunes cartoons.
If you're white... You can't watch thisLeBron made it pretty clear.
Like Don Cheadle supposed to save this horrible mess. 🤣
This movie is good. But I still think Tom and jerry 2021 movie is better.

Review title: I... did not expect to enjoy this as much as I did.
Review_body: Based on the trailers that were put out, and then later clips from the movie itself, I figured this would take the appeal and bite of the Looney Tunes, sand down all the edges, and focus instead on making bland advertisement for everything else Warner Bros owns.And it... doesn't? I mean, parts of it do, I guess. The end of the first act is all about traversing the Warner Bros. Universe, interacting with The Matrix and Wonder Woman and all these other WB properties, but it never feels like the point of the movie in the way you get with, say, "Ready Player One" or "Ralph Breaks the Internet."The last comparison is of particular note, because in Disney's movie about a character on a network of branded properties, they chose to have Wreck-it Ralph exploit clickbait for money and make friends with a poor, down-on-his-luck pop-up advertisement. It felt gross, like Disney didn't want to create a conflict of interest with their marketing partners.By comparison, Space Jam: A New Legacy is about Warner Bros inventing a Youtube-esque algorithm to make all of their future movies. It then suggests that, in order to conquer the entertainment industry, they need to sign LeBron James and create a deepfake clone that will star in all Warner movies -- past, present, and future. The real LeBron rightfully says he thinks that idea is stupid, angering the algorithm and giving us our jumping off point for the story.I loved the idea of the algorithm as the movie's villain, and A New Legacy doesn't shy away from making jabs at problems with data privacy and digital rights ownership.This is a movie that has its tongue lodged firmly in cheek. For some, I could see how this could lead them to not connecting with the movie. A New Legacy is big on making fun of something for being bad, while also doing the exact things it's making fun of. I mean, consider what I just said: LeBron James rejects the Warner Bros pitch because he thinks sports stars in movies is dumb, but the whole movie is basically what The Algorithm was trying to make. That kind of double-meta self-aware humor is this whole movie's bread and butter, and either you're in to that, or you aren't.Even the CGI-ification of the Looney Tunes themselves, where they get "upgraded" from traditional cartoon animation to 3D computer graphics is played for meta humor. The Tunes look at themselves, now with realistic fur and skin, and sneer in disgust. It echos the sentiment I saw from some on social media. The movie is drawing attention to its own marketing gimmick and trying to get you to believe that they don't like it either. Whether that's true or not is buried under too many layers of production bureaucracy to know for sure, so I advise you to not think about it too hard. In that light, I thought it was fun, and it at least shows they knew their audience.Which is the whole movie, really. I'm pretty sure I had more fun watching A New Legacy than I would have if I went back and watched the original Space Jam. It's not a perfect movie, and when it does lean in to the pop-culture parade, it's definitely at its worst. But overall, it hit almost every note I could have asked for.

Don't judge this movie by all the reviews.Y'all are comparing it too closely to the original when we should just be comparing it to other kids movies nowadays.And honestly it was a little too much. But it was nice for Lebron to have his own movie. IT WASNT BORING either. Too much CGI if i'm gonna be honest but not atrociously disgusting.

Now let me just say that this movie is underrated. This movie isn't that great and it is a step down from the first. LeBron James just cannot act what so ever and there is just nothing memorable about this movie. The plot isn't great I wish the basketball game had a better bet to it. Overall not that good, but I would rewatch it.
Overdone and thoughtless attempt be James trying to show he is the best!!! He isn't!!!
LeQing didn't switch teams or walk off court during the game like a big baby all while calling himself goat.Fr dude is nothing more then a wannabe good guy who is greedy af and unsportsmanlike.

A very bad movie and one that only young children or Lebron James apologists will even slightly enjoy. The beginning of the movie before it all goes into the toon world is atrocious. James' acting is terrible and the written is beyond cliché. There is some enjoyment in just seeing the classic Looney Toones characters and brief appearances from some DC Superheroes, Scooby Doo, Space Ghost and other Warner Brothers characters. But the actual movie is garbage. The original Space Jam isn't high quality but it is at least fun. This is just dumb and you don't need to shove how great Lebron James is down my throat. Greatest athlete in the world? I suppose it's arguably true but I think it's a stretch to say he is still the greatest basketball player in the world let alone greatest athlete in the world. We all know Michael Jordan is a more legendary figure, in his personality and his game, and Lebron's Space Jam is just a cash grab on what was a beloved kid's film. My wife did cry when Bugs Bunny "died" so I guess it did something right.

This "film" is basically just Warner Bros saying: "Hey everybody! Look at all these things we own the rights to! Aren't we freakin' awesome?!?!"You might enjoy this if you're five-years-old and can look past the terrible script and Warner Bros shoving everything they own in your face at every opportunity. I find it's usually the stuff aimed at the younger demographic that's always stuffed to the brim with logos and big names; they just love shoving it all in the faces of those young, undeveloped minds, don't they?Space Jam 2 goes down as another example of the many failed reboot cash-grab attempts that have flooded the industry in recent years.That's the reason I always find myself seeking out indie films these days, far more originality than anything the mainstream can muster up (no product placement either).Want a tip? Just forget this film ever existed and go and watch the original. It's 25-years-old and is still far more fresh and gripping than this drivel, it actually had focus on the Looney Tunes as opposed to the ball-bouncing protagonist; and the story was far more entertaining.

Review title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
Review_body: It's just a shameless and soulless piece of garbage that is essentially a giant Warner Media commercial. Also, why is Ryan Coolger producing this?!

Fun movie! The Grandkids loved it. They've watched it 3 times already on HBO MAX. I've seen the original so I don't know why the other reviewers (perhaps adults?) are cutting it down. Kids under 13 will most likely love it. Can't speak for the ages over that. LeBron and Don Cheadle do a great job.

Space Jam: A New Legacy was a lackluster sequel not a remake but this time it stars Lebron James as the NBA hero pulled into a animated basketball game to save his son from the rogue AI played by Don Cheadle. The story lacked originality but it was an ok family friendly movie with a message to young adults to always believe in your yourself and not to give up. The animation was top of the line but you feel as though you are watching a lego movie that is commercialized with all on WB movies they have ever created like Harry Potter, LOTR, and DC characters. The rest of the cast included Lil Rey, Sarah Silverman, and Anthony Davis. The characters were voiced by Rosario Dawson, Zendaya as Lola Bunny, and Gabriel Iglesias. Of course they did try to tease us to recruit Jordan but he ended being Michael B Jordan, such stupid jokes. Overall it was ok, I would not watch it again.

Review title: Daffy Duck Needs A New Agent
Review_body: This didn't need to be nearly 2 hours long.LeBron James makes Michael Jordan look like a good actor.Needed less LeBron James and more Looney Tunes.More Daffy Duck required.

This movie is just a meme and an advertisement for WB productions. Lebron James is a terrible actor. His relationship with his son in this movie is shown so emotionlessly, but a Lonney Tunes are still fun and made really good. The main villain is fun...yeah it's weird but fun. A big + for Bigchungus and Notorious P. I. G scene. A big - Lola looked better in the first one.
What did you expect? It's a steaming pile of woke garbage. Lebron James can't act at all, and Lola Bunny is suddenly supposed to be the most popular cartoon in the franchise. Stupid.

Review title: Ok it is worse then first but there both the SAME!
Review_body: Listen it is a good film but every body is like "When I was a kid I saw space jam in theaters and it was great! Then this came along and booo!" The reason it was bad to you is cause you watched the first as a kid and you watched 2nd as an adult! So maybe watch the movie with a grain of salt.

Review title: I don't think it's as terrible as everyone says...
Review_body: ...Maybe that's because I just saw the original space jam for the first time right before the sequel. So I carried literally zero expectations. I'm thinking that may have helped me out some.It was fine. Lebron plays a real a-hole for a lot of the movie. Why he signed up for this script is a little beyond me. I wasn't mad at the concept of traveling around Warner Bros films. At least they were overt in plugging their stuff rather than slipping product placements throughout and thinking we all won't notice. It was a relatively cute idea but also cheesy as all get out.I will say the Looney tunes gang was missing some of their original zing which was disappointing. If they'd been acted and written a little better I may have even bumped up my rating a little bit.

Review title: They went to over the top
Review_body: The movie would have been a lot better if they just had normal big guys playing them in basketball like the original Matthews like snake creatures and ice creatures they. Two over the top also it was no reason for LeBron James's family to be in the movie.

Let's be honest: the original Space Jam was not a great movie. It holds nostalgia in our eyes because it starred the greatest basketball player of all time next to some of our favorite cartoons. However, the original Space Jam looks like a classic compared to this overly produced mess of a sequel.First off, let's get something straight. LeBron James is an amazing basketball player and he's very popular with young adults. However, he does not have the same aura about him that Michael Jordan did. MJ came at a time when being a celebrity wasn't so ubiquitous like it is now with the Internet and social media. Also, media is so fragmented now that we really don't have those "shared" experiences like we once did. EVERYONE knew MJ and the Chicago Bulls, basketball fans or not. I'm not sure LeBron has that same appeal. Also, even if people didn't like MJ, they respected him. Maybe it's because he gets political, or maybe because he switches teams, I don't know why, but LeBron is much more polarizing. Maybe it's just the cultural climate we live in today, but there are a lot of people who straight up don't like the guy.The second thing is how corporate this movie is. So many product placements and pseudo commercials all over the place. It takes people out of the story and makes it feel like you are just watching endless commercials for 120 minutes.Third, 120 minutes is way too long for families. 90 minutes or less. Kids loss attention after that. So do adults.This movie is fine if you are looking for something to do for 2 hours, but there are better ways to spend that time than watching a lukewarm, unnecessary, over the top commercial showcase designed as a sequel to Space Jam.

This film started well but was far too long at almost two hours . The basketball match went on for close to an hour. Don Cheadle was good as the villain Al G. I like now the film included characters like King Kong, Penguin, Mini Me etc. Michael B Jordan had an interesting scene .

Review title: The Looney Tunes make it a 2
Review_body: The only reason this is getting anything above a 1 is because of the Looney Tunes. And they weren't even funny 90% of the time.Could this have been a good movie? When I first heard they were doing it a few years ago, I was cautiously optimistic. I didn't think it would be so bad. The creativity just wasn't there. Space Jam 1 will live on and this "New Legacy" will be forgotten.The only laugh I had... the Michael B. Jordan bit was good.This smelled of Lebron trying to imitate MJ. I won't deny Lebron is a great player but he'll never be MJ. Kobe was the greatest player to follow the MJ era.Uninspired. Soulless. Forgettable.
This film is pure trash!! This is the absolute worst film of all time and I blame the writers for their lack of storytelling. Who even approved this?? Oh yeah... Warner Bros.

Review title: No laughs and no heart. Just a CGI salad
Review_body: Barely coherent "comedy" that's not funny. Not thrilling, not suspenseful, not fascinating. There is no positive adjective to describe it. Just a B movie storyline with terrible acting. They could have made 5 blockbuster movies with that budget. Maybe if the "hero" of the story was a little more likable...
Not sure who this movie was made for. It seems as if Lebron is forever chasing Michael. And that is just sad.
Communist China advocate LaBra Shames drops the balm and loses the game, again.

Review title: No, I don't believe you can fly
Review_body: How can you follow up remaking a classic with this pile of trash? Seriously this shouldn't even share the name Space Jam. This is a shining example of why some movies just shouldn't be remade. If you can't even come close to being as good as the original, don't bother. This is nothing more than a cash grab at the name.

Review title: This is the epitome of Corporate Hollywood
Review_body: One giant WB advertisement injected in a horrible script, with a contrived plot and pathetic performances. The irony is this just makes me hate WB even more. This studio has completely lost touch with it's customers.Space Jam was a fun silly movie of the 90s that never took itself seriously. "A New Legacy" tarnishes that name in the most embarrassing way possible. Seriously who approved of this disgrace.

Come On and Slam and Welcome to the Jam! Gremlins! Gremlins are in this movie! We also get a cameo from the aliens from the first Space Jam. The cameos in this movie are great. Space Jam: A New Legacy is not as good as the original but it is still good. I love all the stuff to do with Warner Brothers and their movies and the Warner 3000. This movie looks impressive. Porky Pig is my favorite Looney Tunes character. The Notorious P. I. G. Joke was funny. I liked when they went and recruited all of the Looney Tunes characters from the different Warner Brothers movies. LeBron James' acting is questionable but that's alright. I watched most of this movie yesterday besides, the last 20 minutes. I had to finish the last 20 minutes today because I went to go see Cruella in the movie theater before I could finish this movie but the point is, I like Space Jam: A New Legacy more than Cruella. I know people hate this movie but being a fan of the first Space Jam, the Looney Tunes and movies in general. I had a great time. I didn't really care about LeBron James' fake son in the movie, Dom or the Goon Squad. I don't like modern music or a lot of stuff apart of current culture so I didn't like LeBron dabbing or the new jersey's but I am happy that when the Tunes and LeBron are training they wear the original jerseys. I do not like LeBron James and his acting was questionable to bad and I wanted Michael Jordan to reprise his role instead of LeBron James but I really like the Looney Tunes. I can see some problems with the movies but I just don't care, I was very surprised that this movie is actually good and I really enjoyed it.Overall, Space Jam: A New Legacy is not as good as the first but it was better than I expected. I am happy I saw it once but I don't know if I need to ever see it again. I would recommend giving Space Jam: A New Legacy a watch.

Review title: If I could give it less than 1 star I would!!!
Review_body: Don't even waste your time with this garbage, tried to watch it with my daughter, even she was like...turn this trash off!!! That's all you need to know!!

I've taken a break from reviewing the movies for a while but what on Earth is this?! Lola Bunny isn't Lola Bunny any more, Pepe Le Pew is "deleted", why??? Just add him and remove the part where he touches anyone without his or her will! I'm giving it 8 stars nevertheless. I love Bugs' world so much...

Review title: Dispute Over Summer Camp Leading to SAO Incident
Review_body: Lebron James is an undeniably legendary player, but definitely a terrible actor. I guess the intended audience of this movie are toddlers or elementary students who'd laugh at obvious scripted conversations about algorithms in the form of War Machine trying to take over the world. Btw Don Cheadle presented us what real awkward is through his cringing performance, not to mention he's probably the best actor in the entire movie. The only scenes that rippled my emotion and created a slight excitement is the flamboyant development of King James and the recruit of Michael Jordan which turned out to be a total disappointment.

Review title: A cartoon comedy-style movie, with beautiful animation, with crossovers and references to warner bros and nba,but the script is very bad
Review_body: It doesn't have a great script, but the strong point is the animation and the intelligent references that the film makes. The animations are very good and modeled, almost perfect, I loved the 3d and 2d character models, and the crossovers with all the characters from warner was amazing, and even has a lot of reference about the nba who likes basketball will love it, it's a comedy movie in a cartoon style, it's funny and despite not having a great narrative it manages to involve until the end. With the same essence as the first movie, lebron's acting is good. Certainly worth watching.

Review title: Threw up a whole bunch of nothing
Review_body: Lebron James must work with the Tune Squad to save his son from a diabolical A. IWhat ever you do , do not compare this to the OG.This film is geared towards pre teens and younger, with that being said it did its job there. Where it faults is delivering an enjoyable story that any age could find interesting. With outdated comical references , horrid acting from known actors( shoutout to Don Cheadle) , the amount of colors, and characters; it's clear to see this film is over the top and was a little too much. Instead of focusing on the theme ( being a father and showing interest in your sons passions) they threw up a whole bunch of nothing.With that being said Space Jam : A New Legacy doesn't live up to the hype. With poor acting, a mediocre plot, and no other strong themes, I have to rate this as a below average film. If you have HBO max watch it, don't spend extra money to watch this.

Review title: Not as bad as people think
Review_body: If you go in watching this movie for what it is.... And not for what your childhood nostalgia wants this to be, then it's absolutely decent.Nothing amazing. Nothing completely origins. But a fun spin on a family movie updated to a modern time.I'll not be watching this many times over. But it holds up for what it claimed to be.
This film is unnecessary. The original had heart and humor. This is just loud and obnoxious. Bron's acting is unfunded high school play quality. I'd give it a negative grade if I could. Stay away.

This modern update on the original should not have been made.Every aspect of the premise, characters, and script was predictable and boring.Aside from the it serving as one long Warner Brothers infomercial, when compared to other animated fare currently available , this simply wasn't worth the $10+ some people paid to watch this mess at a theater.The actors aren't the blame for this, the producers, direction ,studio and Labron should never have green-lighted this travesty.

A great family film filled with comedy and even tugs at the heart strings on occasion. I will say this, the film doesn't hold up to the first one. Why? Because A New Legacy goes a step above the original Space Jam. The updated animations and fresh music set it apart from the Michael Jordan version. Lebron is a marketing genius and deserves any praise thrown his way. We all knew this film was coming. My family loved it, especially my son who loves Lebron and the Lakers. Ryan Coogler did a great job with the screenplay though I questioned why some of the lines weren't written out or replaced. People will be hard on this film because not everybody is fond of Lebron James. Don't be surprised if they make a space James 3.

Review title: LBJ please keep your day Job!
Review_body: As so many before me,, WHY??Nobody needed this movie at all.
Such a horrible movie. Just another example of Lebrun not being able to hold a candle to Michael.

Review title: That's going to be a 1 for me dawg
Review_body: I love space. I also love jamming. Much to my surprise this movie's title left me wanting more. The main character, Lebanon James, was, to put it mildly, a terrible actor. I think if he took his talents to south beach he could potentially have a basketball career. But Miami will always be D Wade's house, big ups to my man D Wade.Are you really surprised/10.

So awful. Completely a self-serving vanity project with no thought for the paying public. Sad to see my favorite Looney Tunes charcters being degraded by their association with this movie.The story and characters are so superficial you don't care for either. LeBron could have been substituted by a piece of wood with voice-over, and it would have had more personality.Agree that the original Space Jam wasn't some deep profound artistic achievement, but it was at least quirky and fun. This new version was so commercialized and shallow, that became intolerably annoying when it became evident why this movie was made.It was made ONLY for grifting purposes by a bunch of grifters. So if you don't want to give your hard earned money to opportunistic billionaires, then skip this money-grabbing scam project (can't bring myself to call this a 'film').
It's an awful movie, but "Notorious P. I. G." sent me.

Review title: No more sequels to good films
Review_body: Thus was a disappointment compared to the original Space Jam. It appears to me that this one is one side story rather than a fun tribute to the first one. The toons were ok CGI instead of classic us up to viewers presence, I preferred the animation of the original. Glad it was on HBO as I wouldn't pay 20$ per ticket to see in a theater. Check it out if you are bored and nothing else to watch. My 3 rating is being generous.

Review title: Is it Product Placement or Nostalgia?
Review_body: I decided to watch the original Space Jam before watching this new one. I have to say I found it to be clunky and boring at times. Let's just say it hasn't aged well. Viewing it left such a bad impression that I waited a few weeks before watching the sequel.My expectations for the movie were low, given the many horrible reviews. After a slow start, the film took off and found its groove. I found myself laughing out loud several times. When done, I went and read the reviews. I don't get why there is so much hate. Nor why there is so much love for the original. Two key points I'd like to make.1) Many complained "this is just product placement" given the wealth of Warner television and movies scattered throughout the story. I have to wonder if these are the same people that were in awe of the same level of product in "Ready Player One." I guess that movie tugged at "nostalgia," but this one is only "product placement." Whatever. I didn't see it that way at all. Warner crammed this movie with so many Easter Eggs it will take multiple viewings and endless pause/rewind to find them. Just check out the endless YouTube videos out there listing what others have found. Personally, I absolutely LOVED this aspect of the movie.2) The original Looney Tunes cartoons often operated on two levels. Kids got the slapstick fun and silly gags. Adults often caught a different set of jokes targeted at them. So, when people complain about "Why are there these adult movie references in a kids movie?" The answer is simple - the joke is for the parents.I rated this movie an 8/10 because I think kids will have a blast. There's a heartwarming story woven throughout the film. The VFX are fantastic. I also feel the Warner references show a huge level of care and detail put into the script. Lebron does a fine acting job. IMO it runs about 15 minutes too long and could have used a bit more editing to improve the pace. Otherwise, it's a blast.

I guess on a larger scale of rating this would be a higher 3/10. Something closer to a 4. The original space jam wasn't great, but it felt good. It had fun with its self and it did justice to the Looney toons franchise. It wasn't a masterpiece but it's a beloved classic. Space Jam A New Legacy doesn't do any of that. It feels like a stretched out advertisment that lasts 2 hours. There's maybe 1...2??? Jokes that made me at least grin. They make the Looney's 3D for no reason and nothing quite makes sense. The acting across the board is bad. Don Cheadle played about as good as he could with his character and it lacks any soul or purpose other than basically stroking Lebron's ego. There was no reason for a sequel, but the fact they got 6 writers to write and come up with this is beyond amazing tbh. Worth a watch if you have HBO Max already I guess but don't pay anything for this.

You know for a movie with six credited writers it's almost a miracle Space Jam 2 is as coherent as it is. I credit that to Malcolm Lee's assured direction and LeBron James' innate charisma. Although James isn't a master thespian he has screen presence, more so than Michael Jordan. The film starts with a similar framing device like the first film, where you have a quasi-autobiography involving the main character as a child. It establishes that he pushed his son to achieve and he's become something of an overachiever. He neglects his son and doesn't support his passion for video games. So the film has some emotional stakes before you get into the Looney Tune world. The Looney tune sequences are a lot of fun, and they get a lot of mileage out of the sight gags.There are some clever sight gags like Wile E. Coyote and Road runner in the Mad Max Fury Road universe, or Lola Bunny playing tournaments in the Wonder Woman universe. This film is very similar to Ready Player One, since that you have various characters interacting with various universes owned by Warner Bros. I will concede that this is Warner Bros advertising their IP, but none of this bothers me, since a lot of the gags were plot specific. Alas, not all the gags work like the Porky pig rap, or the matrix spoof, but the film doesn't linger on this for too long, and part of the reason this works for me is that the film is very self aware about what kind of film it is. So if you're a millennial like me, and you have nostalgia for the original Space Jam, you might enjoy this film since this has the same spirit as the first film. Space Jam 2 is far from masterpiece, but for what it is it's a fun family film.

Not worth watching! Micheal Jordon was better! With the actor Lebron James, he has a bad reputation for wanting a cops to be killed. So no one is interesting in actors who hates cops. So therefore makes the whole movie not worth watching. Lebron James sucks and is a huge LOSER!

Review title: U can't even laugh at it for being bad.
Review_body: LeBron has the emotional range of a brick wall. The biggest facial expression he makes the entire movie is the photoshopped smile on the poster. This was an abomination of blasphemous proportions. I dunno what blasphemy even is, but this is probably it.

I'd never see the first install so I watched them both this weekend. Conclusion - SJ2 was really entertaining and actually better than the original. The first half of SJ2 was a bit dry but set up a good theme. The second half really stepped it up making the story complete and satisfying. The effects, animation, cultural references, cameos and humor worked for me.James put in a good performance, as he did more just say the lines written for him. He certainly won't win "Best Actor" but he seemed very much engaged and convincing as a father who has to learn how to allow his son to be his own best self. A very human and relatable fun film and performance! Bravo King James!
This movie was not as good as the original but i still had a good time with it, i thought it was a decent follow up.

Review title: A Dumpster Fire Mess of a Movie!
Review_body: Despite some pretty good animation, the rest of the movie overall is a hot garbage mess with abysmal writing and direction, flat unfunny humor, references that most may or may not get, subpar soundtrack, sluggish editing and pacing, bad acting, a nothing story, etc.This so-called Space Jam movie is just pretty much a crappy carbon copy of Ready Player One with Looney Tunes in it. I rather just go watch the much better Ready Player One or even the first Space Jam movie than this dumpster fire ever again.If it weren't for Cosmic Sin (my #1 worst movie of 2021), this would definitely be my absolute worst movie of the year!Lastly, Michael Jordan > Lebron James.
