The movie provides 2h of original content for Shaqtin' a Fool.Every 5s scene where a real person appears on screen trying to act, would be a strong #1 Shaqtin' a Fool contender. The inside guys would have lots of fun with it.

Being a huge fan of the original Space Jam, a sequel wasn't generally a bad idea but I never saw any reason for there to be one. Perhaps one could argue a sequel can work if you got the right talent, the right sports star for it, and a solid plot. It could be possible to do something like this, but you'd need to find all the right things.Space Jam 2 doesn't have any of those elements at all. The film is a complete mess from start to finish. It really has no reason to exist at all. If anything, it makes me wonder why anyone bothered with this in the first place at all. It's painfully obvious though that the film is trying to cash in on nostalgia for those who loved the original Space Jam film. Sure, Space Jam definitely had its weird moments but at least it worked and was fun and entertaining; much more than this film.The first strike against this film is who they chose to be the sports star. So they want to stick with a basketball player, so who do they choose? Somebody fantastic and loved by lots of people? Like maybe Tim Duncan, Dirk Nowitzki, or Kobe Bryant? Nope! Make way for Lebron James. Why he was chosen is beyond me when I felt there were other better choices is beyond. That's only the beginning of the problems with the movie though.If you thought Michael Jordan's wooden acting was bad in the first film, Lebron James is somehow worse. Lebron is either taking things too seriously or is trying too hard to be funny. Jordan's acting was wooden yes, but at least some of the deadpan deliveries got some chuckles from me. Here, James is trying too hard to be serious or funny without balancing it out.The other actors are okay for the most part; given the material they've got to work with. Some of them are good like Bugs and Daffy being pretty good. But the acting in general is really nothing to write home about. It's just passable at its best.Most of the problems with the acting though can be attributed to the awful script. The dialogue is repetitive and it gets tiring really fast. Lebron constantly saying he has to save his son or, more annoyingly, the constant gushing over Lebron James himself. I know the original Space Jam definitely gushed on Michael Jordan, but good lord does this film take it to another level. The movie has to remind us again and again how good Lebron James is, and it gets sickening quickly.Equally bad is the comedy in this movie. The first film's comedy did have some awkward moments in it, but a lot of the jokes worked well and still stand up well to this day. The jokes in this movie are instantly dated or are tiresome. Hearing Granny say "haters gonna hate" just felt cringe worthy and a lot of the visual gags just makes you want to roll your eyes. The only slightly good joke was Sam shooting those basketballs; it got a slight chuckle from me.The CGI and cartoon effects look good for the most part. However, the Looney Tuns don't work out well in the 3D portions. They all look rather poorly designed and facial models (particularly Bugs and Lola) look off and jarring. The other designs are fine for the most part though.The film relies heavily on a lot of winks and nods to other WB properties such as The Iron Giant, some appearances of Harry Potter for some reason, Austin Powers, or A Clockwork Orange. They don't add anything to the movie overall; nor does it serve any purpose aside from some poor fan service. If anything, seeing those characters will remind you there are better films you could be watching than this.The story overall is just an utter bore. The whole movie plays it in a generic way that has very little creative twists or turns. There's very little creativity in this film and the whole movie ends up being by the numbers in how it plays out. There is one twist that may get you off guard, but not by much. There's no sense of fun, no entertainment, and no joy. It just feels boring and dreary.The original Space Jam definitely had its problems for sure, but at least it felt like a fun film that was tongue in cheek entertainment for everyone involved. This movie though feels like it has only one demographic being targeted; very little kids, and I do mean very little. Even then, kids would be more entertained with almost any other movie than this.Do yourself a favor and forget this film happened. Go watch the first Space Jam with Michael Jordan. While that film has its own problems, it can at least still entertain and give some great laughs. This film really serves no point at all other than to be a cheap cash grab. The only legacy this film has is one of wasting your time and being an overall failure.

Review title: Amazing? No. A good time? Yes.
Review_body: A lot of reviews seem to take issue with A New Legacy not being "like the original" (and perhaps LeBron James rightfully insulting a certain so-called "politician"). I may not be blinded by nostalgia but let's be real, Space Jam isn't, well, the classic everyone thinks it is. I'm a 90s kid and I didn't think much of it then either. Trailers for the sequel played in front of nearly everything I saw the past couple months, and I've just about had it. Until I actually saw it. By no means is this a masterpiece but it sure is a lot of fun.The script - by six credited writers (four of whom receive story credit) - isn't winning any awards anytime soon (except maybe a Razzie), but the hackneyed cliches and tropes can be easily overlooked by a quality performance by LeBron James, his acting chops previously seen in 2015's Trainwreck, and Don Cheadle, who clearly knows what he's working with and spares no time in hamming it up far past eleven. The only real nitpick I have cast-wise is Zendaya as Lola Bunny. Now I'm a "Zswagger", having enjoyed her past work (Euphoria, The Greatest Showman and the Marvel Cinematic Universe), but the in-jokes at the previous, albeit standalone, film would have fared more comfortably with Kath Soucie.James plays a fictionalized version of himself, father of three, his youngest son Dom is a tech prodigy who doesn't want to follow in Dad's footsteps. While at Warner Bros. Studios, Dom is lured into the "Serververse" by rogue artificial intelligence Al-G-Rhythm (get it?), who wagers LeBron to a basketball game wherein his and Dom's freedom depends on winning. Upon being thrown through virtual space to Tune World, LeBron, now in 2D animation (hopefully, we'll get more of that in the near future), meets Bugs Bunny and learns that the other Tunes have been exploring other realities, persuaded by Al-G.Up to this point, it was all merely self-aware. Here, it takes being a WB product and kicking it right in the "balls". The realities are other assorted Warner-owned properties, including but not limited to, DC Comics, Harry Potter, Animaniacs, Hanna-Barbera, The Wizard of Oz and a number of considerably more adult-oriented franchises, i.e. Game of Thrones, RoboCop, Mad Max, The Matrix, Austin Powers, and Rick and Morty. But the barrage of cameos doesn't stop there; a blink-and-you'll-miss-it shows Bugs transforming into Internet meme Big Chungus, and at the big game, Beetlejuice, The Mask, the Gremlins, Pennywise, the Droogs from the ultraviolent Kubrick thriller A Clockwork Orange and (this still baffles me) Sister Jeanne of Ken Russell's highly controversial (and WB's equivalent of how Disney feels about Song of the South) The Devils. Her appearance is far more frequent and leaves one to wonder if the studio plans to acknowledge the film in any capacity anytime soon.In the long run, Space Jam: A New Legacy, while not necessarily good, is regardless entertaining. It's like Ready Player One or any given MCU movie: don't expect anything substantial, just go with it and have fun pointing out the Easter eggs. 3.5/5.

Review title: So shockingly bad it makes me sad to even rate it this low very cringy movie.
Review_body: Within the first 2 minutes it was cool, within 5 mins of the movie it was just like a video tribute to him just with creative editing not a good look at all, within 15 minutes clearly they promo for Nike was to extra like ok we get he is apart of Nike, now the acting from James himself was awful very cringy most of the time clearly whoever decided to make this movie didn't factor that in at all they could have use it's real wife n kids to draw more of a real emotion out of him ijs, then the way Don Chino look like ugggh I personally hate the upgrade to the jerseys that's just me AD as a hawk or eagle then to use the WNBA players like they did was awful I hate that part with a serious passion they could have use them better alot better and actually use them as the women that they are very distasteful the voice for Lola threw me off big time the way they even use some of the looney toons was a head scratcher they could have kept Pepe Le Pew frfr they when they got to the actual game jaw dropping back to back cornball lines very basic ABC-ish it's a kids movie I think but woooooow this was awful the acting was so bad it took away from the plot of the movie in my opinion it just seem like a movie gear more towards James then I guess whatever the point was suppose to be I didn't even finish looking at the movie I was so ashamed of it I like the call back to the mon-stars but other then that I can't say I like anything about the movie then the son walking away from him while he talking to him at that point I was saying to my self bruuuuuh Hollywood need to stop it lol no way in the world that's happening without putting a hand or hands on him to stop him slow him down or you know but that's how unrealistic this movie came off as at least with the original space jam you wanted to or felt like you could be in the movie or that could happen to you this one was very cringy.

LeBron James is trying to get his son Dom to get into basketball, but Dom is much more interested in gaming, to the point where he creates his own video game. When they go on a trip to the Warner Bros. Studio, they get into an argument and they find themselves in an evil computer A. I. known as Al-G Rhythm. Al-G forces LeBron into a basketball game with his own son and sends him to Tune World. There, he meets Bugs Bunny who misses his friends after they went to different worlds. Bugs agrees to help LeBron get his son back and the two gather the gang for the game.I have been waiting for this film for a long time. I am a huge fan of Looney Tunes and I have always wanted to see them on the big screen ever since I was a kid. For that, this was one of my more anticipated movies of the year just for its source material. It was the one movie that I told myself that I was going to watch in theaters no matter what news or reviews came about. All that said, the first film is not all that special to me, but it was a nice crossover between basketball and Looney Tunes. This sequel makes for a much bigger crossover. Is it a slam dunk, or does this big budget juggernaut miss the goal?Space Jam: A New Legacy is a mixed bag. The story is where the film falls apart the most. There are too many cooks in this kitchen. It tries to be about basketball, LeBron's legacy, Warner Bros' film catalogue, the big game inside Dom's video game, the Looney Tunes and the fractured relationship between LeBron and his son. There is so much happening in this film at such a fast pace, that it is hard to make out what is happening a lot of the time. It is over reliant on references and some of them are pretty bad. Did we really need an Austin Powers reference? Some of them are not too bad. Seeing Foghorn Leghorn ride a dragon in the GoT world was awesome and both DC worlds were great. One reminded me of the DCAU and the other was animated like a comic book. However, they come off as more of an excuse to show how many IPs WB has than to show how the Tunes got separated. The third act is when the movie finally regains focus and the game itself is quite exciting.The humor is hit and miss. There are some horribly cringeworthy scenes where they try to modernize the characters, but there are plenty of scenes that put a smile on my face. There is a scene with Roadrunner and Wile that made me crack up and almost anything Bugs did put a smile on my face aside from the one scene. When the Looney Tunes get to act like themselves, that is where this film shines. Some of the humor from LeBron and Cheadle cracked me up too. They know how ridiculous this film is and they give it their all. The best gag is one involving Michael Jordan. The emotional moments are unbelievably cheesy and sappy, but not to the extent of Tom and Jerry. There were a few scenes where I got a little sad. Seeing Bugs so deflated is just depressing for me. The ending made me even sadder. It helps that they are at least well acted and that the relationships between the characters are done decently enough to get some emotion. Yeah, I was into this film more than I should have been.As for the characters, I like the way Bugs Bunny is portrayed in this film much more than in the original Space Jam. He has so much more personality and wackiness while playing a bigger role in the story. The scene where he first meets LeBron and messes with him is one of my favorite scenes of the year so far. He is painting tunnels, he is tricking Marvin into taking his ship and he even says "this means war" at one point. He is also much tougher here than in the first Space Jam as he is the only one that sees through the villain's plan and tries to go against him. If you are not a fan of him, he also gets a couple scenes where he is the brunt of the slapstick so he is not invincible. He even gets a few emotional scenes that work such as missing his Looney friends. This is my favorite portrayal of Bugs Bunny in a Looney Tunes film so far and they nailed his character... except for the scene where he dances to a pop song that made me want to throw something at the screen. Jeff Bergman gives his best performance as Bugs. He brings this character to life any time he voices the rabbit and this film is no exception. I was kind of disappointed that Eric Bauza was not voicing him at first because I love Bauza's take on Bugs in Looney Tunes Cartoons, but Bergman killed it in this role by showing the range Bugs has in his personality. He deserves a lot more credit than he got. If there is one thing I will firmly defend about this film, it is the way Bugs was handled and voiced in this film.Unfortunately, the other Tunes are a mixed bag. The best cartoon characters in the film are Wile E. Coyote, Granny, Daffy Duck, Tweety and Taz. Wile in particular is really funny. He has no lines and yet he probably got the most laughs out of everyone. He also gets a few awesome moments that I did not expect. Granny does too as she goes up against this huge virtual basketball team. Taz has the coolest basketball play out of everyone. Daffy Duck makes for a funny coach while getting the most stylish outfit. Roadrunner actually gets a scene where he gets humiliated which is surprising because he is arguably the most invincible main LT character. A lot of the other characters are wasted though. Gossamer, Yosemite Sam and Elmer Fudd get so little to do. Gossamer does not even get a scene of him joining the squad! I am not sure if Foghorn Leghorn got to do anything in the game. Speedy could have been used a little more, especially when you take his voice actor in consideration. Sylvester gets hardly any screen time at all. Marvin does not even join the game. Even Daffy could have gotten a bit more screen time. The biggest wasted potential of all however is Lola Bunny. She is made more of an action girl than last time, but they give hardly any focus to her relationship with Bugs or improve on her personality from the first film. She is more supportive of her team at least, but I wanted to see more scenes between her in Bugs. The one good thing is that she does have a soft spot for family, but they should have done more with her character.Voice-acting wise, all of it is great from the talented voice cast. Eric Bauza voices Daffy, Foghorn, Porky, Elmer and Marvin and he crushes it. Bauza is a very talented voice actor because he can capture the voices of the characters perfectly, especially Daffy. In addition to Bugs, Bergman also voices Sam and Sylvester, but gets little to work with them. Bob Bergen is solid as Tweety. I really liked Candi Milo as the sassy Granny here. I also liked Gabriel Iglesias as Speedy and I would not mind seeing him voice the character some more. Then there is Zendaya as Lola Bunny. She is fine in the role, but I prefer Kath Soucie's take on Lola. Heck, I would have loved to have seen Kristen Wiig come back as Lola, but Zendaya gives a sweet performance as the character that fits the friendly tone of the character. However, she did not need to be the only voice actress credited in the ads. Overall, the voice cast is fantastic and they brought these characters to life.As for the human characters, they are not bad at all. LeBron James is fine in the movie. He has more fun here than Michael Jordan did in the original. He has better chemistry with Bugs and he embraces the silliness of the movie. I liked his arc with his son more than I thought I would. It has a good message about letting your child be them. Don Cheadle unsurprisingly steals the show as Al-G though. He does not give a damn. He just hams it up entirely and I loved it. He made for a much better villain than Swackhammer. I did not expect Cheadle to act this hammy in the film, but his presence makes it a lot more fun. He is also charismatic and easy-going when he needs to be. The goon squad is cool on paper, but I just do not see them fitting in the world of Looney Tunes the way the Monstars did. While the team does make for a fun antagonistic team for the Tunes to go against, the players themselves seem out of place.The visuals look fantastic. Just seeing 2D animation is exciting enough, but it is so fluid and energetic, that it felt like watching a Looney Tunes short. The expressions are fantastic and the slapstick works for the most part. Animated LeBron is a lot of fun and they did not waste his design at all. They put him at the brunt of slapstick and play around with his animated design the way they do with other characters. I wish the whole film was 2D. That said, even the 3D animation looks great. The Tunes look solid in their transitions for the most part, the goon squad have wicked designs and the court feels like a huge high stakes game. Again, the animation and expressions look great and there are even some funny jokes about their transitions such as Bugs' disdain for it. The basketball game itself is a ton of fun and every character from both teams gets to utilize their abilities to their advantage in the game. The soundtrack is good, but I like the first film's soundtrack better. Nothing popped out the way the first film's music did.Space Jam: A New Legacy is a tough movie for me to grade. On one hand, I had a good amount of fun in the theater and just seeing Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck on the big screen is a dream come true for me as a fan of these characters. That being said, the movie is a freaking mess. It relies too much on references and there is too much going on in the story. I know that some reviewers have torn this film apart, but I cannot bring myself to dislike it because I enjoyed my time with it too much. That being said, it is hard to recommend this movie to pay money to see it in theaters because it has a lot of problems that cartoon to movie adaptations have along with heavy-handed crossovers. If for nothing else, I am happy that I got to see some of my favorite characters in theaters.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a soulless and joyless experience that doesn't even succeed at being entertaining in any way. While the original Space Jam (1996) was also a corporate cash grab, it at least had a distinct sense of charm and fun that is severely lacking here. The film felt more like a 2 hour long advertisement for the various properties that Warner Brother own than an actual film. The references to R-rated properties such as Mad Max, The Matrix and Game of Thrones seem out of place for a family film (cynics could say the film is targeted at millennials)The plot centres around the strained relationship between LeBron James' relationship with his youngest son Dom, who wants to be a video game developer rather than a basketballer like his Dad. After the two are sucked into the 'Warnerverse' they are pitted against one another in a game of basketball based on the game Dom has been developing ('Domball'). This is not an emotionally investing storyline mainly due to James' stilted performance which may be worse than Michael Jordan's in the original. I guess there is a positive parental message here regarding letting your kids chase their own dreams rather than impose your own onto them. It could have been executed much better though.I like to find the positives where I can, and the animation and CGI in the film is really vibrant and pops off the screen. It's easily the highlight of the film but unfortunately it has nothing to back it up with - I found the film exceptionally tedious and the jokes were mostly cringeworthy and unfunny. The most humour I got out of the experience was how awfully brazen and out-of-place a lot of references were. Pennywise the Clown and the Night King enjoying a game of basketball? Rick and Morty dropping off the Tasmanian Devil onto the heroes? What even was going on in this film?Really I can't recommend this film in any capacity. It's an overly long and thoroughly dull slog through Warner Brothers self-congratulatory vanity project that seems to lack any sense of self-awareness. I couldn't wait for this one to finish.

Space jam a new legacy is a pretty ok movie. I wasn't really a fan of the story that much. In my opinion not as good as the first movie but I recommend watching if you've seen the first space jam or if you love the looney tunes 👍
Y'all keep paying to see these movies and it's why they keep making them. They don't care about how bad the reviews are when they're still #1 in the box office.
I kinda interest to me about this film has been hilarious to see in the previous precious years.
Really surprised reading some of the reviews . Took my grandson and we loved it . Silly slapstick comedy .. made me smile and laugh. Loved seeing all the old characters . I'd watch it again for sure.
Nothing more than an idiotic vanity project. Don't waste your time or money.

Review title: A drug trip that feels more like a nightmare
Review_body: "Space Jam: A New Legacy" has so much stuff in it that it just makes a film that feels tiring.The good in this movie is of course the visual effects. They are fantastic, and are just popping with color. Some of the jokes also got a laugh, and I loved how there was so many brands being put in with the characters. It made it so funny.But that's about it with the positives. This movie drags on for so long that I started to get very bored at times. Most of the jokes are pretty unfunny, and the cameos are just too much. Lebron James unfortunately, didn't give that great of a performance. He tried way too hard and it didn't work. The brands too just got very annoying. It feels like that was all the movie cared about and it just got very annoying.Overall despite some fantastic effects, and some cool scenes, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is too long, not very funny, kinda cringe, and also at times can be very boring. This is not a slam dunk.

Review title: Awful...Jordan was and is the best of all time.
Review_body: Hey LeBron...shut up and dribble. No, seriously...don't ever "act" again...you're an uneducated moron.

Review title: All the stars for THE LOONIES
Review_body:
I wont compare it to the first one since it's just like completely different story
Especially they gave fake hope of M jordan's cameo. Hhaha.And no spacejam's songs!I guess it doesn't deserve that much hate
Still entertaining. As long as you watch it as 'stand alone'movie. Not as spacejam's legacyWell the only thing keeps me laughing is the part when the loonie gangs play
Since i love loonie toones, i give ALL the stars for them.Story kinda meh.

Review title: Space Jam A New Legacy Review- A Fun JAM TOON SEQUEL
Review_body: Space Jam A New Legacy Is JAM PACKED With Tons Of WB Easter Eggs, Plenty Of New Toon Fun, Stacked Cast And A Huge Toon Sequel Like No Other Return. This Sequel Takes Things From A Plain Basketball Court To An Epic Wide TOONVERSE. Seeing The Looney Tunes In Action Again Was Soo Funny And Ridiculous And Lebron James Is Fun, But Kind Of Unnecessary. The 3D CGI Effects Is Freaking Phenomenal And Played Really Stylish On The Toons. There Are A Ton of WB Easter Eggs That Appear And To Catch And Really Add Fun To This Sequel. Plot Felt Different And Fits Well To The Exact Story. Lola Bunny Is Really Good In Here And My Personal Fav. The Cast And Voice Cast Is Wild Especially Don Cheadle, Zendaya And Gabriel Iglesias. There Are Literally Soo Much Fun Scenes To Pick As Your Favorite. Love The Colors, Cinematography And Music That Are Used. Soo Much Plenty of New Toon Fun That Will Have You Laughing And Toon To Your Feet. BUT THIS SEQUEL IS NOT AFRAID TO EXPLORE THE TOONVERSE IN POSSIBLE WAYS.As A Fan Of The First Film, This Sequel Is Jam Packed From Beginning To End And If You Love The First Film, Your Going To Have A Toon Blast With A New Legacy.

What a boring movie, my 6 yr old kept asking why was she not laughing. She said it was horrible, this movie couldn't even keep a 6 yr old happy. Movie has really good graphics, yet it's too long. Lebron is still a bit dry with not a smooth delivery. All the corky moments that made the first one good. This one has none.

Review title: About what you'd expect from another remake/sequel
Review_body: I don't usually write reviews for movies I'm indifferent about, but I will say my bar was pretty low and it slightly exceeded expectations, at least compared to the Tom and Jerry movie. There were a few laughs, and the opening montage was nostalgic of the original Space Jam. And the people who said this movie was basically about showcasing LeBron's talent were right, but the original did the same for Michael Jordan. I don't expect basketball players to be phenomenal actors and neither should anyone. I did enjoy the Michael B. Jordan cameo and all the universe references which was a funny twist. Even some adult films like Mad Max and Austin Powers! Definitely didn't expect that in this movie. Some might call it pandering, but I guess I enjoy being pandered to.

There is so many things wrong with this movie and it's an embarrassment to the original. The acting of LeBron for starters. Also why are they having LeBron play himself but have a fake wife and kids in the movie.

Going into this movie there was a lot of hype, I mean this was the long awaited sequel to the 90s smash hit space jam and with basketball legend Lebron James starring this time, you can see why everyone is so excited.With out giving anything away this movie exceeded expectations by fuelling our nostalgia with tons of great references to the original, while also managing to stand on its own to feet as a NBA/loony tunes family movie.

Review title: A s*it sandwich is still a s*it sandwich
Review_body: Poor garbage and quite frankly should NEVER been made. Seriously, stab your eyes out now, and save yourself the trouble of watching them bleed out from watching this pure rubbish! Put it in a black hole and DELETE it from this world!

Review title: Don't listen to the critics this is a fun movie
Review_body: The Good- This is a great return for the Looney Tunes characters. There are certain jokes and quirks that absolutely work in here and there isn't really any character here that falls flat. Everything about the Looney Tunes characters is amazing and I have missed seeing these characters on the big screen. The animation is great as always and the CGI works when it's needed to. The actual basketball match is great when these characters are going completely bonkers it is so much fun to watch. I smiled and laughed throughout the whole film which is all I was really looking to get out of this film. Don Cheadle was a lot of fun in this role as well.The Bad- I didn't think LeBron James was that good in this role his acting just felt very fake or forced especially in the emotionally heavy moments. I wish that it wasn't completely focused on LeBron and more on the Looney Tunes much like the original.Overall Thoughts- Space Jam: A New Legacy is a fun movie, it's not a perfect film but neither is the original. It brought the Looney Tunes characters back on the big screen and did them justice, although I'd have loved to of seen them to be more of the main focus of the story. I miss these types of movies and this brings back a lot of nostalgia. Overall I'm going to give "Space Jam: A New Legacy" a 7/10.

Go into this with low expectations and the intention of having a good time and you will enjoy it. Inside jokes were great and only recognizable to an NBA/Lebron fan and although the story is not exactly original per say the animations were fantastic.I have a feeling the bad reviews are coming from bitter Lebron haters. I'm not a Lebron fan on the court but off the court he's great. The new Toon Squad jerseys/unis are outstanding and I was entertained from start to the finish. I won't spoil it here but the movie even had a moment where I got chills. All I'm going to say about that.This is not the place to show your hate for Lebron or debate the Lebron/MJ GOAT status. Just enjoy the movie for what it is. Having said all of that what's missing is a soundtrack like the original or even a hit song but long gone are those days of movies producing chart topping songs let alone soundtracks.

Be wary, viewer! You've heard this movie sucked, yes? You're expecting it to be so dopey and goofy but a little endearing. This film is not that. It resembles a slave auction, where the evil master WB puts all their slaves (IPs) up for a humiliating display? It is a brutal, demeaning, animal process, which is what this movie ends up being, too. If you've ever liked a fictional character, seeing them in this movie makes you like them less. Insulting on so many levels of the filmmaking process. Corporative slave auction. It freezes to the touch.

This was a great film, all the visual effects in the movie were amazing and they're simply awesome!I really loved the part when all the characters from others movies from Warner Bros. It's great to remember all those characters.I loved seeing the classic characters that were part of my childhood such as Scooby Doo or the Flintstones!The plot is the only thing that seem out of place. I consider this story very original and great but it could have been better.Good characters and great acting performance.In some parts, the movie has resemblance to the first one, but I loved it!!!A movie that you must see with your family this weekend. Highly recommend!!!

This is (for sure) the worst movie of 2021. It would a be Herculean labor to make something worse to this. It's like watching a new "Live Service" Movie-era. The reason that I dislike Fortnite is the reason that I dislike this movie. Boring and soulless !The "greek salad" type-movies need to stop. Only Wreck-It Ralph (2012) managed to do this just once. Ralph Breaks the Internet (2018), Ready Player One (2018) and Space Jam: A New Legacy (2021) are just an ode to corporate dominion and greed. They imprison IP names created with love and pathos and mash them together to earn money. Nothing more, nothing less.
News flash to all these zombie sold out corporations... we will never like LeBron ever again. He ruins everything he touches.

Review title: Not the best, not the worst
Review_body: I wasn't a huge fan of the original film so went into this with a fairly open mind and only really watched it because my 6 yr old son wanted to.It's nowhere near as bad as some reviews are making out but it's far from a classic. Not being an avid fan of the original I can't compare the two films.The acting in this is so wooden it makes Pinocchio look like a real boy. But at the the same time some of the cameos are ace! In fact, me & my lad quite enjoyed spotting the characters in the crowd during the big game. Sadly, they aren't integral to the plot so don't really hold weight when it comes to giving a rating.I can safely say I will neverwatch this movie again of my own volition. I did however enjoy spending the time with my boy.On a side note, reminiscent of Garth Elgar.... girl bunny is strangely attractive lol.

Review title: C'mon everyone it wasn't that bad
Review_body:
Let's be dialectical here for a secLebron's acting was ....passable in a passable movieDon cheadle's role and character arc.....above average in a passable movieThe tunes acting all looney was... better in some parts than others in a passable movieSee the trend here? This movie (like most) doesn't have to be black and white; good or bad.It can be cute but really pushing in the corporate sponsorship there
It can be soulless but yet still have some heart at the end
(remeber dialectical!!)
To be honest I thought I was gonna hate this movie from the start and I did I actually did but as the film progressed and the characters were given more time to shine especially in an important scene that required emotions I thought it wasn't good neither bad just.... PassableTo say it was better then the original is a battle you will never win because it remains such a memorable piece of nostalgia so it's really silly to fight over itDoes this movie redeem the Looney tunes to their former glory .... absolutely notBut to the younger generation it just might be
(Dialectics!!)

Terrible, just terrible. The Mrs. And myself got that this wasn't aimed at our age group when we started watching, but what we got was a horrible mess, putting The Last Jedi to shame in both the number of nastily leaking plotholes and overall bad screenwriting.Not worth an actual review I'll suffice to say we got out when the movie turned cartoon style. We figured the movie would become watchable at this point. It didn't.I managed to avoid the original, despite buying hundreds of original movies a year on VHS when that came out. Figured it wasn't for me. Should have kept my guard up I guess, getting old made me weak.I hope this Le Bron James fellow (not sure I spelled that correctly, I'm European, so to me he's just a name I've vaguely heard of) got paid his weight in platinum for this. Surely he'll never get another paying job as actor?I think I'll go take a shower now, watching (part) of this "movie" made me feel kinda gross.

The movie is great and if I dare to say even better than the original. The movie is full of pop culture references and it's really funny if you belong in the adult audience. It has its fair share of 3D and 2D animation and the main idea is more promising than the original. It's actually less stupid and more satisfying to watch because everything in the plot is built with much more care than the original space jam which is cool and all but it barely fills its 90 minute duration. Space jam a new legacy is 2 full hours and you have something cool to watch every minute. I really wasn't looking forward to watching it but I'm glad I did. It's a very nice family movie with respect to the original.

Review title: Ok.. Old one was better, but this was Good
Review_body:
I can't understand the negativity for this movie.. it is nicely done, great CG, great nostalgia, good story, meh acting but again this is Lebron the basketball legend.. I highly recommend this for family view..
I loved it..
I agree, should've been a sequel not a remake, but ok it delivered with cute referencing to the Micheal Jordan one....

Review title: Not horrible not great just meh
Review_body: This film is meh. It's so meh I can't muster enough meh to review it🤷‍♂️

I'm not sure why the ratings are so low for this. As an adult, is it the best kids movie I've seen? No. Was LeBron's acting terrible (as expected)? Yes. Did my 4 and 6 year old nieces like this? They LOVED it. It's a movie for kids that every kid I know who's watched it has actually enjoyed. If you're an adult and are looking for a great movie to watch, this isn't for you. That being said, for adults who do tune in, Don Cheadle makes the movie. He's hilarious.

Is there like a prerequisite to overuse CGI nowadays?The original was good because the story was simple, akin to the Looney Toons cartoon series, and the cameos from the other NBA players were simple and light-hearted. The only CGI was the obvious putting the real-world characters into the Looney Toones cartoon setting.In this abomination, for starters the name of the movie doesn't even relate to the theme. It's a cash grab off past glories.There is no mention of outer space in this, WHICH IS HOW THE ORIGINAL GOT ITS NAME. Instead this trash was set inside a computer (game) system. Not even remotely close to outer space.Turning the Looney Toons into 3D stop motion animation was just trying too hard to modernise something that didn't need modernising.LeBron was stiff and too sentimental. The sentiment wasn't needed. Even though MJ was the star attraction of the original, the plot wasn't about him per se. However in this product-placed trash, the movie is all about Lebron and how he's a superior individual who can still be better. Yawn, seen it a thousand times already.The family were just far too perfect too. Except for the son who created the game. He was too self-entitled. Just totally unrelatable, the whole lot of them.The video game was a complete rip-off of NBA Jam too. Didn't try to hide it either.Having the teams scoring in the thousands was just dumb.Fortunately, the kids will be naive to the original and not see how flawed the plot of this abomination combined with LeBron's cardboard acting and they'll probably enjoy the OTT antics of the Looney Toons in this. Me, a childhood fan of Looney Toons and Space Jam, not so much.

It sucks. I couldnt even finish it. It exist solely as an ad. Marketing other better films. I honestly dont know why this film was made!The first film thou not perfect, was way better and memorable. This film is fgorgetible. I honestly hated it. Regretted wasting my time on it. I did not finish it.
Wish I could give it less than 1 star. Going back to watch the original. Maybe. I think this may have killed it for me. 😫

This trash is hardly a movie. Just one long commercial for LeBron, advertising, and product placing. Simply put, it's all a money grab for the elite companies to cash in on. What a shameful world Hollywood has become. Sad part is, Lebron's ego won't let him realize how bad this is. He will literally think it's Oscar worthy. How many times does he have to have his name mentioned!!

That's how you'll feel the whole movie, there's nothing on the line.Everything happens with ease, no real problems faced. Everything feels superficial, just happening because some lazy writer wrote so, all for conveinience to take your hard-earned cash with the last amount of effort.Even a 6 year old would write a better more indept movie. Now the Space Jam wasn't everything, but it at least felt like it had a soul. This "New Legacy" however is just a bunch of checkmarks on a generic plotline.If you don't watch it you don't miss anything, in fact you save yourself quite some time and most of all frustration and disappointment.

Review title: Not great but what do you expect from looney tunes
Review_body: My wife and I enjoyed it for what it's worth. You can't take this movie to serious because it's a cartoon! For those of you who didn't like this. What did you expect from this? Even the real actors didn't take this that serious and they had fun with it. They weren't going for the Oscar they were going for entertainment. If that's how you would look at it then you would enjoy this just like you enjoyed the original. I do wish that Micheal Jordan would've showed up but I still enjoyed it just the same.

Pointless movie made just so hollywood can ripoff consumers and rake in more money for delivering mediocrity. LeBronda is a joke and not a role model like Michael Jordan was and is. Maybe hollywood will one day realize the majority of the public doesn't buy into the media's propaganda and virtue signaling crybabies.

I watched Space Jam for the first time when i was 5 years old so i have it on my mind with good nostalgic feelings.But man, how i enjoyed this movie. I've seen many people complaining about the cameos and refferences... but that was a good part too, Ready Player One has a lot of that and no one says nothing bad about it; references and cameos appart, the animation and overall story is good and pretty enjoyable for everyone; classic humor can be seen everywhere with the Looney Tunes and many other jokes told. And the match had such action and intense moments alongside the 3D animation characters that are very good (yeah, that's for the haters of Lola's redesing, she's still good).But as this had all that good, there was only 1 thing that tooke me out of the movie completely and it was everytime Lola talked... let me explain. In my country (Spain) they decided to cast Lola Bunny with a Star Talent named Lola Indigo... and she breaks the moment that the movie tries to build, fun, sadness or even the speech in mid-time is runined by her Star Talent voice (Zendaya at least did it great, for sure).Ejoyable? Yes, Good Humor? Yes, Cameos? Yes please! Everything is good... just don't watch it in Castillian Spanish... Lola is a hurt for the ears.

Review title: Space Jam 2, How we inserted every Warner Media character into this film
Review_body: Ohh boy. I just saw Space Jam: A New Legacy. My head is still spinning from what I just saw. Granted, the first wasn't a Oscar winning piece, but it was watchable and exciting.We open up with LeBron as a child, more interested in his GameBoy. Coach takes his video games away as it isn't helping and say's basketball will help your mother.Mr James ( or King James, uggh as he is called over and over)asks his son, who is developing a video game, if he wants to tag along.to the Warner Brothers lot to listen in on a supposed project. At this time, we meet Don Cheadle's character inside the computer (yes, it is really that confusing.)Don Cheadle wants to play a basketball game. If you win, you are free, I win, you stay with me in here forever. So, James and Bugs Bunny go on a search to find the Loony Tunes characters.That is the movie. Assembling the "team" then playing a game. The movie is chocked full of every single Warner Media character. It got to a point where it was super frustrating seeing so much brand product placement. Sure, Disney does Hidden Mickey's, but that is less subtle. Seeing It the clown and The Mask were too distracting in the crowd. In fact, there was an overly long, awkward Austin Powers bit which did not fit except being owned by Warner.. At one point, I figured I'm watching a giant ad for HBO Max.One more thing that annoyed me, Lebron can not act! I wanted to leave, but I forced myself to watch this. Couldn't Warner Media have picked a NBA star who can well, act?

Review title: An excuse for WB to advertise
Review_body: WB's name was all over this in the most terrible way possible. It's the definition of cringe.Terrible acting by pretty much everyone involved apart from Michael B. Jordan's cameo lol.The only good parts were some Loony Tune jokes here and there.They basically stole the plot of Hook too.What an absolute disaster.

Even worse than the first one just a bunch of stupid references to other Warner brothers properties to disguise the thin plot. Most of the loony tunes would taste good on my plate not as 3 dimensional characters they're as flat as flapjacks. This movie is boring as hell I was not all interested it's just shiny gimmicks made to make small children want to watch it like dangling keys in front of a baby.

Review title: (Mis)using a famous name does not save the day....
Review_body: I started watching the film fearing that it would be just a mediocre combination of a legend basketball player's life surrounded by many of my favorite cartoon characters à la "Despicable me". Alas, it wasn't even close. The story sucked, the actors, oh well (they're not actors, right? But then why do they act...). No coherence, no character developing, not even enough cartoon moments, no real laughs, nothing to keep you watching. Yes everything is cartoonish, but besides the names and facial features there is nothing reminding me of my childhood's heroes. Also no basketball (I mean real basketball). To my utter disappointment Warner Bros managed to produce a sequel to Space Jam, which is even worse than the first one (and that's no easy task).It is simply one of the worst movies I watched lately, and I am certain, that it wouldn't have made it to the theaters without LeBron's name. It's a pity it finally did....

Review title: Did they get a robot to play Lebron
Review_body: Seriously, this guy does better acting on the court feigning injuries. I don't get it, it was like listening to Shaq give a thesis on gravity wells. Unintelligible and boring. I even thought the toons were 50 shades more benign than they've been portrayed in the past. Having watched the original Space Jam in theaters too as a kid, this is the furthest they could've gone from the original MJ legacy. Maybe just let certain IPs die.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is an entertaining and nostalgic movie. It does a pretty good job at presenting the world of the Looney Tunes along with some great Easter eggs. However, that's pretty much the only good thing about this movie. Basically every other aspect in this sequel is just plain bad! The acting, the story, the plot and everything all around.It was fun watching some of the characters we grew up loving, but this movie misses a lot more than it hits.

I really tried to enjoy it while watching it. But I just couldn't. I found myself checking to see how much time is left at least 5 different times and at one point I paused it to be on my phone for 30 mins. I never really laughed, the most this movie got out of me was a couple smiles. And that's it. Only time I came close to laughing was the Michael B Jordan. Cameo. That was pretty good. Other than that, I watched it and was disappointed and will never watch it again. I thought Lebron acted well for not having a lot of movies under his belt and he was funny in Trainwreck so I gave him the benefit of the doubt with this movie. Not even gonna compare it to the original. Doesn't compete. Even if the original didn't exist and this movie came out on its own it'd still be crap.

Space jam a new legacy is proof that Hollywood has officially abandoned the pursuit of creativity in favour of rehashed old content made for algorithms & click machines. Its like all WB Exces, LeBron & some ball players sat together and imagined a vanity project to simply flex on audience. I liked some cameo but it was cameo after cameo after cameo with little to no part to play in movie. Plot is absolutely non existent you can guess the whole story from trailer. LeBron being a plank of an actor doesn't help either. Too many holes man too many, skip this one.

Review title: For a Family Movie it deserves a 10
Review_body: I don't know why people expected Lebron to start acting like Christian Bale, but this film is a basketball and kid oriented film, for a family as a whole to watch. Lebron did better than I expected with his acting (obviously not the best or close but still good enough) and the visuals and use of other warner bros intellectual properties made the movie just that much more fun to watch. There were a few moments where I even laughed out loud. It's not the best, it's not the worst, just appreciate a good, fun film instead of bashing it because Lebron knocked your team out of the playoffs. This is coming from a Clippers fan btw.

Review_body: LeBron chasing Jordan's legacy is as legitimate as this movie. Utter trash. No one will ever match what Jordan did in basketball but this movie just put the final nail in the coffin of GOAT. LeBron proves once again that the on,y consistency he offers is letting people down. Questionable NBA legacy and abominable movie career. Don't bother with this one.

Review title: I Only Gave A Bonus Point for Looney Tunes
Review_body: Bron had a promising performance on the movie Trainwreck. It just plummeted here. And yes, Michael Jordan is STILL the GOAT.

I expected to scoff at this entire movie and instead I only scoffed at the first third. The premise of Lebron's son being some NBA Jam inventing wunderkind, and Lebron being the regimented dad who couldn't see the literal genius behind him was just so dumb. It was the most paint by numbers "I think I know what kids are into" setup they could have went with, and Lebron's acting only made it sillier.But once they got into the Looney Tune world, there were some decent chuckles. I'm a sucker for the Looney-style slapstick and some of the references to other WB properties landed, even if most were lazy. People consider the gratuitous referencing/advertising to be ruinous to the movie, forgetting their was a scene in the original where Daffy kissed his own ass with a Warner Brothers logo on it. At least there was more effort than THAT in this one.The best parts of the movie are Lebron and Bugs gathering the Looney Tunes team together. The stuff before that was awful. After, the game itself went too long and there wasn't as much comedy as I was expecting there, but it was fine. Not nearly as entertaining as the original but I'd say it did it's job. And the ending was just there. Nothing to it.Overall though I think there is plenty of stuff here for kids to enjoy and JUST enough old school Looney humor and references to make adults not hate their lives watching the movie. I think it's overhated by the weirdos that can't stop with Jordan/Lebron debates. Just take the movie for what it is, and it's not "good" but it's enjoyable.Which is exactly what I would say about the original, by the way.

Review title: LeBron's new Space Jam falls short of the original
Review_body: Space Jam: A New Legacy trades the heart and soul of the original film for what seems like a corporate tour of WB's IP branding.
Animes Nice, but stories is not normal. Half of film is praying for ending.

Review title: Not a good return for the Looney Tunes
Review_body: The problem with this movie is everyone will compare it to the classic original Space Jam movie. Lebron is a better actor than Michael Jordan BUT Michael Jordan was universally loved by everyone. Lebron has fans but not everyone likes him. They also market this movie as a family film yet Lebron uses foul language. Not a family movie or even an enjoyable one. I say skip it.

I got very confused thinking whether this is a reboot or a sequel because of the logic and mentions of this movie. Throughout the movie, it felt more like a reboot than a sequel since the first movie the world of the Looney Tunes lived underneath a golf course, and in this movie, they live in a self-aware computer simulation designed as an algorithm which made it feel like a reboot. But when we meet the Looney Tunes characters they mention the most obvious things in the first movie, like Bugs and Lola mentioning that they've done a basketball tournament before and all of the other Toons remembering Michael Jordan and Sylvester bringing Michael Jordan but instead brought Michael B. Jordan for an unnecessary cameo. Which makes my mind hurt like thunder: is it a reboot or a sequel?I believe Warner Bros. Relied on nostalgia too much in this movie, there are cameos and references to their movies but they don't do it right, they even made cameos of characters they don't even own like Rick and Morty, I think. I don't know how many things they own but they relied on it too much and don't have enough time to improve the story.The good parts in this movie are the setups and payoffs in it but some don't make any logical sense. The plot is good with the stakes, the goals, but some of the urgency doesn't make any logical sense as it was established before.The character arc of LeBron was a little cliche but all the other arcs from other characters were either tossed aside or replaced that doesn't fit with its thesis and we're never established in the first place.I understand that this is Looney Tunes where everything is crazy and fun but in cinema there has to be some rules that need to be followed.

Frankly, I don't know anything about basketball, I grew up with the first film, and at the time I knew the name of Jordan, but only because it was a little bit mentioned on television, an iconic name like Dali for boxing or Pelé and Maradona for soccer... Lebron, on the other hand, I did not know who he was, nor that he was disliked by half of the fans of this sport, so I did not automatically judge him as an unfortunate choice.I found the film itself a little inferior to the progenitor, which was already a simple film for kids, with a non-actor visibly struggling to talk to the void (even for real actor it is complicated). Lebron honestly seemed less awkward than Jordan, but the film falls on other fronts. There are too many improvised humans for too much time, and the emancipating diatribe between father and nerdy son, quickly becomes annoying. While the first film, in its mediocrity, I could still watch it every now and then, of this sequel, I think I just liked the recruiting part in 2d animation.Regarding the scandal for the flattening of the chest of Lola I think that the fans have exaggerated... a little, it is true that in the '90s she had a more aggressive appearance, but she never had an exaggerated body like Jessica Rabbit, nor even provocative like Berri of "Conker" or the Minerva Mink of the "Animaniacs". Lola has been made more generic, for small children, it is true, a pathetic choice for sure, but it is not all this great change and loss, she's never even been popular. I would have understood more if the fans had complained about how sometimes, the CG, does not render his face very well in the "three-dimensional version". On the other hand, regarding the exile of that loser womanizer of Pepè Le Pew for ravings of incitement to rape ... it reminds me of the silly polemics about japan robots in the 80s and against magical girls in the 90s. Luckily Pepé has never been particularly nice or funny, give a damn, but it remains a disturbing fact.As for the opponents, the first impact is negative, the Monstars were not very charismatic masses of muscles, but their being dull and brightly colored made them nice. These new mutants have less time to make themselves known and have to struggle harder because of the grim CG.The development of the challenge is rather confusing because in addition to sports, it mixes video-game rules with Looney's follies, and computer graphics complicates things. The Rap part sucks, but not as much as the excessive citation of the Warner properties, which used the film to get a mega publicity, even making many famous characters move awkwardly in the background, worse than a Capcom fighting game. Plus, other minor quotes that should grab the nostalgic, like the wtf Mc Hammer ballet. Even some regular scenes are a bit nonsense, like super Granny against Chronos.The quality hasn't really dropped, it's just that they tried too hard in my opinion. Simplicity was the winning weapon in the first film, the incipit of this sequel feels more stupid, both for the identity of the algorithm, and for the way in which technology is superficially treated, with an aftertaste of old "Serial Experiments Lain" that doesn't get your brain off the ground like a couple of unscrupulous cartoonish alien entrepreneurs. Obviously, the new generations will elaborate it in their own way, but I don't think they will diverge too much in opinion.In short, a film to be seen only once, there is a certain attention to detail, but... I doubt it will be remembered as the first with Jordan.
Wubba lubba dub dub rick and morty have very secret easter egg in this epic that takes place in WWII is truely terrible and disgusting.

I thought it was rather entertaining to watch. People are being overly harsh rating it 1/10 and it certainly doesn't compare to bad movies I have watched before. Review title: Space Jam: A New Legacy: A Fun Children's Movie
Review_body: Space Jam: A New Legacy: A Fun Children's MovieDimwitted, entertaining and action filled, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" serves the purpose it needs to serve and more!In a cartoon world, famous basketball Star LeBron James and his son are trapped in a Warner Bros algorithm. To get out, LeBron James teams up with the Looney Tunes in an epic basketball match for the ages.Despite LeBron James' poor theatrics throughout the flick, the acting was phenomenal. Whether it be Zendaya as Lola Bunny or Don Cheadle playing a rogue AI, the film featured many famous actors who performed their heart out, no matter the scene.While the acting was nothing to laugh at, the plot and writing wasn't nearly as good. As it is a kid's movie, the screenplay featured many unnecessary scenes that present cameos and semi funny jokes for the adult audience. Moreover, in true Space Jam fashion, the story (although fun) was too much.In addition to the acting, the special effects were amazing. No matter the scene, the screen was brimming with life and color. Furthermore, despite their cartoonish appearance, the Looney Tunes look as though they belong in real life.In summary, Space Jam: A New Legacy is a fun movie that suffers from a horrid plot and bad writing.

Review title: Space Jam: A New Legacy (2021) feels like a long SNL sketch that just bombs hard.
Review_body: It is always trying too hard to overachieve, that it ends up constantly under delivering. There is a scene early on in the movie where James says to WB executives - "Athletes acting, that never goes well. ... With all due respect, this idea is straight up bad." And that in itself is the review of this movie in a nutshell.In another scene later on, where James and Bunny are making a team, James starts naming DC characters that would make for a great team - Superman, Iron Giant, King Kong, etc. Now that would've been a fun and new twist to the original legacy of Space Jam but instead what we end up getting is a bad mish-mash of the old movie with the same old Loony Tunes characters.Throughout the movie I was so distracted by all the WB Easter eggs and that made me realize how uninteresting the actual movie was. It just did not make me feel anything. I re-watched the original Space Jam before watching this one and Oh! How much fun that movie was! It was silly and goofy and yes a little loony but I thoroughly enjoyed it. I would suggest you re-watch that one and just skip this one.If you thought Michael Jordan's acting was bad, wait till you see LeBron James' acting.

Initially I had no plans to watch this being a fan of the original, but given it was free on HBO Max as a family we decided to give it a go.Overall I'd say it wasn't completely terrible, but definitely wasn't as good as the first one. The story while good enough as a sequel was really brought down by the James family acting moments. LeBron and the kids were wholly unbelievable, but the mother was decent as the no nonsense member of their family.While the upgraded graphics were really good, the best parts of the movie were where they were cutting on LeBron for various things he has done in his career and Porky Pigs rap solo in my opinion.The only thing that may have saved this movie was if Michael Jordan really had walked into the locker room instead of Michael B. Jordan.This just seems to be another case of LeBron trying to prove he is better than Jordan.

Review title: Not as good as the original but still enjoyable
Review_body: Let's get one thing straight. The original Space Jam is far superior to Lebron's remake. But this remake was still fun to watch. Lebron can't act to save his life. His acting was atrocious. But then again, Jordan's acting in the original wasn't much better either.Enough with the MJ/Lebron comparisons though. Too many fanboys make the mistake of judging this movie on a biased perspective of whether or not they like or dislike Lebron. Aside from all that, Lebron's remake did a decent job of entertaining the audience. From an artistic and creative point of view, this movie was awesome. I especially liked the attention to detail in the basketball game scene with so many WB characters as spectators. Very cool.

Review title: The magic of Space Jam is missing
Review_body: For those of us who grew up watching Space Jam of the all-powerful Michael Jordan we will surely not like this new version very much. And it is that nothing can be reproached to LeBron James who made a great effort to ignite that magic but rather the error comes from the excess of excess computer production.The plot is loose, chaotic in colors, chaotic in production and with little or very few moments that make you laugh. It is hateful to compare but in this case it was necessary to compare it with the first film, so this new version leaves much to be desired.

I still prefer the first Space Jam than this part, story was not written well, acting was very poor. One thing that only stands out was the looney characters themselves, love them all! Great animation and visual effects, but that's about it.

Obviously LeBron James is NOT a professional actor, but neither was Michael Jordan. I'm sure most of these negative reviews are from people who grew up with the original (like myself) and feel like this isn't as good. The original is on HBO Max too, go back and watch that one again, and see if it is still as perfect as you remember. I guarantee it's just as silly and fun as you remember, but far from a perfect movie.This movie is also far from perfect, but it's not supposed to be?? It's a Space Jam for this generation with this generation's most prominent basketball player. Yes there were some weak plot points, and less than stellar acting in some places, but it's still a heartfelt movie with a good message for kids and adults alike.The animation is the best part of the film for me. I loved seeing all the classic Looney Tunes on screen, and I loved the addition of Zendaya as Lola Bunny.If you have HBO Max, it's definitely worth the watch. I would not pay extra to see it in theaters, but it is a fun time.

Review title: It's solid, but it's just not my Space Jam
Review_body: I grew up on the original Space Jam movie and I loved it for the pure enjoyment of Bugs Bunny and the Looney Tunes. Is the original really that good to begin with?? Well, no. The original suffers from many of the same flaws that A New Legacy has, but ANL has just a few more. Michael Jordan in the original movie had some pretty stiff acting and Lebron James is the same way as well, except MJ's characterization felt a little more realistic while Lebron's was more over the top and lacked the soul that this film needed. Lebron and his "son's" story just didn't really mesh super well and made the film feel a bit off balance. Bugs and the gang were just as entertaining as ever though and Don Cheadle as the villain Al G Rithm was pretty amazing. The overall story itself was a lot more complex then it really needed to be which made it feel unnecessarily over the top constantly. I understand the premise of the franchise in general is insane, but at least the film from 96 managed to stay more grounded and balanced with its characters and story. Is A New Legacy really that bad? No, but the flaws are there and fairly noticeable, especially when you finish the film and it feels like you just missed something. It was still a fun enjoyable time and the concept is just fun for kids. A solid 6.5/10 for sure, but I'd watch again so maybe a light 7/10 on a good day.

Good:
Was smiling from ear to ear the entire time to see the toons back on the big screen and to finally get a sequel to one of my favorite kids movies.Lots of references really hit the point and there were quite a lot of heavy laughs to be had.Lots of creative ideas and moments when the movie got very aware of itself on the meta level.The "Hook"-like plot about the relationship between a son and his dad was pretty well told.Knowing the toons for a long time gave you the chance to laugh a little earlier than everyone else whenever a characteristic scene was set up.The "Mad Max" sequence.Bad:
Didnt have the excitement, the well-done editing or the awesome score of the original.The 2D animation was too clean and not as charming as the classic Looney Tunes stuff.The CGI felt weirdly out of date.Lebron isn't a very good actor.The crowd of many WB characters present at the game mostly looks like people in bad cosplay.Quite alot of cringe and cliche.

But really more of, Computer YouBetterDontChargePeopleForThis.Take a note from the comments. Everyone is SICK and TIRED of remakes and series continuations of classics that don't stay true to said classic.This movie was a disgusting cash grab. Even if you have absolutely nothing left to watch, this still wouldn't satisfy your TV needs.

Review title: Not as bad as they all say
Review_body: Okay....yes it's not very good but it's not trash like everyone says here. I do think the majority of the hate comes from them making a second one with Lebron though. People love Jordan and want to compare it like he is trying to out do it etc. It's called a new legacy because Jordan is to old now etc so you need the new most famous and most would call the best player of current times. They even reference MJ and they clearly remember him etc. It's not like they are taking that away they are just going with a new player. Again, I think most of the below 4 star reviews have something to do with their love for the first, they hate Lebron, or they think MJ is the best and want to do the comparison thing to Lebron. The movie is not great. This movie was doomed to be hated when it was green lit. Yes I do think they could have gone with a different plot and it would have helped the movie a ton. Lebron could also be a better actor lol. Cause oooof. I watched it to just see and it's not that great but it's a movie you can turn on and watch and I'm sure kids will like it. It's a fun movie that could have been better but I don't think it deserves the hate it's getting. Again read most of the reviews most of the hate is from the reasons I said above. Just watch it as it's own movie where Lebron plays B Ball with looney tunes. They gave love to the first and had a few funny jokes about it etc. It's not great but it's what it is.

People complain that LeBron is a bad actor when his soul purpose was to be a serious workaholic athlete, but even then his acting was still pretty good as well as his lines and comedy. This movie was a little bit cheesy but nothing that I hated. It wasn't '96 Space Jam good, but almost as good. See it, you will enjoy it.

Review title: Space Jam New Legacy is NOT a complete dumpster fire
Review_body: I'm going against the grain here in saying Space Jam: New Legacy was NOT a complete dumpster fire of a movie. It's more of a matter of perspective. Most people reviewing this movie now were under the age of 10 when the original came out in 1996 including me. That movie was a classic and remained in our minds as a cherished memory. As it should because it brought Looney Toons, which were still relatively popular at the time, and Michael Jordan who was a literal basketball legend known world wide, together in formula that was fail-proof. I feel most people already had a stigma coming into this film whether their personal dislike of Lebron, uninterest in the old school Looney Toons characters, or just not willing to like this movie because the original is the one we hold close to our hearts.I personally started enjoying the movie once the toons were introduced. Before that point, it was borderline unwatchable. You have to remember overrall, this is a movie geared towards kids of that age group in today's world. You can't take every movie so seriously.Yes, Lebron's acting sucked but so did Michael Jordan's in the original. The film IS a bit all over the place but sometimes you just have to sit back and enjoy a movie for what it is. If you go into it with that outlook, you might not have that horrible of a time.
Movie doesn't deserve all the hate, it's fun and enjoyable to watch.
Boring plot and LBJ is a terrible actor. This is basically a 2hr advertisement for HBO Max.
Terrible. Couldn't finish it. Watch the original, it's much better!

Review title: A movie made for no one
Review_body: There were two ways Space Jam: A New Legacy could have succeeded: as a kids movie for today's kids, or as a nostalgic homage to the original. It fails at both.It's far too long and slow for a kids movie, and the Looney Tunes don't appear until something like 1/4 way into the movie. Kids don't care about Casablanca, The Matrix, and A League of Their Own. Kids aren't nostalgic for MC Hammer. They don't care about lines from Training Day. Kids sure as hell don't go to a movie for references to A Clockwork Orange.So is it for nostalgic adults? No. This movie has nothing to do with the original Space Jam. It doesn't acknowledge the previous jam. It doesn't even play the signature song. There are no clever jokes for adults. All of the properties I listed above (and hundreds more) are used as mere props to remind the audience of how many properties WB owns.It's a total waste of film.

Definitely Doesn't deserve the low rating ...The movie was fun and entertaining but also not a perfect movie ...the good things in it is the CGI and some of the jokes were funny and i enjoyed this One more than the original space jam.

Why? Just why?It seems we are doomed to have one of these nostalgia-bait, blatant cash-grabs each year.The special effects are an improvement on the original, except worse somehow.All the charm and soul of the original are gone here, and with no fun lead or compelling story, what you're left with is a handful of broken characters and ideas.If you like the original, don't watch it.If you don't like the original, definitely don't watch it.If you haven't seen the original, watch that instead.Please don't waste your money, spend it on one of the actual movies out now.
Who edited this, really badLola needed to be thicker.
I believe the character development between LeBron and bugs bunny was some of the best character development I have ever seen.

Review title: LaQueen should stick to acting on the court.
Review_body: I thought it would be much better since he is a great actor while playing basketball. I couldn't watch it all the way through I had to go drink some drano.

So yeah, this movie is bad. It's a blatant corporativistic circlejerk of Warner, nothing make any sense and it's filled with awkward moments. The audience for this is Warner executives, Warner workers and their families. It's neither for children nor for adults. Yeah, all of that is true. But seriously, have you watched the original in the last, I don't know, 5 years? Maybe it has more heart than this one, but it also has the exact same problems, at least in what concerns the corporativistic aspect and the main protagonist. So I don't get why this is bashed, and not the previous one, outside of blind nostalgia. Furthermore, I find funny that this is corporativistic garbage, but all the Marvel and DC movies are not. Who bashes those movies for those aspects?? Almost no one. Anyway, I'm not gonna defend this movie, other than some jokes that I find funny and creative, in the Looney Tunes vibe. 2.5/10.

Review title: Good Looney Tunes Movie, Mediocre LeBron James Movie
Review_body: I'll keep it brief, but let's just say that LeBron James is definitely not actor of the year. When he finally meets the Looney Tunes after he and his son, Dom, get into trouble with the Warner Bros AI, the film's antagonist, then it gets interesting since the Looney Tunes characters were fun enough to carry the film.With that though, they should've taken cue from the first movie and introduce us to the Looney Tunes characters earlier, and point out the stakes through the AI character.The ending also could've been better, longer, and covering more than one real-life location. The closest we got are the photos in the credits.

Review title: Stop acting like the first one was masterpiece theatre
Review_body: These super low reviews are just haters. Look, he ain't my favorite player either...but as a 90s kid I like this one so much better. Kids will love this for sure! It's definitely a new legacy.I love the casted versions of his real family. I also loved all of the nostalgia throwbacks and a few hilarious surprises that kids and adults will eat up for sure.The beginning was dry.. But once they actually get to the game...recruiting and playing...it got better. I didn't expect to literally lol. I was prepared to hate it. But I didn't. Solid watch - 6. Your kids will love it.

We all know that space jam 1 was a classic. It was something we watched over and over as kids, and continued to do so throughout our adulthood giving us nostalgic vibes. However, space jam 2 wasn't nearly as good as the first. It was confusing, and the actual basketball game was unrealistic with crazy rules. Lebron was hilarious in train wreck, but he still needs some time and practice improving his acting skills. One more thing about the first was that the soundtrack was wayyyyy more memorable, which I still listen to today. I don't recall any song from the second that I would put on my playlist. Space jam 2 was just a one time watch.

When a person thinks of the looney tunes now, they unknowingly make it a synonymous grouping of all of the tunes. But it wasn't always like that, and anyone that knows the original looney tunes cartoons knows that. A cartoon may contain three, heck, maybe even four looney tunes all together, but never the entire cast! Thus when space jam arrived, collecting all of everyone's favorite loons together in one movie, the praise and excitement was ecstatic. This was the brilliance of space jam, and is one of the reasons why many still love the film. But this left space jam: a new legacy at a disadvantage. People have already seen all the toons together,(twice!) so now what? Well, how about instead of just all the looney tunes getting together, what if ALL Warner brothers properties got together?! Let's be honest, that sounds pretty cool. When you start to think about it a little more though, many problems arise. "How do you account for clashing art styles?" "How do you combine all worlds together while maintaining focus?" And ofcourse "who will replace his airness, Michael Jordan?" The answers: a simple versatile new cartoon style, a complex high tech computer, and the new basketball king, LeBron James. After saying all this, I understand why people feel this isn't space jam. It feels something sort of like space jam, but it's not. It's more like a ready player one spinoff movie than a looney tunes film! And you're right, 100%. I can not argue with you and ignore that and if that's how you feel I 100% understand your resentment towards this film. Personally I found a great deal of enjoyment in this movie, not just from its interesting concept and beautiful(I mean gorgeous) visuals, but from its new lead and story. Unlike many other people, I personally quite liked LeBron in this film, and this may be an unpopular opinion, but I think his acting beats Michaels by a long shot. I understand people thinking he's annoying and a bad father, but to be fair many of his faults are pointed out directly in the film, and he changes for the better by the end of the movie. As for the super computer aspect, I thought it was an interesting, though still kinda dumb idea, and honestly pesters me with more questions of "how???" The more I think about it. The final aspect, it's versatile new cartoon style, is another aspect I expect caused much irritation with the fans. "Why change the art style?" Like I said before, when trying to combine so many art styles, changing some may benefit the overall flow of the film, making it look more... "normal" I suppose. That being said, the looney tunes old design is sorely missed, and I felt that they're redesigns we're honestly unnecessary, and obviously I'm not the only person holding this opinion based on others ratings. And so all the main aspects of the film can either be positives or negatives, based on your expectations from the movie. Personally, I enjoyed it. Are there plot holes? Yes... and the first space jam held none??? In all honesty I wouldn't go into this film with the expectations of seeing a looney tunes film. I'd go into it with the expectation of seeing an epic warner-brothers basketball game, starring the tune squad and LeBron. Simple tweaks in expectations may make it a far more enjoyable experience to some, and I recommend a rewatch with that mindset if you felt unsatisfied with your first viewing.

Review title: In space, nobody can hear you groan...
Review_body: I gave it a 3. I was feeling very generous. LeBron will never be the global phenomenon that Jordan was no matter how hard he tries to walk in his footsteps. Jordan needs to bust his a*s and give him 60.
Haters gonna hate. This movie not Oscars material but is a good familiar movie.

Not well scripted or acted. Hollywood needs to learn that highly paid pampered privileged athletes are not commanding endearing moments from audiences. If you want to waste money because you love LeBron go ahead...guarantee you will walk away feeling like you put money in a shredder!
