Review_body: Very boring and corny. Its only somewhat interesting for like 5-10 minutes near the end. The only thing that remotely kept my attention inbetween was the cringey moments they throw at you every few minutes. Theres this forced plot about loving your children more than your career kinda like in Kazaam. LeBrons kid is extremely unlikable, hes a lazy spoiled gamer/hacker that only cares about himself. Oh, and the main villain is one of the worst I've seen. Terrible.
One Word: narcissism.It's not a movie it's a hagiography. One big advertisment. A movie it is not. LeBron James cannot act and is simply not a very relatable and likable person.
I had to stop watching. LeBron James should stick to throwing a ball. He should stay away from all forms of media.

As a 90s baby who grew up watching the original Space Jam, I'll admit that even that movie is really flawed, but this... this wasn't it. While I did enjoy some of the father/son moments, I think the first movie benefited from really just embracing the silliness from top to bottom. The plot was thin, but it was a Looney Tunes/NBA crossover; you don't really need to explain why everything's happening, just have fun getting there.This was fun at times, but it mainly felt like it was trying too hard to not be the first film (despite the in-film allusions to it), and got too bogged down by the need to remind you that LeBron was being a bad dad.
You cant make a good movie with just good animation.Story was trash, acting was trash. Lebron is trash for pandering to the CCP going as far as to say that free speech is bad.

Review title: For Our Kids, Not For Us
Review_body: The bad reviews are from adults expecting a follow up to the original Space Jam. This movie is for kids, not for adults. We already had our Space Jam, this is theirs and my son absolutely loved it.

The first Space Jam was corny and goofy, but it had its own unique charm and a simple yet acceptable plot that made the involvement of Jordan and other NBA players make sense as much as a cartoon basketball game movie could.This however is straight trash. It feels like one part feeding Lebrons ego, one part nonsensical abysmal story, and ten parts promotional work for everything WB owns.The plot involving a computer algorithm as the main antagonist that somehow sucks LeBron and his kid into a server and then forced them to play the sons video game creation is the most half baked idea I ever heard. The acting by almost everyone involved is the furthest thing from believable possible. The whole thing is a lot of cgi flashy nonsense and nothing of real substance. This is just an embarrassment through and through.
Not compatible or comparable to the 90s jam...stupid.....boring....acting is bad.....even cartoon characters are not funny.....skip it.

Review title: Absolute steaming pile of hot garbage
Review_body: Save your cash....and sanity, watch the original Space Jam as that has everything you're expecting from New Legacy.....like a believable plot and comedy.New Legacy has no redeeming features, it's absolutely terrible and a clear cash grab for WB and ego stroke for LeBron. Lame plot lame acting....zero laughs from anybody for the whole 2hrs.I don't know LeBron and I feel this movie has made a lot of people not want to meet him either....comes across as a dim wit that has no sense of humour and is ignorant of his kids and their ideas/ dreams/ aspirations/ hobbies.....you know, because he's soooo busy working long hours at the factor.....Oh wait, he just plays basketball for millions of dollars.....Yeah he's a bad father. Didn't like LeBron with his political blm nonsense but he's actually smashed it out the park with reasons to dislike him.LeBron would be my first choice for a live action Pinocchio, as his "acting" was incredibly wooden.... king James 😂 talk about ego....they could have used a mop instead of LeBron and it would have been just as believable.Feel sorry for Don Cheadle having this smearing his career, as he's generally a good actor in good movies.I'd rather pull out every hair on my body with tweezers, than to watch this painfully dull movie again. 1 star for Don Cheadle and the effects team.

Review title: This is just a fun, goofy, fan service overloaded movie!
Review_body: This movie is everything I expected it to be. A fan servicey, silly, fun movie. And it was just that.The opening did surprisingly get me invested in this movie. I like the cameos in this too!I feel like zendaya wasn't the best choice for Lola (still love her tho!)You can tell Don Cheadle was having so much fun with this role and it pays off. He's great!Lebron is feels a bit choppy but it's because he ain't an actor so I can't really complain.All the other voice acting in this movie is great!All round, this is just a fun, goofy, feel good, fan service overloaded movie! 6/10.

7.0Superstar LeBron James and his young son, Dom, get trapped in digital space by a rogue AI. To get home safely, LeBron teams up with Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck and the rest of the Looney Tunes gang for a high-stakes basketball game against the AI's digitized champions of the court -- a powered-up roster called the Goon Squad.
No one is expecting lebron to get an Oscar nomination so calm down. The CGI is awesome and it's fking funny.

I'll just start it off here. It's not perfect. As a kid, I didn't really watch the original Space Jam but loved Looney Tunes. I just wasn't into the whole sports theme. I remember certain parts of the original, such as Micheal interacting with the Looney Tunes characters, and when I heard a film with some 2D animation was coming to cinemas, I was hyped. I love 2D animation and I don't understand why it doesn't do well in terms of the box office.I didn't go into this film expecting much and... I got exactly what I expected. It was a fun filled experience but I felt bored? I'm unsure how to describe it. The 3D models look off at times and the acting was mediocre at best (I could not take the villain seriously). I also didn't laugh much at all which is unusual as I still find myself laughing at Looney Tunes to this day.The cameos though were really fun and I loved seeing the Tune World come to life. At the end of the day though, this is a kids movie. I'm not the correct target audience for this film. And you know exactly what I would have though of this as a kid? It's ok. Nothing more. I would have went off to watch the original cartoons afterwards. It's pretty unmemorable and I can't even remember the kids name off the top of my head, considering I just watched it yesterday.It's a good movie and a fun ride, but probably one you'll only watch once unless you absolutely love Looney Tunes, 3D animation and basketball.

I just watch Space Jam new Legacy on HBO max yes a lot of people might say bad reviews on this movie but it's actually a good movie to watch even though a lot of people said LeBron acting was terrible but there's no way Michael Jordan is a better actor than LeBron I know I'm going to get a lot of hate and a lot of thumbs down but LeBron is eventually going to get better with acting take it more serious in Hollywood and he still has a future in Hollywood 👀👀👀 not until after he retires from basketball I'm saying it right now a lot of people might hate my answer but I don't care what your opinions or you bad reviews say😂😂😂✌✌✌🤔🤔🤔

Review title: Not horrible, but won't satisfy the lovers of the original movie.
Review_body: As most of the users have written in previous critics, the movie has a lame/poor screenplay - and it is written by dozens of people! The movie is not very bad, still watchable, but won't satisfy the lovers of the original movie. I was a child when I watched the first movie; this one seemed like a pack of popular culture references overall. This is totally made for the gen Z or the newer one (Alpha). Loved the Michael Jordan - Michael B. Jordan joke, that's it. :)

I will say I did enjoy the movie for what its worth. I will say that some of the plot points were not all that well explained and they could of made a better effort at making it more cohesive. Lebron did well and made it seem like he was enjoying himself and showed his inner child when he was with the looney tunes. I still have to say that this reboot/sequel does not hold up the the original, Lebron is just not Jordan. Over all it was a decent film for this generations youth and I am sure that kids that go to see this movie will enjoy it.

This film had all the looniness you'd expect from a loony tunes movie. Its very fast paced, it's often stupid but thats kinda to be expected. I was entertained and never bored that's all I can really ask for. Worth checking out not amazing but passable.

My wife and I sat dish on a Sunday afternoon and popped this movie on We were pleasantly surprised with Space Jam 2. Funny and heartfelt. We had low expectations and came out thinking what a good movie this was.

This movie was ok, people just are negative no matter what today, our world is lost. It's entertainment, not a serious movie, take it as it is. Lebron was asked to do this movie, don't blame him. This is why I hate people, judgmental idiots.

Review title: I know it wasn't supposed to be a masterpiece but still..
Review_body: So yeah it wasn't boring, but like it felt empty, even the cameos felt unimportant, it was definitely a movie, still entertaining and a good time with your buddies.

Review title: LeCringe might want to stick to bball
Review_body: This was unwatchable. Granted it's intended for a child-audience, but us parents have to sit through the awfulness as well.Played like a lengthy commercial, and james' acting is embarrassing.

This reboot of space jam missed the point of the storyline. Instead of trying to so hard to relevant and cool, Warner brothers forgot this movie was marketed to children who probably don't know the looney tunes like the children that grew up on them. The original was about the looney tunes needing help from a legend saving their world from being taken by what I would call Bullies of the cartoon world. The movie it was fun, entertaining as well as teaching kids to stand up for themselves. I get main stream celebrities are not actor which is not what I was looking for. The main reason I watched it for the looney tunes and the storyline. This movie doesn't even compete or compare to the original.

Also, it's worth pointing out the original Space Jam was not amazing either (people are just blinded by childhood nostalgia) so this is about the same quality of acting and story,

Review title: It's not a masterpiece but it's not a 1...
Review_body: I saw the OG Space Jam maybe once or twice as a kid, so I wasn't as distraught over the idea of a remake as some people seem to be. My expectations were not that high. I was pleasantly surprised.It definitely starts off slow, but picks up eventually. I started off on my phone (watched at home) but actually watched the last 2/3 of it. The animation is worth paying attention to, if nothing else, and the crossovers and stuff are neat to catch.The 1 star reviews are unwarranted. James's acting is really not that bad. There are a few scenes where you can really tell it's not his day job, but I've seen other movies, with "professional actors" who did worse and nobody is ripping them a new one in the reviews.It is enjoyable. Appreciate the animation and the humor (there are indeed a few chuckles), and remember the fact that really, this is a PG movie and the target audience is like 8-13 year olds. You just will not get the depth and intricacies of plot that you would expect from a Scorsese, Spielberg, or Kubrick. I mean. Come on.It is a kid's movie, folks. For kids today to relate to and understand.This is a movie for children to enjoy. Not 26-35 year olds trying to relive their youth.If you want to see the original Space Jam so badly, rewind your VHS tapes and watch the original Space Jam.

This move is a full on praise of Lebron and how great and wonderful he is. Don't get me wrong, I'm a fan of basketball and I'm a fan of movies.. yet this drivel was over the top. It was a full on slobberfest on how the mighty king Lebron is. I'm sorry, I do not want to be hit over the head with that. It's like he spent money on this to be like: "look how great I am!" And I'm not having it. There was some really great elements and some actual potential to make this movie enjoyable, but it falls way to flat. I seriously wanted this movie to be better because it could have been fun. I'm thoroughly disappointed. I'm just glad I didn't pay to see it.
I love this movie because there is heartfelt moments and everything! I think it's better then the first one because it is really advanced tech!

I'll start by saying that Space Jam (the original) is one of my top 10 favorite movies of all time! I keep seeing people talk about the "acting being bad" and "being the worst movie ever made", but honestly I think people are letting nostalgia get the better of them.To me, this was an enjoyable movie that pieced in so many more properties from Warner Brothers, in a way that made it its own. It has kid-esq humor that can still be enjoyed by adults, and it had a mixture of new wave enjoyment with peppered moments of Nostalgia. It wasn't the most intricate story-line you're ever going to see, but you can tell there was an effort put forward.A Corny, Fun, over the top movie...I think if people forget that this is suppose to be its own entity...it is something they will truly enjoy. And Lebron James's Acting? Not as bad as people say...but its also not going to be an Oscar worth performance when you're in a Looney Tunes movie!

Review title: As a film its not great, but as a movie sure why not!
Review_body: It clearly is not supposed to win best film at the oscars but for what it is, it was pretty good.You can see how Lebron slowly became more comfortable in front of the camera as the movie progressed. He started very stiff and dry and then you can see he got into his role more when interacting with the Looney Toons characters.I loved the addition of all the Warner Bros characters. I think thats what really made the movie. Seeing all the characters from old shows or movies that spark memories in the audience. They really hit the mark for their target audience.I think thats also part of the reason I like this movie. Its specifically targeting the audience of people who have seen the first one and are probably a bit older, maybe 20s-30s and like basketball as well. A very specific population, and if you don't quite fit into it you won't appreciate it as much.Ok yes its corny and has bad acting. But thats not really the point of the movie. Like I said before, it's not supposed to win Best Actor or any award probably. So just take it as it is and have fun. It's not so serious.

Is it time to wake up already? I was looking forward to this movie and was ready to overlook below average acting. Terrible plot development + bad acting = slow and boring movie. We shut it off a little past half way and took a big step up to an exciting show and watched the Waltons. Seriously, this felt like a Lebron biography with an attempt to be funny by putting cartoon characters in. Much anticipation, big letdown.

Review title: My thoughts on space Jam a new legacy minor spoilers
Review_body: I want to start off this review that I have a huge fan of the original space jam. It has a place in my heart. So having said that after it was announced I was not very optimistic of this film. I went in not trying to compare this to the original and go in with an open mind. So after viewing the film I have to say I did not enjoy it . It was very lackluster and the acting was horrid In my personal opinion. It made me really want to watch the first one. Lebron isn't that good of an actor and I really wanted at least a Jordan cameo. One good thing was that there was a lot of Warner bros cameos and references which I found pretty cool. Overall it's not really that good maybe a kid might like it but fans of the original will not enjoy. I was expecting a micheal Jordan cameo and I got really excited went they alluded that he was coming to help. But they turn it into a joke with micheal b Jordan and it left me with a sour feeling. Having said that I really think it was not a good film no where near the original there were some really good jokes that made me chuckle a bit but other than that the jokes fell flat mainly it was aimed towards kids not fans of the original. So I give space jam a new legacy a 3/10. Let me know what you thought of the movie.

Review title: Was Lebron supposed to be the villain?
Review_body: Good things; the Toon Squad Lebron colorway, looking in the crowd for different characters, and I liked the video game ideal. The movie should've been dumb fun, but it was what I thought it would be, bad and mostly boring.

Michael Jordan's acting in the original was poor, but could be forgiven (he's not an actor, after all), but this is just rubbish. LeBron's acting is poor, as is the rest of the cast, even the Tunes aren't funny.Don't waste your time, if you want something for your kids to watch, I'm sure there's plenty of other things out there.

Review title: Just a bunch of LeBron haters
Review_body: It wasn't amazing, but it was pretty entertaining. Lebron acted a heck of a lot better than Jordan did. Original Space Jam had more star power but I respect the message that was put across in this one. Great family movie and I loved all the references. Both movies stand on their own.

I thought the storyline wasn't all that shabby. Leflop acting was mostly a miss. There could've been better development around the Goon Squad. Shoutout to Klay & Dray though. Michael B. Jordan scene was cool, but still would've been better if the Michael J. Jordan actually showed up. Eh I might watch again at some point. 💯💯

One of the worst acting I have ever witnessed
I have seen better acting from a child in fail
Video on YouTube
JUST AWFUL MOVIE.

Review title: The Lebron James and Warner Bros movie
Review_body: The whole movie was begging for viewers to "look at me". How great am I says Lebron James. Heh, remember us, says WB characters. Please look at us. We are just as relevant as Marvel characters. Yes, we really are. It was a showcase for Warner Bros and a vanity moment for James. He has a massive fan base, if you didn't know.

Review title: It's a 6/10, but a very low one
Review_body: Earlier today, I watched the first Space Jam, and I really liked it. It's no masterpiece, sure, but it's not trying to be. It's just a fun experience that knew what it wanted to be. The characters were likeable, it had good, fast pacing, the animation and 2D hybrid worked really well and it was just all-around fun.As for the sequel? Meh. I actually really liked the first half. It established the idea of a digital universe with Warner Bros. Properties, where LeBron James meeting Bugs Bunny in the Looney Tunes world and the other Looney Tunes being able to access different Warner Bros. Worlds. I can understand why some people wouldn't like this, it does feel very self-promoting and there are references to stuff for adults that kids won't understand. But on the other hand, they're only short scenes and do work as part of the concept of the Warner3000 Server-Verse. Other than that, I just thought that the film was really fun at this point. The Looney Tunes all get a time to shine and I almost thought that it would be on par with the original.As for the second half, that's unfortunately where the film starts to go downhill. It's not bad, and I like how they try and spend more time with the basketball game, but it's also where the film's biggest issue for me starts. You know how I previously criticised Maf's SuperMarioLogan Movie for feeling rushed with it's pacing. Well this film has the opposite problem. The basketball scenes feel slow and tend to drag on.Whilst the basketball stuff in the first one felt shorter in comparison, I didn't have an issue with that as they didn't overstay their welcome and the film's fast pace helped this. As for this film, I feel like they spent too much time on the basketball game. It hurt my enjoyment of the film because until then, I really liked it.I also find it funny that the last scene with the Looney Tunes that aren't Bugs have them looking sad whilst Bugs supposedly dies before he regenerates in the real world a week later.But overall, I did really want to like this movie, even with the poor reception it got. It's still okay, sure, but I was disappointed.

It's a rare occurrence when the kiddos and I aren't on the same page when it comes to movies. It seems as if animation studios have learned to cater to adults as well as children when it comes to kids' movies, and that's a great thing as a parent. But then a movie like Space Jam: A New Legacy comes along which gives parents nothing to grasp on to and makes you feel every minute of its excessively long two-hour running time. As for the kiddos though, they absolutely loved it!In Space Jam: A New Legacy LeBron James basically plays an exaggerated version of himself, treating his two boys like basketball teammates, rather than acting like a father, in a very overbearing and demanding way. Although one of his children likes playing basketball, his youngest Dom (Cedric Joe) would rather stay in his room building video games. LeBron is having none of it and demands that Dom constantly practice as well as attend an upcoming basketball camp. It is then, after a series of strange events, Dom & LeBron get sucked into a computer program run by Al G. Rhythm (Don Cheadle), with their only hope of returning to the real world if LeBron can beat Al G. In a basketball game. It may sound easy, but with James only having Looney Tunes characters as teammates and Al bringing in NBA & WNBA stars on his team, this may be a game that LeBron can't win.THE GOODNot a penny has been spared in making this one of the most colourful, beautifully animated features ever seen on film. Animation has come a long way from 1992's original Space Jam and in this sequel of sorts, all the usual Looney Tunes characters return, but this time, have been given a 3D-style makeover. If only some of that money was spent on producing a decent script!Mr. 10: This film was awesome. I loved seeing all the Looney Tunes characters come to life and seeing Porky Pig rap was my favourite. There were also lots of funny jokes, which was good too.Mr. 7: All the Looney Tunes characters are so silly and it's really funny when they're constantly fighting with each other. I like how they all team up together to play basketball against the bad guys.THE BADWith a script that sounds more like a Public Service Announcement, rather than an entertaining movie, I actually thought I was listening to something that a bunch of sixth-graders had put together rather than a Hollywood movie. While a lot of animated movies may cater to adults this film does not even bother, keeping everything low-brow and very childish from start to finish. I have no problem with this because my kiddos loved it, but what I don't understand however is just why you'd bizarrely put in scenes from The Matrix, Mad Max, and Casablanca. Mr.10 and Mr. 7 were continually leaning over in their chairs asking me what all these strange scenes were. Not only were kids not born when these films were originally released but they're not even in the age range to watch these films NOW!Mr. 10: The only part of the film I didn't like was Al G. Rhythm because he didn't make any sense. Sometimes he's really strong and then sometimes he's really weak. If you run the computer program shouldn't you always be strong?Mr. 7: I didn't like the bad guy because he kept changing the rules so he could win and LeBron would lose. It didn't seem very fair.THE UGLYIf you want to see a film whose main reason to exist is based wholly and solely to market toys to kids, then Space Jam is that film. From start to finish there is always a product brand, toy, or game perfectly positioned on the screen to face the audience with a character on the screen saying something along the lines of "hey will you pass me that LeBron James branded basketball?" 'Yes, I can pass you this LeBron James branded basketball'. This may be a slight exaggeration but watch this film and you'll get my drift.I knew that Space Jam: A New Legacy wasn't going to be good but I just didn't expect it to be that bad. From wooden acting (by the human cast) to Looney Tunes characters with voices completely different than the ones I grew up with, this movie was quite the slog to sit through. In saying that though, my kids enjoyed every minute of it and I'm happy to admit that not every film is made for me.TWO AND A HALF LEBRON JAMES BRANDED BASKETBALLS OUT OF FIVEMr.10: This film was awesome. The Looney Tunes characters were really funny and it was great to see them all team up together. Porky Pig was the best. Four and a half out of five.Mr. 7: I liked seeing all the Looney Toon characters turn from cartoon to 3D and they were all really funny. But I didn't like how long the film went for or the bad guy. Four out of five.
There are some interesting moments and scenes, but, in general, so boring and so far from original.

Awful movie and poor execution. Lebrons acting was sub par, a lot of the movie worlds they actually visited were ones little kids wouldn't even know what they are referencing and the end game was like being on ADHD and trying to watch a basketball game. AWFUL. Skip it!!!

They shouldn't of named it Space Jam. Disrespectful towards the original. Felt low budget. Like a tv special that just dragged on way too long. Horrible and cringe even for a family movie. Lebron was better as a cartoon. His acting is like he's reading the lines. Just happy my family and I watched it for free. But the 2 hours is what I'll never get back.

Review title: Poor choices made something good bad
Review_body: Other than some classic characters only one-liners, this movie didn't make me laugh.I understand in this type of movie there needs to be a certain level of overacting involved, Which the OG Space Jam had and still played out well. But Space Jam 2 just did it a bit too much.And worst of all I don't understand why do you need so much of social messages in a movie like Space Jam and make the jokes so much restless, oh! Sorry, did I mention jokes? There were none.Everything doesn't need to be politically correct sir, some things are better with dumb humor.And a big downvote for making Lola Bunny flat af. Not into the furry stuff but the og Space Jam Lola Bunny's looks played a major role in the movies jokes and overall humor.Again, a message to all the studios, Somethings are better left dumb humorized and everything doesn't need to be politically correct. Oh! Sorry, it's an American movie! They don't care that most of the world doesn't care about politically correct humor.
There was once a time when cinema was great,original and fresh. Those days are gone. Im 35 and am so thankful to have been able to enjoy an era of great cinema. Its just sad what has happened!

I know a lot of people don't like this movie and I can see why LeBron James isn't the best actor the story is all over the place and it is a bit in your face with the WB references but that's the problem LeBron James isn't an actor he's a basketball player so if you rate this movie on his performance then your going to rate it low its a Looney Tunes movie so the story isn't the main focus if you rate it based on story you are going to rate it low and for the WB references yes they were a bit in your face and I don't have an excuse for that but you need to rate this movie on Comedy and that is where I think it excels a good amount of the jokes were funny and I loved some of the cameos so I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a good time and just have fun and laugh.

Review title: Take the Torch and Make it Burn Brighter
Review_body: This movie is insanely good for a 90s child if you ask any guy at that age. Like one critic said in the review for Avengers: Endgame-'The final chapter is for someone who has read the former stories.' This draws for the following arguments I represent. The movie is almost like a hip-hop version for Ready Player One. You can watch so many Easter eggs in this fantastic movie. I'll cite some that I can remember or I can recognize, The Matrix, Batman, Rick and Morty, Jobs, Superman, Wonder Woman(of course with her famous BGM), Joker, Pennywise, King Kong, Kevin Hart, AD, Klay Thompson and the most stunning one-Michael Jordan(with the Sirius BGM).Without doubt, all these lined with LeBron James made it a masterpiece and of course, the performance of Don Cheadle is professional as always.For those who grow up with those characters or players, I can say we all share an amazing feeling like 'Gosh! Finally someone put all those things in a 110 minutes movie.'The group of Wonder Woman and Lola Bunny, Superman with Daffy Duck and Don Cheadle as Jobs really impressed me, but if you ask me which scene is the most incredible one, I can say it's the MJ's show up. When LeBron's team are all depressed with no hope in the half, the Sylvester said he found Michael Jordan to help them, and as the Sirius went on, we saw his shoes , we felt his airness and his power! And finally, here was the Michael B Jordan, even Daffy Duck roasted that 'we couldn't get Michael A Jordan, so we got Michael B Jordan?!'The look on LeBron is very funny, we could see his complexion changed from expectation to shocked and last, disappointed. This punch line has got me too, my face was exactly like the LeBron at that time.One man's meat is another man's poison. Unlike 1996, Space Jam made its best in that age. People in this time have a severe sight on everything, sometimes even mean especially when you try to take to flame from the legend, but I think LeBron made a different, outstanding, and impressing performance that could only be achieved by him not just in the court, but off the court, and in this film.

Review title: It's like a really long commercial with bad acting
Review_body: Obviously the acting is bad. But it's like the only purpose if this movie is to sell us stuff. Just not very entertaining at all. So disappointing!!

I have seen a gazillion one star reviews, this movie won't win the Oscars but it wasn't bad. My 6 year old loved it and watched it twice already. What's with all the comparisons to Michael Jordan from reviewers? That said it was funny the way they brought in Michael B.I personally like Lebron, and I'm not sure why he gets so much hate, so I enjoyed the movie, CGI was top notch. Plotline is silly but it's a cartoon movie, comes with the territory, in my opinion. It's a family movie and it's ok. Stop making it look like the worst movie of all time.

I will never understand how some movies get made. Furthermore, I'll never understand how legitimate stars and respectable actors attach themselves to these films. Favors? Cash grabs? I'd be embarrassed if I we're Done or Zendaya.LeBron is awful. The writing is awful. I suppose the effects are okay? None of it is enjoyable. My kids-who wanted to watch it-quickly lost interest.Do yourself a favor, and don't watch this. It's not even worth the background noise.
Great kids movie. This is not meant to be reviewed like its up for an award. People need to chill with their opinions.

Yes I have a ten Bc it was a film full of fun laugh and entertainment. I tiny agree it was an easy predictable game but let's all be realistic, is a looney tunes game. Don't act like the first space jam wasn't like that. The only thing that bothers me is lebron acting. I think wade would ha e been a better candidate in my opinion. The film is just a family film to enjoy. It takes you to a nostalgia with unexpected cameo. People are being to harsh in a film that involves a bunch of loonies. It was creative with all the multiverse. I really enjoyed every min of it. Just don't pay attention to the people and just watch it with the family.

Review title: Unless you hate yourself, skip it
Review_body: LeBron James vanity piece. I'd rather watch a Progressive Insurance commercial on a loop for 2 hours.
Don't let the negative reviews stop you from watching it. Stop comparing the 1st space jam and judging lebrons acting. Great family movie.
Kids loved it and we (the parebts) enjoyed looking for all the Easter Eggs...and there are many.Just leave your brain at home and watch it with your kids.

I think some people are not going to like this movie but I thought it was fantastic. The humor worked for me, This is the first movie this year where I laughed out loud in the theater. I went there with a friend and we sometimes had a chat when a character from another movie came along and that was really nice. I think this is a movie you should see in the theater.The story is of course a family story but they say it in its way that it is fresh, of course it does have its family movie ending but that doesn't matter, because I had a good time with the movie. The CGI is very good and I'm happy with what they put it in.This movie is definitely a 9/10 and I would recommend it for old space jam fans young and old as it wouldn't disappoint. NEED ANOTHER SEQUEL.

Review title: This movie is devastatingly awful. The 10s are almost all fake!
Review_body: It is rare for a movie to be so offensively bad that it actually damages the culture of a nation, but congrats space jam, you have achieved lows beyond my lowest expectations.If I could give it zero stars I would.Despicable.P. S. Why is it that 99/100 of the 10 star reviews have only reviewed that movie? Super fake attempt by "someone" to improve the rating on here!

Review title: The biggest difference between LeBron and Jordan
Review_body: LeBron in "Space Jam: A New Legacy": Buggs, you gotta take basketball seriously. This is a serious game, not a simple fun. Why don't you follow the rules!?Jordan in "Space Jam": Oh crap Buggs, why didn't you tell me I could lengthen my body? Hehe, my arm is so long.
Where did Tom & Jerry go? There were supposed to make cameos as guest players during half-time.

Review title: Didn't expect much but this was painful to watch
Review_body: The first Space Jam was cool when it came out because I was 9. It's silly today and I don't consider it a "great film." That said, I would actually watch it if I found it while flipping through channels.Space Jam: A New Legacy is a two hour tooth grinding headache. I only laughed at its audacity. It's a copout to say that the film is just supposed to be fun since that's a theme. It doesn't care about its audience. Watch it and find where the 150 million went into making this.

Review title: Space Jam 2 is Good. Deal with it.
Review_body:
This movie was panned. I know that. But guess what when it first came out so was the first Space Jam. This Space Jam has a Rotten Tomatoes score of thirty-seven percent. Guess what the original has a Rotten Tomatoes score of forty-four percent. "But this movie is just a commercial for Warner Brothers."Need I remind you that people said the exact same thing about the first Space Jam. Doug Walker (in character as The Nostalgia Critic) complained that it was just a commercial for Nike. It's a critique with which I disagree but it was never an uncommon one. This movie was bombarded with the exact same critiques that the first one was when it first came out."But what about the pop culture references?"
The first Space Jam also had those "I didn't know Dan Aykroyd was in this picture".It's exhausting to have to go through all the illegitimate critiques before you get to the legitimate ones.My biggest worry when I saw this film was that it would be a blind rehash of the original. It wasn't. Instead of being about Basketball it was about video games (albeit sports influenced ones). Instead of having themes about standing up for yourself it has themes about trying to bend others to your will.Bugs Bunny has a great moment towards in the end of the film and I love what they've done with Lola as a character. The humour was genuinely funny and I for one enjoyed the Easter Eggs to every Warner Bros movie ever.The Algorithm's plot to force Lebron to play against his son in apocalyptic Basketball actually was clever in its cruelty. And I do think the characters are well-acted. And to keep this a Spoiler free review I'll just say if you're paying attention it wasn't a Deus Ex Machina. (I can't give more details).What did I not like about this. I don't love the transformation of the Looney Tunes from cartoons to live action though to the movie's credit neither do they. And the early part of the film spent too much time trying to advertise Lebron James (where the original didn't with Michael Jordan). The Algorithm could have had a more fleshed out motive but Cheadle played it well enough that I don't care.When the merits of this are measured against this first, I like the first better. But I still greatly enjoyed this film and find the attacks against it unfair.Space Jam 2 is good. Deal with it.

This is simply a way for Lebron to make millions to spew hate back at people for the elite. Simple as that. The people who financed this farce should be fired. No one that watches basketball likes this man. His acting skills are nowhere to be found. Anyone with more than two brain cells knows this was a way to pay him to keep on talking garbage about America and true Americans.

The original Space Jam has always been in the running for worst movie ever. It's beyond horrible. This is not nearly as bad. And, obviously, Lebron is a much better actor than Michael. Get over yourselves for a minute and try to have some fun with your kids.

An overall disappointing film. Lebron may not be a solid actor, but he defiantly tries, however this film falls apart due to terrible directing, cringe-writing and overall lack of vision. The toons feel like they take a back seat in the entire movie when compared to Lebron and his son's family problems (which isn't even that relatable). The entire execution of the films plot is just bizarre and there are many moments that are just boring or feel like they are being rushed/trying way to hard to get a reaction. For a film that emphasizes in things "looney," this was probably about as un-looney as you could get. The sequel deserved better than this.

Review title: Space Jam: A New Legacy THOUGHTS
Review_body: When I first heard there was going to be a new Space Jam reboot (sometime after watching the 1996 film for the first time during the 2020 pandemic), I became convinced that Hollywood really tries to play up the classics by rebooting EVERYTHING. Star Wars, Halloween, Jay & Silent Bob, the list never ends.It goes without saying that the original Space Jam is a Warner Brothers classic. It's a funny throwback film with a sense of fun and escapist wonder. My first viewing of the film was a smooth and unique experience that I often have with cult classics.Fast forward a year later in the pandemic's aftermath, and I'm with four other friends watching A New Legacy in theaters. Like many reboots, it incorporates tropes synonymous with the term Generation Z. It involves smartphones, technology, groundbreaking Computer Animated Imagery (CGI), and what better way to incorporate Basketball than to put a big shot like LeBron James on the big screen (in the same way Michael Jordan filled the role of an iconic basketball superstar in 1996).Spoilers ahead, this is your final warning. So let's talk about the plot. It begins in 1998 with a young LeBron James becoming distracted by video games and learns that he needs to "apply all" of he wishes to play basketball. He throws out a used original Nintendo GameBoy his friend gives him and we cut to a montage of James's career playing over the opening credits like the first movie. In the present day, James has a family including two sons, one who plays basketball often and his other son Dom (who loves video games) who is a child prodigy that can actually program and homebrew his own video games.James and his family visit the Warner brothers studio and Dom takes an interest in the studio software known as Al-G Rhythm, who traps James and Dom into virtual reality. Al-G takes Dom as a prisoner and attempts to use him to beat his father (the LeBron James) in a basketball game, where Al-G instructs James to assemble a team of players for a basketball game in the span of 24 hours.James meets Bugs Bunny in Tune World (and only Bugs, as every other Looney Tune left Tune World thanks to Al-G convincing them to explore other realities by being in crossovers of properties such as Mad Max, Wonder Woman, ect), and essentially reunites the original Tune Squad (sans Pepé Le Pew due to the Culture Wars), and once the Tune Squad is reassembled, Al-G kidnaps every Warner Brothers properties (including R-rated films like It (Pennywise)and A Clockwork Orange) and kidnaps people from the REAL WORLD on their phones to watch the game, the James family withstanding.Al-G then "upgrades" the Tune Squad by rendering the Looney Tunes in an astonishing CGI. Tune Squad goes up against Goon Squad, consisting of video game characters Dom designed led by Dom himself. During the first half, Goon Squad outnumbers Tune Squad heavily, and as if that wasn't bad enough, the biggest letdown occurred. During the halftime break, Sylvester attempts to recruit former Tune Squad member Michael Jordan (from the 1996 film) but accidentally locates Michael B. Jordan instead. I genuinely fell for that, and I have no idea why they did that. Yeah it was a funny joke and all, but at least have Michael Jordan give LeBron James a little wisdom to bring strength to the group, ya know?So in the final half of the basketball game, LeBron tells Dom that he no longer wants to stand in the way of his dreams, and Buggs welcomes him into the Tune Squad with Al-G assuming control of Goon Squad. The Looney Tunes use their cartoon physics to make a comeback and the Tune Squad ends up winning when Bugs sacrifices himself by pulling a glitch maneuver that deletes him and posterizes Al-G, basically offing him. The movie then ends with Bugs actually surviving and walking off into the sunset w LeBron.When I walked out of the theater, I felt that the movie, while not as good as the original (for a few reasons),can still pass as mindless entertainment the first time around. It's a pretty funny movie that's worth a watch, despite the negative reviews. One scene in particular that had me laughing in my seat was when during the big game, the Tune Squad turns into a group of rappers with Porky the pig roasting Al-G, it came out of nowhere and it was pretty hilarious.The characters, while not memorable to the 1996 film's degree, were still fun. LeBron James and his family dynamic intertwining with the current state of Looney Tunes (both literally and figuratively) attempted to make a stronger story out of the original while introducing modern themes. I'm almost under the impression that the title A New Legacy can be a reference to Gen Z.In conclusion, I walked into Space Jam: A New Legacy with fairly low expectations (sans hoping Michael Jordan shows up), and I walked out mostly satisfied. Not one hundred percent moved (like with It (2017) and The Iron Giant (1999)), but satisfied. I went out to the movies with my friends for a fun night, and the Looney Tunes came through.

Only gave it a Ten so that it could eventually reach a more honest ranking than what it currently has. This film deserves at least a 6. People are judging this film as if it could have been Oscar potential but dropped the ball. It's just a kids movie. Let's appreciate LeBron for agreeing to do such a film. He knows he's not a great actor and he even jokes about it in the film. He was aware that Space Jam means a lot to others and had big shoes to fill. Over all this film was far better than I expected. So many fun fictional character cameos. The original Jumanji was great. The remake with the Rock was great and was a reimagining just like this space Jam. It was a fun film if you leave unreasonable expectations at the door.

Review title: A dull witted sequel that shouldn't have been made
Review_body:
Is this a promo ad for Lebron James? Sure felt like it.Sat down with the Fam and I was the only one who really didn't like it. I got the references
(including the Bobby Knight reference) and saw all the WB characters. Some of the jokes were funny but most just felt awkward.Judge it for yourself, just don't expect anything spectacular.

While the jokes don't land very often and there's way too much product placement (especially for brands that endorse LeBron), I can't deny that this movie is really entertaining. The fun novelty of it all just lends itself to a easy watch.

Review title: Not as good as the original but not as bad as most make it out to be
Review_body: This is a fun, entertaining movie. It's certainly not one that you'd watch and come out of the theaters pondering the deeper life lessons this movie taught you, it's a popcorn flick. When an athlete is the main actor you should probably lower your expectations a bit. LeBron is obviously a top-tier actor but he wasn't horrendous. Compared to Jordan in the original Space Jam his acting is a bit better seeing as he actually seems to be showing some emotion like he would on the court in the actual games like when he talks to the referees in the real games. In the original Space Jam, Jordan looked bored most of the time and barely expressed himself.I liked how there was a mix of 2D and 3D animation which shows the different era we're in now compared to 1996 where 2D was king. However this movie unfortunately represents this new era in another way by littering the movie with constant references which can be a fun game for the audience to spot and recognize characters from other Warner Bros. Properties but this screams of the movie being a giant advertisement by Warner Bros. Starring LeBron and the Looney Tunes.Compared to the original, this is a bit worse but it's not horrible. I enjoyed watching the film and got to the end. Many of the reviewers claiming that the original Space Jam was much better make it seem like the original is some sort of Oscar worthy movie when in fact it's not. Most of those saying that are looking at the original movie through rose-tinted goggles. The original was better but not by much. On top of that, there are claims that this movie is basically LeBron worship as a god but it takes many cracks at his shortcomings in his career and legitimate criticism fans have of him such as switching teams too often and passing the ball to teammates at the last second instead of taking the last shot.If you're looking for an entertaining movie to watch with your brain turned off or with others I'd recommend this movie. If you happen to be a fan of the NBA or The Looney Tunes, this movie should be on your radar.

Review title: Not even so bad it's good, it's just bad.
Review_body: The one star is for the animators who put in a lot of work into such a terrible film and nothing else. Everyone is phoning it in. It's an ego trip for LeBron. Even when he's not around people are asking "where did LeBron James go?" and "Gosh I sure do love King James." You know this.Here's the one moment I had a slight glimmer of hope for the film.Very early on there's a scene where out of touch execs pitch a dumb movie with star power to LeBron. It's stated these dumb film concepts, made by a soulless AI, are not a good idea. And for one single moment, I hoped that this was meta commentary, a glimmer of self awareness in a film about to dunk on itself.No.This is a vanity project for LeBron and WB, it's as crass and commercialised and soulless as the film concepts it pretends to reject.Don't waste even a second on this film.So much wasted time and effort.Enjoy your new pool or car or whatever, Cheadle.It really bugs me as well that so many people are making this about "wokeness" or the latest culture war nonsense. Or even their personal opinion of LeBron. I don't care about that. I don't care about The s*x*u*l assault Skunk or people misremembering a rabbits assets. This is based purely on the film I endured.No exaggeration, I didn't even know nor care who LeBron was. This movie was my first introduction to the man. And based on how he portrays himself in a movie he produced? He's a terrible human being utterly out of touch with reality with a desperate need to be validated and a massive over inflated ego. I don't believe this was a caricature of Mr. James because his acting isn't good enough to be an exaggerated version of himself.Days later, I came back wondering if I'd been too harsh, I mean the Fury Road Runner part did make me smile. But that could easily have existed as a silly skit totally removed from the film and still be fun.Literally everything else, every other scene, despite being bombastic and colorful and sometimes weirdly OVER animated, had the same flaw. They were boring. I don't know how you can have such a wellspring of creativity or at least a wellspring of franchises to draw from, and manage to make it utterly boring, tedious, monotonous. An endurance test.The first film was no masterpiece, but this is just a waste of everyone's lifespan.
In a day and age of reboots and remakes, this sequel should've never happened. Absolute garbage. The first one was fun. Im sure LeBron got payed well though.
This movie was one of the worst of 2021 so far! The whole cast seemed disinterested in their roles, the effects were strange and the overall vibe of the film felt like a video game.

Review title: Mocking snyder verse ?? i could not connect to the movie after that
Review_body: WB you want to make money it's snyder verse not server verse hope they learn the lesson soon :) wanna make big money #Snyder_verse this movie is fun by parts...2 hours too long this time know which movie to trim and which not to.

Review title: Terrible, terrible, film. Two hours of your life you won't get back.
Review_body: In short, this makes the first installment, which was no masterpiece by any stretch of the imagination, look like The Godfather.Everything about this movie is just wrong. It only exists to highlight the greatest hits of Warner Brothers and its subsidiaries.Don't waste your time and/or money on Space Jam.

Review title: If you like nostalgia and product placing. Here is you movie.
Review_body: It has a great ending, corny humor, all your favorite characters back in the day. It does send a msg about the story line. I didn't like it was a bit political.I liked the ending and a family, father and son story. That's it.
Space Jam: A New Legacy (2021) is not a movie. It's a 2 hour commercial for HBO Max, so it's a complete waste of time.It only gets 2 stars from me because of the Looney Tunes characters.

Bad reviews appear to all be based on nostalgia remembering the original for more than what it was. This was quality with laughs and lots of jokes for all ages. A money grab? Well, no duh. All movies are. You weren't watching an indy film here. Great to see the Looney Tunes on the big screen again and a good story. Dad's, stop making your kid be like you.

Screw the haters, the only reason why people keep smashing this film to pieces is because "ooh it has way too much product placement". But you know what I think about this movie? It's awesome. I liked spotting the Warner Bros. References, they're one of the reasons why the movie is so fun to watch. I was really looking forward to this movie, and I was hoping that it wouldn't receive negative reviews like the live-action Tom and Jerry movie (which I also liked but not as much as this movie). Unfortunately, it did, and it got a whopping 26% on Rotten Tomatoes, which is ridiculously lower than Tom & Jerry's 31%. I didn't care, and I watched the movie anyway, and I really enjoyed it, and if you think I'm going to watch it on HBO when it gets added to the premium channel in the next few months, you're absolutely right.Overall, I give this a 9/10. This movie will always be more superior than its haters ever will be.

Review title: I'm going to keep it simple

Overall, highlights include seeing the Looney Toons back on the big screen with some comedic moments, aka the Mad Max scene, and a good message at the end. Don't understand the hate behind including the other warner bro franchises.

There nothing to say about this except it's a giant flaming pile of garbage .... Kim Kardashian is a better actor than Lebron, it was painful to watch him attempt to "act" ... how are you that bad at playing yourself?!? Please do not let this ran EVER act again. Stick to your orange balls dude.

We loved Space Jam 2. The graphics are crazy-amazing. Watch it on a big-screen TV if you have one. One of the scenes took a year to animate, apparently. The story is predictable and very family-friendly.We were amazed at how the director was able to find voice actors to mimic the voices of the Warner Brothers toons. Bugs Bunny is perfect, so is Daffy Duck and Marvin the Martian. In other cartoons made since Mel Blanc died in 1989, no one has ever been able to get those voices right. Well, this time they nailed everyone. Even Foghorn Leghorn and Yosemite Sam, which I think would be tough.Porky Pig's rap is a high point. Since he stutters, we were wondering how he was going to pull it off, but he does!And why aren't there "style points" in real-life professional basketball??The majority of the reviews here show that people were offended by the focus on various Warner Brothers properties as part of the story. We loved it! It was so neat to see Pennywise in the crowd, or the Iron Giant or King Kong, or to see the worlds of Harry Potter and the Matrix and Casablanca as Lebron goes whooshing by them. We liked those movies back then and it was enjoyable to see them flash by throughout this film. Rick & Morty even make an appearance! If you like these characters, why are you mortally offended to see them in another movie? So weird.It is true, Lebron can't act. What were you expecting? Viola Davis level acting? It's not his focus in life. But he did okay, and the people around him (his on-screen family, Don Cheadle, toon voices, etc.) did a great job.We had a rollicking time watching this. And a big thanks to the studio for doing the day-and-date release of movies in theaters and on HBO MAX. We loved seeing this on the release night and we hope HOPE! Hope that they will continue to do this. We do not expect to ever go to a sticky-floor cell-phone-ringing people-yakking theater ever again, so having the benefit of timely movie releases at home is an amazing benefit. Thanks!!

This movie is epic and mind-breaking and ground-blowing and awesome and definitely on of the best you just have to watch this! It's amazing and clever and really jumps off the screen and blows you away on an amazing ride! I saw this movie at cinemas and it was amazing and thrilling the entire experience of watching this clever movie on that huge screen and definitely one of the best movies I've ever seen at cinemas! As well as one of the best sports movies, the best sci fi movies, the best American movies and the coolest movies of all time! I won't give away any more, you just have to watch this! IT'S HUGE FUN!!!

You'll be hard pressed to find a an unbiased review as most either love or hate LeBron (will give a 10 or 1 just because). But unbiasedly, this is an atrocity.Unnecessarily long. 2 hours? Not sure you can expect 3-5 year olds to pay attention for the entirely of the film considering that's the only audience that will find this film enjoyable. Jokes were played out, stale, cliche and flat out cringe. CRINGE. Very difficult to pay attention. Was not captured there was no life or spirit it felt forced. 0 character development the "villains" had no character or personality you didn't even know who to root for in the game. Isn't that the point?You know "it's so bad it's good" that's basically LeBron. He is so bad that it makes for some unintentionally funny quotes. That along with terrific CGI is the only reason I won't be giving a 1. Even then it gets overbearing 95% of energy went into the animation.This movie can only be enjoyed by those in the single digit age because anyone with a fully developed brain can't possibly watch this abomination and say "wow that was great". WB completely neglected the audience that enjoyed Space Jam and who were excited for the sequel which is a damn shame. If they wanted to make a Mickey Mouse Barney kiddy movie don't name it Space Jam. Think of a different idea for that new audience you're trying to capture opposed to riding Space Jams coattail. Obvious money grab. Pathetic.

So, I wish that they shouldn't have included a real-life celebrity as a leading star of the film and just focus on Looney Tunes characters traveling across the Warnerverse by saving it from this film villain as it would work best for me. Anyway, I was blown away by a cameo appearance by a pair of the titular characters from an adult animation in a FREAKING kid film which is insane to me which kids watching this portion wouldn't get it at...all!!! Well, aside from Lebron stuff...this film is pretty enjoyable and I admired how animation style from other franchises like Rick and Morty and DC marge with Looney Tunes just like in Live-Action crossovers, and it was a blast. I would recommend this if u want to just see Looney Tunes traveling across the Warnerverse.

We both grew up watching the original and were suprised how much we loved this one! It was hillarious we laughed a ton! If you didn't laugh during This movie you have no sense of humor. I could of done without swearing in a kids movie only reason why it got an 8 not a 10. Teaches a good lesson for families and how families are fundamental you need to stick together and support each other! Also that dad isn't always wrong or an old fuddyduddy he is trying to teach you so you succeed in life because he loves you. Also that dads need to love their kids and pay attention to what they like to do as well and get to know their kids. What kids movie teaches you to love and respect your parents? Not many anymore usually just knock the parents down or mock them for being dumb. It was refreshing to see a non modern agenda lesson being taught in a movie.Also love the shout out to Michael Jordan and all the this has happened before to make it a true sequel, the shoutout to Akron, and all the references to Lebrons mistakes like leaving from team to team. And as far as an ego movie if you watched the original, Michael Jordan was proclaimed matter of a fact best basketball player in the universe this one says greatest of all time (and they say uhhhh the verdict is still out on that one or well there was that one guy) so which one was more egotistical?Go ahead thumbs down this review but we loved this movie it's a keeper!

As movie sequels often go, they are produced due to the well received public and critic reception to the first film, meaning that the second film in a successful film franchise can only go one of two ways; become a box office knock out with a re-imagined perception of the first film along with new and modern visuals and ideas, or risk angering already established fans to the first movie with no originality, or a strong enough chronological link to the first movie in order to connect them together. Space Jam: A New Legacy, does more of the second.The concept of merging NBA legends with animal cartoons is brilliant, original, and has the versatile ability to appeal to all ages, from toddlers to grown adults. What the original Space Jam does seem to lack within its visuals and 3D cinematography aspect, this sequel fails to continue, or even attempt to include.This sequel to the original classic Space Jam somehow loses its humor and playfulness along the way, painfully stringing along overused height and race jokes, having tacky and simply terrible visuals of the cartoon animals, and containing a premise that makes just about as much sense as it's casting does (spoiler: none). However, actress Zendaya, known for her more recent roles as Rue on HBO's "Euphoria" and MJ in Marvel's "Spider Man: Homecoming" succeeds in her role as Lola Bunny, and may be the only saving grace in this entire movie. Whilst this movie receives a 4 overall, LeBron James' acting receives a 1. Barely.Space Jam: A New Legacy really just fails to embody the spirit of the first movie on almost every single line. Fans of the first movie will be extremely disappointed with this sequel, unless they're fans of borderline basic jokes, bad acting, and a confusing plot that nobody will remember.
I don't know why people are dissing this film it's just a bit of fun silly mess and that's all stop complaining!

Let's face it, for all of us parents now wanting to treat our kids to movies in theaters again after such a long time where it was not possible, we'll basically go to anything family-rated at the bargain matinees. Literally, anything. However, 30 min into this, I couldn't figure out how the agents of Dom Cheadle and LeBron James talked them into this project. I've loved Dom Cheadle in everything I've ever seen him in, he's a wonderful actor, but he has nothing to work with here. His character has no depth - that's how he's written, it's not Cheadle's fault. LeBron playing a fictional version of himself seems natural and engaging in front of the camera, I'd like to see him in other things, because this movie is kind of a mess that didn't need to be made. The set up takes a long, slow time to get through - fictional LeBron has trouble connecting with his son, who would rather expand his talents for coding and creating video games than play basketball and just wants his famous father to accept him as an individual. He and his son butt heads, but later try to mend fences by going together to the Warner Brothers studio to hear a pitch generated by the AI heart of the WB "Serververse" (no, really, a serververse). LeBron passes on the opportunity, but the AI algorithm (played by Dom Cheadle) takes offense and kidnaps the pair in revenge, digitizing them into his cyberspace within all the WB vaults. He then separates them, manipulating the son into thinking the AI is his friend and basically threatening LeBron into assembling a team of Looney Toons characters to face off in a wild, crazy rules basketball game to be held later. Confused? Confounded? Not even sure why all this is our plot exposition? Yeah, me too. We then plod through LeBron recruiting different toons and then the day of the big game - where it's revealed his son is now the star player on the opposing team along with malevolent versions of the OPs he created for his own video game and the WB AI as the Goon Squad coach. Somehow, inexplicably, the AI has also managed to kidnap andndigitize thousands of people across the globe to be spectators, along with LeBron's wife and other children. He tells LeBron right before the game starts that if he loses, all these people will be trapped in the "serververse" forever (eye roll). Don't even get me started on the absolute slog that is the big game. It goes on forever. And ever. Needless to say, LeBron and his son reconcile, join forces and win the game against the AI, who is vaporized, and return to the real world. LeBron accepts and encourages his son's individual pursuits and later they discover the toons can now visit them in the real world. Snore. But, my kids were just happy to be out at the movies again, so I guess it's worthwhile for that.
Ignore the bad reviews. This is a great movie with cgi like Speed racers and Ready Player 1. And glad to see many easter eggs in this movie. Is good to see Space Jam is back in a different way.

Review title: It just goes on and on and on
Review_body: This movie looks like they took the original Space Jam as an example and remade every scene, but added the extremeness of it by about 200%. With about 45 minutes of movie to go, the game starts, and it will take those 45 minutes to actually wrap it up. There is no training montage, before but a small compilation of scenes of Bugs and 'King' James where they get back all of the Looney Tunes from the other franchise planets because... Well, I don't know why they're on other planets, actually. They tried to explain, but it was such a weird explanation, it was the most cheap plot device ever.So, no real training can be seen (they even acknowledge the fact that Babs is the only one who can play basketball), and a second before the game starts LeBron angers everyone by making the Tunes actually play like him (and failing). Creatively, it all feels really cheap. The best jokes are Daffy turning into CGI and saying "Oh, I feel expensive!" and Sylvester saying "It's been 25 years, I thought he aged gracefully!", that's it. This movie wasn't needed. I didn't need to watch it.And how could they kill off Bugs Bunny with such an emotional tearjerker like that? It's like they took the scene from the original where Bugs saves Babs and gets slammed doing it, but now turned it into something where he could actually die. Bugs Bunny shouldn't die, he's a fricking Looney Tune!
It's a generally enjoyable kids movie written by the corporations of NBA and Warner Brothers, just like the original. You get what you expect. It's alright but a little convoluted and long.
Way to kill a classic movie. I knew it was going to be killed but cmon this was just horrible.

The Looney Tunes are back for a brand new adventure. After more than twenty years, Space Jam returns to the big screen with another explosive installment. Even if it's not perfect story-wise, the movie has enough heart to entertain the younger audience. The humor is well-crafted and the characters are funny enough to make the viewer interested in what's going on. LeBron James works fairly enough as the lead protagonist, even when the world around him is totally computerized. The soundtrack is memorable, not as much as the original, but still good nonetheless. All things considered, this franchise can still offer a ton of exciting and dynamic moments, which is why I wouldn't mind seeing another one in the near or distant future.

If it entertains kids, fine. Lots of over-their-heads references and a few snicker moments. My biggest laugh was LeBron happy he was in Hufflepuff in Harry Potter World. They didn't pay Don Cheedle enough to do this.

Review title: A couple good jokes and references.
Review_body: This movie is extremely simple, as excepted. It stars a bad actor that comes in and does not give a convincing performance. The set up is convoluted and not planned out well. The best parts of this movie come from it's sometimes clever jokes and references. It's worth a watch if you have young kids or love basketball.

It's just a LeBron commercial. I watched 5 minutes and couldn't believe how annoying it is. The movie is not about making a movie. It's about LeBron. Everything is about LeBron. I don't see the point in this. Call the movie LeBron or whatever but not Space Jam. The original Space Jam wasn't this annoying. Every character had his part. It wasn't about Michael. Michael was just part of the whole thing.

Review title: Cleaning up warm cat vomit a more pleasant experience
Review_body: Too bad the rating system doesn't include negative stars because that's what this movie deserves.
It was not great. But honestly, Don Cheadle tried his absolute best....and I respect him for it....

Review title: Nothing more than a flex of Warner brothers assets
Review_body: If you love the original 90s movie, dont watch this - you'll find nothing but disappointment.99% of the movie is full of irrelavent nods to all the IP's owned by Warner brothers, I mean what child is going to understand the scenes involving mad Max and the matrix????Many adults will be watching this movie with their children hoping that the nostalgia of the 1st movie will come flooding back, but all you receive is 2 hours of utter nonsense, with some pretty animation.The story is broken, the actor's are essentially robots and the entire pace of the movie is all over the place.

I may be a bit biased because I have a 3 year old and it's a nice bridge movie for both of us, but this movie is just okay in its execution. I definitely don't have nostalgia bias, as the original space jam is honestly not that great either. But this one is just okay.

Why do these characters still look like cartoons? It's 2021. We should have more realistic versions of these characters by now. Just look at what they did with Clifford. Now THAT'S good filmmaking. Not this.
Bad acting. Bad writing. Bad everything. This movie is less entertaining than watching a homeless crackhead taking a sh¡t on the sidewalk while blowing another crackhead.

Review title: Worst movie I have ever seen in my life
Review_body: Talk about total waste of time and money. The original was 1000 times better than this trash. I do not recommend anyone wastes their time nor money on this sorry excuse of a movie.

Review title: It's good for what it is: a silly kids movie
Review_body: SERIOUSLY!!! Why is everyone giving this movie a bad rating. It's literally just a kids movie. It's cheesy. It's silly. They do a lot of homages. The storyline wasn't that bad. Okay maybe Lebron's acting could use a lot work, but hey it wasn't bad for this being his first time on the big screen. Don't listen to these negative comments and check it out for yourselves. Don't expect anything except a little cheesy fun movie.

Review title: Don't listen to these Karen's! The movie was good!
Review_body: It was really good. Obviously not as good as the first one but it was still Good! You people are seriously so hard to please these days it's so ridiculous!!! I loved it, it was funny and had really shocking and funny cameos that I didn't expect! I suggest this movie if you're not a little ***** that's hard to please. 😊

Review title: All you see is haters here my friend.
Review_body: Sit back and enjoy the fun with your kids or just your grown self. LeBron never signed up to be a actor it just came with the territory and I think he did very well. Stop comparing it to the first as well because it is not. It's not a 10 but I'm going to give it one anyways to help balance out these haters.

Space Jam: A New Legacy was quite a thrill coaster. It was filled with fun and energetic feeling. There's was a little bit of something for everyone. We even got a little bit of nostalgia from the first movie which was really nice to see. It was different from the first film which I thought was okay seeing as it's a new Legacy of Space Jam. My family and I give this movie top ratings because that's what it deserves.

Review title: I'm sorry just a cash grab for WB and to feed Brons ego
Review_body: I know a bunch of these reviews have to be filled with lebron hate without even seeing the movie and I went into this wanting to like it. But I'm sorry it's just a 2 and a half hour long commercial for all the Warner's property with plenty of dialogue describing lebron as the greatest player of all time and more than a ball player. Some parts made me laugh but you're distracted by the decades of WB characters in the background to actually pay attention to the movie.
Horrible writing acting and even worse voice actors who couldn't lace the shoes of Mel Blanc! This should have been left on the drawing room floor!
It is a children's movie I will not judge it by a simple plot.

Review title: Space Jam!? More like Space Spam...
Review_body:
Or or or....like,
A Waste of.... SPACE.Don Cheadle is fun though.The writers do try with a slightly deeper plot than the original.LeBron. If the dude can't act, give him fewer lines and spotlight the Tunes instead.But the King must have his way. Tyranny I say.

Lebroon is a loser who will always be hiding in Michael Jordan's shadow. His acting is so bad it looked like they had to put peanut butter on his gums and edited the talking in after. The amount of "urban" pandering was beyond pathetic. Everything was rap, rap lingo, or a rap reference. If you hate police, and think white people are the cause of all YOUR bad live choices then this movie is for you.

One star for the "let your kids be themselves" message. When this comes out take a shot each time they say LeBron James. How could a 2hr long movie feel so rushed? Black Captain America's acting was the only saving grace.

They over used some cheesy after-effects tight focus blurring throughout all of the live-action + 3D toon scenes (which is most of the film), where only one character is in focus at 1080p and all the other characters look like they're 144p resolution. This is not just in a few key scenes, this is throughout the majority of the entire friggen movie! Even characters doing the talking or main action are often blurred out with focus placed on someone else. As if we're only allowed to pay attention to that character that's in focus and noone else. No bueno.I hope they do a new cut release with no blurring so I can enjoy the film in HD.Otherwise, the art was very competent and visually appealing. I just wish it wasn't all blurred out all the time.

Yo everyone! This isn't godfather part 4! It is LeBron james playing basketball with the looney tunes while being a reference filled joy ride with a bunch of visual eye candy. Just put down your notepad and enjoy the show.

And as i said in the title of my critic, "Ohi recognize that" Yes, we can find a lot of references in the movie, characthers from Warner Brothers. And other bas thing is the "why"of the game. In the first one, Michael Jordan played because they hitted Tweetie, in this one, its just for LeBron's Son. And the jokes... uuuuh i dont want to mention them. That's it. And the end was kind of bad to be honest. And also ¿Why are fans so mad at lola bunny's new desing?

It is literally just an ad for WB and HBO Max. If you give these people your money I feel sorry for you. PLEASE, for the love of all that is holy, STOP giving these people your money just to spit back in your face with something like this. It is nothing short of insulting that these companies keep underestimating the intelligence of the general population. But it is nothing short of disappointing and demoralizing that so much of the general population continue to blindly throw money at corporations that have no respect for them, their intelligence, or society as a whole. This is not culture. There is no value in this so called "film."
Avoid at all cost not entertaining at all. The best thing about this movie is the honest trailer on YouTube tearing it apart.

Review title: What have you made with HBO
Review_body:
It's good to go with 90's kid .... But no direction no plot
Too much boring.

Ok. First of all, I never really liked the original Space Jam. It was over all a very weird idea. Michael Jordan and Loony Toons.....doesn't that just sound weird? So, I at first was not planning on even watching the new one, but I heard here and there that it was a decent movie. I watched it. I hated it. It gave me a headache. I at least was hoping for it to be better than the first one, but it wasn't even close. Lebron James is as interesting as a brick wall. It seems like half of the movie he forgets that he's fighting for his and his son's life. Other than a couple scenes it just all about playing the game "right". Zendya as Lola just felt.....odd. The cgi was trash and it felt like I was watching a cheap Netflix original. I wasted my time watching this. Pure trash.

When I finished this movie I could literally feel the tears coming out of Michael Jordan's eyes. Why why would you try and duplicate a classic like MJ's Space Jam. Remember their is only one G. O. A. T.......

Review title: A heartless corporate shell of a shell
Review_body: The original space jam was a glorified commercial, and this one is even hollower than that.

It's not the greatest, Lebron James can't act that is very clear, i watched it with my 3yr old and he enjoyed it which is their target audience. They were going for an update to the original but it's not as entertaining as the first one, it starts to lose your interest because of Lebron's wooden performance the story is also kinda meh. All in all i think kids will enjoy it but parents might get a bit bored.
Please stop remaking movies and stop using athletes who are barely functioning humans.

Review title: It is what it's supposed to be C+
