For the long form commercials that both space jam movies are- they're good for what they are. Solid C+ mindless entertainment. It's a movie about cartoons and y'all acting like it's supposed to be giving the secret to curing world hunger.

Review title: Because I can't give it a zero
Review_body: This movie is simply horrible because LeBron is in it... Enough said! If you think his acting on the court is pathetic than this is a featured film of it...
The movie wasn't terrible. It was no OG Space Jam so you can't compare it to that. It was entertaining, corky, fun, and had a good message. Give it a shot! Haters gonna hate.

Review title: LeBron James is no Michael Jordan
Review_body: I think the review title says it all. On so many levels, Michael Jordan completely outclasses him, both personally and athletically.

Some of these reviews are pretty harsh. If you want a fun, family movie that's been updated from the original, but still has little pieces to tie into it, then you'll be happy! Don't get me wrong, I love the original since I grew up with it, but thought this was a good updated version. Yes, some of it was a bit of a WB ad, but other parts were fun to see the various characters interacting. Give it a chance!

Review title: Visual Are nice.... rest is trash...
Review_body: Storyline is bad.... CGI feels out of place.... Lebron is really not great... but to be honest acting with green screen is a challenge for most.Dont waste your time.

What a SHAME to the original Space Jam! Lebron James is garbage. Only good thing about this is the Looney Tunes are awesome but they went woke so they go broke. This movie is SO BAD! Hopefully they pull the movie and save face for the original Space Jam. Michael Jordan will always be the GOAT!

Review title: Disqusting with all character Warner Bros
Review_body: Overall quite enjoy. At the beginning of the film, the audience is also introduced to the figure of LeBorn James so that the audience knows who LeBron James is and all the achievements he got. The Looney Tunes character is also presented with their own uniqueness.The conflict that was played around the family between father and son until the ending was packaged well.The perceived drawback is the tempo of the story which is very rushed. So that it doesn't feel emotional between the LeBorn James character and the Looney Tunes characters themselves, it's only about Looney character searching, Looneys join, gather and then compete with their opponents. The dish that is quite disturbing is when movie characters from all Warner Bros. Productions start to appear.

The people who judge the movie based on the first film have no argument. I went into this movie just ready to expect a basketball driven plot line with superstars all over. This movie had that but has all the right shine and polish for kids. They won't go as deep as we do. Kids will love this film and the pop culture references are fun for the adults. Its not nearly as terrible as it's getting rated.
The movie is very enjoyable my kids loved it and I had a nostalgic blast .Don't listen to the reviews I don't know what they were expecting !!! It's a fun kids movie !!

Review title: I mean... what did you expect?
Review_body: I really cant understand these bad critics. You know that you are going to watch a kids movie with Lebron playing basketball with the Looney Tunes... come on, the expectations cant be that high.... yes, it was hilarious and nonsense in some scenes, but that is what Looney Tunes is all about! I just think the expectations of the people are way too high nowadays. If you take nostalgia aside, it is even better than the first movie.For me, it was an entertaining movie and I just enjoyed watching it from the start till the end. I liked the idea to switch from a real existing tune world to a barely alive tune world in the Warner Bros network. Also the message of the movie was wholesome. For me, the best part of the movie are all the little fanservice/insider jokes for 90s kids. It was like travelling back to our childhood.All in all it was a nice movie and it fully met my expectations.
Doesn't deserve that much hate, the movie was ok 6-7 starsGiving 8 because it currently has 4.5.

I expected acting to be bad given the lead is a basketball star not an actor and to his credit he did fine. However the story was not well developed. Characters were not well developed. All of a sudden you would see random toons added out of no where. Nothing about it brought back the original vibes that were exciting and fun. It was all cgi and fake. WB clearly wanted to say how many franchises it owns rather than focus on the movie and who ever promoted that idea should get demoted. This was a 2 hour marketing campaign rather than what if a basketball player played basketball with looney toons characters.

Review title: A bigger budget does not make a better movie
Review_body: I personally find this a very difficult movie to summarise. It's really not good, but there are some entertaining aspects and ideas here despite what many reviews are saying. Yes, it is true it's basically a 2 hour ad for WB, but their visiting the various franchises to find the Looney Tunes was a nice idea - the problem I had was that this part was far too rushed and just not funny. The execution is a mess. There's just too much going on. It flits from franchise to franchise and it's just tiresome. You can tell the people in charge of the visuals and animation tried hard, but it feels exhausting to watch.There were surprisingly few moments involving the Looney Tunes that I cringed at, but at the same time they weren't particularly memorable either. In fact, they kind of felt like an afterthought as they're not directly involved in the main plot. Whereas in the first movie they need Michael Jordan to help them, here they just happen to be LeBron's team for no real reason. Speaking of LeBron, he's about as charismatic as a brick. No, Michael Jordan wasn't outstanding, but he at least had some screen presence. LeBron's acting is dreadful, and that includes his voice acting. He's just a complete and utter bore to watch, and just not entertaining enough to carry the movie. There were some amusing moments here and there, but this movie takes itself too seriously. The first movie is a lot simpler but I prefer it that way - it pokes fun at itself and the actors looked to have a good time. This movie was visually chaotic, and it all seemed so lifeless and fake. It had a needlessly convoluted plot that made no sense, and it was far too long. At almost 2 hours in length, I wish they'd have spent more time on introducing the Looney Tunes characters than the tedious basketball game itself. It's basically a big, soulless cash-grab with some funny moments.There was more 2D animation than I was expecting, and this was nice to see, but the movie overall was lacklustre. It very obviously had a much larger budget than the original, but that definitely doesn't make it a better movie. If you see this movie at all, see it for the visuals and animation. Otherwise, it's pretty terrible.Oh, and I'm also confused as to why they didn't have Bob Bergen voice Porky Pig in this movie. The guy who replaced him is okay, but Bergen's Porky is by far the best. It's just odd to me since Bergen is in the movie voicing Tweety when Porky is his speciality.

For as great as Space Jam was...this was 1000x horrible. James has proven himself a souless human being and it shows. This movie is nothing but a Lebron James ego show. Don Cheadle and the special effects were pretty much the only bright point.

Review title: Misleading title, because this isn't a movie: it's an ad that tries too hard
Review_body: First off, MJ is a legend and he always will be. This movie didn't work with the chosen cast. I'll keep it short, the movie looks good with the animations. However it is hard to watch because it doesn't make any sense from the beginning, contrary to the original. If you want to look at an ad campaign for warner bros, this is your thing, but it is not a movie. I feel bad for the people who did the animations for this 1/10 ad.
Woke, boring, all cast is black (???), political, you know where this is going. Long advertisement, absolute fail.
I love space jam but this one is way to long and I think that James can't play himself lol. It seemed like a high school play with looney tunes.

As a fan of the first Space Jam I knew they wouldn't be able to recreate the magic. I did enjoy all the tie ins with other WB characters. The set up of the storyline was not great but I extremely enjoyed the basket ball game (which is almost half the movie)My kids (6 and 8) said it was better than the first. They are use to great computer graphics so compared to the diets that obviously had number 1 beat.If you go in to it not expecting much I think you'll enjoy it.
I didn't expect to laugh so much and have a good time! Best movie of the summer for me 🙌🏾

Spent more time on the characters in the crowd which was more interesting than the plot. Few funny moments with throwback lines from space jam. I'd watch it just to see what 150 million dollars gets you and to complain about it with your friends and how Jordan will always be the GOAT.
The trailer of the movie makes it better than what it was. I like the first one better. I wouldn't waste my time watching this.
The animation looks great, but that is all this movie has to offer. I give it LebrOne Star.

If you are looking for a story or a logical reason for this basketball game, You will not enjoy this movie.However, you will laugh because it's as funny as hell , albeit the Weird Basketball rules.I enjoyed The Michael A Jordan and Michael B Jordan scene. Good One 😂

Review title: Space Jam: A New Legacy - Review
Review_body: Ah oh, another cash-grab from Warner Bros. This new sequel is exactly what I didn't want from a sequel. The screenplay is literally very bad. It is so generic that I cannot help myself. I just kind of hate this movie. Absolutely boring ride without some greediness, lame safe play from the studio.

10, maybe not, but still just as good as the original. Little less for the older gen, lot more for the new kids. Looney toons still shine and take center stage and Lebron is definitely a better actor than Jordan. Cameos are fun and there is a pretty close ratio of cartoon to cgi. Good fun summer movie. Yes there is cheese but what you would expect. Real rating- 6 or 7.
Don't bother seeing this another waste of time adaptation of a classic.

Review title: Wanted to like it, but couldn't look past big issues.
Review_body: Space Jam - A New Legacy - 4/10 - Very meh, but it was somewhat entertaining, probably more so for the kids. There were little nods to the original - yes it is a sequel and the first movie did happen - which was kinda cool. I thought they might act like the original never happened, but they acknowledge it in several ways. Some surprise appearances were funny, like Michael B. Jordan and the original monstars in the crowd, but wasn't a fan of a similar intro about Lebron's life. Should've done something new. It felt at times as a worse reboot of the original, but if you see it as just a movie on its own then it did have its moments.I liked the reverse of the original where Lebron was a cartoon in their world as opposed to the original where they made the Looney's more human / 3D like. The morale of the story is good, the story itself not that much, but the original also had a silly setup. Don Cheadle tried his best, but lacked the villainous traits to sell his character. Lebron is probably the worst in terms of acting, which I expected, so that's another reason I like the cartoon. Unfortunately this changes for the game itself and the Goon Squad didn't look good or cool in my opinion. Dame Times was probably the worst scene of the movie. The biggest issues I had with it aside from Cheadle and Lebron are: the lack of certain Looney Tunes, lack of side stars and the basketball game.Let's start with the game, which didn't feel like a basketball game but just lots of gimmicks and fast paced scenes to show off animation. This ties in with the lack of Looney Tunes, as WB showed off a lot their own films and characters, which I didn't really have much of a problem with since the Looney Tunes still had a big part of this film. A common critique I disagree with is that the Looney Tunes don't play a big part, which was my worry, but that's not the case at all. There is however a lack of certain characters to shine, in my opinion Speedy Gonzales - voiced by Fluffy Gabriel Iglesias - should've gotten way more lines and while's he really tiny, him not appearing for long stretches was odd. The back and forth between Tweety and Sylvester lacked as well and Taz would've thrived in the craziness of the game, but they didn't capitalize on his 'talent'. Side stars in terms of people appearing as themselves or comedians to make it funny, like the original, was lacking. A certain NBA legend in terms of broadcasting making a significant appearance was cool though. That is another reason I would've loved more Speedy since Fluffy's lines are definitely the funniest of the movies.All in all, for children probably entertaining enough, but Lebron lacked MJ's charisma to really make this memorable, the Looney Tunes had their moments but could've been better, casting was a bit of a disappointment and the basketball players as the Goon Squad barely left a mark. Glad I was able to download it and not waste a few hours going to the theatre. Since I'm not a fan of WB and given how poor some of their own characters looked, it did feel a bit cheap to make all these references to their own products. The message of the movie was good even if poorly executed due to bad acting, but I managed to sit through it, so a 4 is in some ways very forgiving. Looney Tunes saved it from being a 2 or even a 1.

Review title: A Fun Movie About Basketball and Cartoon Characters
Review_body: I understand why many people are not very fond of LeBron James, I'm not a fan of him either, but that doesn't mean we have the right to discredit what he has done for the game of basketball and what he has brought to the game. Do I think he's a perfect human being? No. Do I think he's the GOAT? No. But I respect him, 'cause he's a great family man and a great player. And this goofy movie about basketball and cartoon characters is just that, a goofy movie about basketball and cartoon characters. What did you expect? Oscar-worthy acting and screenplay? I think if there was a God of Basketball in Greek mythology, it would've been Michael Jordan, but it annoys me how some people act like he was the greatest actor of all time. This movie is different from the original, and I liked that. I personally think it's better than the original, but that's just my personal opinion. It's not a movie you'd watch alone to give you food for thought and make you contemplate your existence, but it's very fun to watch with your family and I respect that.

I see the armchair critics and nostalgia hounds are taking this WAY too seriously..1) Did you really expect Schindler's List or something? It's an NBA star playing basketball with the Looney Tunes. It is what it is.2) The first movie wasn't anywhere near to being the cinematic masterpiece that people think it was.But nostalgia makes things look shinier than they were, so meh..
It was essentially an extended Nike commercial/self-fellating Michael Jordan adventure.3) If you go in expecting the first movie, you'll be disappointed. Don't expect spectacular acting either. Again, it's good for what it is.If you go in with the very simple "Well, it's just a kids movie, so it's gonna be simple,goofy fun." Then that's what you'll see.It's still strange to me, seeing grown adults panning a kids movie, as though they're the target demographic. 20 years ago, sure. Your opinion on a movie like this was way more relevant. Not now.It's like a kid reviewing Grey's Anatomy or something. They're gonna think it sucks because they're not the core audience.

Review title: This movie is complete and utter garbage
Review_body: The acting was trash. The story was very stupid and they don't even play basketball! It's some stupid game Lebron kid in the movie created. It was really dumb.

I am not sure why this movie is getting low ratings. I'm sorry, this movie was not made for the 35 year olds who remember the original. This was made for kids. Yes, no remake or sequel can out do Michael Jordan's Space Jam, however it was fair for my kids and they enjoyed it (which is what matters)

Review title: i think WB has ruined the original with this movie
Review_body: I know it's not a movie for older people who were fans of MJ but even some kids movies have some humor that will keep the parents amused.This movie has none of that.
I give it a 6 for the animations. It was fun to watch. Storyline is boring. Would I watch it again. No.

Review title: Go, Tune Squad!! Best Basketball Game Ever!! 😄
Review_body: I just want to say that this was the best sports game I have ever watched. Like, why is this movie that bad? It's a really good Three-dimensional game which the Goon Squad. But I would tell you, "Welcome to The Space Jam" was not said in the full feature movie. At the end, it was really emotional that Bugs Bunny has been gone from the glitched but came back when Don took him to basketball camp. The lines that were said which were some of them were different. I knew this was the perfect fit for me. For now, this is my #3 favorite movie of all time!Go Tune Squad! We love you! 🏀👏

Review title: A dumb movie for dumb babies
Review_body: This movie is pretty lame the story is unimaginative & basic but the thing that really makes this movie bad was all the references like that Rick & Morty scene was painfully cringing also really appropriate to put them in movie for babies & a bunch of characters made adults like the groods & pennywise I mean get you put then in to get money out of people but you could at least make it PG-13 at least that appropriate & I know cussing in the movie but are you gonna watch a movie for the cussing, this movie lame it's just a big advertisement & I will not ever again & hopefully Warner bros will take the hint that looney tunes don't work on a movie platform judging on how much the movie is being bashed.

Review title: Warner Brothers Presents: Hey look at all the stuff we own!
Review_body: On the eve of a merge, Warner brothers struggles to keep its intellectual property afloat despite some interesting moments in the acting, writing, and direction.

I tried to go into this movie objectively. The original Space Jam with his Royal Airness was a favorite for my kids growing up. This was not a return to good times. So much wasted opportunity here. At the end of the day this was nothing but a paid advertisement for the Queen of the NBA. Hard pass all day long.

Movie constantly tells you that LeBron is the greatest basketball player ever...but that's not the only bad thing about this movie though... I like Don as actor but he's really annoying as the villain in this movie. WB wants to remind you what franchise's they own. If WB owns it it will be mention. WB also spent good money to put in a crazy amount of product placement in. *spoiler*The Looney Tune's don't show up for the first half hour very boring starter. Once the Looney Tunes show up it finally gets entertaining though LeBron ruins a good amount of the humor. Though it also takes them awhile to get to the other looney tune characters it's lot of Bugs. (Note I'm not against him but he's just gets on my nerves in this movie. ) On top of all that the actual basketball game is a cheap video game with terrible point system. It's easily the worst part of the movie. All in all it tries but falls flat I wasn't expecting it to be better then the first movie but was hoping for something instead of nothing.

Review title: This whole movie was for sure written by an algorithm
Review_body: Everything is just so meh, there is no soul , the film is way to long . The people that made this have clearly never worked on or played a video game before . I would have rather watched the emoji movie again.
Some fun with some older Warner Bros characters, but very disappointing.

The whole movie is either a.) telling us how great Lebron is or b.) showing how much intellectual property Warner Brothers owns. Good for kids under 5 because of the bright colors, which is the only reason I gave it 4/10. Somehow the first Space Jam from over 20 years ago has better graphics...I truly don't understand. It's all one giant advertisement with 0 originality or fun. I was already wary of LBJ due to his politics and conceited attitude, somehow I came away from this two-hour product placement having an even lower opinion of him than before.
This is absolutely horrible. I can't believe any studio in their right mind would release. Total flop!

Review title: Didn't Live Up To It's Potential
Review_body: Definitely not a great movie, but it's not as bad as people online are making it out to be either.
No words. Absolutely terrible. Didn't watch the end.

Review title: Can we just pretend this doesn't exist?
Review_body: This movie was never going to be as good as the original but this was just straight up terrible.

Review title: Space Scam: The 2 hour Warner infomercial/LeBron ego trip
Review_body: I turned it off after 20 minutes!(surprised myself I stuck around THAT long)I am glad I caught this on HBO Max, otherwise I would have asked the theater manager for a refund!To get the bad taste out of my mouth, I am now canceling HBO...again and HBO Max...again!!
This movie was so terrible that i will not be watching any film ever again.

The acting is awful, even Don Cheadle isn't very good in this movie. It's nothing but a dull reboot of the original and serves as a way for Warner Brothers to reference themselves for 2 hours and for Lebron to show how amazing he is for 2 hours. I'm not gonna act like the first Space Jam was good, but at least it wasn't total cringe. At least the first Space Jam had moments where I chuckled. Heck at least they played actual basketball, not this video game bs. This is just two hours of CGI that tries to distract you from how hardly anything is going on. If I wanted to watch a poorly written and poorly acted film staring an NBA player, I'll go watch Kazaam.

Okay maybe I was over expecting not looking at the fine print of the movie so to speak but I expected it to have more to do with the toons I mean it's a cute little movie and the family comes first value is important but it's not what I wanted I don't love or hate lebron but it's just simply not what I wanted.

I went to see this movie as a joke and for laughs after seeing all the 1 star reviews which are hilarious but after watching the movie I have to disagree I know the original has a special place in people's hearts and in their childhood but this movie is made for the new generation so of course you might not find the jokes and movie as good as the original which is great but I love this movie yes it's an advertisement yes the acting is not great and yes porky pig rapping almost made me die of cringe but this movie was fun and the animation was great! It was just a fun movie to watch and the soundtrack was fire. I know some people didn't watch this movie because of LeBron but you don't really think of it when you watch it at least i didnt but I think all things aside it was just fun.
I was hoping it was more like the first one. But nothing beats the original. Maybe the new generation does..I already miss the Monstars 😁

Review title: Ignore the hate, this movie is a lot of fun
Review_body: There's a lot of hate on this thread for this movie; a lot due to the idea of a sequel ruining the first. If you're like me, and the first came movie was released when you were a child, this will bring back a whole lot of nostalgia, and that to me, is priceless.First of all, remember that this is geared towards a young audience; one where Looney Tunes is not as prominent and Warner Bros. Knows that. The use of other films to show the various time travel exploits of the Toons is real fun, and makes you wonder just how much Warner Bros actually owns. It's impressive.The movie itself is your standard hero-villain type we've always known and the storyline of LeBron James' relationship with his son is a pretty good one. Sure, there's a few plot holes and weaknesses but it's Looney Tunes where cartoons explode and are alive the next scene - take that at face value.If you're looking for something fun and enjoyed the first Space Jam, this does not disappoint. In fact, A New Legacy brings back all the fond memories of seeing the first movie and is great for kids too.
Very bad movie!!!!!!Space Jam was a good movie but this new version was awful !!! What a waste of time .....

Review title: Space Jam 2 or Wreck it Ralph 3?
Review_body: Space Jam was one of the first movies I've seen in theaters and 25 years later we got the sequel no one needed lol.Such a weak storyline. It's all about product placement and a huge commercial for Warner's movies/shows. Very disappointed.

This is one of those movies you ask yourself how a room of "professionals" could have possibly come to the conclusion that the ideas, themes, plot, script, etc... were a good idea. My kids were bored and unamused, and I obviously was as well.

This is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen. Most bad movies you can find a little joy in how bad it is, that's not the case here. Shameless cash grab! Poor story line, cgi over cartoon for no real reason and it looks terrible. CGI porky pig is disturbing. This should have been a wonderful nostalgic trip and instead it's a dumpster fire. The entire movie is a Warner Bros. Easter egg which makes nothing an Easter egg. The worst example of recycled garbage Hollywood has ever produced. Even Don Cheadle phoned it in because he knew what trash this was. LeBron < MJ! Can't be the greatest with a losing record in the NBA finals and in Hollywood!

Review title: Kids will like it, adults may find it boring
Review_body: I have agree with some of the others that this movie is kind of boring. I hate to say it but it is. The reason I give it a middle rating is 2 things: most young kids will enjoy it. My 10 year son loved it! But he's a fan of Looney Toons and he likes LeBron so that's just a no brainer. Also, the special effects are really cool! And it's cool to see some pop culture characters from other hit tv shows & movies, make appearances in this movie as well.But with all that I still don't know what it is, I don't know what was missing, it's just.... boring! It didn't have as good of laughs as the original although it tried but just didn't land. I didn't hear anyone in the theater really laughing, not kids or adults! I honestly can't say what they could have done different other than hire more comedy writers cause at least then it would have been funny for everyone. I'll give them an A for effort, but this could have been better.
Terrible acting all around and a very weak story. Lebron should stick to basketball. Really disappointing movie.

I thought that Tom and Jerry's movie would be the worst cartoon made. Thanks to WB and LeBron, you guys just took over that category! LeBron had the nerve to be happy about a $31 million opening. The money they shelled out to make this mess will NEVER be made back! Your acting career is finished!

Review title: They have fantastic stars but poorly done
Review_body: It could have been a great show...but characters are poorly done. It is a waste of time.
Not funny at all. CGI is ridiculous. I like Mike, LeBron can't hold a torch to him on the court or acting. Don't waste your time.

Review title: Broken Back Due to Heavy Shoulders!
Review_body: This movie was carried by one person and one person only: Don Cheadle. If it weren't for him (and of course my kids) I wouldn't have given this movie a passing glance. It had potential "okay" moments that lasted a split second, only to be torn from poor writing, coattail riding, and whiney actors (LeBron James). Poor writing is just that: poor writing. However coattail writing speaks of the first one being so great that they banked on its success bringing this one good profits and supporting ratings. LeBron James, well he whines about everything (pay, politics, playing time, etc). I feel bad that Don had to carry this movie for a bad rating payout!

Review title: It's a cartoon, not Citizen Kane
Review_body: It's really sad to see that so many people take the time to trash a movie with 1 star reviews just because they are jealous of the star. They are either Michael Jordan fans that are scared to admit LeBron is better at basketball or they are mad he doesn't play for their team. That should have no bearing on the review of a movie but haters gotta hate. It's no Roger Rabbit but it's fun and the graphics are excellent. The rants about it being a Warner Brothers commercial are ludicrous. It was great trying to identify all the characters from the WB. I'm going to watch it again to look for the ones I missed. LeBron seems to let negativity roll off him but I hope he doesn't let this ridiculous outpouring of vitriol and hate discourage him from future projects. I think he'll rise above it. Check it out.
The voice acting in the original Resident Evil game is Oscar worthy compared to this god awful acting. I'm literally crying because it's so bad lol. Do not recommend 1/10 easily.
Can we go back and not make this film it's atrocious.
They didn't place the Space Jam song. That alone makes this movie unwatchable.

How can anyone relate to the arrogance and privilege exhibited by an ultra rich protagonist in this obviously not for "regular" people movie? Children under 5 years old may enjoy some of the animation and special effects. Other than that...this flick is disturbing.

Review_body: Watch the original, MJ is the GOAT. This movie is painful...my kids fell asleep during and my wife wondered how this got past production. Just awful.
We'll THAT was sucktacular! Don't waste your time on this. Read a book. Clean the dog poo from your yard. ANYTHING besides this movie!

Boring is da game and this movie lost at it
thats how boring it is.

Review title: Underwhelmed - The 1996 Original was Much Better.
Review_body: Nike wins an Oscar for gratuitous logo placement in almost every scene.The plot is boring and drags along. Doesn't really go anywhere or get to the main event until the last half hour of the film. At least it gets remotely interesting from that point. (About halfway through, my 4yo restlessly piped up "Why is it taking so long?")Too many side thoughts become distracting from the main thread as Warner Bros tries desperately to cram in a reference / cameo to every franchise in its massive arsenal.Almost nothing is funny or humorous - which is disappointing for a movie based around looney tunes characters.The "acting" is cardboard and feels scripted. (I suppose that's what you get when there's nothing left in the talent budget after paying for the main elite athlete star.)If you are a Le Bron fan, this might just be passable.
We waited all these years for this ? Let's never make another space jam movie , I feel like lebrons " acting " hurt everybody else's acting.

Review title: Summer movie for kids in the time of Covid
Review_body: I took my son to see this yesterday to bust up some of the cabin fever. I didn't expect a lot, so I wasn't surprised.It's not a bad movie, it's just another movie right now. If you have $50 and 2 hours to spend, go see it. Or Mortal Combat. Or Black Widow.Guys, we live in a time when King Kong vs Godzilla is not only raking in money, but thumbs-up from critics and fans.If you go see a movie or go through a drive-thru at a fast food place right now, let's be honest...you're an adult and you know what you're putting yourself through.The only disappointments were the voice actor for Foghorn Leghorn and me finding out later that that wasn't Angela Bassett (one of my movie crushes).
This movie really sucks.The michael cameo was super lame.The movie was just awful.Don't watch 1/100.

Review title: Just an add for WB...Dame s/b the hero
Review_body: I'll never buy LeBron as a hero, he has too much ego. Terrible overall just to shove the WB catalog down our throats the whole time. I found Don Cheadle more charming than a bad guy and the Dame Time scene was great. Dame is the hero personality this movie needed and he would've been great if WB wasn't so worried about putting the "name" in the lead role regardless of the best fit. Also, did they run out of money for a decent script? Only about 3 chuckles in the whole thing and it was just bad. Space Jam: Dame Time now that I'd "watch."

Space Jam A New Legacy was a beautiful sequel to the first movie, I heard all the comments from the critics and I was not happy, this movie was gorgeous and it made me feel like a kid again. I will admit, it is not better than the original, but if your a nba fan, you will love it. Don't believe the hate from the critics. Go see it...

Story - 2/10

BUT THE MCDONALDS SPACE JAM MCLURRY - 10/10No words can describe how much i enjoyed the limited time mcflurry. Without this movie I wouldn't have such an experience. Thank you LeBron :)

Why did they even try to redo Michael Jordan's Space Jam? This was no good. I wanted to throw up. They tried to slip in clips from other movies like Austin Powers and the Matrix... don't waste your time.

Hubris has led to the end of many an empire. King James is no different. In trying to be the MJ of this generation, he decided to go down the path of re-making one of the most random decisions of MJ's life. The result is a horror show of bad acting, inexplicable story line and shameless parade of so many irrelevant Warner Bros IPs that it could be a showreel.Kids movies have come a long way, evident from the likes of Luca, Raya and Ferdinand. Emotionally charged, poignant with messaging and joyous in visual splendour, these movies are a delight even for adults. So, then why this travesty? This movie is so bad, I fell asleep. I was thinking about getting out within 10 minutes of the starting.LBJ, you better have a post basketball career. Anything but this. Actually, doing nothing would be so much better than this.

The usage of 2D and 3D animation was great! This is not a movie that's gonna be critically acclaimed, however, there's technical expertise that was amazing! It's okay to have a movie that doesn't take itself too seriously.

Review title: i enjoyed it, but it felt like a huge ad.
Review_body: I quite enjoyed the storyline, i think it was a cute movie and the animation was good, but i wouldn't watch it again. I hated how it just felt like a huge ad. Instead of like a 30 second ad, it was like and hour and 45 minutes or whatever. Warner brothers has brought so many amazing movies, and i love to see them here, but not ALL. THE. TIME. I do think it's worth watching, but not multiple times.

Review title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
Review_body: I mean seriously wtf is this pile of gargabe???!!! This movie wasn't just boring, it was excruciatingly painful. Everything about it was just downright awful. The acting was some of the worst Ive ever seen and just the overall plot was ridiculously stupid. Most movies I can manage to finish, even the really bad ones, but I had to force myself to go to sleep to stop myself from witnessing the cringe. I can't even think of a single good quality this movie has. Id rate it 0 stars if that were an option.

This movie was absolutely horrible, i may not be a fan of lebron but that wasn't his fault. The story line made no sense whatsoever! The acting was horrible. Even don cheadle couldn't carry the movie. Also the looney toones characters had bad acting! How can you mess that up?

Review title: the negative reviews are a joke
Review_body: It's a movie for kids!!!!!! My 10 & 7 yr old loved it. & they also love the first one. I am a 90s kid & grew up on MJ & Looney Toons & I still think Space Jam 2 was great & entertaining. I loved all the wb cameos, the mad max one made me laugh out loud. Ignore any negative reviews & also go in knowing youre not watching an oscar contender. People really really love to hate Lebron & it really shows with all the reviews.
Not sure what happened... they lost the plot it was boring and felt flat honestly. Watch for the nostalgia and that's it.
This movie made for fun. Reviews are bad because they had very expectations. This is kids movie. Chill...

Review title: Warner needs to realize making a movie/animation is more than just filling the 2-hour period of your audiences
Review_body: I just want to start with what was wrong and then I'll mention the good parts at the end* TBH, I'm not a Lebron hater at all but man this dude should stick to his basketball. I know he tried to do it but in my eyes he failed as an actor. The first 20 minutes of the movie felt like a documentary to me. There was nothing special about it and well it took 2 minutes until you would realize about the father-son problems.* Another thing is the looney toons appearance. I appreciated the fact that they included most of the iconic characters in looney toons but I feel like the only ones who mattered were Bugs & a bit Lola. Daffy and Porky and many other characters were not in the spotlight. They just used coyote & mig mig jokes many times during the game and I guess the writers forgot other characters do exist too. The funny thing is I don't remember seeing speedy doing anything on the field even though he is supposed to be the fastest one :)* Being predictable is another problem but since this is just a family friendly product that you might watch it once for laughter (if you found anything that much funny throughout the movie) , I'd rather cross this one out.Overall, There are many things wrong about Space Jam 2 but still, it might bring some joy to you. Especially kids who will probably find it good too. But Warner missed an amazing opportunity for having a cool cross-over movie. There was many easter eggs and of course the appearance of other iconic characters out of the looney toons universe too but in reality, none of them mattered. I tried to not care about the reviews when I was going to watch it for the first time but I ended up having the same idea as 90% of everyone in here.

Review title: Solid children's movie, funny and lots of nostalgia.
Review_body: This movie was exactly what I expected it to be. People who were expecting an Oscar award winning acting performance from Lebron are very delusional. Please do not forget that this is a movie made specifically for children with an NBA player as it's main protagonist. With the low expectations I had for Lebron's acting skills, he surpassed my expectations. But this movie wasn't just about Lebron, the Looney Tunes absolutely delivered a great performance. They were so good, the amount of nostalgia and comedy they brought was incredible. On top of that, there was a ton of other nostalgia aside from the looney tunes which I won't spoilt but it was so cool how Warner Bros brought it all together. The CGI and visuals of the movie were incredible and anyone saying otherwise clearly doesn't know a thing about good CGI. The main thing that I think stands out most about this space jam was how much I laughed. It wasn't a masterpiece but what children's movie is a masterpiece? I can't think of any. I liked it and my son liked it too. Better than the original.
This was actually really good! Music was fire! LeBron James was amazing and the Goon Squad was great! Still, don't know why this movie got bad reviews! But, I like this movie good! 10/10 - Kohan64.

What a terrible movie! It was not funny, it has no storyline. I really did not like it. Lola bunny was a complete different character, her deep voice and tomboy style wasn't it. There was no basketball. Terrible.

This poor movie did not have a chance. Just months before it's release, the liberal cult of snowflake-crybabies, decided to cancel a cartoon character named Pepé Le Pew. He was my favorite character. I know that if you are a liberal that you don't have a sense of humor, I get that. I know that if you are a liberal that you have to be told when to laugh. But if you can't see the funny in a smelly skunk who wants to get in close with hugs and kiss', maybe cartoons are not for you. Maybe instead of getting a cartoon cancelled, you should try to figure out how you are going to move out of your mothers basement.And then they cast LeBron Lames as the lead? Lames is the main reason I missed this movie. Putting money in LeBron Lames pocket is the same as putting money in Communist China's pocket. I refuse to support a Communist loving, police-officer-hating, ignorant-race-bating-bigot, like LeBron. And judging from the reviews and response this film has generated, everyone else feels the same.There is a reason that Michael Jordan is the GOAT. Not only did Michael revolutionize the game of basketball but he also revolutionized the icon status. The reason Michael was so great, was because he was just as good off the court as he was on the court; Meaning he had class.

Firstly, I personally don't think this film deserves all the really bad reviews it's receiving - it's a fairly enjoyable film with albeit quite a basic plot, which wasn't expected to be a twists and turns kind of film.The acting was good and at moments quite funny too, it's great to see Bugs and co all back on the big screen again.This isn't a reboot of the original at all, more of a modern continuation and homage (as if you've seen the film you know the original is alluded too many times). It is also a fun way of getting a new generation into the world of Looney Tunes!

I dont know why all the bad reviews, you guys gotta stop takin things so seriously, this was a fun, wacky family movie that is obviously not meant to be taken as anything but that. I liked the Looney tunes, i loved every minute they were on screen, ill admit the story about Labron and his kid outside of Looney tunes wasnt good, but neither was Michael Jordans in the first movie. This movie is about Looney tunes playing basketball, you all need to take a chill pill and learn how to have some fun..

Review title: Decent of a sequel but, not for new fans.
Review_body: The CGI element made the movie not that great, neither does the start did some justice. Liked the cameos tho, story wise did not do much wrong. 7/10 at best.

Review_body: It's very simple...not everything needs to be redone or reimagined.

Review title: Worst thing I've seen in a hot minute
Review_body: Couldn't finish the movie. 30 minutes in and still no tunes-no space for jamming- no soul. Bron's acting is actually worse than MJ's-didn't know that was possible. Needless movie trying to bolster what Bron believes to be a better legacy than MJ's-sorry-like his ball carrier-this movie comes up wayyyyy short.

Souless showcase if WB properties. The movie substitutes a plot for parents fan fare on movies/tv shows that aren't even for kids. Mad Max Fury Road, Pennywise from I. T., and Game of Thrones have no place in a Space Jam Movie.Toss this movie in a fire and watch the original. Your kids will thank you.

Review title: Ignore the Reviews and make up your own mind
Review_body: Saw this today, personally I don't think it's as bad as some of the reviews make out. It has a lot of WB cameos yes, but where is the harm in that? It's been done in a funny way and why not? Acting isn't as bad as others have made out. It's a little cheesy, but it's also funny. If you liked the first Space Jam you'll probably enjoy it. It's definitely not the worst kids film I've seen. It's also a good story about being yourself.

Review title: Bad writing and an odd plot
Review_body: I went into this movie with an open mind. As a previous original Space Jam movie fan I thought this would be similar and have the same magic. Boy was I wrong. The dialogue was bad and the plot was strange and confusing. I am not sure that a child would understand the algorithm portion even with a character in place of a program and the first half hour is nearly unwatchable. Too much bad dialogue. Just play ball with some toones. I got the feeling someone thought since Lebron was an "actor" they needed to give him more lines and chances to act. This was a poor decision. When the cartoon portion started it got much better but still seemed pretty poor. At this portion of the movie kids may start enjoying it a little more but it is still no original. Better luck next time Warner bro's.
My 2.5 year old watched it and she loved it... she wasn't feeling the greatest either. My man and I both thought it was good. <3A.

This plot was horrible, the comedy was lack luster, hated the use of the looney tools compared to the first and don't understand why they chose the direction they did. The movie just straight up fell flat and boring.

Review title: MJ must now be the GOAT
Review_body: Michael never made us sit through 2 hours of absolute utter dog defecate.I was so excited by the idea of this movie. The thought of the server universe and all of the WB IP existing in its own digital universe I thought was really intriguing.In reality this movie seems like it was written by listening to kindergarten kids listing good ideas for a movie and merging it all unfiltered into a 2 hour snooze-fest. The movie goes nowhere and has no message.

Review title: This movie is for Kids...not Adults
Review_body: The problem with reviews is movies for kids is that they're done by adults. If kids rated our movies we wouldn't want to see them. This movie is not for the adults. It's for kids. You have to watch this from the perspective of an 11 year old and see how you would have liked it. My kids loved it and thought it was wonderful. It's heartwarming, funny and actually has amazing special effects. There are also good family values with themes of family, fatherhood and the important of being yourself. Will it win an Oscar? No, definitely not. But my kids laughed and smiled and ignored their tablets while it was on. It gave us great family time as we enjoyed it together.
I know LeFlop is doing all he can to chase MJ but this was a bad idea. The characters in the crowd were more interesting than the plot.

Review title: Terrible, bad acting, not funny.. it sucked
Review_body: The movie doesn't have any soul like the previous one.. so bad, please skip it. Don't waste your time.

Review title: Not what I expected but in an Entertaining way!
Review_body: I have been extremely keen for this one for my kids, I loved the original Space Jam & was excited for this one & at the same time not sure what to expect...I was highly entertained & enjoyed Space Jam: A New Legacy. It's a movie and a movie is supposed to entertain you as an escape - does the job but it's not for younger children as it is very story driven. Younger kids will enjoy from the 35mins mark for Bugs & his crew! Loved all cameos.....especially MJ hahaha.

Hold on, I'm getting up from my bent knees which have spent the last 60 minutes worshipping Lebron James. The movie takes him way too seriously. Very much in need of humorous self deprecation or SOMETHING that alludes to a shred of self awareness.Don Cheadle does well but is literally drowning in CGI.The original was endearing and capturing with lovable characters and an authentic Jordan. This knock off manages to turn Space Jam into Space James, who doesn't offer anything beyond his name. And the CGI is suffocating.

Review title: LeBron ruined basketball and now he ruined A classic

I centrainly hope they'll make more movies just like this one, seeing other worlds as well as other characters.

Review title: It's nothing amazing but it's not that bad!?
Review_body: Had to write a review based on how many pointless other reviews are done just bashing LeBron James.This movie is like a mix of the original Space Jam and Ready Player One. There are lots of inside jokes within the movie that reference to other WB movies & basketball (obviously).Brons acting was okay. The storyline of movie was also okay. I loved the pop culture references and the digs movie had at LeBron. It was nice and easy to watch. I wasn't the biggest fan of how they changed up the basketball storyline when it turned into bonus points etc but I'm a gamer so I didn't actually mind it as much.Overall, I'm happy that I saw it and enjoyed it but I wouldn't go out of my way to watch it again.
If they give out an award for worst movie of the year bet the ranch on this one.

The movie was soulless and the story was not convincing for his kid was kidnapped and he had to play a game to get him back, so boring and even bugs bunny's character was soulless and not like space jam one , most of the looney tunes characters on the film were soulless and cold,this movie project is so bad.

SJ2ANL is fun and very well done! Pay no mind to the close-minded, low forheads, because "Haters hate"! The movie has substance and delivers a consistent theme throughout, which is heartfelt, universal, and clear to those who get it, who know, and resonates on many levels to many generations. The "Serververse" and the WB Universe rocks! The soundtrack is inspiring and up-to-date, and augments the FAMILY FUN, as does the cast that does a truly wonderful job in this standalone film. Well done! Kudos LBJ and crew!

I love Looney Toones a lot, but this movie was one of the most boring movies I've ever seen in my life. In the first twenty minutes of the movie,there was a family drama that I didn't care about and I got bored while watching it. The worst features of the movie are that it is very boring and the acting is terrible. LeBron James and Don Cheadle's acting is disgusting. There are good things in the movie too. There are references many movies and TV series such as The Matrix,Harry Potter,DC,Rick and Morty,Mad Max:Fury Road, King Kong,It. There are also funny references to old Space Jam movie,but these references cannot save the movie. The same goes for music. In short, Space Jam: A New Legacy is a movie for me that I was really bored with expect for 6-7 minutes.

Was the acting good? No. Would I want to watch it again? Also no. For a family movie night this was a winner for ages 7 and 10 they watched it and liked it while the adults chuckled about the lame acting. If you're watching this in your mid 30s alone hoping it will bring back some 90s vibe you'll be disappointed.

Review title: Who is this movie meant for?
Review_body: Now I loved the original Space Jam growing up and I was excited to hear there was a new one finally being released but this was just WB showing off their properties.First off the villain, AL G. Rhythm, (really? That's his name) feels like he forces the start of the movie by choosing LeBron to be the center of this WB collaberation. But why? What makes LeBron so special that it warrants this? Because he knows how to dunk a ball?Now the first movie had a ridiculous villain too but at least it made sense to me as to why he was going after the toons.The movie is your basic "parent doesn't understand child" cliche story in every kids movie. It isn't bad but it is hard to like the kid when he doesn't see he is obviously being manipulated.Speaking of manipulative. Bugs Bunny, while I understand he is the original troll of the cartoon universe, tricks LeBron into recruiting the toons when he already had people he wanted to recruit. Bugs basically said "oh your kids in danger? Well forget that I gotta get mah buddies back."Next are the references which makes me ask, "who is this movie for?" Kids? Adults? Furries? I don't know, because while it looks like it is for kids, it has references to movies and shows that they are either too young to recognize and too you to still watch to this day.If you have a kid or are a kid you'll enjoy it but this will not age as well as the original did in my book.The original cost $80 million to make and made back 3 times as much. This movie cost $162 million and I doubt it will even see half of that. This is a flop.
I don't know why there are some bad reviews but to me it was great.

I believe NO, it was horrible and basically praising the "KING" lebron james over and over and over and over ..... you get my point. I am truly sad for the animators, they did great job, but the writing was terrible, RIP animators. Didn't laugh at a single joke, and before watching this I rewatched the original, and boi O boi what a let down this was. Like compared to the original this is shizer. The original with M. J. was a master piece. What happened hollywood?

If you came in to watch the movie expecting LeBron James to be a good actor, you're a fool. I came in with low expectations and it made it a little better. A big "pro" of the movie is when they made lebron into a looney tune animation to help cover up his poor acting skills. I felt the story plot was really dumb, but the father/son drama kinda hit home. I also felt like a lot of stuff was going on, too much. But, it was a watchable movie and had some really fun/cool parts and great animation. If you plan on watching it, maybe go into it without trying to be over critical, and watch with the family.

Review title: Give credit where credit is due
Review_body: The start was a bit dull but beyond that was a pleasant surprise, especially considering the negative reviews. Amazing visuals & some very hilariously unforgettable quips. Really enjoyed some memorable scenes.

Review title: big chungus almost saved this movie
Review_body: Big chungus had a small cameo that almost saved this movie.
Honestly is better the movie of Michael Jordan , I didn't like this movie.

I have no single idea why low star raters or critics are being harsh on this movie, this is a fantastic movie! I love the plot and even though it doesn't sorta make sense, it's just part of the fun and nothing too serious, heck even the movie tells you in your face!It's all for fun, Lebron James did a great job in this movie, and I can't even explain the amount of stuff this movie has to offer, it's like a weird dream I never thought I wanted to come true, and even though I never watched the original space jam, I still loved this movie and get some references of the first movie and weirdly get the nostalgia feeling even though I never watched the first movie and never born in the 90s, which tells you something about how special this movie really is, it brilliantly takes fans who didn't watch the first movie into this, while taking old fans with nostalgia and old school childhood cartoons and references that could make old fans say "Hey I remember that!" And this movie does tease the fact that this is a direct sequel to the first movie, but they actually don't spoil new fans if they didn't watch the first movie, but the old fans might recognize the references about the first movie this movie teases, and even if people don't like this movie, you can't lie that this movie is just like Ready Player One and has tons and tons of movie references that you might've enjoyed, and seeing your favorite movie in this movie, oh yeah and the part when they turn into 3D is pretty awesome, I know some people aren't gonna like it but you have to know this is a New Legacy, this isn't the 90's anymore, this is 2021 now, but the movie does still keep the 90's nostalgia but still being modern, and that's how you make a sequel to a 90's movie.

Review title: This does not feel like a space jam movie
Review_body: This movie is bad, why is it called Space Jam still when it has nothing to do with space? When I watched this movie it was based of a computer world/"planet" but had nothing to do with space. I don't get it.

I had to balance my rating between what I would give it verse what my kids would give it. Being a father of 3 boys (1 really into Lebron) I watched this because they wanted to. Obviously it is not the amazing Space Jam we remember but...On it's own it's not terrible like people suggest. I don't know if it was Warner Bros. Decision or Lebrons but he does get hyped up as "The King" way to much in the movie. The story line is pretty wacky and goofy as a Looney Tunes movie should be and I think that's where I keep it in positive light. I personally would give it a 4 or 5 but taking into consideration it's a kid's movie and my boys all loved it, i'll compensate for that. It has jokes, basketball, cartoons and it shows a relationship between a father and his son (I can appreciate that). In all honesty it teaches a good lesson about following your dreams as a kid and as a parent to not force your kids into the same path you followed.On a side note, I can only imagine how hard it is to be a super stars kid. They have to grow up with so many expectations because of their parents. In this case, it makes feel bad for Lebrons kids, painting a real picture of expectations passed on to kids that follow in their parents footsteps.
Yeah, times change and this new Space Jam evolved with it. Loved it.
Don't listen to critics make up your own opinion about Space Jam A New Legacy I really enjoyed it the 2nd time around and I would definitely watch it again.

Review title: Ignore the haters and go see it, totally worth it.
Review_body: 30 year old average joe here went to watch it with my 11 year old bro, and we totally loved it. The jokes are funny and the story has a big heart. The story is ok, i mean obviously its unreal and whatever but c'mon its the Looney Tunes, i mean taking into consideration the original one, both stories are completely unrealistic and what else. However, i dont go watching cartoons expecting and inch of reality and sense. I go to have a good laugh and have a great time and that is precisely what it delivers.Lebrons acting was ok, Jordan had more charisma yeah but LB performance is not bad. The rest of the characters are well done, specially his son Dom, i think he was also quite good and other family members had a coulpe of funny jokes and situations. Don Cheadle was great as the bad guy, he gave it all and was very pleased with the acting in general.Now for the laughs and jokes, i personally liked them a lot. I liked the fact that they placed the movie inside the Warner Bros universe, which compiles movies and subjects like DC, Harry Potter, Matrix, and Casablanca, to name a few. I had a laugh with the scenes involving the Looney Tunes appearing in all those classics, we all have watched over and over, it was very original and a good twist. The effects of course are waay better than the last one, the 3d models looked amazingly great.To finalize, i was very glad with the overall message of the story, which revolved around LB accepting the fact that his kid is different and that all passions are worth it. I think it is very meaningfull in this day and age, when we have kids more focused on electronics and videogames and we adults criticize them, just like our parents critisized us in their time. However, as LB puts it "you do you". I personally identified myself with LB and his son; when the 1st one came out i was a little Dom living on my world doing my things, now i feel like a LB trying to guide the youngers to my mentality and all, and it is here where we forget how we where the same, its all a cycle. In the end what matters most is family, and loving each other. The movie pictured this issue beatifully, it made me tear up a bit tbh.Anyways, ignore what other say, the movie is very enjoyable and has a great message. Take your kids with you or your siblings cousings, whatever. They will enjoy it and you might learn something about yourself too. Not as good as the original but still worth it. 7/10.
Bad acting, Warner smug, just NO... if this is what's coming on HBO Max, well... then I'm out...

Review title: I read "unrealistic" in a number of reviews. Really?
Review_body: This is a movie about the Looney tunes coming to life for God's sake! And people here are calling it unrealistic?! To be honest, I do not think there was much room to manoeuvre in terms of the plot. There was going to be a basketball game between the Looney tunes+LeBron and a set of mean characters, and I think they did the best they could with that. People are hating on this movie because they remember the Space Jam from their childhood to be much better, simply because they were 5 or 10 year olds at the time and were very easy to please. Just because you grew up, does not mean this is not a good kids' movie. I loves the original Space Jam, but I thoroughly enjoyed this as well!
If you like Space Jam, and basketball, please don't waste your time on it. Just watch the original one and Last Dance after it. It will be a gazillion times better.

Which is kinda the entire point--they're BASKETBALL. PLAYERS.Found myself LOL'ing several times (Nike swoosh anyone?) and even crying. Which is the mark of a great movie. Also confused by the trivia on here saying it's not a true sequel because they're called the "Goon Squad" and that the Monstars aren't even in the movie. We see them at least twice that I can recall.Actually thought it was better in a lot of ways, mostly because of all the different fandoms, and stars/cartoons that were in it. Not just the Tunes and Lebron/Goon Squad.

This was an absolute tragedy. They had a huge budget for this film clearly, so why not hire some actually decent writers and come up with a good and funny story? It's supposed to be corny, so was the first space jam...but this? Omg. Worst story premise on the face of the earth and then it had the nerve to try to make you feel something at the end??? You know what I feel Lebron? Anger. Anger for you wasting 2 hours of my life with this hot garbo. I moderately like Lebron as a person and an athlete and I just find there is no earthly way he watched this movie and thought it was good and ready for release - no sane person could have. I'd be interested to hear his true thoughts. This was honestly one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life and I'm not even exaggerating. After the opening scene, pure cringe pedal to the metal all the way through. I physically cringed watching the movie. Every scene belongs on r/cringetopia - as a matter of fact I wouldn't be surprised if I went to the sub right now and it was all clips of this movie. Shame on you Warner Bros. Wow, this movie was so fun and amazing. I love it a lot. Space Jam A New Legacy was really great and LeBron's performance with Bugs and the rest of the Tunes was amazing and awesome. This movie was way better than the original Space Jam, and also LeBron had a better performance than Michael Jordan. Overall this movie was fun and great.
