Don't listen to the critics on their negative scores on this movie, it's a Loony Tunes movie. What do you expect? Also they're obviously LeBron haters.

Review title: Space Jam is for the Children!
Review_body: The original Space Jam was one of my favorite movies as a kid, because when it came out I was 11 y/o. Looking back, it's a bad movie with bad acting. But I still give it an 8/10 for the nostalgic factor because it was made for kids from the mid-late 90s, and not for 30+ y/o men. In retrospect, it's probably a 6/10.I tried to watch The New Legacy with the same perspective and realized that it's even better than the original because it has more heart, better acting, and the artstyle and special effects are second to none. The cartoon segment has one of the best animations I've ever seen. Mind you, I've watched in 4k on a 65" inch TV.Although it is a kid's movie, it does have an underlying respectable message for parents. Especially African American dads, the importance of being present but not overbearing, to hug your kids, and to say "I love you."Lebron's acting needs some work, but it's better than I expected. If he is patient enough by accepting small roles, he could develop into an action star.Don Cheadle, Mr. Kung Fu Kenny himself, is back on his BS, did a good job for the most part of the movie, BUT, I'd personally prefer Kevin Hart, Samuel Jackson, Andy Serkis, or Johnny Depp since they are also known for goofy and eclectic characters.P.s.: I had to overrate the movie a bit due to the haters giving it 1/10. Why would you sit through an unwatchable movie?
I cant believe how wrong they got this. So poor. Im ashamed of War Machine.

Its bad like it makes bad movies look good. This movie should not have been made. Lebron cannot act they should have found someone who can act not just the "best" player in basketball. I found this movie extremely lacking in creativeness with Toon Squad vs Goon Squad. I do not understand why both team were called Squad no one working there could come up with anything better at least the first one had Toon Squad vs Monstars. With all the crazy neon lights my epileptic brother could barely watch the move. If I could give less then one star I would. Do Not Watch go watch ice melt or something else.

Some of you are so full of hate for no good reason!Space Jam: A New Legacy completely surpassed what I was expecting. I went in thinking it was going to be awful, and I was happily wrong! It's fun, light, has all of your favourite tune characters (plus other WB character moments) and is just a good family flick. If you're like me and you don't take movies so seriously you will enjoy this, and if you have kids (ie; the target audience) they will for SURE enjoy it!

In true Looney Tunes fashion there is gag after gag and lots of fun. The franchise crossovers are good value too. There are so many little jokes that span different generations. The things my kids laughed at vs the things I laughed at were different yet we all found ourselves laughing through the whole movie. Folks have been way to quick to bag the movie with lowball reviews. Enjoy it for what it is, good value entertainment that the whole family can sit down and watch together.Pleasantly surprised at how well LeBron did in his role.
I'm more ashamed that I saw this than I would be if my friends saw me riding a scooter.

Review title: Lazy sequel but really with the 1 star reviews
Review_body: First off I loved the original movie. It was a cheesy fun kids movie and featured some really fun set pieces.This sequel my expectations were low and yes I could guess every story arc and plot device going. Yes the film is rather lazy but I've seen so many movies that are worse.For starters this was always going to be a standard sequel where it crashes in on the original but doesnt come close.The main negatives from my side besides an original idea is that what made the first film good was the looney toons characters played a main part in the story, this film suffers a lot from sidelining them as a supporting role and instead focus on a boring villain.

Just a big No, no no. Who on earth let's this get green lit? No real story, a bet for no reason? How can you call it space jam if it has nothing to do with space? The original is the one and only as it had to do with space : aliens ie The Monstars from another planet wanting the looney tunes as theme park attractions.
After the first ten minutes, I was done. I just couldn't. Sad..

Review title: 10 year old me would have enjoyed this!
Review_body: I was 10 years old when the original Space Jam appeared in theaters. As a kid obsessed with basketball, I thought it was amazing. I rewatched it many times throughout my childhood. I have not watched it for the last 10 years because I knew it would ruin the memories for me. I am 35 years old today, having just watched Space Jam New Legacy. Was it bad? Yes. Were there any good moments? Not really. But this movie isn't made for 35 year old me. It's made for the kid in me. And I'm sure the young me would have thought this was a great movie. I don't think I'll ever watch this movie again. That being said, it kinda brought me back to the young me. Sometimes... I wish I could go back to that.

Perhaps the only funny line in the whole movie was when lebron said the computer was black when they saw don cheadle. Other than that, my god this thing was tremendously boring, unfunny, and emotionless. Warnerbros just really wanted to show us how much stuff they own that we don't care about. Give me the OG space jam with MJ any day over this.
He should just stick to basketball because she sure as heck can't act. This movie had so much potential but his acting is just horrible.

My brother and I just got through watching the film, and we really like it. It was crazy, adventurous, and surprisingly poignant, at times. LeBron James may not be the best actor in the world, but he was great in this. Don Cheadle did a great job playing the villain, and I actually hated him. All of the actors did a great job. The animation and CGI in the film are great. I didn't think that I would get used to the hyper realism animation that the Looney Tunes turned into halfway into the film. It was well done. I just wish that they would've had Pepe Le Pew in the film and showed Lebron bonding with The Toons. Still, that didn't stop me from enjoying the film.Also, yes, most people don't like the film and that's perfectly fine. Everyone has their own opinions.7/10.

Review title: Burn this movie to the ground!
Review_body: Storyline sucked. Hardly any character build up. Acting was trash. Humor was cringe. Warner Brothers trying to advertise themselves. Easter egg overload. Disgusting to the film industry. Hope this movie gets all the negative feedback it deserves.Rude comment to leave, but in all sincerity I mean it in a constructive way to help motivate Hollywood into creating fresh new ideas.

Okay, the first space jam is not high quality, but it is fun. This one was so predictable and painful and the pop culture references DID NOT save it. Honestly, only watched it for the rick and morty reference and i only watched the whole thing because i kept thinking, it cant be this bad right?This movie is truly painful and lacking in a original story and jokes. Id say it ruined looney tunes, but nothing can do that for me. Skip this one itll save your sanity for a bit longer. Also, hopefully Don Cheadle, the nba stars, and all the other prime time actor didnt read the full script before agree to this monstrosity. Warner brothers really just trying to advertise themselves heavily. Its too late buds, you will never catch up to Disney, not even with Lebron.
I can't think of anything good in this movie.I don't recommend to watch this movie- just a waist of time.
It actually is a 6.8 out of 10. I think the animation was really well done, but the movie did more advertising than storytelling. And I also deducted points for not showcasing Michael A. Jordan.
It really ain't that bvb and. My nephew loved it. That's what mattered to me the most.

It took me like 6 times to get thru the movie. I finally finished it. I went back and watch the original space jam. I must say the original is way better than the newer version. LeBron should have just left the legacy of Space Jam along.

Review title: Lebron was right... focus on the fundamentals
Review_body: Too much flash and not enough substance. We didn't get to see tue toons be loony until the very end and for a movie supposedly about basketball, there just wasn't enough (certainly not featured like in the original). There were some good moments but at the core, it pales in comparison to the original.
I don't understand the bad ratings by the adults, this movie is meant for kids and has everything that's needs to be in a great kids movie.

Review title: WOW....worst movie I have seen in years
Review_body: This is one huge ego trip for Lebron James and a huge advertising platform for Warner Brothers. Lebron's acting is some of the worst I have ever seen. He lacks any depth and personality. The plot is terrible. Not even close to the original. Whoever had the idea to create this piece of garbage should be fired. DO NOT waste your time and money on this.

Review title: Most Overhated Movie of All Time
Review_body: This movie is not a 7/10, I'd say a 5-6. But if you watch the movie and think it's a 1-3/10 you didn't watch the movie. I only gave the movie a 7 to boost it some. The movie is filled with cringe moments and bad acting. I don't know why They didn't just use LeBron's real family because his "family" in the movie weren't great actors. The movie is enjoyable and has some funny moments, but has more cringe. The audience is definitely 12 and under to really enjoy it, but as an adult the movie is still enjoyable. If your a fan of the original Space Jam or Looney Tunes classics would recommend watching.

Review title: Campy looney family fun. Reviews are too harsh on this movie
Review_body: Yes, most of the live action acting was bad, including LeBron.Yes, the movie was in some ways an expensive ad for Warner Bros and LeBron.Yes, the movie over-idolizes LeBron to a conceited extent.But didn't we expect all of this going in? "Epitomizes everything that's wrong with the film industry today"?? Really? Space Jam is the movie you use to make this statement? I'm confused, did people think this movie would actually be good?I went in with low expectations based on the subject and LeBron. All of the bad aspects of this movie were expected and, to me, comfortably in the realm of CAMP.The Looney Tunes themselves were fun and brought the movie up to being enjoyable at the end of the day and worth a watch.If you come at this movie expecting anything but campy looney light-hearted family fun, you will be disappointed.The movie is being underrated in the 4s right now dragged down by a lot of 1 star reviews. It belongs at 5 or 6/10.
... and I loved and enjoyed every second of it. I need to rewatch it to comprehend everything that was going on the sidelines during the game.

Review title: Lebron James as a role model? No thanks.
Review_body: I have kids they are target age for this movie. I will not mention or endorse this film in anyway. Lebron is an absolute moron and I hope this movie ranks so he realizes he doesn't have the infinite star power he thinks he has. Check yourself, Lebron.
Saw it. Sucked. It really sucked.I can't believe how much it sucked.

Review title: Good family values, bad acting, ect.
Review_body: The movie was basically a big commercial for every Warner Brothers movie franchise to the point where they sacrificed real substance. Basically a cookie cutter movie that you've already seen, but ooooo let's sell out a franchise and make a ton of money without needing much more than cgi and a couple modern day big names. Of course it's not The Space Jam you guys knew, and that's on you if you expected that level of quality. I just didn't expect it to be THAT bad. Lebron is awesome, no doubting that, but the reviews saying he can't act are spot on. It's like Michael Jordan trying baseball. We thought it was an interesting idea, but we all knew when it was time to move on....... it's time Lebron in case you were wondering. Stick to Basketball. Btw go back to Miami. ;)

Review title: What I think of Space Jam: A New Legacy.
Review_body: As a fan of the first Space Jam, I will be saying that there is a lot of good things about it, The Animation, the voice acting, especially Zendaya's performance, and the lot of effects & effort the film made. But, the plot, kinda feels like it's a cheap copy of the first film, either way, it's a great film none the less.
This production is a whole other level of stupidity ."For this Reason I'm Out" .I want my 2 hours back.

I wanted to like this movie, and I really tried, but it was just a bad imitation of the original "Jam". LeBron is a great basketball player and needs to stick to that as his acting style leaves me wondering if a computer had taken over his body and stolen his emotions.The Toon Squad in the New Jam just didn't have the Looney of the Tunes of old, it was hash of rehash and the laughs were hard to find. Maybe I am too old and kids under the age of 10 will "get" this movie, but I would urge adultish folks to skip it.Warner Bros. Shoved every bit of IP they own into our faces (why is this becoming the norm?) in an overlong (2 hours+) movie. I was hoping for a new, updated Jam, but this movie just made me feel like Jelly.

Ok, was it the greatest movie? No, but come on! It's not a 1/10 either. It was entertaining enough. Was it MJ? No, but it was still an ok movie. It had all the Loony Tune characters, plus several other Warner Brother characters. It was a little long, but I think it's better than what people are giving it. I am glad I saw it, just give it a chance.

I expected this movie to be a complete blast and was hoping I would be happy throughout the entire film as I was with the original Space Jam regardless of how many times I watch it.The Looney Tunes in the film were a blast. Believe me, they're charming, they're cute, they're funny. They're entertaining. They did butcher Lola, Granny, and Marvin severely but outside of those three the Looney Tunes maintained their charm and cuteness they've historically had.Had the movie not made Lebron's child the antagonist and romanticized Lebron the entire time it would have been significantly more enjoyable and as a result of that I can't justify giving this film more than a 4/10.Lebron was cocky, awkwardly romanticized and put on a pedestal the entire film.. this wasn't the case with Michael Jordan in the original and that's why he was so fun to have in the film. In the original Michael was just "He's great!" "We want to learn from you" and besides that it was focused on EVERYONE and their importance.

Review title: Wanted to love it but hated it
Review_body: I went in because i wanting to love it but ended up hating it, its about a guy who kidnaps about a hundred people, threatens to kill 20 people and tells you if you win a basketball game you can leave, but he cheats because he doesn't want people to leave but he loses and he brings them back home but why? He was in control and crazy mad that he lost?
Honestly, I like the movie. Despite people not liking it. It sheds new light to the old space jam. Guys, you should reconsider watching this movie.

Review title: Bad acting all the way around
Review_body: We all knew LeBron couldn't really act and he is sort of exempt from actually putting in a good performance. He's LeBron just put him in the movie and surround him with good acting and it would be ok. Nope. Don Cheadle(an extremely good actor) puts in a subpar performance as an antagonist. The voice distortion they give him when he gets upset/angry throughout the movie sounds BAD almost like they went with the first filter they came across in post production and were just like "yep that's good let's move on"The most glaring performance however is from neither the protagonist or antagonist but from the most important character in the movie, Bugs Bunny. Not sure why they didn't just let Billy West do the voice again as he is what Bugs Bunny is supposed to sound like. The guy they got to do it this time sounded off the entire movie and it really sticks out.I watched this movie twice just to make sure what I watched the first time was as bad as I thought it was and it is. I'm sure kids will like it but this does a bad job as a sequel for fans of the original(which would be the parents of those kids)
LeBron James a big try hard. Should just stick to flopping in the NBA.

Review title: Don't believe the hate, Haters will always always hate nothing to do with the movie
Review_body: Spoiler alert. My kids and I liked the movie. It was a better storyline than the first one. I loved the first one, I saw as a kid and the soundtrack of the first one was awesome. This one had better CGI obviously and storyline. Don Cheadle was a great villain. Lebron did better than MJ acting wise but they aren't actors. People are just going to leave negative reviews because they don't like Lebron. If you are wanting an Oscar winning film then you are wasting your time. If you want a fun and entertaining movie for the kids the definitely see it.. the rap battle, the cut scenes from WB movies, all that was fun and awesome. If you read the 1/10 reviews it's filled with crybaby haters that are against Lebron's politics. Noon way is this movie a 1 out of 10. The hate is real. A lot of these haters can't stand Lebron and hate everything he does! They even say that MJ was a better actor! Lol that's laughable!

Review title: Just turn off your brain and enjoy the nonsense
Review_body: Well, that movie wasn't as bad as the others are saying but it's not going to win any oscars anytime soon either. The movie is ludicrous as to be expected, as the plot is razor thin, but if you just came to watch just the Looney Tunes like I did and just wanted to see how this one fairs to the original then you might actually be able to enjoy the movie a bit.The Plot: What plot? The plot is so barebones that it might as well not exist. If you've seen the trailers then you know what to expect because there's no twists or turns to speak of at all. LeBron goes to a Warner Bros. Meeting, they pitch him to be the face of the brand, he doesn't like fun CGI, his son gets abducted because he's smart, and to win him back from Don Cheadle he has to get the Looney Tunes back in action. That's it. The plot is actually funnier if you imagine the woman playing his wife in this movie as just Michael Burnham going into a Looney Tunes holodeck program. The story stunk so bad that when my co-worker asked if it was worth watching, she told me that I wasn't selling her the movie well enough to go see it.What I Liked: I liked the cameos of the various Warner Bros. Brands including Superman, Wonder Woman, and even Rick and Morty (didn't know they belong to them?). The Tune Squad broke up since the first film and went to the other brands to branch out on their own, leaving Bugs by himself in the Looney Tunes world (Daffy is in Metropolis, Speedy and Granny in the Matrix, Lola in Themyscira, etc.) There's also the hilarious puns on the Goon Squad antagonists (Klay Thompson as the splash man and Damian Lillard as a time god with Dame Time were my favorites.) LeBron himself is even parodied as being all work no play (even though anyone who watches him can see that he plays with finesse), and they poke fun at the fact that he's obsessed with forming superteams and that he's always abandoning his old ones if they're not good enough.What I Didn't Like: There's an awful lot of pandering for LeBron, so much that it'd make MJ blush. He's constantly referred to as the king and the antagonist wants to merge with him or something solely because of said title. At one point someone refers to him as the greatest athlete in the world (I respect LeBron and love his athleticism but, c'mon). The CGI Looney Tunes were a bit creepy to look at when I first saw them in the trailers and even in the movie I still didn't like them (they didn't like their look either which I found amusing). Also for a kid's film there's quite a bit of swearing so you've been warned. The acting from everyone except the Tunes was awful.What I Thought Was Weird: Zendaya as Lola was a weird casting choice but she did a good job regardless so can't really complain. Pepe Le Pew missing will always get me upset and it still feels weird that he's absent because the cancel culture didn't like him. Also Ernie Johnson as a play-by-play commentator (did Kevin Harlan and Marv Albert turn this role down?) Don't expect a cameo from Jordan or any other player from the original film.The Verdict: If you liked the first Space Jam, chances are you'll either like or dislike this one. Don't expect anything mind blowing (except for maybe how dumb the plot is), and just watch the Looney Tunes do their thing, and you'll be just fine. At least I can wash my Space Jam shirts now.

A sad attempt to rekindle the popularity of the original. Lebron James just wants to be Michael Jordan but he's nowhere near as authentic and doesn't have even half the talent or charisma. The film throws in Superman, Harry Potter, The Matrix, and every other nostalgic thing from Warner Brothers in order to distract you from just how bad it really is. It doesn't have nearly as many laughs as the original, and just tries too hard to be better and crams so much into it that it just becomes visually overwhelming and noisy.

Review title: A long, distracting WB commercial making a slam disappointment.
Review_body: Yes, I have seen the first Space Jam and it was... meh. But certainly better than what we got here, especially as a smaller filmmaker.I do have good things about the sequel, though. The animation is great! I like how it keeps the usual charm of the Looney Tunes and is the best part of the movie. More specifically the 2D animation... the CGI is okay.I also liked the last 25 minutes, that being the basketball game's final quarters where the Looney Tunes get to be their usual selves which is entertaining and sometimes, even funny to watch.With that said, there are problems that make this a slam disappointment.The acting isn't the best, but hey, at least it isn't like 2003's The Room.The plot is like the first film, mixed with a message hammered into your head: Looney Tunes gathering together to play basketball with a superstar, the team wins, etc. The message of being yourself is fine enough, but what seriously bothers me is that every 5 minutes of the movie, it's "You've got to get your son back!". I know this is a kids movie, but that is a poor excuse for any movie. Kids have more vivid imaginations and would get the point after just one or two times, let alone nearly 10.Sooo, what gives the movie a 4 out of 10 for me? The overuse of IPs! I am not kidding when I say this but I kept getting very distracted by these pop-culture references (although the cartoons being added into WB films like Mad Max: Fury Road or The Matrix sounds like a cool idea at first) as well as Warner Bros showcasing every franchise, brand and character they own! Even getting Rick & Morty (a show intended for Adult Swim, btw) to have a cameo. Kids aren't going to get every reference and the fact they play specific music for Harry Potter or whatnot feels rather cringy to me. It feels like I'm watching a 2 hour long WB commercial for their stuff; that it's my biggest issue of the movie.Yeah, this is a 115 minute film! Imagine Warner Brothers shoving their IPs into your face for that long, including smaller details in the background for money to get their products or see them. Sure, kids may enjoy the animation and other aspects but honestly, WB shoving in their IPs (including their own logo seen at the start of their films) just makes me not enjoy it enough to be called good. There are some good stuff but everything else was distracting or just plain not good.With that, a 4/10 is good in my book thanks to the repetition (including the plot) and Warner Bros making a hammering, promotional commercial rather than, oh idk, a true Looney Tunes sequel. I don't care for huge promotional stuff, I'd rather entertain with something actually fun, like a live basketball game.

Review title: One of the worst things I've ever seen
Review_body: This actually hurts. It's not just bad, if they tried, and it was just bad, I think we could all just roll with it and laugh it off and say it wasn't terrible at least they tried....but no....What they did here was turn a classic from our childhoods into one of the most egotistical self involved sellouts of a promotion I have ever seen. As if that wasn't bad enough it's terrible, witless, and devoid of any genuine character. No effort, care or attention was put into anything except maybe the work of the animators themselves; but outside of that everything was subpar or worse.
Big chungus so funny. Make me laugh very much. Recommend watch. That is all folk. Do you get it? Like end of movie. Peace out.

Review_body: King James who....should have stuck with the orginal.

Review title: Awful. Save your money and watch the original instead.
Review_body: The guy that dubbed himself KING JAMES is an awful actor. Mix that with more lefty nightmares like Sarah Silverman and you get one big flop. I guess he's used to that though.The only way they could make up for this atrocity would be to remake it entirely with Michael Jordan instead.
The visuals are good. Nothing else is good in this movie. I expected nothing and still felt angry afterwards. Don't watch this movie if you enjoyed the original!

Lebron's acting was better than i expected, despite still beeing bad. The animation is good. But the scenes are too silly and awkward, even for a child. The writting is terrible and the story is a complete mess, everything makes no sense. Dialogue is not terrible, but it is pretty bad. The villain is generic as hell and has a pretty stupid motivation. The soundtrack is a bunch of random songs that should serve as a reference to other movies/shows, but it ends up terrible and annoying, very, very bad. Characters are stupid and forgettable. The cartoon characters were ok, but their character development is horrific. All in all, garbage and skippable movie, wouldn't recommend it.

My son loved the film but to me it sucked! Don't waist time in the theaters watching this garbage, watch it on HBO MAX so you can leave the room. If you do watch it you're kid will LOVE this film. I hate the goon squad, the Monstars are way better at least the toon squad isn't the looney squad. Finally as much as Teen Titans Go is garbage I would watch Teen Titans Go see space jam. P. S. The Micheal Jordan you wanted was Micheal B. Jordan how stupid at least my kid is happy and that's what I wanted for ME and my child but NO, doubt you can't make it through the 2 Hours of seriousness not a looney movie!

The overly negative reviews on Space Jam 2 are just unfair. All I can imagine is just a bunch of negative, angry middle-aged adults sitting in a kids movie with their arms folded and mad about everything before the opening credits even begin. What did you expect? Titanic?No, it's not better than the original Space Jam, but how many sequels are better than the original? No, the acting is not great, and yes, a lot of the plot makes no sense whatsoever. But it's just a hokey little kid's movie people. The special effects were amazing, and it put a smile on my kid's face. It ended up being a good little outing for me and my daughter, who wasn't born for the original Space Jam, but I've watched it with her many times. I knew the remake wasn't going to be epic, but it was cool to watch something with my kid that was a part of my childhood, so to speak.I'm not saying everyone should fall in line and love the movie like sheep, but people on here are being way too harsh and looking at this the wrong way. This isn't the best movie of it's kind, but far from the worst.

Review title: Not as good as the original, but not bad
Review_body: It's tough to review Space Jam 2 without considering who (and what) this movie is for. It's targeted for children, and nostalgic adults who love MJ's classic Space Jam movie. Space Jam 2 attempts to balance the line between the nostalgic, older generation of 90s kids with the instant gratification-seeking, fortnite-playing, younger generation. For the latter audience, the film is stimulating, constantly active, and (probably) satisfying. While SJ2 performs admirably with kids, it's misses a golden opportunity to achieve immortality alongside its prequel. Space Jam 2'a greatest downfall is it's lack of willingness (or ability) to be self-aware or nostalgic. A half-hearted shtick which employs Creed's Michael B. Jordan teases the possibility of connection to the original Space Jam film (wait that's not Air Jordan!), but any expectations of clever homage are aroused without being bed back down. MJ is not in this film. References or bits from the original film are extremely limited. Charles Barkley and Shaq don't make an appearance, though their TNT colleague Ernie Johnson plays significant minutes alongside consumer film staple, Rod Williams (Get Out). The centerpiece of the movie is, of course, the high stakes basketball game between the Tune Squad and the Goon Squad. Despite Lebron's stiff (but unexpectedly okay) acting, he plays the superhero athlete role admirably. Lebron's best moments happen physically on the court. The Looney antics of the animated players, as well as the suped-up video game elements simply add to the great entertainment. The game is just flat out fun to watch. Space Jam 2 is NOWHERE near as good as Space Jam, but it is a fun, positive movie for kids and basketball fans to enjoy.
Not something I would recommend but it is a good time waster.
You adult critics gotta stop watching children movies yo my 8 yr old autisic son loved it and honestly in this type of movie thats really all that matters....to me at least.

Review title: bringing more morals and good message
Review_body: At first, i should tell that I AM NOT LEBRON FANS. I am trying to be neutral. Yeah most of real athletes didn't act as good as real actors so i didn't expect too much but this was good. Take back at space jam 1996 where the movies actually focusing on the comedy, the new legacy trying to show us more about parenting, trusting each other, morals and attitude. Is this movie belongs to kids? Or adult? Both are okay, this movies teach kids how they reach their dreams, respecting family while also teach adult how to parenting, how to be good "father" icon to their childs and of course not to be selfish both in family or teamworks.

Review title: Not A Good Movie But A Really Fun One
Review_body: Now if you are coming into this movie expecting top tier acting, please i beg of you don't watch this, because if I'm being honest the acting is horrible voice acting even worse and the cgi at times looks disgusting. But with all that being said it is definitely one of the most fun movies i have ever watched, with all the easter eggs and characters this movie keeps you entertained throughout the whole movie. Now another bad thing about this movie is the plot makes no sense and the motive of the villain.So in overall i give this movie a 6/10 now it's optional to watch this in theaters I don't recommend, it's more like a family movie, but if you want to nobody's stopping you.Thank you so much for reading my review godbless.
Story line up basically normal but Cartoon character great join a legacy 🙂
Movie should have never been made. Has nothing to do with 1st one and really made a joke of it. All the changing in the CGI to keep it low budget was ugly. Movie will put you to sleep.

Review title: A disgrace to the Space Jam name
Review_body: LeBron's acting made Shaq in Kazam look like Daniel Day-Lewis. The Looney Tunes voices were all kinds of wrong. I have never seen the Looney Tunes so dull in my life. Every single scene felt like a neverending cringefest. The best thing about this movie was the special effects. The visuals are amazing, the animation is immaculate, the transition from animated to live action is seemless. But that's literally the only good thing you can say about this film. But worst of all, there is no Bill Murray!

Took my kids it was fun for them ...I see so many reviews clearly attacking lebron and probably haven't even seen the movie ... this is for children not for your old grumpy self ... calm down .. look at the insane 1 votes ... haters have arrived and oh it just beat black widow.

Review title: Makes the original Space Jam look like Casablanca
Review_body: I'm a huge basketball fan and movie buff, so I went into this movie with a big opened mind, (I mean it's Looney Tunes of course) but this movie has absolutely no interesting storyline. I made the mistake of showing the first one to my kids, so their expectations were probably high for this one, and they were nearly falling asleep. I do not recommend wasting your time on this movie.

Review title: Not perfect, but still a good time.
Review_body: Way too long, and very boring in parts, but when you except what it is, you'll have a great time with A New Legacy.

Review title: CLASSIC CULT IN A FEW YEARS!!
Review_body: LeBron James soars in a Looney Tunes adventure that will delight generations of fans.

Review title: LeBron's acting skills are as bad as his winning a championship by himself skills
Review_body: Just like with every championships LeBron won in basketball he would need two or three All-Stars in this movie to make it work. He got a decent Supporting Cast, but he had no major a-listers to carry his poor acting and mediocre plot through this shameful copycat of the original. Save yourself the time and money. Just go and watch the original Space Jam and enjoy.

Review title: Better than I thought it was going to be
Review_body: I don't get why this movie is getting so much hate. It was actually a fun movie to watch. Way better than I was expecting. It's pretty silly but the plot was thoughtful and heartfelt and the visual effects were cool.
This is the worst thing I have ever seen, an absolute travesty to the existence of humanity as a whole. LeFortnite James' acting is just as bad as his 2011 NBA Finals performance.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a SLAM DUNK!!!! I loved space jam 2.Me, My dad, And my sisters enjoyed it too, I loved all the cameos.And everything else. I saw a lot of hate for the movie, and i don't know why.At the end of the day: Ignore all the haters, It is a great movie that i would recommend.
This has the be the worst film ever made. Why? The acting 1/10 the story 1/10 LeBron James -10/10 congrats Space Jam A new legacy you win the most boring film of the year.

My family had a great laugh watching this amazing movie.Thr jokes were impeccable and perfectly timed. With animation to follow was the cherry on top.Don't listen to silly comments, have a go of you want a good laugh.

Review title: This was disastrous even with low expectations.
Review_body: An unoriginal script and very bad acting is an understatement.The movie industry has proven again how to deliver a bad product and an excessive use of advertisements.There was only one thing I liked about the movie and that was the dressing room part at half time. Go watch that on youtube.My advise is; don't waste your time/money. Skip this one.The original Space Jam is King! Not LBJ.

Remember that time when Jarrett Allen completely humiliated and embarrassed Lebron James by blocking his dunk attempt? Well, believe it or not, this movie is even more humiliating and embarrassing. I know, I know... "that's not possible," you're thinking. Yes. It is.To be fair, Lebron is obviously a great player overall. Truly. But he should probably stick to playing actual basketball (not space basketball) and confronting pa announcers at children's basketball games.

Review title: Calling it dreadful is being too nice
Review_body: Twenty-seven minutes in before a WB cartoon character (Bugs Bunny) makes an appearance. The first half hour is how great LeBron James is and what a fancy home he has. Unlike the first Space Jam, this is as soulless as a computer board. The second LooneyTunes film was full of chuckles. This one is a stone cold disaster.

Why? This is the question ask myself... Why mess with a great movie from 1996 to create this thing?I have to say, i gave it a 3 just because of the giggles i gave when looking to the toons and the ball-machine sketch in the beginning because the rest is just awful!Lebron James can't act to save his life. MJ didn't know either back in the 90's but they were smart and only gave him short sentences and spread along the movie! Here? He's always talking!!! And the life lessons? Precious!!! Review title: Do Yall Realize it's a CHILDREN'S MOVIE?
Review_body:
So many grown people are bashing it online either because they're comparing it to the original or simply because they hate LeBron James. Whatever the reason my be, this movies is not made to entertain please adult's taste of humor, like the first movie wasn't. We love that movie because it's from our childhood, do you think many adults from '96 loved that movie when it came out? Probably not...
Watching A New Legacy as an adult, yes it's cheesy and silly half the time but I like it because I know what type of movies its supposed to be & who it's supposed to entertain.

Well... I liked it... Never seen the first Space Jam movie and don't really know anything out LeBron James. But I did watch Looney Toons as a kid.I thought the movie was great honestly. Funny in parts and quite moving in others. Had a great message too - (for kids) be yourself and (for parents) don't force your kids to be something they're not, love them for who they are.I loved all the cameos too.I took my Nephew (9) to see the movie and he enjoyed it as much as I did. Left the theatre with huge smiles on our faces.I don't understand all the negative reviews on here. Changed rating to 10 to counter all the negative nancies.
I read lots of reviews and thought l shouldn't watch it but my family and l absolutely adored this movie!!!

This is possibly the worst film I have ever seen. The most damning thing is that I was just bored, I don't even have the energy to hate it. It was a total mess, all over the place with no real structure. The attempts to reference the Warner Bros back catalog were lame at best, and the handful of decent ones were so old none of the target audience would get them. Truly awful, cringeworthy mess.

If you're giving it a bad review solely based on personal feelings for LeBron James, your "review" isn't a "review" but an opinion piece. The movie was entertaining, although it Amy not have captured the same magic as the original, we enjoyed the character crossovers. Enjoyable.

Review title: Absolute Garbage - And that's an understatement.
Review_body: I get it, LeBron is a superstar, no doubt.But his acting in this movie is absolute garbage.The best part of the entire movie was the Michael Jordan part. I'm not going to spoil it for those of you who wants to watch it, but let me warn you, don't waste your time.I want my 2 hours of my life back.

Review title: Fails where the original Space Jam succeeded--being a watchable movie
Review_body: The original Space Jam, if we remember, was this super exciting movie where we got to see the Looney Tunes intellectual property outside of their domain and interacting with the real world and THE Michael Jordan. Real celebrities and sports stars played themselves in the movie. It was meta, self-referential, and irreverent towards pop culture at the time. These concepts were really exciting in the 1990s-look at what Scream did with horror cliches, and what Casper did with celebrity cameos around the same time period. We loved it, and Space Jam capitalized on all of this stuff while still giving us a fun, watchable movie. The unfortunately can't be said for this new Space Jam.The original Space Jam managed to fit a pretty lean, economical screenplay around these pop culture references and goofy distractions--there's a very, very clear three-act structure with some A, B, and C storylines running throughout that generally all carry through pretty clear arcs and wrap themselves up sufficiently without much head-scratching afterwards. You can go back and watch the original and see that it is well-paced, there's nothing that feels unnecessary that makes the story drag or raise a bunch of questions, and it does a satisfactory job of just being a fun movie. It's an extremely easy watch. It's not a "good" movie, but it's a well executed family fun movie that hits all of its beats and gets out without overstaying its welcome. The acting is lousy and it feels like a cheesy 90s time capsule, because of course it is. But it is entertaining. It does its main job of just being a watchable movie.Going into the new Space Jam, I expected nothing except a watchable movie and getting to see Lebron goof around with the Looney Tunes, as well as the occasional pop culture gags/distractions.What I got, however, was a really, really tough watch.Lebron is written as a mean, domineering, out of touch father and his very first introduction onscreen is extremely unflattering as a result, which makes our protagonist highly unlikable from the very start.MJ in the original Space Jam was written as not only a loving father, but they managed to also successfully portray the greatest athlete of all time as an underdog, and we totally buy it. They even leveraged the actual events of his real life into the story to ground him and make him likable, and it paid dividends in the final product. It was a very, very shrewd way of using a meta approach to effectively drive storytelling forward. In this case, Lebron is kinda rude and makes his own kid resent him as a result. There is no attempt made at grounding Lebron's character in any way like MJ was. Lebron doesn't need to be an underdog per se, but give us something about him as a real person to root for at least. We got nothing from this screenplay in this regard.A little later on, the main conflict arises and I watch Lebron get sucked into the serververse by Don Cheadle to go on a frantic search for his kid. I'm basically going "wait, why is he suddenly so emotionally invested in this? He has been nothing but cold, mean, and distant with this kid the entire time." There was nothing particularly meaningful developed between Lebron and his son before the kid goes missing, so it's tough to buy that Lebron is just devastated that the kid is gone. On top of this, a completely unnecessary and extremely poorly fleshed out wrinkle is added as a way to raise the stakes--he has to find the son or else his millions of instagram followers get stuck in the server forever. The social media followers were and are never a part of the story and are simply thrown in to raise the stakes because the kid being gone clearly wasn't enough to get an audience invested (this is being used as a crutch for poor character development). It's a tough narrative sell and I don't buy it.In Space Jam 1, the motivations were incredibly simple yet effective: Michael has to get back in time for his baseball game. His family, who he deeply loves, will worry about him. The NBA players will lose their talent if he doesn't. They will all be slaves on Moron Mountain. All of these things are sufficiently developed and explained beforehand, so when they are used as leverage to raise the stakes for MJ, we totally buy it and are invested. These stakes feel real and scary, and we root so hard for the Tune Squad as a result. This new Space Jam story makes the old Space Jam screenplay feel like an economical masterpiece on par with Die Hard.I don't worry about the son's plight in this new Space Jam, because every interaction with the most important adult in his life (the movie's protagonist Lebron) that he's had up to this point has been extremely negative and the villain is the only adult in the movie who overtly connects with him on a personal level and encourages him in his pursuits. Being stuck in the server forever with a very supportive Don Cheadle and his cute lovable Pixar-style sidekick looks and feels like a far better option here--it doesn't feel like he's been kidnapped or is being held against his will whatsoever. The son is very, very clearly enjoying his time in captivity and it just kills the sort of damsel in distress archetype it's shooting for here. It's really, really bizarre to see a kidnapped kid enjoying his time and never, ever once asking, "where is my dad?" or maybe saying, "let me out of here, I want to go home." What is going on here?The movie is absolutely loaded with forced, hamfisted, and genuinely corny (not in a funny dad joke way) references to existing Warner Brothers IP. I believe I counted four (4) overt references to The Matrix of all things (remember in the late 90s when it was common to see a Matrix slo-mo bullet dodge reference? It obviously got old quickly, even back then). These all honestly get very old, very fast. There's too much, none of the references are creative or particularly funny, and they really do make the movie drag along more than it already is. It all just serves as filler. The same goes for the insane amount of CGI effects in this movie. I marveled at it, not only for how much work went into it by the artists, but also at how utterly unnecessary it was and how much it dragged out scenes to be way longer than they needed to be so that we could wait on actors to wave their hands and arms all over the place to interact with the CG stuff. If there's any way a CGI thing can be used, it is. There's zero discretion in this regard. It's pure filler and incredibly distracting most of the time. With all due respect to the artists and the hours they put in, its a huge technological achievement but incredibly over the top as a result. You really get the sense that this is what the movie is built around, rather than all of it being built around a movie.The original Space Jam has occasional cameos and some breaking of the fourth wall, and uses the Looney Tunes IP and some minor corporate product placement as part of the meta/self referential pop culture shtick it was doing. Some of these ideas and sequences have aged better than others, sure, but none of it feels unnecessarily forced or crazy over the top and it all went over fairly well originally without detracting from the story or taking time away from developing characters. They were built around the movie--the movie was not built around it.TL;DR: Ultimately, the new space jam fails where the original Space Jam succeeded--in being a watchable movie.

I'm going to be probably the only 10 point review here. I'm not saying this is a 10 out of 10 movie. It's not. But it is fun to watch! It is nostalgic! So I don't know what you guys were expecting a Tarantino film?? Shut up.

Review title: A letter to the Sound Department
Review_body: Dear Sound Department. WTH?I mean, honestly the effects, quality, etc are well done. But the volume between the vocals and the effects make it almost unbearable to watch. You have to turn your sound system to max to hear the vocals and prepare to have your eardrums blown as soon as a sound effect comes up.Or learn to love subtitles.I rated this what I did because other departments did their job.
I admit I slept through most of it - I'm a self-employed solo mom. But my daughter was entertained so it can't be that bad. She's still talking about it. Great for young kids, fail for the rest.
Please stop trying to redo everything. Michael Jordan was made for the movie.

Just another way to ruin a classic film, nothing special about this movies besides the WB Characters... lebron ruined this film with his terrible acting! Maybe we can wait another 25years for a good Sequel.

Review title: Fun movie expanding on concepts of the first movie
Review_body: I saw Space Jam in theaters as a kid and really enjoyed it. I took my kids to A New Legacy and laughed throughout the whole movie. Are there plot holes? Yes. Is LeBron an Oscar level actor? No. But that didn't make it any less fun for me and my kids seeing the Looney Tunes at it again.I really enjoyed how they took the concept of bringing in other WB movies like Mad Max, Matrix, King Kong, etc. I wasn't expecting that.Don Cheadle was a bit melodramatic, but hey, he's a villain in a kids movie. If you're expecting a dramatic performance from people acting across from cartoons, this isn't the movie for you. If you want to just shut your brain off for a bit and laugh at cartoons, you'll enjoy the movie.

I love Looney Tones! But its 2021 and they've lost their steam. LeBron James fell flat. The father/son rivalry was a decent start but I was still left wanting something more. The whole point of the film made the least amount of sense too. After everything, why does Don Cheadle even make LeBron play basketball to get his son back? He's got them both now; mission accomplished. But Cheadle says lets play basketball and I'll even use my cheat code to take away points..only once though. That part of the plot was weak. The original kept the plot simple. This one did too much. And I guess its "space jam" because of cyber space.. I'll stick with the OG.

Review title: I wanted it to be good so bad.
Review_body: I went into this with a very positive attitude but.... no just no.

Review title: Every bit as flawed as its predecessor
Review_body: People really like to hate this movie apparently. I don't see what makes this movie a 4.4 versus Space Jam's 6.5 though.The animation in both is great. There's product placement. The story is sloppy. The acting is mediocre at best, at least from the main character. Voice acting is fine. They're both completely watchable, in fact they are fun movies.I'd say the main thing that separates these is time. We have more realistic CG animation now, which makes this movie look higher budget than the original. I was surprised to find out that the difference in budget is not /that/ large (when accounting for inflation). It's about a $10M increase.I think this movie deserves to be criticized but not to the point of completely glossing over its positives.I recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys cartoons, and doesn't take movies like this super seriously.

Review title: I just feel sorry for the actors
Review_body: WOW.... I had gone into this reading all of the reviews, saying this was a terrible movie. They were right. This was hands down the worst movie I had seen in a long time. LeBron, please promise the world this is the last movie you will ever be in. Nothing in this movie is believable. I really feel sorry for actors like Don Cheadle and Michael B. Jordan who somehow got roped into doing this snooze-fest. My guess is that they were fulfilling some clause in their contracts or just owed someone a favor, because no one in their right mind would have read this script and used it for anything other than toilet paper. I will leave you with my last thought, as I was going to rip apart all of the scenes, but I thought I would leave this as a no spoiler warning. Anyone over the age of 10 should walk, no, run away from this movie.

I was a big fan of the old one and I don't like Lebron too much, but I thought the production was fine. I like the old one better, and this one is definitely a bit more fast paced but it's a good kids movie at the end of the day.You can tell a lot of thought and production went into this, which I respect.Honestly, for a sequel to this type of movie, they put together a good show.I probably wouldn't spend money in the theaters, I watched it on HBO Max. But it is definitely worth a watch if you have seen the old one.The Luney Toons always make me smile though.

The Looney Toons were great! The WB montage was incredible! I had a great time watching it. Sure it had cringe moments but so did the first one. And I appreciated that this one didn't try to be a remake.

Review title: King Flop in the court and in a movie!
Review_body: This movie is Absolutely non-sense! It's not even half as good as the 1st Space Jam movie. The GOAT MJ made the movie fun and exciting to watch but this movie with lebron is ABSOLUTELY NON-SENSE!.Waste if time!

I went in to this movie with low expectations and high hopes! When I was a kid Space Jam was the Jam! MJ was everywhere. Even after his early retirement. The original had a great original story with lots of NBA cameos and Bill Murray. It had probably one of the best soundtracks of any movie in the 90's. I still have all of the action figures from the movie including MJ. With that said. This movie was missing most of the things mentioned above, but it did have a lot of movie cameos, like ready player one, and also I have never been a huge fan of lebron, but I will say because of this movie I like him a little more. It was still fun to watch, and was entertaining. It will never be MJ's Space Jam, but then again Lebron will never be Jordan.

Please save your time , it's so bad I can't even put it to words .. how the F this even made to the cinemas lol.

This movie is the definition of the movie quantity over quality. Technology is the focus of the movie, and not much else. The acting is horrible. The looney toons act like a 3 year old who was born in 2017 would assume them to act like. Lola the bunny and Bugs DID NOT flirt with each other ONCE. In fact, Lola's entire role was just being the "team player" and inspiration for the team. The "we can do this if we put our hands together!" classic POS conceptualization. They say movies have become more sensitive to the audience. This movie is the definition of tailoring to the general audience. It is so "average" that it makes me gag a little. This is not looney toons, this is "let's make sure our 3 year old gets exposure to inspiration figures that can teach valuable lessons" tunes.
Not much spirit, distasteful graphics, and low quality lines all over, a few chuckles here and there.Lebron is not to be compared to MJ.The ads were a disservice to the spirit of Space Jam.

Its a good film but in the shadow of the original. It also feels really rushed and seems to miss out key moments throughout. Also the acting in some scenes is awful.

Review title: Yeah Lebron sucks but I thought everything else was fine
Review_body: I feel like people are being too hard on this film. It's not as good as the original, and lebron is most definetly the worst part of the film, but it's not the worst thing ever like some people are making it seem. I can for good 2d animation, vfx, and looney tunes gags. I believe the movie delivered on all those fronts. I'd even go as far to say that the voices and personality's of the tunes are intact, and even slightly better the space jam (except Lola, she was just ok.) in general, a decent popcorn flick that's kind of just a mindless watch that can be enjoyed for the cartoons, pretty much like the original in my opinion.

I came into the pics a huge space jam fan so I had high hopes for this film, is it as good as the first?? Heck no! But is it still a good stand alone film ABSOLUTELY! I loved the WB cameos and as a proud Hufflepuff myself I was glad to see Labron as a Hufflepuff my highlight though was seeing my fave cartoons as live action cartoons I really loved the design and SPOILER the joke of seeing "Michael Jordan" was hilarious great movie really enjoyed it.

Was blind people at loony bins the target audience?And now investors need at least $100 million in ticket sales to recover from this flop.Not gonna happen, this is beyond lame and detestable.

I watched it open minded and had a good time, everyone knew how the movie is going to end even before the movie came out, it's not about that, it's about having fun and learning the message of the movie.

LeBron was terrible and the storyline was horrible. The decision to turn the game of basketball into NBA Jam was also terrible. Lots of money wasted but hey at least I didn't waste any money going to the theaters to watch this garbage, thanks to HBO Max.

I got lost and the character of Algorithm doesn't do what an algorithm does in the real world, like how is he suggesting a movie? And is it basically a big wah that LeBron rejected his idea?The part I enjoyed most was trying to see which WB movie characters I could spot in the finale crowd.Original was much better. My biggest laugh was when they said Michael Jordan was coming and it was Michael B Jordan.
Who ever thinks this movie is garbage it's not. This movie might actually be at the the same level or better then the original. I recommend watching this movie if you have the chance.

Review_body:
Yep, a long ad of Warner Bros, Nike, LeBron JamesAs expected, LeBron's acting sucks but what surprised me is that even known actors such as Michael B. Jordan acted badlyNone of the Jokes landed

That's all that matters. That first one wasn't all that great either. It's a kids movie that the kids might enjoy if they're into basketball or pop culture.

This was nostalgia and cameo galore!!!!!! You have to be okay with the hbo brand as well as other brands thrown in your face but hey that's Lebron getting his payday! We all know the real reason why we watch. I love hbo products too man.

Obviously doesn't deserve a 10 but have to offset the trolls and people comparing it to their childhood. It was an enjoyable movie that you can watch with your kids or enjoy without as a little nostalgia trip.People saying LeBron can't act, you're right. Neither could Michael. Doesn't really hurt the movie because you should expect that a professional athlete doesn't know how to act. There's a lot of WB referential humor which can be a bit much sometimes but doesn't become overwhelming. Great self-deprecating shots at LeBron throughout. Felt like the other NBA/WNBA players could have had more screen time but they were probably busy with something else.Overall it's a funny and heartwarming cartoon basketball movie. What do all the haters expect? Casablanca (which does make an appearance)? Sit back and enjoy the goofiness... or Loony-ness. Eh? Ehh?

I just don't understand how this movie had such horrible reviews. I should start off by saying I am 42. It was not great, but definitely not a 1 or 2. I wonder if most of the people giving it very low grades are just disappointed because it didn't hit the same feeling that it did 20 years ago. Remember, you are an adult now. This is a kids movie. My kids know nothing about the Looney toons, but they f*ing loved this. Shut your face weirdo's.
WOW just terrible. Not much else to say. Just terrible. T E R R I B L E.

We was already going to watch the movie because he was in it. If this was the route they wanted to go it should not have been called Space Jam like its predecessor. The lines..awful. The plot... even worse. BUT... Great graphics.

Insult to Jordan. Another Lebron James. Narcissist event.
This movie is no masterpiece but it's extremely entertaining and you all salty.

Review title: I'd rather watch The Room on repeat for 2 days straight.
Review_body: I didn't mind when they removed Pepe Le Pew, I didn't mind when they made Lola Bunny less awesome then what she was in the original Space Jam, and I didn't mind the horrifying names they chose for the Rebooted Monstars. However, what I did mind was the fact they took away the classic 2-d animation and made the cartoons real. That was terrible. I did mind when they basically made every freaking call back they could to the first movie while also throwing in every other product that WB has in their pocket. And I did mind that WB decided to go with freaking Lebron James, China's superstar and all around dipstick. There are so many better, more refined basket ball players then the Loser of the Lakers. You want comedy, go watch the original. You want love between a father and son, go watch The Judge. You want Looney, get HBO MAX and watch the classics, it'll be cheaper then spending the $50-60 it'll cost to take your family out to see this doodle disaster.

Review title: Possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen
Review_body: The title says it all. A complete mess from top to bottom. Nothing saves this calamity. Horrific.

What disappointed me most about this Space Jam movie was the lack of a decent soundtrack. The original space jam soundtrack was iconic. This movie had a terrible (and almost non-existent) soundtrack.The movie itself was bad. There was hardly any focus at all on the "Goon Squad" villains and their motivation. The main villain (Al G Rhythm) was awful.Put simply, this movie should have never need made. I bet I have watched the original Space Jam over 50 times growing up. I was really hoping for a fun, heartfelt successor to the original Space Jam movie, but all we get is 2 hours of disappointment from a Hollywood money grab. But hey, I'm sure they'll sell plenty of merchandise/toys. Way to go.
If VHS was still around, this would have gone straight to it. What a pile of ....
Just don't. It's a waste of time. Honestly it's one of the most boring things I've ever seen.

It's fun, colour and a kids movie after all. Stop comparing it to the original and just enjoy it. It is a bit daggy in parts but the kids loved it. The visuals are pretty cool and the music was great.

Review title: A New Legacy? More like A Disgraceful Legacy!
Review_body: Despite literally having some good visuals to an extent, and got some chuckles out of some moments, this movie was honestly very terrible. In fact, disgraceful at best.They got the nerve to have LeBron James look like he's so great, despite him being controversial in real life, and being the worse of many dull characters in the film. It pains me that people give Michael Jordan so much unfair crap thrown at him for his performance in the original film. I though MJ was really good in the film, because one word can really describe how MJ is in Space Jam, and that is "genuine." LeBron doesn't feel genuine, and it doesn't help that the supporting cast weren't as good either. They're all trapped in this massive, corporate mess of a story that devoid of logic, even by Looney Tunes standards.Speaking of Looney Tunes, some of the characters were okay for the most part, but characters like Granny, Porky Pig (because that cringy rap battle), Lola, and Bugs Bunny were basically ruined. Lola's character literally doesn't have much going for, despite having more screen time than the 5 minutes of screen time she had in her (much better) debut in the original film. Yeah, she's not the worst of the bunch, but I'm not supporting a progressively dumb redesign choice from the mind of Malcolm D. Lee, who clearly didn't understand Space Jam, or Lola Bunny to begin with. And, having Lola to consult the help of Wonder Women pretty much ruined it more for me. She's already a strong female character, you don't need her to have this pointless "development" for her character to "grow." As if The Looney Tunes Show from 2011 haven't screwed her character up enough, by making her into that stupid blonde stereotype, voiced by Kristen Wiig (nothing against her, but she's not all that to me as Lola)... Anyways, Bugs in this movie, despite me liking him, I mean he's the most iconic character ever, but they literally tried to kill him. Not only in the many dumb moments, but the ending to where he performs "the glitch move" and dies. But, of course despite explaining stuff like this literally in the past, including the original Space Jam, Bugs is alive and well, making that cheap, sappy, and manipulating moment of sacrifice completely pointless!I don't want to make this way too long than it already is, but if I were to speed things up like the hilarious time-lapsed Don Cheadle (Al. G. Rhythm) introduction scene, here's what else sucked hard in this film. Al. G. Rhythm is a crappy villain with broken motivations, an attention-seeking attitude, and The Mummy Returns-like CGI near the end, the Goon Squad were rushed-CGI cringe. The soundtrack was forgettable, but slightly decent in some areas, despite not being nearly as awesome as the original Space Jam album, and James Newton Howards score of the original as well. The overuse of WB IPs (mostly a bunch of R-rated ones in a PG kids movie) were very distracting, and honestly one of the worse parts of the plot. I know Pulp Fiction was referenced in the original, but that was a pretty funny gag that worked for the film, and its characters. Lebron's son should've been the most interesting character, but all believability is thrown out with how fast he can make an advanced-looking video game within the supposed months and weeks he spent on. Seriously, that bugged me before the plot even settled in! And, the biggest kick in the balls for me, as a fan of the original film was the god-awful Michael B. Jordan scene, as it's a joke of hyping up Michael Jordan's grand entrance. One of many reasons why this film is very disgraceful. In fact, I should say this film's more disrespectful. It definitely takes the cake as one of the worst films of this year.One more thing I would end this off. Space Jam, to me is a good film no matter what the case may be. I know it's not perfect, and that's the point. Literally, there's so much to love about this film, and it was made by better people that at their very best knew what movie they were making. It may seem like a gimmicky cash-grab to others, but it's so enjoyable and fun that you care less about what the studio wanted to do with the film, or what the nay-sayers say about it. This disrespectful standalone sequel is not Space Jam, and it dang sure ain't no great family film. It takes too much and throws it all in the kitchen sink, and screws a lot of things up. Almost everything about this movie is everything I feared it would be, and I'll definitely not be watching this travesty again.2.5/10 for having a few good things, but the rest of the movie being nothing but total nonsense, and idiocy that goes along well with The Tom & Jerry Movie of 2021. Pure utter garbage. I'm sorry, but this movie sucked. The original is the best, hands down.
The Sequel has Wonderful Special Effects than the first part.

Review title: I don't understand these bad reviews!
Review_body: Real rating - 7, trying to counteract all these negative reviews.This was a fun movie for me and the kids. I loved all the references to other movies and the cameos. It's definitely geared towards this generation of children with the video game/technology aspect.Give it a chance, don't listen to these negative reviews!

Lebron james is terrible in this movie. Looneytunes are always fun and seeing Rick and Morty was cool. Don Cheadle never disappoints. Seeing all the other WB stuff was fun but also seemed real desperate to let everyone know WB exists.

Review title: Lebron needs to stick with basketball
Review_body: This movie was bad. Lebron trying to ride Jordan's coattails, and failing all along the way.

Everyone involved should be ashamed. LeBron can't act and they really mess with the looney tunes I've grown to love. Also they ripped off Ready Player One on so many levels and tried to mask it as their own creation. Bad writing overall and a huge woke let down ,when are writers going to learn.

Review title: While having it's moments, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" lacks the personality of its predecessor.
Review_body: *Some spoilers for the original "Space Jam," and "Space Jam: A New Legacy."When I was eight years old, my younger brother and I fell in love with the original Space Jam. We had grown up on watching "Looney Toons" every morning before school and on the weekends, and seeing that combined with the greatness of Michael Jordan was something to behold. I've seen the movie countless times, and I still enjoy it to this day. As I've grown, I've been able to recognize that "Space Jam" is, in fact, not the perfect movie I once thought it to be. Let's be honest, MJ isn't a very good actor, the writing is funny at times, and the story is lackluster. However, the things that carried "Space Jam" to cult status were:A. That absolute banger of a theme song.B. Solid replication of the original "Looney Toons" magic.C. The authentic message and overall heart that the movie has.The same cannot be said about "Space Jam: A New Legacy."To me, and probably a lot of audience members, extreme corporate influence takes away from the authenticity of a film. It felt like non-stop, Warner Brothers were constantly reminding me about all of the things that they own. There's moments in the movie that make you forget you're watching a movie about one of the greatest basketball players of all-time playing the sport alongside a group of zany, iconic characters, and feel like your HBO cut away to a five minute commercial break where they show you all the other things you could be watching instead. It left a bad taste in my mouth, as if Warner Bros. Were gloating that they had the rights to all these properties. The cheapest way to try and mooch points from your audience is to hit them with non-stop nostalgia instead of coming up with original scenes. Instead of trying to etch iconic moments into the "Looney Toons" lore, they just throw out the "Foghorn Leghorn is in Game of Thrones gag" or "Speedy Gonzales and Granny are in The Matrix gag." Frankly, it's insulting and cheap to try and act as though those jokes are funny or original. Those properties have been parodied millions of times, and by adding on to the pile, you're just beating a dead horse.In the original "Space Jam", Michael Jordan has a great chemistry with the toons. While it is a bit silly and cheesy at times, it absolutely captures the essence of "Looney Toons." The jokes are genuinely funny and it feels as though there is substance there, with or without Jordan. In the original, the Toons have quotable moments that have stuck with me for years. However in this movie, the Toons lack their iconic personalities except for in little, forgettable bursts. There isn't a single moment or quote from the toons that I remember, and I just watched the movie 30 minutes ago. I felt genuinely robbed of seeing some of my all-time favorite characters come back to life on screen. Just because Bugs Bunny says "Eh... what's up, Doc?" doesn't make him Bugs Bunny. It felt like nothing more than a shallow interpretation of the characters that are so profound and lovable. The original was Michael Jordan AND The Looney Toons. This movie is LeBron James (and the Looney Toons are kind of, sort of around.)The message portrayed in "Space Jam" was genuine. People idolized "His Airness." He's one of the, if not the, most prolific athletes in American History. There is a reason the phrase "Be Like Mike" was used. People wanted to be like Michael Jordan. He's successful, charismatic, and the definition of a man who would do anything to push his team to the top. The Toons come to find out that they can't beat the MonStars if they try and replicate Jordan, but instead find themselves discovering the individual things that make them unique and special to access their true strengths. The message was to believe in yourself and be confident in your own abilities to be the best person that you can be. The movie never directly spelled it out for you, but even as a child, I fully understood the message. I think the writers for "Space Jam: A New Legacy" wanted to make the message as clear as possible, because it was though every five minutes there was some dialogue about 'I don't want to play basketball! I want to be a gamer!" or LeBron saying something about fundamentals and making his kid do something he didn't want to do. Being hit over the head with the message the entire movie really doesn't make me appreciate the lesson that they're trying to sell.To say this movie was unwatchable is false. It's no masterpiece, and it certainly isn't the original, but it has it's enjoyable moments. I found that there was little moments that made me genuinely smile or laugh. LeBron poked some fun at himself here and there in reference to old memes which were funny at times. I've seen a lot of people in these reviews talking about how "LeBron is the worst actor they've ever seen" and things like that. No, LeBron doesn't give an Oscar worthy performance in this movie. But, if you look back to the original, neither does Michael Jordan. It's not really about that, and to me, it's unfair to judge either of these movies based on the performances of James or Jordan.As a fan of the original, I will most likely be seeing this movie again. I'll put it bluntly. The story is uninteresting, the writing is mediocre at best, and the corporatism is so blatant that it's nauseating. It's not a good movie. There was more times I laughed because of something cringeworthy over something legitimately funny that happened in the movie. Would I say it was a bad experience? No. Even though many of the aspects of a good movie were missing, when you watch this movie, you can honestly tell how much fun LeBron, Don Cheadle, and co. Are having during the production. Don't take it too seriously, and you might find yourself enjoying the experience like I did.Just a few recommendations:A. Don't see this movie in theaters. Watch it at home with friends or people who enjoyed the original. Being able to poke fun at some of the cringeworthy moments really added to my experience.B. Keep at least five bottles of Pepto Bismol on standby, just in case the sheer amount of cheap nostalgia goes straight to your stomach.Bonus points for the "Big Chungus" joke. The meme is beyond dead, but I respect that you left it in there.4/10.

Review title: Doesn't take itself seriously, neither should you.
Review_body: This movie was meant to be just for fun, I don't understand everyone's big expectations or crushing reviews. We went back and watched the old Space Jam to show our 5 year old before watching this. She loved both of them. We saw this at a drive in and I was dreading it after reading the reviews. The acting sucks in both, because they're basketball players, not actors. We all got some good laughs in. The premise isn't supposed to make sense. Suspend disbelief, have good snacks on hand and just be silly and it'll be just fine.
