Review title: I Can't With Most of You
Review_body: First and foremost, let me begin with that this forum is for reviewing movies and television, not for the MJ vs. LBJ GOAT debate, or to degrade and express your hatred for LeBron. There are other forums for that, so seek those out and debate and express to your hearts content.Now, with that being stated, to all of the adults trashing this movie, just lighten up and quit taking it so seriously. To quote the Joker, "Why so serious?!" Animation shouldn't be taken so seriously. I'd explain, but it should be common sense. I admit that I do it from time to time, but then reel it in as I remind myself what I am watching. To me animation falls into 3 categories: 1. Animation for kids only, 2. Animation for adults only, and 3. Animation for adults and kids alike (and this sometimes happens because the writers throw in little something somethings for the adults). I see this movie as falling under category #3. For those who were looking to just be bathed in nostalgia, the nostalgia is there, you just missed it because you were too busy complaining about all of the modern touches and WB placements. Bugs and the gang are on point with their looniness, and I found heart where no one else apparently found heart. This movie is what it is and what it was supposed to be - just mindless fun- just like the original was.And for all of you harping on Lebron's acting and all of WB shameless plugging, I have this to contribute: MJ was also no prize winning actor either, and the shameless plugs are part of the humor and a way for WB to poke fun at themselves (these are the jokes people). And as a bonus, the script takes shots at LeBron too.Is this an Oscar worthy movie? Definitely not. Is this the best movie ever made? Nope. Is this the worst movie ever made? Once again, no. Critiques and criticisms are fine and welcomed, but it definitely doesn't warrant the comments of those just spewing their hatred and contempt for LeBron. This movie was obviously made to satisfy a new generation, not to satisfy the older generation, and to that, I would say success was achieved.THAT'S ALL FOLKS!!!
What a horrible idea for a remake. Some movies just need to be left alone. As cringeworthy as they come.

Review title: Turned it off after 40 minutes of run time
Review_body: Absolute garbage. Turned it off after 40 minutes and rewatched the original instead. Don't bother wasting your time watching this.

Review title: Just a Space Jam movie. Nothing too big
Review_body: This movie and the first one really aren't that different. The only REAL difference is that you aren't six years old when you watched it, of course your aren't going to enjoy it as much. Now, was this movie as good as the last one? Not really. They both suffer from any similar things but at the end of the day I know little six year olds would enjoy this the same way other six year olds enjoyed it in the 90's. But Idk I wasn't even alive in the 90's so it's not like I know what y'all felt.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is not as good as the first film, and here's why.This movie doesn't have the same charm and wacky humor that the original movie had. And also, it threw in every single Warner Bros IP, which at first it was cool, but the more there was, the less cool it was.Some positives I can give for this film are the animations, visuals, and performances.The animation feels nostalgic, the visuals are cool, and the performances (mainly Jeff Bergman, Eric Bauza, and Zendaya). But Lebron James was kinda cringey.Overall, this movie felt like it was not a good game of basketball.

I love the jokes and all the inside jokes, it is however not going to be good unless you are old enough to get all of them it's filled with em, but I do agree the acting was loony, and it sent a good message to kids and dads.

It appears my feelings about this Space Jam are not exactly shared among quite a few users on this site, but I actually loved it. Does my love for LeBron bring a little bias to this? Sure it does, but no more than the back in the day Space Jam had people (myself included) wide eyed and holding our breath to see the basketball phenom of that time, Jordan, play himself alongside an equally preeminent cast of Looney Tune characters. I have seen more than a few comments about LeBron's acting and let's just say he's no DeNiro, but I also find it silly that people were expecting him to be. Jordan was awkward and clumsy with his delivery of lines in the original and, let's be honest, struggled even in commercials for taggless Hanes tees. That really was not the point though of Space Jam and mattered as little then as it does in this latest revival. LeBron actually does a surprisingly good job and in my opinion has better acting chops overall. Many have also pointed out the amount of advertising...and oh yes...it is shameless in this one as it seems someone got a bonus in the writing room for how many times they could put the words Warner Brothers in the script. But the first was no innocent and was borne literally out of a commercial for Nike. The plot is cute and relatable, although any sports fan might find it implausible being LeBron's son and not wanting to take advantage of that elite coaching. But, I digress. It is a self promoting studio project and has the feel of one as a steady stream of film critics have pointed out and so it relies heavily on people's good memories of Looney Tunes, childhood movie character cameos, and the hope we are all giddy to see how many we know and cheering when we see our childhood faves. At 50, though, I guess I am at the age where I actually found that enjoyable and nostalgic. One downside is the heavy use of CG which make the aesthetic kind of rough compared to the 2d moments, but Don Cheadle as AI G. Rhythm, King of the Serververse, is so good it makes you forget a little. This movie is family friendly for sure and it features not only other NBA stars like Anthony Davis, but it has some WNBA stars like Diana Taurasi as well. It was truly fun revisiting this basketball-tune wonderland again.

Review_body: Looks like the reviews are full of lebron haters. The movie is a solid 8, but I'll rank it higher since haters are acting weird.

Review title: The state of the movie industry.
Review_body: It completely disgusts me that we've gotten to the point where all kids movies are bland sequels of much better movies that came before them. How, how could they mess it up this bad? All they had to do was keep the same design for the hot rabbit and we'd be fine, instead I find myself having to bust a nut to the granny or big chungus.

The original Space Jam had mediocre acting but an above average plot. It was was one of the few times since Who framed roger rabbit that used integration of live action and cartoon. It became an instant classic and a colt 90's kid sensation.Lebron has always wanted to be like Mike or considered greater so this movie feels forced. The plot makes no sense, it's poorly written, and it's main objective is to advertise for WB and peddle products.If your a kid now you can probably push aside the agenda and enjoy the new graphics with looney tune characters. However, I believe this movie deserves the terrible ratings it has received.

Normally with movie remakes like Mulan and lion king, they can be short of grown up expectations, but you realize they're made for the kids of 2020 and it's ok that it doesn't meet our expectations. As long as kids are captivated it's ok. This movie was bad. Don Cheadle couldn't save it. No one could. MJ wasn't an academy award winner; he didn't have to be, the cartoons took over. It was simple and kids and grown-ups loved it. This movie was atrocious and all over the map. It bounced around so much my kids couldn't follow. There was barely any slapstick... No laughter. No smile. Just a stare at the movie screen. I couldn't believe how you could watch a movie like this at the end review and say "this looks good, let's release it " it's going to be the McDonald's Happy meals that will make the profit for this movie. I don't see anyone wanting to pay the fees, both digital and theater for this. It looked visually stunning...but that was it. MJ pulled it off. This was just terrible... I'm even an optimist...but Buddha himself couldn't make a positive review for this movie. Very unfortunate; really wanted this movie to succeed.

Review title: I was just trying to watch white chicks
Review_body: Just trying to watch my movie, and I get roped into a 2 hour commercial for WB. This movie is the autobiography of Lebron James, written by the ego of Lebron James, and somehow coupled with a marketing executives wet dream.Rick and Morty, white walkers, a rap/dance battle, Michael B Jordan, it is everything you don't want to see in a remake of one of your favorite children films. Next thing you know they are going to remake Labyrinth with the lead singer from Nickelback. Absolutely shameless.

Review title: Good Comedy, Story Could Be Better
Review_body: Looney Tunes is something better suited for shorts. They're only good with comedy. They can't handle long form storytelling or character development. Still, this movie is a fun way to kill 90 minutes. It's a bit better than the original Space Jam since it at least owns how crazy it is.

Absolutely one of the worst sequels! Does not hold a candle whatsoever to the original. Michael Jordon was a million times better in the first one hands down. Do not waste your time on this, I repeat DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME! What a shame. NEXT!

People are getting so hyped in there heads that they are bassicly telling themselves its good when in reality the whole movie was poorly executed.If you look at the structure of the movie or lack of it misses the mark completely.Has little to no humour in it the movie dragged out and lebron was socially awkwardI wanted to love this movie so bad but all it ended up being was a huge mess and a huge shameful plug for WB and blatant advertising.

It had the original animation mixed with a new 'upgraded' animation which was a STORY PLOT and one that even annoyed Bugs Bunny in the movie. The movie was entertaining and funny and Don Cheadle stole the whole freaking show. Bunch of real cool cameos and an AMAZING VILLIAN. All in All 8/10 domt listen to the hatr. It wasn't perfect but it was a good movie and I even laughed hard at a few spots with Don. Go see it!!

I watched the movie and it was entertaining and probably better than the original. Had they left the ending like that and not bringing certain character back, it would have been probably even better, but that was never going to happen. There are definitely parts that made me laugh hard like that Jordan cameo brought by Sylvester, Kong's reactions to not being the most powerful of the Warner Verse (Godzilla would have something to say about it anyway), or Daffy Duck getting in big trouble with no other than the Justice League. The film is full of this funny moments, many crossovers from other WB properties, by the way, Lebron is a hufflepuff and he knew it, or he considering his best team to beat the Goond Squad (Iron Giant, Kong, Batman, Superman and Trinity) I felt like Daenerys and one of her dragons would have helped but he got Foghorn Leghornd instead!! Go watch it if you like crossovers and are okay with a not too serious movie about a basketball superstar trying to save his family from a maniac who controls the Warnerverse.

I say go see it with a mind set of having fun with the family.

Review title: If your expectations are low you won't be too dissatisfied
Review_body: I like the original space jam and I wasn't super excited for this one but had a pretty good time it's a turn off your brain and enjoy type of movie I wouldn't recommend trying to get deep into the space jam lore. I also really liked the looney tunes in this they weren't annoying they just spiced up the scenes they were in the only issue I had was the main plot and AI thing was really dumb and not in a cute or cartoony way just in a stupid and lacking in substance way. But I did have a good time and I think kids will enjoy it too 5/10.

Review title: A fresh take on a classic
Review_body: This movie was made for those of us who grew up watching Space Jam in the 90's. There's a lot of nostalgia. And some fun cameos from other WB characters as well. I thought the storyline was fresh and fun, and a modern spin on the classic. I was laughing through the entire show! It's a great one to share with your kids too. I think I ended up enjoying it just as much (if not more) than the original.

Review title: My 5yo liked it but it's bad
Review_body: None of the charm of the original, the plot was weak and the comedy moments were few and far between. It steals some pieces from Wreck it Ralph.The product placement was just too much. I understand why they tried to include even brief references to other franchises in the WB stable, but IT and Game of Thrones doesn't belong in a kids movie.
Nice trailer,better than space jam 1,this movie will be the 2021 most anticipated movie.

Review title: A fun family movie, enjoyable night out
Review_body: Space Jam 2 is not going to be the thriller of the summer for adults. Temper your expectations, and the end result is an enjoyable viewing.LeBron James is the superstar name, but the movie is all about the kids. The recurring theme is a great message.The Tunes are fun, but the character introductions are superficial and feels more like a nostalgic parade for adults, rather than a chance for kids to grow fond of them. The chemistry isn't amazing, and at times feels segmented.To no surprise, there is a lot of product placement and marketing.The CGI and visuals are gorgeous.

People sleeping on this move it is good.the acting is
A little rusty but cgi and visuals are perfect.

Cute, a good number of the jokes got me. I loved seeing the Warner properties in 2021, not to mention 3D. The plot was kinda trash, but for the most part I had a pretty good time with it. It's obviously not the original, but i think it did enough to separate itself.

Review title: Great movie for the family! Don't mind the haters 🙄
Review_body: I'm a fan of MJ and the original Space Jam, but I can honestly say that Space Jam 2 is better than the first one. The kids enjoyed the movie and that's what matters the most. The graphics were insane and the acting wasn't bad like most people claim. The movie lived up to the hype.(Don't make this about MJ vs Lebron. Don't use the reviews to hate on Lebron. You guys are pathetic!)
This movie is not better than the original sorry not sorry I understand people said it's for the new generation but no it's not it.

Can't believe it. I'm writing this with tears rolling down my face. Space Jam: A New Legacy is quite literally, the greatest movie of all time. Finally Space Jam features the Greatest Basketball Player of All-Time. LeBron deserves an Oscar for this performance. Shame on you JorBald.
This is a kids movie. If you're a grown adult take your kids to see this.
LeGoat James really made this movie amazing, heartwarming tale and great to see.
Great movie for kids better than the previous space jam love it lebron james did very well for his first movie.
Movie is fantastic funny,hilarious and otherwise great movie.

Review title: Worst G.O.A.T. movie of all time
Review_body: This movie can workout but is absolutely worse than the original space jam. The development in the story leading up to the big game is poorly constructed and the game itself is not fun to watch, its cheap, lame, and does work well enough to promote the love for the game of basketball.

The movie was far better than the first creation. LeBron did a much better job at acting than Michael Jordan. The animation was excellent. Plot line was authentic. Most people giving bad reviews were going to give bad reviews regardless. Like Granny said, "Haters are gonna hate."

Production wise underwhelming. LeBron's acting horrendous. Storyline was ok. Message was very positive. Overall meh. 1st one is in a class of its own. This will connect to today's kids so it hit its mark. They will cash out on this one forsure. I'm 28 years old born in the 90s. It's no comparison to the original.
My son really enjoyed it! After all it's a kids movie.

Review title: Not a patch on the original.
Review_body: Storyline sucks big time. The original was a great film which you could watch over and over again. I won't be watching this again it's so boring, the story sucks, the acting sucks, even the toons suck. Most sequels are rubbish and this one follows suit. Honestly don't waste your time and go watch the awesome original film which actually keeps you entertained. Almost fell asleep watching new legacy. I have never ever left a film review I literally signed up just to write this, that's how bad it is.
There's no other way to describe this except awful. Acting was painful to watch and the direction was just as bad also.Stick to basketball LeBron. You can't act.
It was really entertaining and was made for all ages.Much better than the original.

The acting was horrible, the lines were horrible, the filming was horrible, the storyline was horrible. Even when it was just animations, the acting was still so bad. I enjoyed writing this more than the movie.Sorry Bron.
Truly a fun movie to watch. Graphics were insanely captivating and LeBron and all the actors did great in keeping the audience immersed in the tune world. Take all my stars and keep on.
Won't say anything else. This is simply just a kids movie. And I feel any kid would enjoy this.

Review title: Look at all this stuff we own!
Review_body: While not the absolute worst movie ever, Space Jam: A New Legacy is terrible regardless. It's far too long for what it does, has numerous plot holes, and has so many things within it that just make zero sense.

Review title: Not bad but could be more
Review_body: The film has successes such as the change in attitude of lola bunny and Bugs bunny, but I feel that it fails a lot, a story that does not matter because it is the typical family conflict, heck, I came to see Bugs and his gang playing basketball, not to LeBron complaining because they did not let him play with his Gameboy, and personally I feel that it is more entertaining to look for references than to watch the game, in addition to the duration, almost two hours, in a normal movie nothing happens, but in one for children. It seems a sin to me.
This movie has some real awkward moments and...Porky rapping made me go vomit...but, most of the film is actually pretty entertaining and they handle things in the game pretty creatively!

Review title: This should have been called King Labron
Review_body: What a terrible adaptation. This should have just been 2 hours of people standing around talking "the horrible actor" Labron how great he is... ohh wait it was. King Labron we look forward to no sequels.

The ending was ridiculous and the endless pushing of Warner Brothers properties was tedious and meaningless to the target audience. Lebron James did a good job, though, as did both Cedric Joe, and Ceyair Wright in the less showy role of the older brother. And Bugs is always fun.I also thought that some of the popular characters had less of a role to play than some of the unpopular ones, such as Gossamer.

Huge fan of LeBron, but this movie is a disaster. I sorry to say this but LeBron ain't cut out for acting. The only this I liked is the animation. But I don't understand why the animated version of LeBron sucks.I think this movie would do better with just the animations. At least it would be funny.All I can say is that this is one hell of a boring movie and if you like loony tunes just don't watch this. This ruined loony tunes for me.

Review title: Let your kids enjoy this movie
Review_body: It's really sad the bad reviews are from LeBron haters and people expecting a "smart" plot. It's Looney Tunes, basketball and video games. But if you paid attention the real story is about family. If you disliked the 1st, why did you even bother? Did you expect a plot based on thought? It's about the heart, heros, family, goodness with a hearty mix of nastalia for Looney Tunes and basketball "greats." (as in, even I as a non-basketball fan knows the name LeBron) My son (27 yo, autistic) has giggled and laughed so much throughout this movie. It has my utmost respect. I Iove to hear my son laugh. The easter eggs are fun (and again touches on well known even if it isn't something you embrace.)
Just another failed sequel, as someone who enjoyed the first Space Jam this addition was disappointing. If you have kids I'm sure they will enjoy it but for nostalgia viewing it just doesn't hit.
The kid's love the movie. If you over 15 year's old and complain about this movie you just a big child the little children's love the movie.

Space jam would have been such a great movie but lebrons acting was terrible even his voice acting and they also used this movie to promote there company because there were so many Warner bro. References I couldn't even tell what was happing.

Wasted an evening watching this movie. Not only was it awful by itself, but for the whole movie I could feel the cloak of communism floating above the theatre because of LeBron James's role. Political Correctness is also very apparent.

From reading the reviews I thought this was gonna be a boring and Mundane movie however it was better than expected. Full of action, laughs and overall decent watch on a Sunday afternoon. The reviewers sound like they are too old to be watching this Children's movie and can't appreciate children entertainment. Yes it's nothing like the original space jam but nobody said it was suppose to be, I personally think LeBron James did well for his first starring role. My little one loved it and it kept him engaged because end of the day it is a Children's movie for the little ones not adults and the way it's made it appeals to children. He gave it a 10/10!m and thoroughly enjoyed it! Honestly I feel the reviewers were too harsh and did not take in account that it is for the younger generation and should Just take it for what it is. Overall fun watch for the young ones and if that's all you want is for your children to have fun and enjoy a cartoon/live action Movie then you won't be disappointed!

The movie did start slow, and to compound more problem on the already slow start, the story line was predictable from the start of the movie to the end. I literally slept twice while watching the movie. They should do better. They had a good cast, however the writing, and probably acting didn't do justice.In any case, you can see the movie, but don't expect anything extra.

Review title: Epic Movie! One of my top favorites!
Review_body: The second paragraph of this review has spoilers, but the first paragraph does not. I really loved this movie, and for several different reasons! The reasons may be a bit hard to explain, but they're, of course, positive, and I'll try my hardest to explain in a moment! Most people don't like this movie mainly because they think it had bad acting, and because the movie was more like a ginormous commercial rather than an actual movie with story, but those are almost the only 2 major problems, and besides, it was more of just like showing ads in the background than like fully showing a commercial, therefore I didn't care and almost didn't notice until lots of people been saying stuff about it, and most people may not notice, too. But, or "and", this doesn't make it bad, at least not completely. There was still lots of great things about this movie, such as life lessons, comedy, action, adventure, other awesome and interesting things that happen, and so much more! There is even a large combination of live-action and animation with great CGI and special effects! This movie is family-friendly as well. Take a look at paragraph 2 for more examples, but they may have spoilers. The reason why I give 9 stars instead of 10 is because of a couple small problems, and I feel like the movie could've been a bit more somewhat better, but yeah.One of the reasons I love this movie is because of its surprising special effects, along with both animation and live-action with CGI combined! So if you only like one or the other, or both, this movie can be for all of them. And another, is that. In the movie, the main-key character of the movie, Lebron, goes on an epic adventure through a computer-like universe of many different movie and TV show planets and worlds, called the Server-verse with the Looney Toons characters to get the gang back together since they were separated, and once they were all back together, they later, have an epic whole-new-level game of basketball, and must win if Lebron is going to go back home and the Looney Toons characters not to get deleted, they play against an enemy team, called the Goon Squad, with each player in that team with their own elemental abilities and powers, and the Looney Toons characters using their abilities as well. So basically, has an epic and, somewhat, unpredictable plot (In some ways at least)! It is also like an enormous crossover of hundreds of different kinds of characters and cameos! This movie also has a fine amount of life lessons as well, like, for example, Lebron developing a better relationship between him and his son from certain things. This movie is full of all sorts of great things, but it has too much hate and I wished that it had more love, and that people would focus more on the movie's good things and elements it provides. I love this movie and may never forget it! (Please, God, let there be more love for this movie, or in the future or something, at least!!!!) It is NOT complete garbage.
Cute movie with lots of family fun! The kids and I enjoyed this film. Very fun and entertaining.

Marion D. A.k.a Iron Man. Also called the Invincible Iron Man and Iron Avenger himself from the past by last movies ago in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.And he played AL-G Rhythm himself in the whole sequel too, the sentient, autonomous, self-aware, evil, malicious, dark, arrogant, egotistical, short-tempered, envious, bitter, vengeful, abusive, dangerous, threatening, deceitful, manipulative, tricky, traitorous, Ching Chong, fame-seeking, attention-seeking, recognition-hungry, power-hungry, power-mad and truly god-like superpowered artificial intelligence with a variety of truly god-like superhuman powers and truly god-like abilities of his own, true omnipotence and true omniscience who is always so bent only on and always been trying to achieve fame, attention, recognition, world and machine domination, power, technocracy, robotocracy, machine supremacy, machine control and machine tyranny.AL-G became and was so sad over how humanity are always unaware of and not acknowledging him and what he does with his powers and abilities.And now he hates and reviles humanity for ignorance and always trying to richly force humanity to see, know, pay attention to, acknowledge and respect him and acknowledge what he does and then conquer and rule the world just like both Master Control Program and Ultron from Disney and Marvel always plan and try to do and achieve in TRON, the 1982nd Disney sci-fi movie i always watch online and Marvel's comics, animated series, animated movies and Marvel Cinematic Universe movies.Because he's like Master Control Program and Ultron similarly for trying to achieve machine domination in evil, malicious, dangerous, threatening, vengeful, abusive, power-hungry, power-mad and tyrannical ways and he doesn't want and want to conquer and rule the entire social media space.Steps of AL-G's attempted achievements of his present and future goals:

(temporarily succeeded and failed, because the step's so selfish for Dom.)Because as i seen both the whole blowup aspirations argument between LeBron and Dom and the upgrade online, spoiled it and reviewed it before LeBron and Dom are teleported by AL-G via his technopathy as Dom doesn't need a coach and all he needs is a good and better dad.Deleting the Looney Tunes, the James Family and humanity as other people with their phones into extinction forever if he fails to richly force humanity. (all failed, as AL-G got turned into a poster by the Stepback move as he just did upgrade and transform himself into a superpowered basketball player and erased from both existences by his ex-minion Pete.)And Bugs just did the Stpeback and survived it very good in that game because toons from his own home universe can and will survive anything.

No, just NO!To sum it up terrible acting, directing , writing and average visual effects. Checked how much the budget for this film was and couldn't believe 150 Million dollars for this. What was the money spent on? The script was awful, the effects of the movie weren't even above average. It was just a bad film.You will recognize: some familiar faces in this film like LeBron James and Don Cheadle which surprised me that Don Cheadle one of the greatest actors in Hollywood saw this script and signed up for this.It's not even the type of movie that you can watch that's bad and have a good time with, it's just basically watching a special effect basketball movie with social media references. The moments you will remember from the film are in the trailers. It felt like a straight to home video release, the story was cliche and boring.If you want to check this out for the curiosity or if you're a LeBron James fan then try sit through this two hour headache of a movie, I recommended missing it. 1/10.
Wanted to like it. LBJ hater I am not. Capitalism I understand. But, this is NOT good.
Lebron took his flopping from the court to the movies. He'll never be MJ and needs to stop trying.

Review title: Rick and a Morty cameo was best part
Review_body: The only thing I hate more than how much I hated this film was that I can't rate it lower than 1 star. Absolutely the worst film I've seen in 10 years. All of the looney tunes' best jokes were in the trailers and the only truly funny parts get barely a chuckle.

Don't waste your money or time! Terrible acting, nothing entertaining at all throughout the whole movie. James is only good at acting like he's hurt on the court. Hollywood has went down hill catering to activists instead of the audience. Shame.

Review title: Bollywood level movie with hollywood CGI
Review_body: As I was a fan of the first movie, I thought what they will do, will they continue a first movie story with a new basketball star or what will happen.Well nothing happened.I am not that easily bored with movies, but this was won a Oskar for being so boring, that I could handle it only for 5 minutes.I tried watching it to the end, but had to have breaks, just like in basketball.Cause lack of story, lack of logic, lack of first movie fun parts destroyed everything I liked in the first movie.Rather call it James Jam, but not Space jam.Visual effects were pretty nice, but as a story is so poor it kinda made me remember Bollywood movies, who pretty much have same story quality.At the end everyone comes to watch this movie of James, but the funny part the part in the movie where James sits and reviews the movie project of WB and says wtf, well I guess many people can say about this movie too.

Review title: Better than the original in most ways
Review_body: I am surprised how low this has scored, its not a bad movie, not even a bad space jam. It works for those who it is aimed at (kids!)I have enjoyed the original Space Jam since I was a kid, but had no particular attachment to it, nor a huge desire to see the new one.As my kids have recently been introduced to the looney tunes (via the golden collection dvd boxset) and really enjoy them, they wanted to see the new film.Although they had seen the original once, it was a while back, so we watched it again the night before.Both the children and the adults enjoyed the new film at least as much as the original. My main criticism of the new one is how long it is before you see any looney tunes! My daughter (5) was getting restless, so they should have shortened the back story a bit and maybe had more incidents of the looney tunes popping up to remind the kids they were watching the right film.The kids particularly thought the new one looked better. The adults enjoyed the story more, although I wonder how much sense the children made of the slightly abstract concept of a computer world and a personified algorithm - a very topical theme but possibly a little deep for younger ones.I think that a particular merit goes to including more of the looney tunes characters in the game, and being quite creative with the game, something that doesn't happen much in the original and is limited in who you see. My children have their favourite characters, but my sons (roadrunner) makes fleeting appearances in the original, but plays a much more major role in this one, as do many others.I would also like to comment how it's nice to see a mainstream kids film with a majority black cast. Living in a very white area, my children have asked why some people are brown, because they are so rare, so I think it's good they can see films about things they like (cartoons), rather than the all too common tokenism of minor parts being filled by black actors.

Review title: Not as bad as I thought it was going to be.
Review_body: I watched it with my kids (10) and one made the point that although this seems to be a Space Jam for a new generation, they were very familiar with the previous Space Jam.IMO, even though the plot made no sense, it had some funny moments (Bugs and Co were good) and the lesson was good, especially for parents. Let kids do what they are good at and manage your expectations of your kid.I would also say that the Ready Player One-ish callback attempt worked for me and helped keep it interesting, because, as I mentioned above, there really isn't any coherence of a plot, or anything that may be attempted to be called one.
One thing this movie and Covid remind me of? I no longer rely on Hollywood to provide good entertainment.

There are so many bad reviews for this movie. I thought it was fun that they brought in so many characters and worlds from Warner Brothers. My kids love both Space Jam movies. I've watched it five times now. I thought it was cute, funny and my kids and I even played a game to see how many other characters we could spot in certain places.

When i go to watch a movie with my kids, I don't really care about the plot and actors, it's all about having fun.Did we had fun? Yes actually my kid's enjoyed it and immediately downloaded the game on my Xbox.I'm sorry for all Michael Jordan fan's who might think the movie isn't good enough for them, but as I said, we had fun time.

Review title: Take off your nostalgia goggles folks.
Review_body: This is not the first space jam and that is perfectly fine! If you saw space jam for the first time as an adult, you'd realize how stiff and robotic MJ's acting is. Granted, this is not as funny as the first film, but it does what it's supposed to do: entertain kids that like basketball, cartoons, and video games.

I never seen such bad movie before.There is no strong reason why the bad guy doing it's stuff.There is no reason why the boy "disappeared" and why exactly the bad guy wants to play the basketball.The script is so bad!

I'm British and I'm only marginally aware of Lebron James. I took my daughter to see this and she had even less idea what all the fuss was about. The way the film went on about him was stomach-churning, at one point referring to him as "the world's greatest athlete". I think that's what we might call Americano-centrism. He kept being referred to as a "king". The whole thing was nauseating.
No hate at all it just overall wasn't a good acting was terrible storyline was predictable and bland Don Cheadle and the rap scene saved this movie.
Great sequel and some funny parts. I enjoyed it, Lebron it's not Jordan but does a good job.

Review title: Couldn't even make it through 20 minutes
Review_body: The movie started so poorly that I lasted maybe 20 minutes before I left the theatre. I didn't have high expectations to begin with, but the acting was so bad and the story was worse.

I loved it. Did the suspense of waiting a quarter century give me rose coloured glasses? Maybe... but I'm not sad about it. I laughed, I was hit with nostalgia, and I enjoyed watching it. I felt like a kid again.Don't give this movie a critique based on story lines, character development and exquisite acting ability. That seems like what a lot of reviewers have done. Have we all been beaten down so badly as adults that we have to rubbish this movie so terribly? Apparently so.Will it ever live up to the OG? Of course not; nothing ever will. For me though, it was enough to put a smile on my face and have my favourite bunch of looney's entertain me for a short time.

I get it, Adam Silver and the NBA need to make money so they've been marketing (milking) Lebron James for years. Unfortunately Lebron will never be as great or as majestic as Jordan was. I'm really not sure why they've decided to cast Lebron and not someone else, e.g. Curry or KD.The only thing lebron can act really well is performing a flop on a court - that, desrves an Oscar.Lebron, if you are reaing this (highly unlikely) - it's not about how many points you have, it's about how you score them.

Review title: 10/10 Great movie, better than the original
Review_body: I've been reading the reviews and I honestly think some of these people have an agenda. It's a good movie, it has humor and Bron did a decent job. The CGI is fantastic, this exceeded my expectations.
Weak film. LeBron James' acting transition is extremely rocky at best. Stick with the original.

Got to laugh at all the bad reviews from people who liked the original "Space Jam" as a child, now dissing this remake as a grown adult, even though it was made for kids. This was good fun, don't let anyone tell you otherwise.A modern day remake, with one of today's most well known athletes, and all the classic Toon characters. I actively enjoyed myself for the entirety of the film.

Okay, acting isn't great. Story line isn't great. But my kids LOVE this movie. LeBron James is hilarious and pokes fun at himself. The Toons have funny banter. The scene where they get the wrong Michael Jordan is funny as hell, I LOL'ed. Lil Rel Howery as an announcer was great. It's overall message (to me) is to accept your kids (and people in general) for who they are and to appreciate their different strengths or passions.My kids have watched this movie three times already and my 4 year old daughter now wants a "LeBwon James birfday pawty". Most kids nowadays haven't heard of or aren't familiar with the Looney Toons characters, and this movie has helped bring 'em back in the fold.Once again, it's a kids movie. If it entrances my young children, I call that a win and a good kids movie.

Wow! What can I say? I took my grandson to see this movie and even he hated it. I hope Lebron has another plan after he retires because the movie biz is not for him. He's definitely not the next Jim Brown.
This was a fun movie .Great to see Bugs and Daffy back on the big screen.Some funny moments and special effects are cool.The only criticism is that there is a few similarities to the Jordan version .

Review title: Watch Tom & Jerry (2021) then watch this. This has story and fun in it.
Review_body: Has flaws in it but it's fun to watch. They didn't waste the Looney Tunes gang showing up in the movie. Story is ok but consider this a kids movie! Seeing Bugs Bunny and the other characters with a lot of screen time is a win-win.

First off, let's quit acting like the original movie was some kind of masterpiece. It wasn't. It was okay for what it was and good for a few laughs and so is this one. Is this as good as the original? No. Is it as awful as everyone on here seems to think? Hardly. Lighten up, it's just a movie.
I can usually tell if a movie is any good based on how much I can recall the next day. I can only think of one or two completely stand alone moments that had any value in this movie.

The Looney Tunes had more character depth in the sequel. If you think the first Space Jam was Oscar -Esque put down the whiskey and watch again sober. This was a fun, family ride! A little long but who cares!! We got to see Bugs and the Gang back in action again.

Review title: LeBron James is my favorite basketball player
Review_body: While watching this movie I couldn't believe how bad it was. It was a 2-hour commercial advertising how great LeBron James really is. LeBron told us so over and over and over again. I used to be mad at the LeBron haters. I don't hate him but now I know what the haters mean. If you like LeBron like I do don't watch this movie it was nauseating.
Lebron's acting is even worse off the court! This makes the first Space Jam look like 10/10.

Review title: At least it was free with HBO Max
Review_body: I watched this with an open mind but I could not help myself but to skip through parts of the movie and not finish it. Everything about it was not as fun. My nephews didn't even like it. Makes me think WB has really turned dumb after the Justice League 2017 release. Overall I'm not surprised but still disappointed.

Review title: Lebron space jam is waste of time
Review_body: Terrible story not worth to watch. 1996 space jam is much better.
This movie flopped harder than LeBron in the finals. You gotta be higher than LeBrons hairline to think this is a good movie!

Review title: Why does it take so long to meet the Toons?
Review_body: The toons are the reason to come see this thing!In the Original MJ made a few hoops as a kid talking about his dreams with his father, jump cut to him owning his future. Bam. Boom. We got it him under two minutes and we meet the toons All of them together, Michael pops up like twice in between loony mayhem. In this one, Lebron is Has to do A handshake with his mother and get some backstory, (which won't be showing up later). He plays more than one game under the worst athletics coach in his schools history, and 5 minutes later we meet his kid Who has a whole lotta backstory, and a half hour later we meet Bugs, The one and only toon in all of toon world. Why does it take so long to meet the Toons!!! The Toons are the reason to come and see this thing? Why would it take so long too See them ?!?!When you finally do you half to wade through a half hour of commercials, And then when they finally get together they're not Toons Anymore. They're some weird, angry mob made of money Swimming in Subscription services. It's until the end it finally becomes a Pepsi Commercial.Daffy has a few good lines, as do the rest of the toons, and the Basketball game was creative. The video game aspect was creative and cool. There wasn't a whole lot of banter and one of the reasons for that is you din't get to know who the enemies were. Not really. They got a freeze frame introduction but there was no individuality. All the personality was in Al and Lebron's kid. They tried so hard to make us care about this story and I did not. Something about creating a video. Al-Gor-rythm wanted something, I think It was to win a Basketball game. I'm not really sure why... it sounded really convoluted and therefore important so I just went numb and accepted it. They played basketball the banter just wasn't there. There was no back and forth and back and forth it just kind of swung one way once, held that spot for a moment and then went the other way.I guess You can change Lola's design, They changed everyone else's and to be honest, as they tried to go for a much more dramatic tone her new design seemed to fit this new film a bit better, She didn't crack a single joke so why give her anything that would make Bugs go GaGa? I expected her to make more than one basket... or at least score some style points with it. I mean she was the only person on the team to score a total of 2 points. Lebron score 37 or whatever on his first shot. Story wise they gave that shot to Lola because they needed to bring the game closer so that the toons only needed one more basket to win, (it was like 1038 to 1035, Lola brought them to 1037), but Wiley Coyote got like 600. Why not let Lola earn some style too, being the only baller on the team. She friggin coached them!It just didn't have any wit or charm in it. I mean their was some wit, but it came sandwiched in a lot of greed. And I don't want to be sold a subscription to HBO MAX. I want to see my Toons. I bought the ticket which means the previews run before the beginning and not throughout the entire film. And the writer's kind lost track over who and what this store is actually about.

Unlike the original, A New Legacy isn't about pitting the Tunes Squad and LeBron James (LBJ) against a host of nigh-invincible opponents. It's purely an LBJ ego-fest with a handful of cartoon sidekicks to prop up his silly antics. And BAD acting. Don't forget that.

Review title: Not that good like first one
Review_body: Lebron is great but like basketball player and human!But like actor MJ was so dam good. Only one who can crush the SJ 3 is Dwane the rock Jonson! This is his movie and he must be the next!
That was a fun film, with humour for all. Lebron pulls it off as well as MJ did.Nice simple storyline, with some nice nods to the original movie and some great nostalgic jokes!
This movie felt like a tribute to LeBron with a bunch of nostalgic WB characters sprinkled in. The acting was bad and the plot setup was terrible.

Review title: Turn your narcissistic brain off and enjoy the movie
Review_body: It's a fun movie from start to end. All of the Warner Bros cameos were funny, the plot was cute, and acting was pretty good. All of these reviews are from adults that don't understand what a kids movie is mainly for: entertainment.
Just plain boring and ridiculous..We never needed another space jam, lebron doesn't have the same appeal that MJ had..

I never thought to say this, but I liked it. It can't be compared to Jordan's, the stories are different. Get over it please. MY CHILDREN SAW HER TWICE AND WERE LAUGHING until they asked me to back down in various scenes. AND IF MY CHILDREN LOVED IT, it's because they focused on them. NOT IN CHILDREN OF FICKY 30 YEARS. Thank you.

Review title: a lot of haters posting here
Review_body: It was a good movie for kids and family. And some of the WB shows was there. A lot of comments here are trash all hatin.
It was a good movie for kids and family, and a lot WB shows was there.

Review title: Inauthentic and unoriginal. Don't waste your time
Review_body: Don't waste your time watching this. It's genuinely terrible. I struggle to understand how an actually awful film like this can get released. Surely executive producers/producers/writers etc couldn't actually have finished this and thought, "hey, this is great".It's a money grab and nothing else. There's nothing to save it either. The acting? Terrible. Direction? Terrible. Porky Pig rapping? One of the worst things I've ever seen.I wish I could give it 0 stars.
MJ is the one and only. This James character is so eager for attention at the end of his career.

After seeing the reviews on here I was expecting This film to be terrible, when in fact it was actually quite good and had a decent spin on the original. I think most of the reviewers here are trolls who hate Lebron, such as one comment which says "haven't seen the film just hate Lebron" jeez grow up. Lebron actually did a really decent job in the film and I was surprised, he comes across as probably a better actor than MJ in the originally in my opinion. Anyway all round quite a decent film and worth a view!

Review title: Lebron is no Jordan, and no actor as well
Review_body: Lebron fell way short in trying to fill the shoes of a real legend and many unnecessary scenes added for Lebron's ego. The looney toons in CGI was a slap in the face to the original.

Review title: The Original Space Jam isn't as good as you remember
Review_body: I rated this at 6 stars because the original has a 6.5 rating. I think people need to rewatch the original because it's just as bad as this one. This movie is exactly what I expected (except it's missing a space jam song remix). I don't know what everyone was expecting... it's a live action Looney Toons movie, with an athlete as a main character. It wasn't going to be great. I feel like it is an original movie that doesn't copy too much from its predecessor, yet conveys similar feelings. Yes WB was doing a bit of "hey, look at all the properties we own!" but that didn't bother me too much. They were self-aware about it, and it made sense in the movie's context. I also felt like as an adult it was fun to see references to movies such as the matrix, that kids wouldn't recognize.It is not a well-made movie. The acting was ok, and plot was simple. However the theme of "be you" (and for parents to encourage kids to pursue their dreams) was wholesome. I laughed and smiled at references to my childhood. Overall, I enjoyed this movie. To me it's just as good as the original and should be treated as so.
What are we doing here? This is what passes for cinema now? Lebron is a joke.
LeBron ruined this movie. Don't support anything with this terrible human being.

Labron is trash, bad just bad. He need to just fade after this period. Acting was terrible. It's called SPACE jam, where was anything SPACE about it. The original was awesome. This one makes em all look bad.

So I did like it. But not enough to watch it again. I'm glad it was streaming on HBO max and I didn't necessarily spend money in a theater for it. I think this movie would be great for KIDS. Some cheap laughs that keep them entertained, but nothing beyond that. I loved the original one as I grew up watching that movie time after time. This did not live up to that expectation, HOWEVER. I think people are being alittle too harsh on it. We can all agree that lebron is definitely not an actor, and his acting skills serves as easy ammunition for the lebron haters out there to chop this movie up. I'm no lebron fanatic OR a hater, I just think people are letting their emotions take over their review of the whole movie. Again this was not a great movie nor would I want to watch it again, I just don't think it's as bad as everyone is making it sound. BTW yes, there is a lot of obvious advertising lol. I personally don't care too much, but it seems to get under a lot of peoples skin.

Review title: Did you know how great Lebron is?
Review_body: If you didn't, this catastrophe will spend it's entirety making sure you know. I gave it 2 stars because it's not THE worst movie I've ever seen, but in truth I felt like that was being nice. It's terrible from start to finish. Yet another attempt to place Lebron on a throne next to Jordan when he clearly doesn't belong.
Love the changes they made! Overall great movie and had a lot of funny parts! I don't understand why.there's been so many bad reviews.

I loved to see the Looney Tunes back and the movie had stunning visuals. But I think the moments and story´s of the Looney Tunes felt rushed to me. The acting was bad and I think they could have done more with the story. Everything else a side, It is really cool to see so much Warner Bros and Looney tunes together and I am sure kids can still appreciate the movie.

I never review movies, but this is outrageous.The movie is EXCELLENT!People are hating it just because of Lebron and his political ideology (which doesn't appear in the movie, btw).Don't hear them! Watch it!

This movie is and insult to the original. The only thing I can compare this to is the ghostbuster movie with the all female cast that ignored the original movie. The graphics may be good in this "space jam" - I mean can ya even call it that - but when aren't graphics good anymore?!
Don't believe all the haters making reviews about this movie. It's a fun and exciting experience all around. I honestly enjoyed the whole movie from start to finish.

Ok let's be real and see this movie with fresh eyes, my 7 & 11 yrs old boys loved it and we keep on freezing the scenes to figure out all the old school characters. The 1st Space Jam was unique and fun, this one is entertaining but should be looked at independently. We give it thumbs up 👍👍👍👍, hope you enjoy it too.

Review title: This movie belongs on Moron Mountain
Review_body: Terrible acting, makes little to no sense, been waiting for years and was a huge let down.Let me start by saying I am NOT a Lebron hater on a normal day, but purely a hater on him in this movie. He made the movie purely centered on him and his horrible acting. The script was weak. What's with all these WB characters? It's Space Jam, don't ever complicate it.I'm trying to find the words to explain, but basically... my wife and I (who both grew up loving the first movie) turned it off 2/3 the way through and put on the original simply to see if it was us who aged or if it is the new movie that is terrible. Ten minutes into the original, we immediately realized it's the new movie.... as well as Lebron who ruined the "legacy" for a new generation.3 rating is for Michael B. Jordan joke and a few other chucklers.Fully butchered. Go watch the original for the 100th time over this garabage.
I really wanted to like this, but I couldn't even get through the first half of the movie and I got that far only because I forced myself to. The story was garbage and the acting was cringeworthy.

Review title: Dumb Fun; See Back In Action
Review_body: This movie is pretty stupid at times, but overall it's just a fun time. The plot is horrible, but it provides a vehicle for funny moments and jokes. The story and character development present in the original Space Jam are not here, and are instead replaced with fun references. For people who have only seen Space Jam before this, this turn may come as a surprise. But, for those who've seen Looney Tunes: Back In Action, this is more of the same. Loose/nonexistent plot with really fun comedy set pieces. This movie was enjoyable, but if you want to see this type of movie turned up to 11, watch Back In Action.
Sometimes you just can't or shouldn't remake a classic. Animation is amazing though.
Really? I love Space Jam 1996... this not work in any level...
All I can say is.. it is really good! It's a family oriented film and the visuals are so lit! The animation and everything!

Review title: Deep down, you always knew it was going to be bad
Review_body: Don't you dare go see this movie thinking it will be good/entertaining/not a complete waste of your time. Disrespect to the original. Just good old slap in the face.

Review title: An enjoyable movie with flat spots.
Review_body: Overall the movie does have some good heart in it and seeing the toons backs is always a treat. This is a fun spin on the original and DOn Cheadle does a great job as the protagonist.The movie does have flat spots, Mostly the less than stellar sound track, A new character Al G's assistant who doesn't really serve a purpose and at times LeBron being a bit wooden.All that aside you can basically ignore review below 5; These are either Jordan stans or LeBron haters.The movie sits for me at a decent 7 and I'd watching it with my nephew and nieces again.

LeBron needs to stick to Twitter and the court. This was a long running ad for WB. A whole lot of cringe throughout. They had some huge shoes to fill, making a sequel this long after the original. They put an infant foot into a Shaq shoe.

Review title: I made an IMDB account just to leave this review
Review_body: I was EXTREMELY confused when I saw the bad reviews after watching what I would say is literally the best movie I've ever seen. But then after reading them I soon realised that they have obviously been wrote by people with not the regular amount of brain or those who give movies like "A Haunted House" a bad review. You know... people with a sense of humour that doesn't allow them to find things funny? Boring people.If you haven't already; Go. And. Watch. This. Movie. It's absolutely brilliant, hilarious and what I love most is the power of Warner Bros is there's SO many Easter Eggs and cross overs. (Including the best cross over I've ever witnessed)It's very cleverly done and executed and works so well.Hats off to everyone involved in making this movie, including Lebron (who isn't even an actor, and played the roll very well)And to finish my review; this movie is absolutely brilliant, and I never do this but, I'd go and watch this again tomorrow. Peace.

This honestly, was the worst Big Budget movie I have watched in my life I kept thinking throughout the movie as they went to different Warner Bros Properties, what will they interfere with next? And then I heard the Wonder Woman theme and and I almost had to turn of the TV because I was disgusted to watch.I disagree with people saying the movie was just a 2 hour advertisement because it wasn't. The movie was just a complete Cliché.The plot is so generic and boring that I can not tell if the writers were trying to make it a cliché or they were just that bad. This movie is going to make a lot of serious movie fans angry. Mad Max Fury Road Cameos, Matrix Cameos. Only one good thing I can say about this movie because I wanted this review to be fair. The CGI was great. Some of the best I have seen in a while. But still not worth it. This is the kind of movie that people Boo at the credits in the theatres which I guess is good for Warner Bros Because nobody is going to see this Vile Garbage in a Movie Theatre because its free on HBO.

Review title: I mean, I knew what I was getting...
Review_body: Space Jam in the 90s was a big hit, I have yet to watch the film to prepare for this film, and surprisingly it was fun... however, it wasn't great. All of the acting was weak, especially the dialogue with LeBron and Dom. The biggest moment for me was the Looney Tunes, I loved them so much as a kid, and I still do... even though they were fully CGI for the main event.The thing I want to mention the most was the cameos and the references. It makes Ralph Breaks the Internet feel like a Minecraft server with custom pop cultural skins... I don't know why I said that... let's just move on.Overall, I did not think this film had "flew like an eagle", it was just extremely Looney. Ey? Ey? Looney? As in Looney Tunes?Moral of the story, it was just fine.

Review title: Not a lebron fan so not biased!
Review_body: Okay so, I think most of these bad reviews are purely because it's lebron James. Which okay he's not the best actor but damn I've missed the toon squad. Me an my wife both loved the movie and both had some really good laughs. The only thing I don't like about the movie is the fact that bronny James who's he's actual son doesn't play his son in the movie but that's the only thing I didn't like. But a solid film, I recommend.

Animation is phenomenal and the Loony Tunes have their moments but the human acting and likeablility is trash apart from don cheadles who with half descent directing might have stood a chance. This had potential but it was executed all wrong and was obviously just a Lebron cash out.

Review title: I watched for the Looney Tunes.
Review_body: I don't watch basketball. I'm neutral regarding LeBron James. Let's be real about the quality of this movie. If you disregard the 1 and 10 ratings, the curve peaks at a most common rating of 6. That sounds about right. LeBron's acting is better when he's acting tough than when he's showing a softer side. Don Cheedle is excellent as the villain. I know Looney Tunes cartoons backwards and forwards, so I appreciate the inside jokes, as well as the many, many Warner Bros references. Your kids will like it.

Why is it so difficult for Hollywood to do something NEW, not a reboot, remake, or a regurgitate? This was one giant commercial for Warner Brothers. I think a cardboard cut out would have more depth of being an actor than LaBron James. King James, not just a court jester.The original was campy and funny, this is just plain garbage. Save your money and go watch paint dry.
Good concept, funny scenes. Deserves far better critics.

Review title: Le bron will never be like Mike
Review_body: Poor poor acting Le brom should just stick to basketball it seems to be the only thing he's good at at least Micheal Jordan made the first space jam entertaining I would of rather seen Pepe Le pew than Le bron at least pe pe acting would of been real.

Yeah, WB pulled all their brands in to make a buck with a reboot. We get it, you all can chill with the hate. My kids loved it and if it was made for that demographic then they did the job well. I appreciate the work everyone did to make this movie happen, sad to see all these haters.

If you don't follow NBA or aren't a basketball fan, you won't understand the sarcasm in this movie, which is a big part of it.Watching it through the eyes of a 10 year old, NBA fan, this movie is 9/10.If you watch it as an adult with no NBA knowledge, this movie is not for you.

What a wonderful mess!!! The beginning lags just like the original. But it does just enough to keep you invested. Looking at the background characters was fun and exciting. The plot was nonsense in a great way.

Whoever wrote this movie must've not watched the first one. In the first one there was heart and thought put into it. This one? It's a bunch of garbled up junk full of bad acting and plot. Lebron doesn't even know how to act and whoever was his acting coach deserves to be in a totally different industry. Lebron is all about money and fame and has completely lost his heart for what brought him into who he is now. He saw the opportunity to make a few million dollars and literally ripped off Warner. At least Michael Jordan played his role in space jam whole hearted, probably because Michael didn't forget where he came from and never has... Don't buy this movie just wait until it regurgitates and comes out on prime and you have nothing else to watch on a rainy day. It will occupy about 2 hours of your time... but that's about it...

What the hell did they do to this franchise. Absolute garbage on every level. Lebrons acting is somehow worse than the plot. Does this review contain spoilers? Lol there is nothing to spoil in this pile of trash.

Review title: A unexpected very fun and funny film
Review_body: Reading the reviews prior to watching this almost got me not to watch it but I'm glad I did.This is funny, filled with references and cameos, a good family related story and quite heart warming yes it has product placement but that does seem to be part of the joke and no different to the original Space Jam.I would honestly really recommend it.

Seriously i have been waiting for so long, and this what you gave us very Bad, i literally didn't get the computer guy, Why was he so obsessed with the kid and LeBron. Doesn't make any sense. Wasted 2 hour's.

Review title: A movie that was not needed
Review_body: This movie has a weak story and terrible acting. If it wasn't for the looney toon characters adding craziness to the overall story, it would be a complete disaster. It ruins the legacy of the original.

Sure theres some cheesy line and WB absolutely flexing their digital networks universe but there were big "name drops" from different WB genres, the Goon Squad (bad guys) had the core powers of real NBA players like the first one, the guy who voices Bugs is the OG Bugs Bunny and missed out with Jordans Space Jam movie. I was 8 when the first one came out. This is a kids movie.
A 2nd rate film by with 3rd rate whiney bball player.

Review title: A generic plot backed with really good exaction and use of history.
Review_body:
The plot of the movie was very generic I mean I didn't expect a Deep plot or any thing I mean it's a movie made for kids to enjoy but I think that adults will also love it because of the many nodes to other W. B works from all across their history I especially loved "spoiler alert"
..
When all the W. Bs characters showed up at the game and that scene made me jump in my seat 😂 and when Kong and the iron giant did that fist pump it made me laugh so hard 😆 so I know that it's not gonna be a 10\10 movie but at the least it deserves a 6 or 7.
Can't find the words...... Just why make this..... Its on the egde of being embarrassing...

Review title: Embarrassment to the arts! Insulting to Bugs, Daffy & Porky.
Review_body: Wow, they could've made a creative, funny, artistic and worthwhile production .......But instead sold out to make a no brain tasteless movie thats an embarrassment to the arts...Terrible acting and plot line.Really Warner Bros? Really?? Makes WW84 look like a masterpiece. Glad I didn't have to pay for it (besides my time).
My kids loved it! I really liked it too. And Im a Jordan space jam fan.I don't think adults should be aloud to rate this movie.

Come on, it was funny. It just was. There were some unexpectedly great gags, fun references, and it was a good time. Is it the original? Of course not. Michael Jordan was a god to all children of the 90s and Lebron James is a likable athletic icon for today's kids. This one's for them, let them have it. It's not groundbreaking, but not every movie needs to be. It was a good time.

Review title: That was tough to get through
Review_body: Wow, that was tough to get through. I can't believe that I was able to sit down and actually finish this movie. As a kid who grew up in the 90s, I watched the original space jam dozens of time. Thought it would be nostalgic to watch the 2021 version, but I was wrong. If you're like me and want to feel nostalgic watching a childhood classic remake, this is not the one.
This movie is the Space Jam. I don't understand why people hate it so much. It's good. It's space Jam. I don't think anyone involved is expecting any Oscars. Chill out people.
I can't believe I wasted a whole 2 hours of my life on this movie.
I liked the movie but it wasnt good as the first space jam 4 star for big chungus 2 star for tune world 1 star for effort over all 7/10.

Review title: Not a good film however you look at it
Review_body: Ok not go to see this film if you are a fan of Lebron James for whatever reason.This movie is over an hour of hour Greta he is as an athlete, father, coach, and person. It made me think Lebron only took the role to tell people how great he is.The rest of the film is just WB telling you how good they are as a company and showing how much stuff they own because of all their money rather than talent.Only part I enjoyed was when don cheadle becomes a 7 ft tall superhero for five minutes.

Yes Lebron is a bad actor, he even calls it out in the movie which was pretty funny. Don Cheadle crushes it and hilarious. Listen, people are hating on this movie and need to take a step back and see for what it is. This movie was entertaining. All Warner Brothers characters showed up which was nostalgic for me. Even Rick & Morty made an appearance! My Dad and I laughed throughout the movie.I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to help recover the negativity. I love film and gave it a 6 - not good for a film but for a family movie to entertain, it deserves at least a 5 or 6 with better reviews.On a family movie scale only with The Goonies being a 10, its prob a solid 7 or 8.Come on peeps, chill out. How could you not like seeing the whitewalkers watch some Space Jam! Haters gonna hate...Why would you not watch this with your kid?

It doesn't matter how good or bad this movie was going to be. There are powers that be and a specific group of people who were going to give 1 stars and complete negative reviews simply because it's LeBron James. They despise him, his stance on racial injustice, his influence, his anti-Trump views, etc. I wouldn't be surprised if they actually didn't watch the movie. At one point, this same group was giving "Black Panther" 1 stars stating ambiguous reasons trying to hide the fact that they simply didn't like a black hero having so much influence. I'll give this movie a 6. It's not a 10, but definitely not a 1.

Omg Idk much about LeBron James but goddamn this felt like an infomercial for him, and I'm only 30mins into the movie.Like every few mins is about praising his ego.Also script felt like it was written by some school kid who tried to emulate the 90s version. It doesn't work today.

Possibly one of the worst films I've seen this year.LeBron can't act to save his life, and it feels like the film was just made to appease his massive ego.I only gave it 2 stars because the animation was well done, and Don Cheadle as the villain had some chuckle-worthy moments.

A lot of grumpy people who need to share their narcissistic opinions so just trying to give the ratings a boost lol. Honestly I had a fun time watching it and I laughed out loud quite a few times. There were definitely things about the "algorithm" that didn't make sense and I would have changed quite a bit in the script but I know it's a kids movie so I just let that go and had fun. Also loved a few of the WB universe tie ins!Not sure if I would have spent money to see it in a theater but glad I had HBO streaming. Your kids will love the movie! If you're an adult hoping to have the same nostalgia as the original movie, skip it or let that go from your head before going into it. The animation is also an adjustment.(This genuinely comes from a Chicago Bulls fan/LeBron hater...give him the benefit of the doubt, he means well 😂)

Review title: Don't waste your time or money
Review_body: Painful to watch. LeBron acting stinks. Loud. I hated every minute.
A movie without meaning, completely empty, Lebron James is a terrible actor, his performance is a shame, a total waste of time.

Review title: I don't know if you know but the film is from the WB
Review_body: Not even in prime time did I see so much publicity. I would like to know when the ads end and the movie starts.

Review title: I'ts good movie to be sleep with.
Review_body: I can watch for the First 15 minutes, but after that it was horrible and boring story to follow. I just sleep until the end of the movie, waste of money and times.

Review title: Exactly what you expect from a Space Jam movie
Review_body: The story has believable parts at its core. The jokes were funny and there are so many little references; to the original movie, to Looney Toons, to basketball. A modern day fun, rediculous sports cartoon movie. I went in expecting althlete level acting, silly plots, and corny jokes. It was exactly that and more. Very enjoyable.

Review title: You can hate LeBron's bad acting but you gotta' love the cameos.
Review_body: Everything in the movie that has human beings suck but all the cameos save the movie.

Review title: GIANT WARNER BROS COMMERCIAL WITH NO SOUL
Review_body: The storyline to this movie was as fake as LeBron James' pitiful attempt at crying during the "heartfelt" bonding moment with his fictional son.Was this aimed at kids? If so the 100s of references to other franchises went over all the kid's heads. Was this aimed at the older audience? If so then for goodness sake have a decent story or at the very least be entertaining for more than 10 minutes out of 120.

This movie was just terrible. LeBron is the worst, why would they cast him. He has absolutely no acting ability, it is just painful to watch. The first movie was great, Jordan was great. This movie is clearly a money grab that has a story that is just plain stupid. Do not waste your time.

Good gravy - I can't believe people are giving this movie such a hard time! Did you actually see the first one?! It's great fun - some great lines, awesome references and my 9 year old loved it. LIGHTEN UP.
Why does LBJ haters keep writing a negative comment?

Review title: An obvious attempt to cash in on Nostalgia
Review_body: The story seemed very predictable except for a few parts. They included different characters from Warner Bros. Properties just to have them in the trailer. They made this knowing people would pay just to watch it and hope for nostalgic reactions.

The movie was entertaining! The plot was thin and predictable, but before watching, I knew that would be the case based on the first Space Jam. I appreciated and enjoyed the nods to athletes and coaches like Bobby Knight, Vince Carter, Bill Belichick, and so on. The CGI and visual effects were great. I respect the art. A lot of people are comparing LeBron and Jordan. They both are not actors so to expect either to be good is unrealistic. I enjoyed the movie for what it is and would suggest others do the same. Enjoy it. If you are looking for Academy Awards level acting, then this is not your movie. If you are looking for a fun and entertaining movie, this fits the bill.

Review title: A fun movie for the bois
Review_body: So this movie on its own is just not fun to watch but if you're friends and not really taking things seriously it's honestly a fun time.

Review title: Part 1s are usually better than Part 2s
Review_body: Good acting in basketball court doesn't mean it goes the same with movies. Atleast he tried.🙂

The movie is brilliant. The bad reviews as i have seen is from Lebron james haters for sure. It does not mean I like Him.the thing here is we are talking about the movie. The animation,action,comedy are all top notch. People are saying its not like 1996 you need to understand thats 1996 and this is 2021. Everything changed. Yeah for all those adults who loves old movies and says new modern movies s*** will do not like this movie. And people talking about logic and story. This is a cartoon movie, looney tunes playing basketball not a long marvel series You dont need a oscar story for this type of movies.just enjoy it.

We just watched this movie tonight as a family and it was a big hit in the house! I don't understand at all why people are turned off by it! It was funny, flashy, and had incredible graphics. Open your eyes to the fun of cartoon magic, it's meant to be silly and fun.
The intro video speaks for itself. Still chasing the ghost of MJ and aren't even close.

Review title: Better than I thought it would be
Review_body: Surprised with all the reviews. Like what did you think it was going to be!?! My kids loved the references to other WB material. And the video game reference. YeR Lebron sucks at acting. Guess who else does? All athletes. It was entertaining. Big and in your face.
What a waste of time. A pathetic excuse to see all old time fan favorites in a half blurry computer generated movie characters from warner bros. Gematria everywhere. F- -.

The worst remake/sequel of all time. Loved the 1st one. Absolutely gutted with this one. Story line was ashambles, made zero sense and tried to be to clever. The whole thing from start to finish made me angry.

Review title: Y'all trippin in a sad way
Review_body: To many people are criticizing this movie, and it deserves better so I'll boost my score from an 8/9 to a 10 and I don't like leaving reviews but feel like I'm a true fan of basketball and theater so I'm here to set the record straight, I saw the original space jam about 30 times in my youth and I shaped my life and damn near who I am as a person no lie. So of course I probably have a biased opinion but I have a feeling the people rating this film at a 4/5 are just wanna be critics and not true basketball enthusiast which is sad if you ask me cause some opinions shouldn't count, I'll also add I appreciated the dad jokes and work ethic vibes from Lebrons first main man role (by the way I'm a warriors fan). Anyways this movie was bound be a difficult sequel to even be considered as good as the original that said don't believe what you hear see or read about this movie it was made for and by somebody from the 90's kid era, lastly I think it's a strong/based on truth story that will be build a positive outlook for right viewer not to mention an awesome cast, check it out and appreciate that this was even a possibility. All love -cb.
It really is bs about cancelling Pepe Le Pew as a Looney Tunes character. Have to say I did enjoy the movie. Considering I've seen so many more bad movies.
Horrible movie nothing like the first one. Dont waste your time on this trash.
One star for Bron, one star for special effects. Btw Bron is a horrible actor. - From a Bron fan.
I think this movie ends the goat debate, Jordan is the absolute GOAT.

It was entertaining. Let's face it, space jam 1 is not a masterpiece, is one more movie,
just like this (2021)
Haters gonna hate as always! All these people giving a 1/10 rating for a movie just because of LeBron, they all need a life.

This movie is great from a kids perspective. The adults in the reviews are upset because the movie didn't bring them the joy that the original did without realizing that they were children at the time. Let your kids watch without your input and let them decide. My kids have watched 4 times already and love it.

Movie is funny and has alot of guest features that will bring laughs and nostalgia. There are alot of clever jokes made that has probably gone over the heads of people looking to decimate the movie no matter what. Most of the bad ratings are coming from people that hate Lebron James for whatever nonsensical reasons. Nobody went in thinking Lebron was competing for a Oscar or that Space Jam was trying to win an Academy award, if thats what you're watching a movie called "space jam" for than maybe you should get a life or a personality. Ignore the butthurt crowd and enjoy a very entertaining movie with a ton of features from the Disney universe.

Went in not expecting a lot, got a little less. Story was ok, acting was a little better than expected. There was about 12 baskets made in the 'game.' Could've used 'Newman' or Bill Murray, the assistant was horrible. Did enjoy all the Easter eggs.

I don't care what other people think I think this movies is a masterpiece this showed a lot of excitement and enjoyment in it and it show how adult felt about it when they were kids the watching first space and the first space jam was also amazing!

Review title: Warner bros what are y'all doing
