To say I'm disappointed is a complete understatement. Like just random change to jerseys, 50 point baskets 1000 point deficit overcome what was even going on in this movie.

Review title: Just a very bad lame and boring movie
Review_body:
Storywise its just the biggest bull.... ever and could easily be made up by a kid from 7 years old.Its wouldnt be that bad if the story was simple because its the looney tunes but its just bad and annoying just like the acting of lebron and his weird fake kid
The main villian who also creates most of the story is super annoying not funny at all and does not act well his robot friend looks like .... and aint funny. The goonsquad are very forgetable and you only see a couple of them doing a trick during the game and thats all. No soul no real chacter. All the cameos are not more than in the trailer just a flash of them getting by no lines no jokes nothing. Ow and half of them look like cheap dressed up comic con visitors not the real deal. The looney tunes are not in good shape. They only have a handull of real jokes in the whole movie. They get together (only all right part of the moment when they all get picked up from different movies) and than theres the game already . The game didnt had a lot of good action or exciting moments. Just a couple of goofy moves from the looney tunes but it doesnt really feels like they are playing a full game because the choreagraphy and directing is very bad. Also the whole part with the game looks way to flashy and fake with all the ugly CGI and all the real people badly dressed up on the sidelines combined with CGI characters just 1 big mess. The commentators of the game are 2 morons who are not funny at all and very annoying. The looney tunes look bad in CGI and made me sick but ofcourse they had to do it the lame way. If they just did the rogger rabbit and space jam 1 style it would be great but even in toontown they where to lazy to pull it off and made lebron into a cartoon. Ow and the music in the movie is bad as well.That looney tunes footlocker commercial they did some years ago and the other one with the monstarz both with blake griffin where much better space jam follow ups than this messed up movie.

Review title: Movie is so lame and pointless.
Review_body: The acting is so bad. One of the worst movies i have seen.

Review title: Lebron Haters Everywhere. Critics forgot how to have Fun?
Review_body: Keeping it simple.90% of the hate this film has received is Bron haters. Just read the reviews and you will clearly see the hate has nothing to do with the actual movie.The other 10% of the hate this movie has received is critics that have simply forgotten how to have fun. I see so many animated movies getting good reviews they don't deserve but this is apparently appalling?Stop hating and enjoy a simple and fun film. Is it great? No. Is it a 30 or 40 out of 100, Absolutely not. Pretty much sits up there with most other typical kid flicks.

The people writing these 1 star reviews are the weirdest people on the internet. They are grown adults hating a children's movie because either their racism or nostalgia is blocking their ability to logically review the film. Don't be like these people.This movie isn't Schindler's List but it is incredible for children - full of vibrant colors, cool sounds and an easy to follow along story line with an emphasis on family values. Lebron isn't Daniel Day-Lewis but is absolutely on the same level of passable athlete acting as MJ. If you're a DC, Matrix, Mad Max or any WB property fan you'll absolutely enjoy the references. It's a kids movie with the looney tunes, have some fun.

Just really lame, boring movie.Nothing to do with liking or hating Lebron.The movie was hard to sit through.Very few redeeming qualities, other then the graphics, story was weird barely made any sense even for a children's movie.Just one of the worst movies I've watched in a while.

Review title: Fun, Just Like Family Movies Should Be!
Review_body: This is exactly what my title says, it is FUN! It's what family movies are meant to be! Its silly, dumb, amd nonsensical and it WORKS! Watched it with my husband and little son and we enjoyed the silly jokes and callbacks that we as adults who grew up with the OG movie got! The music is good the characters are great, and it was a good watch!

My husband wasn't sure about watching this but the kids wanted to watch it. It was really cute! I assume the bad reviews are from people that hate Lebron. We enjoyed scanning the crowd looking for the Flintstones or Jetsons. The whole catalog didn't bother us at all!

Review title: How do they let movies like this get made???
Review_body: I'm not a fan of Lebron at all. I think he's a cry baby traitor. He is though usually a funny entertaining person. He was far from anything funny in this movie. If your gonna make a sequel to an original movie and make it similar to it. At least copy the good parts of the original. All the cameos in this one were terrible. They barely show the basketball players. They didn't have any funny random people like bill Murray. Then of course there's the problem with fhd story or lack of story. Just not sure how they let a movie like this even made. They're to worried about offending anyone they forgot to make s funny clever movie. I couldn't believe it was 2 hours long and didn't have anything interesting to offer. Please stop making movies like this if your not gonna have a good script.
Just another money grab/forced diversity. Another unnecessary remake nobody called for. Nobody will remember this movie a year from now.

Review title: I think this is a great movie for kids
Review_body: I feel like most people go off nostalgia, but I never like the original space jam, this is for kids not adults. This is like Teen Titans, people hate the new ones, but kids love them. Must watch for kids, and I'm 15 so I really enjoyed it too.

Review title: LeBron should just stick to basketball
Review_body: This could of been something g good but unfortunately it was just terrible!!!

Review title: Why is that WB doesn't know how to honor the first movie?
Review_body: I'm lost in words on how to describe this movie. The first space jam was amazing. When I first saw the sequel I was excited but with a small hint of questioning they're method of showing as many characters that WB has. This was literally Ready Player One, and Ralph Breaks The Internet again with all of the references to games and movie characters. It just too much, like really Warner? You couldn't think of any ideas for the sequel but instead of advertising. Like the part where the Looney Tune characters go into different movies, that could literally be split into shorts and put onto HBO Max. The acting wasn't really great and I'd rather have the Tunes stay in 2d as like the original. This movie hurts my head.
Too many adult moive references such as Harry Potter and it and even rick and morty . The bbfc should of made it a 12a. And loads of memes such as big chungas.

Overall solid movie and i enjoyed it, and the animation was great throughout the whole movie.
Horrible film, nothing like the original. Lebrons role was very bad and I would recommend you just wait until you can rent it at home.Very disappointed, and I'm a lebron fan 😪

Review title: Really enjoyed it and highly recommend
Review_body: Ignore the negative reviews, their from people who aren't familiar with space jam. As a sequel this was a great movie, really enjoyed it!

Not surprised with how bad this movie was. To be honest I never even watched this movie. I'm judging how bad it is through everyone else's review & what I saw from all the previews. So why am I writing a review? To voice my anger that Pepé Le Pew is gone & that Elmer Fudd & Yosemite Sam are no longer allowed to carry their guns. Also, to voice my annoyance that they changed the animation style and now all the Loony Tune characters look stupid. When will media platforms learn to stop fixing what isn't broken?

Review title: Stupidest Shi I have ever seen.
Review_body: Don't bother watching this film even if you are the biggest LeBron fan in the world.

Ok, in my mind, there will only ever be one space jam. This movie never needed to happen. Granted, i did chuckle a few times (cause the looney tunes always make me laugh) and zendaya is always a win for me. Overall, it was fine. It was colorful, and the plot was alright. I probably won't watch it again, though.

Review title: This was a great movie for me and the kids
Review_body: I don't care what other say, but movie was really good. The Kids (The true targeted audience) loved it. The low rating adults need to sit down somewhere. This movie was not designed to outdo the first one. I think it's a great addition to the Space Jam brand.
Me and the family enjoyed watching this movie. Very entertaining and fun for the kids!

Review title: I really don't understand why it's hated so much
Review_body: I really enjoyed watching the movie. Of course it's not gonna have the best acting or plot because that's not what it's trying to do. It's just meant to be a fun movie and it was. Honestly I think it's even better then the first space jam imo.

The acting and plot were sub par but I figured this would be the case going in. Lebron's acting was so bad I found it funny and I think that that is part of the charm of space jam. While some people disagree with the use of CGI instead of traditional animation I actually thought that it was quite good. The colors really popped and some of the animation really blew me away such as the Wet-Fire goon. What I'm most disappointed with is the lack of references or cameos of other Warner Brother properties. Most of the time characters from other properties were just standing on the sideline and while it was fun to pick them out of the crowd I really wish they had done more with it. I think the Lego movie did an excellent job with this and I was hoping for more something like that. Overall, I think kids would really enjoy this movie and as for me I'm glad I watched it. However, I don't see myself ever giving this movie a rewatch and sadly my nostalgia for the original space jam combined with the other problems I mentioned make me a little upset with this film.

Review title: It's way better than these other reviewers are saying
Review_body: This is a normal kids movie based around Looney Toons and Basketball. I did not see the original film, so I didn't have any expectations going into this movie either way. My family and I loved the movie. It was funny, and really enjoyable. Don't let the other reviews sway you. See the movie and decide for yourself. To me, it was definitely worth our time and money.

Review title: WOW these haters are really deceiving everyone
Review_body: THAT movie was a great family movie! Lots of funny jokes, references, and overall a great movie. I loved my family loved it. Really nothing bad to say about it.
Everyone keeps saying how it's "terrible", but my personal opinion is it was amazing && kept the kids && myself rolling. Better than the first one.

Review title: Good but Mj played in a better role than LeBrom
Review_body: I give this a 8.5/10 I enjoyed this movie but somethings in the movie I didn't like two things I did not like was the role of LeBron because MJ played in a better role because he was much nicer another I did not like was the plot of the looney tune at the beginning of the movie though overall I liked the movie it had some good cameos so that's why I gave it a 8.5 out of 10.

Review title: 10 Starts for the Characters not the movie!!
Review_body: The thing I loved about this movie was the characters that came to life.You have so many different cartoons in one frame and that's it.I don't hate it it's just for the kids to know how awesome our cartoon characters were!Rest the story and acting is bad.

Lebron is a great voice actor! He can use some work on screen lol but the movie as a whole was very enjoyable and entertaining. Nice writing, execution, and cast! I'll rate it 7/10!

Review title: genuinely is the only reason this isn't 1 out of 10
Review_body: I genuinely would rather see my entire family burn in a fire than watch this movie again.
It is a one time watch movie. You can see this on your free day. No need to specially take out time to watch this.
There are so many quality animated movies with great lessons for kids and fantastic acting now, and this isn't one of them. Don't waste your time.

Bow down, you are about to be brought before the KING. This movie is all about why you should love and praise LeBron. Forget about story telling, let's gather to witness the greatness that is LeBron. With a capitol G. This is a huge middle finger to the original Space Jam. Michael didn't have to shove his reputation down your throat because his reputation preceeded him. He's the best, that's it. LeBron tries to recreate that here artificially. He doesn't have the weight or presence that Michael had, so he's over compensating. Why make a second if it's not for story? Can Hollywood really profit off of such a failed story if they throw in some characters you know? Get ready for the commercial about LeBron that is space jam 2. Hollywood has become the employee that everyone hates because they hate their job and do barely enough to not get fired.

Review title: Space jam 2 is an easily forgettable movie.
Review_body: Space Jam: A New Legacy is ok. Sure it's a fun movie to watch with your family and friends, with cool animations, but the only reason I watched this movie was for the references of other movies/TV shows. And I'm gonna be honest it's not worth it. I had to see the first one before watching this because I have never seen it and i did enjoy the first one a lot! I guess i expected something great from this movie because of the original. I'm not saying i didn't enjoy it at all it just has a lot of flaws. In my opinion Space Jam: a new legacy has the same problem that Space Jam (1996) had. The acting. Both of the main actors were basketball players. And so their acting felt unnatural and it made both of the movies worse because of that. Also the story was really predictable and sort of a cliche. All in all just a movie I'm probably going to forget about.
It's a really fun movie to watch. Beside all non-sense plots, ignoring that its amazing.

Review title: Take it for what it is
Review_body: As a kid I watched the Bugs Bunny Road Runner show every Saturday morning. I know most of the episodes by heart. Space Jam is by no means A masterpiece; however, if you are a fan of the classic Looney Tunes cartoons, you will enjoy the Looney Tune references in this movie. It also has a lot of 'cameos' from various movies spanning the 1960's through today - off the wall cameos from old Warner Bros. Movies (not just cartoons) that see fun to spot. (Easter Eggs?).That being said, I took me, nephews, to the movies today, and my choices were Space Jam and Baby Boss. I was dreading either movie. Thankfully they picked Space Jam.I fully extended to hate this movie. If you can appreciate a movie for what it is, wait until it is released to DVD or streaming and give it a go.
Better than the first space jam, that one was awful.
Chill out it is a movie for kids. You are full grown adults with jobs and mortgages. This movie was made for children . Grow up.

Review title: Glad I didn't spend money on this.
Review_body: Good CGI can't save this movie and Lebron, I don't know what to say. Let's just say that acting is not in his future and probably should have taken some sort of classes.Really rough. My kids were excited to see it and 1/4 into the movie, one said it was boring and the other called it lame. I watched some more and eventually turned it off.This ones a dud and I love looney toons.
LeBron doesn't need the ego boost. He's already self proclaimed himself "the king" and this movie just show that a bunch of writers were trying to validate him. No charm. No imagination. No bueno.

The actor who played his son was authentic and great! Kept my eyes glued to the screen and not my iPhone! Would definitely recommend a watch!

LeBron's Acting, Like everyone else agrees is not Good, Like Michael in The OG I can see why since this is their first Time starring in a Movie. Ive even heard that Malcom has Plans to make a 3rd Movie Featuring The Rock which would be great, as hes had tons of Acting Roles.Overall, This was a Great Movie, I'd Definitely Recommend it.

Movie was cool Lebron can't act jus like Jordan can't .. people gotta chill, the original wasn't amazing either but I love it any way this movie was jus different soundtrack is cool, def a good watch wit family. People say it's bad because the nostalgia associated with the first one an it not living up to that level .. a cool black family who gets sucked in to the Looney Tune universe good lessons of being a father an also growing up being your own person .. positive message positive images of a strong black man doing well for his family.

Saw this movie in theatre. I did not think it was as good as the first Space Jam, however it is definitely worth watching! It took a while to get going, but once they started playing basketball, it got better. There were some funny moments and easter eggs throughout. I just wish it had more to do with the first movie. I thought Lebron did great and that it's definitely more kid friendly than anything.
As a 90's kid space jam was a huge part of my childhood. I loved the first space jam movie and honestly I love the new one too!

Review title: This movie is for the kids, and the kids will love it!
Review_body: I see a lot of adults complaining that this movie was terrible and then make comparisons to the first space jam, they are quick to forget that they loved the original because they were kids when they saw it, I'm sure if their parents went with them to watch the original space jam their parents would have hated it. This movie is a great kids movie and if we gave kids the opportunity to review this movie on here they'd give it a great review.I think most people reviewing this need to be practical, this wasn't meant to be an Oscar winning piece. Was it goofy? Yes. Was it fun? Yes! Was LeBron a terrible actor? Yes! But all these are the same ingredients that made the original a hit.All in all, take the kids to watch this and they'll love it and love you more for taking them.

Review title: It's not a documentary, stop hating
Review_body: Not sure why people are hating on this movie. It's fantasy and has many LOL moments and Easter eggs. If you think LeBron James is bragging, he deserves to brag; he's not called King James because it's a snappy moniker.Relax and let the movie entertain you. It's sweet and by the end James has an a-ha moment that changes his life view.
Great visual animation. A few comical references but overall fell flat, not quite enjoyable could have just played on my phone.

Now before anything else. This is not about Lola Bunny, I just want to make that clear.This movie just starts with a bad idea at the very start. An Algorithm wants to use LeBron to make their products (shows, movies, etc.) better. Question? Why LeBron? Why him specifically? Because he plays basketball? LeBron was right, that algorithm is busted.

It's cheesy, LeBron is a bad actor, it's loud and bloated, and it's a blast for the entire run time. This isn't a David Lynch film, what were you expecting? Anybody that's a kid, a basketball fan, a fan of the original, or a Looney Tunes fan is lying to themselves if they say they hated every aspect of this film. Yes, it's ridiculous, but it's just so much damn fun! Keep the politics out of it and just enjoy it for what it is...
It's actually so bad that you need to watch it. Just don't pay for it.

Review title: Leave your emotions at the ticket counter, this is a kids movie.
Review_body: These reviews I'm reading are amazing. People are upset about the plot being simple... give me a break it's a kids movie the plot neeeeds to be simple. And people are give it hate because they don't like LeBron James. Lol leave your emotions at the ticket counter get the kids together pop some popcorn and enjoy the movie for what it is. It's not gonna be the next Pulp Fiction or something. I know my daughter loves it and that's all that matters.
This is the worst movie i have ever seen it's boring and even more boring throughout the film don't watch this .

A great movie for the all family. It's funny to me that Michael B. Jordan was In this movie
LOL.
Already hate it cause it has lebron and I'm not trying be that I hate black people but lebron is probably one of the most hated NBA player and he thinks he's good that why I don't like him.

Not sure what film other people were watching but this was a really good movie. My kids loved it (aged 9 and 6) and it kept me entertained too (45).Ok Lebron James is not the best actor in the world but he was likeable and definitely not cringe-worthy. The musical numbers were great fun and got my kids tapping their feet. They were thoroughly entertained throughout, often laughing out loud, and we all came away from the movie buzzing.If that's not a sign of a good movie - I don't know what is.

Review title: Kids loved it - that is what mattered.
Review_body: My kids really enjoyed the movie. Thought it was campy and corny but fun. We all thought James acting was horrible but did not expect much and it did not make it less fun.

I don't know what people expected with this movie to evaluate it so poorly.The original Space Jam was only that good because of Nostalgia and originality. For a sequel, Space Jam: A new legacy tries do update itself but still go for the nostalgia.Bad acting? Check. Painful sometimes. Not much better than the original though.Bad Script? Check. It's basic, uninteresting and I confess I was just there for Looney Tunes. With that purpose in mind. We had some laughs and fun!It it a money oriented/ Advertisement movie? Definitely.But the tons of reference to Warner Brothers titles kept me entertained even when plot lost interest. People here say it's for 3 years old, it has the basic kids movie formula, but you miss these cartoons, you will have some fun along with your kid. Come on, this is no Emoji Movie. People shouldn't be too harsh because there is some love in it at least from the animation crew and it's visible.
Cant say enough things about how awful this movie really is.

This movie good in visuals . You will feel the nostalgia by seeing the charectors who made your childhood ,on a movie .beleive me or not it is a good movie it deserves a better rating .however there are too much advertise but they are ok and you will not get irritated by them . You can watch this if you want to watch a movie just for fun keep your brain aside and have . Nice movie for kids . Not for the persons who want to watch mature movies . It's nice movie when enjoyed with family {specially with kids }

Space Jam: A New Legacy is about a basketball game that the king Lebron James has to play to save his own son, because he has been catched by the ALG. In the middle of all this he found the looneys, and is with them that he plays.

If you grew up with the original Space Jam, this movie isn't for you. It doesn't even feel like Space Jam. Warner Brother's obviously wanted a quick cash grab and decided to make this along with merchandise to sell to the public. Look, this is a movie for kids who didn't get to experience Space Jam in the 90's and I think for them at least, it'll be an enjoyable experience. It has some good animation and a couple of decent jokes thrown in, but the story is lackluster and LeBron doesn't come close to playing his part the way MJ played his. Overall, for me being a huge basketball fan and a fan of Warner Bros, it was a decent watch. A nice family film to go see with your kids or your siblings. Original Space Jammers will be disappointed and dissatisfied with this iteration of one of their favorites, but as the title suggests, it's a new legacy and that means a new generation will come and find enjoyment in this film. I will definitely give it another watch someday, but I've had enough of it at this point. Decent film, good animation, terrible story, terrible acting. (Except for the Looney Tunes)
I would give 1 but there is big chungus.and big chungus is big chungus all pray to big chungus.

WB seemed more interested in injecting WB branded content into a kids movie than to actually produce a kids movie. Blatant nods to the DCCU, the Matrix, Harry Potter and stretching all the back into the 90's with Iron Giant.I stopped watching the movie about an hour into the film.

Review title: This was better than "Good" it was "Good enough"
Review_body: I'm grateful for Michael G(Goat) Jordan. I consider him the "Savior" of Basketball, an all-time great. Basketball was a dyeing sport and in comes this guy just flying and twirling through the air and taking down everybody like it's no big deal, all except his nemesis, John Michael Wozniak, his security guard. Michael paved the way for more players, more talent, more shoe production, more jobs, more money, just MORE. And just like anything we humans deem precious and or profitable to us, we want to keep it alive and keep it going but not only that, to add more to it.The title of this movie says it all. Michael left his legacy and movie for basketball and now Lebron gets to add to that. Just like the first "Space Jam," this one was just as nostalgic and silly.From all the trailers leading up to this, I was hyped, and every part of those trailers that got me there, experiencing it all made it that much better. Visually, I give it a 10. The Looney Tunes were still looney! There were so many movie and tv show cameos that brought out that nostalgia and smiles. Don't go in expecting to be wowed or anything. The acting was of course not the best but it wasn't the WORST. There was a heartfelt moment that Lebron had with his son which felt very real, so props to him for that.This is a great movie for kids and families..... so, Lakers fans.
Just finished watching the movie and let me just say...HOW tf do you include the Droogs from Clockwork Orange and Lucifer in a "kids" movie, but you cut Pepé Le Pew?!?!?!

Now i look around at these negative reviews: uninspired, apocalyptical disaster and overall bad reception.But in my opinion Space Jam: A New Legacy is a really good Movie!I thought the writing was good, although it felt really rushed, The different animation styles including the CGI looked amazing and the references just kept on coming. (SPOILER ALERT)From Pennywise to Rick and Morty to Batman to The Matrix, it was all very well done.The only problem I have is the corporate work here. The movie clearly doesn't seem to put much love into it and could feel a bit soulless sometimes. But as a critic, I'm supposed to look past my personal views and rate the movie the way its meant to be rated.Good movie, would recommend.
This was way too long and was so busy the entire time. Just constant advertisement. I'm on my way to buy some Nike gear after the constant advertising.

Review title: A Pretty Fun, Enjoyable Kids Film (Not As Good as the Original)
Review_body: Space Jam 2 Is a Really Enjoyable Film with some Nice CGI And Really Good Humour, Where this Film falls is the Characters. Some Characters are very Likable and Give off a Good Laugh but Some arent Memorable.
Wooden robot+Abraham Lincoln=Lebron in Space jam 2.

Honestly, I orginally watched Space Jam (1996) and thought it was about average and didn't have any expecations going to see this movie but boy was I WRONG! This movie absolutely blew me away. I love how it included different WB franchises we know and love such as Harry potter, DC, Matrix, Austin Powers etc and had some characters watching during the game such as Pennywise, Joker, Voldemort, Fred Flintstone, Mystery Gang, King Kong etc. But in my opinion, this movie nailed it with the plot, characters, visuals, animation and music. I also loved how the movie transitioned between live-action and 2D animation, this movie respected the original Space Jam and the original Looney Tunes characters while having a different lead in this film. The switch between Jordon to Lebron I didn't mind (also that scene with Michael Jordon in the film was hilarious but made me annoyed a bit!) but all in all, this movie really blew my expectations away and was definitely worth the money to see this. Great job to WB, the cast and the crew!

A film that was long awaited , it isn't a piece of art but it is nice to see. Any viewer who is not a loyal basketball fan will not understand the movie 100% because there are many nods to this sport. A very good twist that this film took, compared to the old one, is that Warner's world became more visible and in my opinion it gave it much more meaning. Despite the fact that Lebron is not an actor, he did very well. The CGI isn't the best but nothing too much uncomfortable to see.

Review title: A New Legacy Doesn't Drop the Ball
Review_body: Must a film be lauded by critics to be loved by the common folk? Must a film be a depressing tale of Oscar winning sorrow to be considered good? I think not. Space Jam: A New Legacy certainly doesn't add up if you think about it too hard, but is a delightful romp in looney goodness.

I came into the movie, with little to no expectation. Considering how bad the first one was and I was blown away by the animation. Solid acting job done by Don Cheadle and Lebron. All in all well done.

As a kid I loved the first Space Jam. I mean the Looney tune characters get in way over their head and challenge the basketball game to a bunch of small aliens and then they become amazing. This.... His son gets kidnapped and the only way he can save him is by winning a basketball game? Really? It's so unrealistic and it's just a horrible premise. I know LeBron wants to exceed Michael Jordan, but maybe he should stop piggybacking off of his successes and make his own.

Review title: Good where it matters, terrible where it doesn't
Review_body: This movie is great fun, not iconic fun like its predecessor, but still good for a laugh. Plot is terrible, but who really cares about that in a movie with LeBron James and Bugs Bunny playing hoops. I was however put off by James' acting a little, and whilst I L. O. V. E. D the references to other Warner Bros titles, I did wish they kept it down a little bit with the flexing and plugging and focused more on the Tunes.Review:Good writing in terms of character, it's genuinely funny at times. A big plus were the Tunes living lives in other universes, great concept! Strong music selection and visually the movie was absolutely STUNNING, I can tell where the budget went. It's just bummed down by mediocre LeBron acting and a little too much flexing and plugging.6/10, have a laugh.PS. I think there were some basketball fans in the theater because they laughed at all the basketball related jokes, so I guess WB did a good job there as well.
Most of the reviews are from people who don't like lebron already so of course I expect them to down play it lmao.

The Animation of this movie was fantastic and it Had some great NBA References and who knew how funny Lebron is. This is a great movie for people who like Looney Tunes or basketball lovers alike.10/10 Definitely recommend.

So much life was put into these characters through CGI and motion capture. The score was also fantastic through old themes and new.10/10 Sadly The Goat debate is finished 🤦‍♀️

Review title: Good movie. But it has its flaws
Review_body: It is a good movie but not as good as the original. Really enjoyed it, though i'm still mad that they removed Pepe Le Pew.. Also Marvin the Martian didn't even appear as a player. I was waiting for him to have more screentime, he just got like 2 seconds of screentime. Liked this movie, but it was not my cup of tea. I still would prefer watching the original Space Jam over this. Lebron James is not bad, but to be fair i missed Michael Jordan, he was really great. And i also miss the Nerdlucks and Mr. Swackhammer as villains but it's fine. A good movie, but not really a great movie. Another thing i kinda didn't like were most of the CGI models, they're all fine for me but Lola Bunny looks creepy and uncanny, i would preferred if they kept the cartoon designs for the Looney Tunes characters, just like the original Space Jam, or Who Framed Roger Rabbit.

There are 4 types of people that are leaving these 1/10 reviews: butthurt conservatives, MJ fanboys, Lebron haters, and people who genuinely didn't like the movie (the first three much more prevalent than the latter).Is this movie great? Review title: LeGoat James' Film Is A Slam Dunk!
Review_body: I was beyond astounded and impressed by LeFortnite James performance in this movie, as it's worthy of an Academy Award. It's also 7x better than JorFraud's performance in Space Jam 1. Perfect Film. 10/10.

Review title: Poor acting, poor dialogue, non-existent plot
Review_body: JLB is a good basketball player, and he may have done a better job acting if the script had been better written. The script could have been phenomenal if they had done a better job with the plot design. But the writers, director, and producers were more focused on money-grabbing that there is no plot, and the movie was pulled into too many directions.The father-son relationship was so skewed by all of the different things the writers/producers/director wanted to do, that the underlying tension between them wasn't resolved. As for the Looney Tunes and LeBron, there is no connection between them, there is no respect shown, no give and take in their interactions.As for Don Cheadle, he did the best he could with what he was given, but his performance was lackluster because the dialogue was not well developed.
And that is why Lebron James is the Greatest Player of All Time!LeGoat.
They tried way too hard. It honestly seems like he just did this for money at this point. Can't believe they watched this movie before release and were like, "oh yeah, this is the one."

Review title: Not the classic and I'm happy it wasn't
Review_body: Thought the film was great. Loved the story, the look and feel. Lebron's acting was on par of Jordan's so no need to compare. Gave me just as much excitement as the original when I was a kid... Realized it's not for my generation right away so wasn't hard to let go and enjoy a family flick. Overall gave it a 10 for fun story, cgi, classic characters, Easter eggs and overall good time!
Lebron is a great actor and this movie was better than the Jordan space name space jam a new legacy was very authentic and the storyline was great.

With new technology and a true lesson that needs to be taught, the new Space Jam feels necessary and futuristically fun. LeBron shines on screen with about as much charisma and star quality as any athlete turned actor. Well known characters and silly worlds allow for a family fun adventure that is sure to have the kids excited and the parents content. LeBron is sure to pass on an important lesson about fatherhood and remains a powerful voice for good after this movie.As a player, a humanitarian and now as an actor, LeBron has surpassed MJ in every conceivable way.

Review title: Not Great by any means - but very pleasing to watch.
Review_body: I will start this review by calling out the vital thing holding this movie back. Lebron James's acting. Now, to be honest, I thought he would be even worse than he turned out being. And for the most part, the writers did a great job of, almost, hiding his lack of acting skill, by not giving him to many emotional lines etc. But that being said, whenever Lebron did need to perform these types of scenes, it sometimes became hard to watch, notably at the start of the movie.That being said, I did find myself enjoying this movie. No, the plot isnt one of great twist, amazing originality, and amazing character development - But it didnt need to be. What the movie does well, is implementing good references and jokes without them feeling forced. Especially as somebody who watched basketball, i really found myself enjoying all the easter eggs during the game. Keeping me entertained and maintaining my focus.There is alot the movie does poorly how ever, but overall, im satisfied, i didnt expect them to reinvent the wheel, nor blow me away, but i was entertained and can see myself watching this movie again down the line. I feel it will have the same nostalgia factor as the original.

This is quite possibly the worst movie in the history of movies. LeBron is just trying to be like Jordan and this is a blatant money grab by Warner Bros to stay relevant. LeBum needs to move on and accept that he's an overrated guy who the league babies to make him feel better. Absolute dog water film and player.

Review title: Bring back a lot of memories with new ones
Review_body: It was really fun viewings the movie especially the Easter eggs and all the licenses that Warner brothers have for me looking this movie and the first space jam.for me Lebron James still need to learn a little more of acting but was great I really love the movie thank you.

Review title: It's a dumb movie but I had a lot of fun
Review_body:
I don't think that this movie is great, but it's no near the worst movie ever made
like 1 or 2/10 is an exaggeration. Not saying people don't have valid points but that I think the movie gets a bit too much hateCritically it's like 4/10 but for the enjoyment I and my sister had while watching it, it's 7/10
just like the first Space Jam was like 5/10 critically but for the enjoyment it has a higher score for meAlthough I must admit I've watched this movie not in English, I watching it with a Polish Dub and I feel like it makes the movie better, just like with the OG Space Jam I thought the Polish dub made the voices of the characters for the most part better, at least in my opinion. So while I heard LeBron isn't very good as an actor or that Zendaya doesn't fit Lola I can't confirm that since their voices were different.I do think some of the jokes were...not greatI can admit it's a dumb movie that isn't great and that there's a lot of things that associated with this movie that I can see why many people hate this movie so much
but despite that I just can't help but like it.

The acting skills of Lebron is also a must to witness, it's definitely not the best but as an athlete, he's acting skill is pretty amazing. The movie is filled with humor and inside jokes for basketball fans. Simply put, it's a complete package.

People just get mad that lebron is so successful (and well deserved). If you are thinking of watching this movie, you for sure should.

Review_body: It was just a boring corporate movie. There was no glits and glamour, it was just a boring slog towards the end.

To all the LeBron haters giving this a 1 star review- show me where LeBron hurt you. I knew this would happen. All the low ratings were predictable even before the movie's release. I guarantee most of the low ratings are from Right Wing Trump supporters who hate LeBron due to his political views. The movies wasnt that bad, and kids will like it.
A great job by everyone who worked on it. LeBron did a great job and stepped up to the expectations.

I thought the movie was fun and definitely enjoyable time watching. The thing about the first movie is no it wasn't good the plot didn't make a lot of sense and that's part of why I loved it so much but this movie wanted it to make sense and added that Lebron wasn't a good father which makes for an uplifting story at the end but I just felt like it wasn't needed. I wanted to just be able to enjoy myself while watching the movie but the dad dynamic made the movie too serious in my opinion. It is a pretty forgettable movie but I enjoyed watching.

Review title: Starts slow... but becomes a really fun ride
Review_body: The best thing about this is that it doesn't take itself too seriously. It's a ridiculous premise and yes, one giant Warner Bros promotion for all of its own properties. But none of that bothered me... because it's in on the joke, winking at us the whole time.The only real problem I had was there was way too much exposition at the beginning to setup what is a ridiculous and implausible premise that was going to be LOONEY to begin with. We could've had the same story beats at a snappier clip.Once we get into Tune World/The Serververse... this thing is a blast!Also, Lebron's acting improves greatly when it's for the sake of comedy. He's got great comedic timing... but he is NOT a dramatic actor. They spent way too long on the buildup... and I'm sure that's why a lot of reviewers have been down on this.But once the real fun begins, it's a truly great ride, especially for the little ones and the NBA fans.

Decent enough the kids enjoyed it that's what I care about. The original was god awful bill Murray saved that movie lebron just didn't have a bill Murray. Acting wise he isn't very good but I mean neither was Jordan. Animation was nice though. I can't stand to watch the original as an adult but I can enjoy the animation quality on this but probably won't watch it again.

Review title: A great return to the movies after over a year if lockdown!!
Review_body: Dont understand the bad reviews! A fun and funny movie with a great family feel. Lebron is great. Go and see it.

Review title: Great family movie with a powerful lesson
Review_body: I'm not sure why all these people are giving it such harsh reviews - it was a great movie for me and my siblings to watch; reminded us of our childhood and we also could keep up to date with the cultural references - lots of laughs. This movie wasn't meant to be oscar worthy - it was just certainly fun and entertainingGo and watch it and see for yourself.
It was really enjoyable. I say that it was a little bit worse than the original.
I have no idea why so many ppl are hating this movie(they're probably jordan stans, oldheads, or Trump supporters) but this movie was actually really good. The cgi was amazing along with the jokes.

Review title: What WB couldn't fit into Ready Player One
Review_body: This movie is bad if you are over 12yrs old. Not that the first was great, but this one is terrible. For one, it has nothing to do with space. The first 30 min is how much Lebron showcases better acting hurt on a basketball floor, than he does in a movie. The montage of rounding up the other toons is basically WB showing off their dvd library. The only realistic part of the movie is when the son realizes the Toons are going to win and he switches sides to be on the winning team. Classic Lebron James. Oh and don't mind the 100 or so Nike plugs in this movie either. They are not subtle at all. Just bad writing, bad acting and the majority is CG for some reason because I'm sure Lebron phoned this one in.

Review title: Not as bad as I thought!!
Review_body: This movie is nothing like the original for a number of reasons! The first one was set in a different time and era. We are in a world now where artificial intelligence is real and the video games are new norm. If you are looking for nostalgia, you won't find it. If you watch the movie with an open mind and not try to compare it with the first movie....you just might enjoy it.

Space Jam is easily a contemporary masterpiece. Dom James is one of the greatest written protagonists and we see this through his self discovery and the beautiful parallelism between Lebron and Al G Rithim, the antagonist of the story. Rithim represents manipulation and control in a world filled with fun and joy. It is also fantastic to see the development as a father in the modern superstar Lebron James. Truly fantastic!

Dame time, and Lebron thinking Michael B Jordan was MJ to save the day. These were the 2 scenes that made my attention span perk up.I know Michael Jordan getting sucked under a golf course to the Looney tune land is cheesy, but getting sucked into a computer to play a basketball game... I'm sorry I just don't understand why. Kids are going to love this movie because of the digital wow factor. But I mean they could have come up with a better story. LeBron should have stayed in Cleveland, because he doesn't belong in Hollywood.

I was all hyped for this movie for nothing. I guess the kid in me was excited since I grew up watching it but they wasted lots of time with this movie because it definitely shouldn't even get one star it's not worth the hype and yes has a good story line but definitely not a space jam movie and makes space jam fans all excited just to be let down.

Man, it's pretty hard to be excited about a movie with so many bad critiques, but after watching it I can confirm that it's mostly LeBron hate.This movie is very fun with humor for young adults like myself and I'm pretty sure that kids would like it too. LeBron impressed me to be honest, he was a very decent actor.My advice for other reviewers: stop being in your feelings so much and be objective, it's just a kids movie after all.

As a stand-alone feature I'd say it's pretty decent. The humor and comedy is great, with the cartoonish antics and the Tunes themselves in particular being a highlight of the film. The cameos and references to some might come of as pointless and/or shameless, but for me they were a highlight of the movie. If you enjoy Looney Tunes or any classic animation or that style of humor, then you will find plenty of enjoyment in this film.
It did not disappoint. Lebron was awesome and the story line was great. Forever a Looney Tune Fan!!! A Must See.

But when it comes to movies it's better not destroy your basketball legacy.He is right when he says in the movie he is a Baller and not a movie star.

I absolutely loved the movie and the story line!!! King James did an wonderful job acting!!! It is WORTH going to the movies to see! Don't listen to the negative reviews, go and see it and review it for yourself!

Absolute piece of garbage film, the direction was nauseous, the acting was minimal, and there were better effects in the dungeons and dragon's movie. Save your time and blow your brains out.

I didn't know what to expect originally but I think Lebron did very good for his first film. It started out a little slow but picked up in the end and was worth the watch . I honestly would give the movie an 8 but rated it a 10 because all of the old heads were rating it a 1 . Review title: Worst movie i have ever seen
Review_body: I made it half way through. It was absolutely terrible. I watched it with my 8 year old nephew and even he asked if he could go play outside 15 minutes in. His quote was, "this movie is annoying". And that was a understatement i carried on watching and i would have rather been at the dentist getting 6 root canals than watch that trash. So cheesey and annoying.

This movie is better than one star reviews. It's not a great cinematic masterpiece by any stretch, but it's fun and entertaining. Let's not pretend like the original was some sort of great film with great actors to compare it to. Watch it without expectations and you'll have fun.

Review title: An Updated better version of the original
Review_body: As far as kids movies go it's a 9 but cuz of the crazy hate and 1's I gave it a 10! My daughter would say it was a 10 though(she's 9 and doesn't even like basketball!) any one rating it less than a 5 in the comment section are just haters, and as Granny says "Haters gonna hate!" due to whatever ignorant and sad reason they dislike or hate Lebron. Lebron's acting is much better than MJ's, but leaving comparisons aside, My daughter and I enjoyed it, I laughed so many times from references or lines throughout the movie and those of lebron poking fun at himself via Don Cheadle commentary. Cheadle played great kids villain, much respect to him and what he did. 1st space jam was a really good kids movie. This one is a Great kids movie, not a knock on MJ(not his fault) Just CGI was amazing, writing was better, more entertaining for adults and much funnier than the original. Overall a great kids movie storyline. That will be this generation of kids space jam they watch. Best kids movie of the last couple years easily!!!

Review title: Haters just want to hate. This movie is decent.
Review_body: First off, like many others, I loved the original Space Jam - but everyone needs to take off their nostalgia blinders. Michael Jordan was a TERRIBLE actor. So for those giving this movie a hard time because Lebron isn't a professional actor need to get off their high horse. This movie is fun and has lots of personality.The negative reviews for this movie are stemming from the same nostalgia that makes original Star Wars fans so cynical about the new movies.This movie was entertaining and worth watching. Stop comparing it to the OG Space Jam that you watched as a KID and remember this movie, like that one, is for kids - not for jaded adults.
Just absolutely terrible and predictable. Plot line is absolutely boring and acting is just not worth a watch.
I can't believe how they make a movie with a person that acted so bad he didn't even try......what a waste of time !!!!!!

Watch the movie. You won't be disappointed. It's a family/children's movie. That's exactly what you got. All of the negative reviews should have been expected. It's LEBRON JAMES starring in Space Jam... The Jordan crowd can't contain their insecurity.

This movie was adorable. It was exactly what I was expecting. I was a kid for the original movie and was so excited to watch this one with my 9 year old. He was cracking up at the Looney Toons and got SO invested in the plot. If you're ready for Space Jam 2, it's a must watch. If you're hoping for some sort of a docu-drama about basketball then you're going to be disappointed. This is a half cartoon/ half live-action movie with Lebron James and the Looney Toons. Know what you're getting into. For a kids movie, it's great!!
This movie made me want to put my fingers in my eyes and swirl them around.

Review title: DO NOT LISTEN TO THESE REVIEWSS!!
Review_body: Most of these reviews are biased people... in all honesty. These are other adults who were kids watching the first space jam and probably idolized MJ. Now they over here reviewing this movie, most likely hating on the one who is in it, LeBron. THE MOVIE IS MEANT FOR KIDS NOT ADULTS. THIS IS A GOOD FAMILY MOVIE FOR THE YOUNGER GENERATION. I mean it really is just sad reading all y'all middle aged adults hating on a movie because of one person. The acting was close to the same of the original maybe a little bit worse to be honest. But KIDS don't care about acting, just like y'all didn't when you watched the damn original. Grow up people!! I liked the original better but to put all this hate on the revamp is sad. LeBron literally idolized MJ as well so I'm sure making this movie meant a lot to him.

Worst movie I've seen since the 90's. LeBron is exactly who we know him to be...a terrible actor on and off the court. This movie should be burned and never mentioned again....again, coming in second to Jordan...as he always will.
Probably the worst movie I've ever seen in my entire life. Can't believe someone thought it would be a good idea to actually make this. Unbelievable.

Review title: Haters gonna hate. It's a fun movie.
Review_body: Enjoyable kids movie. People hated on the original too.

Review title: Was excited to watch it after not caring much about it leading up to it and I was not disappointed.
Review_body: Fun movie, great animation, great music and the GOAT LeBron. Me and the family thoroughly enjoyed it. A bit cheesy at times but I guess you can expect that for a children's movie. Had fun watching it and was better and funnier than I expected.
Tf is wrong with people. This was an enjoyable kids movie. Just sit back relax and just enjoy!!

Review title: This ain't the 90s anymore; and that's all folks
Review_body:
I'm going to be honest here. From a future game developer, an artist and a movie classic appreciator.Space Jam 2 was legitimately a good movie.And before you movie credics from the 90s era that probably reviewed this and are upset by my claim. Let's get it straight, it's not the classic. But the classic was catered to us as kids. This movie, isn't made for us now; it's made for our kids. No of our kids know what it's like to sit at the edge of your seat while Michael Jordan dunks the ball, remembers he was the number1 pick in every basketball game. Still our kids respect Jordan as an athlete, but he isn't what wows the crowds anymore; the game has moved on, and new players are making new history. I really think that's what the debate of space jam is about. We had our space jam in the 90s. We had our looney toons in the 90s, the thing is... It's not the 90s anymore. Times change, and so do people.It's like listening to music. NSYNC, Backstreet boys, Metallica, Korn, Tupac... We listened to that music as kids. We loved it, and would roll our eyes when our parents played something like ready for the world, feeltwood Mac, Johnny cash; because those weren't what was now in our era. As we got older though, we respected our parents choices a
And we may even listen to them now and identify it as good music. Same as our kids nowadays deal with Jordan.The movie from a digital standpoint is great, the cartoons are fun as well; and there are so many things from WBs past that show up in that movie as Easter eggs. The movie takes a videogame digital twist, and the bad guys are pretty cool looking. It's what our newer generations like. And it's a mix with the old and new. Take it how it is, Space Jam 2 is a great movie to enjoy with your family.

Review title: Unbiased Opinion (unlike the rest of the reviews)
Review_body: The hate for LeBron James is crippling. The acting, humor, creativity and parallels to the first movie made it super fun to watch. LeBron had some bad acting scenes like the "hey siri how do I get out of here." but the best of LeBron's scenes exceed the best we saw from Jordan several years ago.

Review title: Crazy enjoyable, better than the original
Review_body: Incredible flick, Lebron solidified his legacy on and off the court. Looking forward to nominations, I expect Cheadle to be getting some accolades for his supporting role.

I'm honestly surprised to see so many negative reviews. I thought it was cute & the jokes were funny. We saw it in the movie theater & the whole theater laughed out loud multiple times & gave a round of applause at the end. A few parts were a bit cheesy but definitely not as bad as some of the reviews I'm seeing imo!

Review title: Great for what it's supposed to be.
Review_body: I don't understand you weirdos that expect an Oscar performance from a basketball player... It's a kid movies, it's not supposed to be a great film.
Branding woke trash....just more hollywood propoganda.
It's okay movie plus it's for kids and all the Bron hater crying over kids movie.

Just saw it in theaters for my anniversary and loved it so much! It doesnt have the same feeling as the first one, but it settles into its own quite well. I was so worried about it trying to hard to be the OG space jam, but they really don't strive for that at all. It's all the warm fuzzy nostalgia mixed with modern day pop culture.As an individual whom uses social media as a huge part of my career I can confirm the algorithm really be acting like that. The villian though isn't really the main conflict though, and he plays a much smaller role than most villans so he's not super fleshed out. It works for this movie. I also loved seeing the traditional cartoon style with live action again, who framed Roger rabbit was a favorite in my childhood, the live action toons were a little off putting at first. Over all great movie, would definitely recommend.
The reviews do not do this movie actual justice. The acting isnt great, but it's a kids movie and still entertaining. Also the original space jam wasn't "good" either. Like, it's space jam, Jesus.

This movie was an absolutely great family film. Lebron is a family man and it really shows in this film. This film has a great but easy story line to follow for kids and some really awesome call backs to old Warner bros classics for the adults.Jordan fans are gonna give it one star because they're stuck in the past and hate everything lebron does. It's a relatable story line for any father or parent trying to balance the art of listening and teaching their child to follow their passion with a plan and work ethic. #blackfatherslovetheirfamiliestoo.

I find that everytime a movie gets it ratings, that they don't speak for me. If they love them, I hate them. If it's "universally panned" I tend to love them.I grew up on Space Jam, and remember liking it as a kid, but I find that as an adult it's not rewatchable.A New Legacy is not without its commercialism or memberries. Its inherent, and so was the original.Its certainly a very time tested and true story. A father wants whats best for his kid, and the kid doesn't want to do it, because he has his own path. Yep, we've seen this before.But, I find the heart of the movie to be genuine, I find the performances of the actors to be believable, I think the cgi was very well done, and the pacing to be exciting and engaging.Its a good movie worth watching. I don't know what the critics and reviewers were expecting, but maybe... it just wasn't for them. As always.

The voice acting sucks, the actors suck and some scenes are so bad and cringy - I could barely watch! It's unfunny and most scenes are irrelevant for kids and extremely boring for adults! But hey! Review title: A Decent Movie to Watch for Fun
Review_body: I had a pretty good time watching the movie. I think some of the low reviews are comparing this movie to the original and many people may have a nostalgia bias. This film is definitely not meant to be taken too seriously as a sports film and is supposed to just be a cartoony kids film to watch for fun. I will acknowledge that most (if not all) of the live-action acting is pretty bad, but the voice acting was good and the animation was phenomenal (except for Al-G Rhythm's transformed design). Some moments were a bit cringey, like Porky Pig rapping or Granny being cool and sassy, and at times it felt like WB tried to forcefully shove in a lot of their properties. But aside from these flaws, the movie is fun to watch if you don't take it too seriously.
The CGI is horrible the whole movie experience itself was terrible a waste of money.

Seeing this was on HBO Max I came in excited. Growing up Space Jam was one of my favorite movies, and this has many of the elements that made the original so great.With the combination of Lebron's acting, and some predictability, I don't think I can give this a 10, but I can say I had a great time watching it and loved all the pop culture references.Many of the 1/10 reviews seem to stem from using a binary to rank the two Space Jam movies. The first is a 10, because they like the athlete in it better and it's the original. This one has to be a 1 because it isn't "as good". Why does everything have to be a binary? Can we enjoy things for enjoyment sake?I titled this zeitgeist to zeitgeist because movies are made for the cultural time period surrounding them. If you were hoping for what we had in the 90s basketball era, film era, and animation era you've set an unrealistic criteria and you'll be letdown. If you come in expecting a fun family movie with the looney tunes being looney and tons of fun Warner Bros film references you'll come out of this with a big smile on your face.We know Lebron isn't a good actor (sorry Lebron, your flopping in the NBA has proved this) but we understand why he's the right guy for the job. I hope you enjoy this movie as much as I did. More than an athlete.

Anyone that wanted or was debating on watching the new Space Jam movie, DON'T!Total waste of 2h. Worst movie I've seen. LeBron can't act for the life of him! My eyes hurt from rolling them so often. TERRIBLE!!The original Space Jam will forever be greater, LeBron will never be MJ and he needs to stop!

He is taller, stronger, and faster than MJ. Better rebounder, passer, shooter, more skilled, and a more versatile defender. He has the body of Karl Malone and eyes of magic. He lived up to the hype and exceeded insane expectations. He deserves 10 stars for the 9 straight NBA finals he made. He absolutely ran the eastern conference. Won chips with 3 difference teams. Wil probably be the leading scorer ever as a pass first player.

Ok, LeBron is not as charismatic as MJ but all the references to the Warner Bros universe are just amazing and fun to those that grew up with it. Ok, it's not animation and it's CGI, who cares all you purists. Just stop the free criticism and enjoy something. I literally created an account at IMDB which I've neglected to do for a decade just to encourage people to watch this movie.

Review title: Such a let down, but what do you expect?
Review_body: Crybaby BronBron is absolutely atrocious on and off screen. If this was made without him it would have been better. His acting is better on the court. The looney toons are what saved this movie from being complete trash.

Review title: Low ratings NOT about the movie. Lebron "Haters" found!
Review_body: This movie was decent remake of a classic. It had nostalgic moments that made the classic good and added a modern/new spin to it as well. People are hating on Lebron's acting?? Come on man! The dude wasn't going for the Oscar award. He was good as expected for the best "BASKETBALL" player in the world right now. I haven't given him the nod for the GOAT just yet- I still think MJ gets the nod for now... but I can smell the stank of Lebron haters. People... Rate the movie- not what you think about the person. This movie was wonderful, and my kids who just watched the original and enjoyed it, enjoyed this one just as much- if not more! Good movie. Well done. I would actually rate it a 7 or 8 but given the hate- I'm making it a 10. If you forget the unfair critics noise you will enjoy this movie! Good job Lebron, and all that put in the work to make this a reality 25 years later!

No it's nothing like the 1st and what film is, but using everything in today's culture worked pretty well. I loved how they threw all the Warner bros. Movies and toons together, and also seeing some of today's all stars in monstars forms. It seemed like it would of made more since to use LeBron's actual family instead of replacements.

Review title: Stop the whining and moaning - great film
Review_body: For those who have been moaning about this film, get over yourselves. I wasn't expecting a master class from LBJ, he is a basketball player after all not an Oscar winning actor. For the 2 hours we watched it was hilarious. Great call back to the WB studios IP, silly storyline but what do you expect when you are meshing cartoon with CGI and live action. Get over yourselves those who just want a reason to criticise. As a black man as well, I loved the authentic blackness of the film. Corny yes, but for me and my wife who are 36 years old with our 3 and 5 year olds who saw and laughed too, highly recommend. To the wannabe critics, get over yourselves.

Review title: This "film" epitomizes everything that's wrong with the film industry today
Review_body: Films today rely on quick plots, with little to no character development to draw in movie goers who'll spend their hard earned cash on some awful excuse for a picture, so that the movie studios can make their profit. They don't actually care if the story is good or not, just what will they get back for their investment.And that's what this film is in a nutshell. Not a single person who worked on this "film" cared if it's good or bad. I can literally picture them sitting around a table at one of Warner's offices saying "how are we going to steal their cash?". There's NO saving grace. The acting is awful, and that's putting it nicely. The direction (or lack there of) is just as bad. It's a directors job to push the actors to get the most out of them. However, Malcolm D. Lee evidently didn't care, as the final product is trash. Then again, what was I expecting from the director of Scary Movie 5? Oh and don't get me started on the "comedy" (palms face).Lets call this what it really is, a cash grab. I even took my nephews and niece (who're young) to see this and they didn't even like it. They threw Looney Tunes in there because hey it worked once, why not spoil an old films legacy like Hollywood loves to do with lame remakes.I feel most bad for Don Cheadle. This Is a huge stain on what was a respectable acting career.Please do better.
Highlight was rick and morty.Lebron needs to stick to flopping on courts, his acting is horrendous.Save your money...

Review title: I've never seen anything like this film, and I hope I never do again.
Review_body: This was honestly one of the worst things I've ever seen. I'd rather watch 2 hours of literally anything else.Not a LeBron hater, but this kind of made me want to be.

Personally I don't care about the LeBron, Jordan problem, all I wanted to see was the looney toons play basketball in their own looney way, this movie did exactly that perfectly, the 1st space jam did almost nothing with the looney toons (just note I watched the 1st space jam 2 days before legacy came out), Legacy used all of the character's perfectly, coyote being the mvp of the match no doubt, roadrunner doing a tornado, Lola doing her thing, grandma beating the heck out of Damian, the bird (forgot his name) dunking the ball which was amazing lol, I thought LeBron's acting was a bit better than Jordan's but they were both basically the same. Review title: If I just spread my wings!!!!
Review_body: I know the movie is set in the virtual space of A. I. but "Space" implies that there are going to be literal outer space influences in the plot... there were no characters from outer space and the plot could have included more up to date characters if we are thinking about the kids... for me as an adult I love the looney tunes characters but my son...i don't think he was that into it. But he loves Lebron so that was it for him... and I know I will get downvoted for this but the soundtrack for the original space jam was what connected it for me as a kid... I believe I can fly is a beautifully composed song. It made you FEEL! Thats what I missed with this one.

Trust me I've seen worse.... Definitely not at the top of my list, but it's not at the bottom either.Yes there were corny jokes, yes it's NOTHING like the original, yes lebrons acting is very meh and yes my KIDS loved it. They've watched it twice now, and it's kept them quiet and happy for a total of 4 hours now....any kids movie that can achieve that is ok in my book!!! They loved the looney tunes in this movie!I look at this movie as nothing but purely a kids movie and if your turned off by the previews and the reviews then don't watch it.

Don't listen to all the hate - it's actually a pretty fun movie! Lebron James is delightful in this. He's great at comedy and plays off the Looney Tunes very well. Don Cheadle is fantastic. Did Warner Bros try to cram way too much into this movie? Absolutely. But it's Warner Bros - they're not exactly known for making good movies lately. The villain's plan and the plot set up makes no sense, and I wish the other NBA/WNBA players got more scenes in this. If you're expecting this movie to cater to your 90s nostalgia for the first Space Jam, you'll probably be disappointed. It's clearly for today's kids. But overall, it's funny, entertaining and more family focused than the original.

Review title: Can Legoat be like his airness, or will he flop?
Review_body:
Space Jam: A New Legacy is the apparent sequel to the cult classic Space Jam starring Michael Jordan, but can this movie be a jam like its predecessor or will it flop like LeBron? This movie seems to understand what it's about, a silly kid's movie with Looney Tunes characters and the NBA's biggest star, but is that where the similarities end for this sequel? Unfortunately, yes, as Space Jam: A New Legacy just seems to have a lack of flow and consistency (like Khris Middleton). Whenever the movie seems like it's going to develop something, it seems that the scene transitions or the entire atmosphere is completely altered. This movie's pacing is too fast and nothing seems coherent, which seems great for a looney tunes short, but not for a feature-length film. The fast pace makes the movie seem lost at times with new characters being added for no reason and a plot that is easily
forgettable and, at times, unfocused. This movie doesn't make LeBron LeGoat or LeBum, just LeAverage. This movie gets a 6/10 😐

Just a horrible movie don't watch it and it had a lot of swearing in it to the point they bleeped out the swear words so the kids didn't know what swear words was said and that ... just a horrible movie at the end of the day.

This movie actually is terrible.This movie sent me to a dark place where the only feeling I could ponder was existential dread. I had read a review on letterboxd of a man who had seen this movie. The review itself was several long paragraphs that explained the despair this film caused him. The reviewers vocabulary and grammatical prowess was beyond anything i've ever seen for a mailman review before. My friends and I found this review kind of funny, being that it was about Space Jam. We decided we were going to watch the movie just to see how bad it was.WARNING:
IT WAS AWFULThis movie is 2 hours of burning hot garbage. I respect Lebron James as a basketball player, but he cannot act. The visuals in this film are jarring and overwhelming, even the 2d animation hurts my eyes. Throughout the entirety of this 2 hour film I could not retain more than 1 or 2 plot points. The whole movie was essentially a Lebron James and Warner Bros advertisement. I've never found a film that's more of an abomination than this one, I genuinely never wanted to turn off a movie more. The reviewer on Letterboxd was correct, I can hardly hear the word Space Jam without having a panic attack. The dread this film caused me is still effective days later. Please, don't watch this movie. Tell your entire family to not watch this movie. The only people that will like this movie are toddlers.THIS REVIEW IS NOT SATIRE.

Review title: Feeble plot, bad acting, no substance
Review_body: The first thing I noticed right away was Lebron's acting, which is obviously not his best skill but I thought: 'hey, he's a ball player so I can let that go.' His family did a good job despite it not being their forte either but I wanted to like Lebron more and I just didn't. He wasn't as charming, humble and comical as Michael Jordan was in the original so overall I found his presence off putting as much as I don't hold it against him.The villain... so here, they were trying to make it 'current' but they didn't need to do that. Really. Not every movie has to talk about social media and followers and gaming and be over the top with CGI. But for this movie, it had to be a thing and it all further bled away the hope of a decent plot.

People have forgotten how silly the original Space Jam was. Michael Jordan was a terrible actor. The plot was just as simple and full of plot holes. Do people think WB was going for an Oscar nod with this movie? It's exactly what it's supposed to be. A nod to the classic with a ton of improvements. We're so numb to effects today we've forgotten how far we've come from the original. The FX and sound were amazing. LeBron was way more animated and invested in his role than Michael ever was. The jokes were incredibly cheesy. But good lord people...it's the LOONY Tunes. It's always been this way. Watch this movie as the 10-year old that watched and grew up with the classic and you won't regret it. Watch it as an ogre wannabe movie critic who has no business watching kids movies, and you will be VERY disappointed.

Review title: If this wasn't a remake it wouldn't be as heavily criticized.
Review_body:
Looking at other reviews of this movie, I had a really good laugh. 9/10 people will say the acting was horrible, but let's get serious- it's a kids movie and it's being critiqued by adults who were children that watched the first one. Rewind, watch the original Space Jam, and tell me that Michael Jordan was a better actor (don't lie to yourself either).This was a decent movie, great for children, with plenty of entertaining bits for adults. The first 45 minutes was amazing, traveling through the "Warner-verse". To anyone saying they didn't laugh at all during this movie, you must have had a bad day. Sylvester and Elmer's intro into the movie was hilarious, along with many of the other toons. The Chapelle Show reference was also great.Does it live up to the hype? Absolutely not. Was it a cash grab? Absolutely. One thing is for certain though, the people criticizing this movie and giving it under 5 star reviews need to be criticized and critiqued themselves. If you go into a movie wanting to hate it or already hating it, why are you even giving your opinion?9/10 Animation
4/10 Story (it's a kids movie)
6/10 HumorThe story is very easy to follow, was missing a good supporting lead like Bill Murray to ease L. J. poor acting (He's an athlete, not an actor, take it for what it is). Don Cheadle did a great job playing a villain- and on top of that it's interesting that no one is celebrating the fact that this was a primarily African American cast. As for the plot, the movie also does a decent job at pointing out the complexities of having a career, while being a parent (wanting the best for your child while allowing them to mold themselves into who they want to be is not easy).All in all, I give it a 6, and a solid one at that. It's entertaining, fun to watch with your children, but not something you definitely need to see or add to your immediate watch list.
Good movie. I like it.Much fun and also good music.

Review title: Love these kind of animation but...
Review_body: The problem i have with good movies, is that every time they try to make a follow-up as good as the original, they always end up making it worse than it potentially could be (With some exceptions).The acting was not very good at all, and thats the problem when you put famous people in movies who are not really actors, just to make it more attractive.The first one was not a masterpiece either, its more a nostalgic movie for us growing up in the early 2000´s. It had some kind of sharm, something wich was far absent in this one. Since Into the Spider Verse i´ve been a huge fan of the new animation style some movie makers have started to play with. Its just pure fun and their creativity feels like anything is possible to create. But this just feels like the movie-makers had a meeting for two hours, and made it in just a week. The animation looks great, but they blew its potential.
I really loved and enjoyed this movie. Great job!!! 💪🏾🙌🏾💪🏾

Review title: It's not winning any Oscars but did you think it would?
Review_body: Look, this isn't a well thought out dram with character development and plot twists. But it wasn't trying to be. It delivers on the note that this is big, entertaining, and yes, sometimes stupid. But so is the original. I'm a 90's kid and I love the original space jam. When we all first saw that movie it hit all the right notes for the person we were at the moment in which we watched it. But it was also ridiculous. I won't ask you to rewatch it yourself because you'll love it again and again the same as me. But I challenge you, get someone who hasn't seen the movie and is generally on uninterested. Have them watch the original and then have them watch the new one. Understand that this movie wasn't made to behoove those who saw it as a young individual. This hit the notes for the target audience and sure the acting isn't great. He's not an actor. Neither was Michael Jordan. But that's the fun you get out of a movie like this. Stop critiquing it like it was supposed to be Casablanca. Relax and watch a fun filled, ridiculous, stupid movie and stop pretending like it ruined your day.

Movie is horrible. Acting is bad they tried way to hard to make this movie work and it was not worth it. Happy I did not take my son to the movie to watch he doesn't even know about LeBron James or Michael Jordan but he himself said the original is way better. The director this movie should of never made this movie reading the script. They should of left it alone the original was a great move LeBron is a great basketball player he should not try and get into movies at all he can not act at all.

In a world where people are incapable of creating original content, this was the WORST remake/continuation I've ever seen. It was free, and I want my money back it was so awful, please don't watch this movie, it is trash.
Great for the family story line is great for today's time.
The only decision worse than making this garbage movie was casting Lebron James.

People are really exaggerating in the reviews. Some ppl are mad over a literal BUNNY'S BODY. Some are mad over a character not showing up. And yes, Lebron's acting is a bit off but don't blame him!!😒He's a basketball player. I saw space jam about a month ago and saw the new one a few days ago and both of them were pretty good. This sequel though, I loved!! I loved the character's designs(which is hard to animate and ppl don't appreciate it😔)when they were 3-d form. Me and my little sister were on the edge of our seats throughout the whole movie. It was amazing!!!And to the people saying they were "sleeping" through the movie: Stop exaggerating. This is made for kids specifically so it doesn't really matter if you slept through it or not. I really dont know how u slept through all that energy😔🤷. It was good!
First off I'm not one To criticize movies I give them a chance first but this movie seriously WTF it was horrible from start to finish.
