This film is not worth your hard earned dollar if you do happen to see itThis movie is boring it doesn't hold up to the fun of the original it takes way to long to even show the Loony Tunes in the original it was 15min maybe even less to show them in this film it takes 30 minutes to get to the part of the movie that makes this a hybrid animation film in addition the humor is a severe downgrade this film just has referential humor oh here is a reference and here is one the point in the film where rick and Morty showed up made me wanna cut my head off it was so bad it wasn't even funny it was just like "oh a reference" no punchline no joke I see this style of "humor" in a lot of movies now a days and it scares meIt is an okay family film if there is nothing else to watch then fine if you are bored on a Tuesday and want to see a film with your kids then this is perfectly okay although they may get bored of it pretty quickly I viewed this film with a friend of mine and he got bored at the 45 min mark and started playing on his phoneI almost fell asleep twice this movie just sorta drags on until it gets to the basketball game the last like 30 minutes the basketball game is the only interesting part of this movie, the point at which buggs "dies" is also an overdone trope where you are baited into thinking a popular character dies even though it is super obvious to anyone with more than one brain cell that he is going to be okay because of course he is they have to make more films to make more money F&%* having original ideas screw though just use overdone tropes and overdone cliques this type of referential humor lazy film writing gives me fear.

Review title: A shadow of its former self

BUT it lacked character development and It failed to keep me interested, the whole movie felt like a giant Warner bros ad. I was so distracted by all the Warner bros characters in the background that I wasn't following the main story at all. Not a bad film but it really didn't vibe with me 🙁

Review title: Light hearted family fun! Great film.
Review_body: I absolutely loved this film! This is a light hearted family film and it took my back to my childhood when I watched the first film. I really don't understand what people are expecting?!? It had all the well loved looney tunes from the first film and it had all the well known characters from my favourite films and shows which I thought was a good take. Overall If your looking for a bit of family fun then go and see this. Try not to listen to all the wannabe film critics and see for yourself if you enjoy it. To be fair to the actors I thought they where brilliant and I thoroughly enjoyed it.
Not much else to say really. Part of my life I'll never get back.

Review title: Super cute and kids will love!
Review_body: Wow! These negative reviews are wild! Went into this expecting one big advertisement after reading reviews but this was such a cute and fun movie. Just allow yourself to enjoy a silly movie about LeBron playing basketball with Looney Tunes and don't take it too seriously. This is an enjoyable movie with adorable classic characters with a very positive message about father-son relationships and being yourself. Also, all this hate about Warner brothers self promotion... I just don't get it, they referenced old franchises that are classic and it was all in good fun, I don't think Harry Potter and the Matrix needs any help at this point...so I don't understand the outrage. Kids will love this movie and the looney tunes and Space Jam concept were very nostalgic for adults.

Review title: Don't believe the bad reviews, a good romp to watch with the kids!
Review_body: I was gutted to see the poor reviews here, and was a bit trepidatious about taking my 8yr old niece. I shouldn't have been, we both really enjoyed it! Really great music (hip hop, new and old), amazing graphics / animations, old school characters from my youth - bugs, daffy etc, Don Cheadle was really great as the baddie, and ok LeBron maybe not the best actor but i've seen worse actual actors! The pacing was great and i even shed a little tear at the end. We were both energised after the viewing and I would definitely watch it again.Ok bad points I guess shoe horning in every film / show Warner Bros ever made, but it was actually quite fun looking for the different characters from films gone by! I laughed a number of times and we were dancing in our seats.I only watched the original once and it was so long ago i can't remember it, maybe that's important so as not to tarnish watching this!If you can bury the cynic in you and go for a good time then you shouldn't be disappointed. Ignore the negative reviews here and give it a chance you never know you might just enjoy it!

Review title: Much better than what the reviews say.
Review_body: I love this movie, despite what the reviews say, it's awesome.I see people complaining about how bad this movie is, just because they changed a lot, but what if they didn't? People would still say it's bad.Whenever I watch new movies, I don't read any reviews before watching it. That helps me see how great a movie it is. I enjoyed watching it. I loved a lot, and I'm not a sports fan. I love a good movie.One of the reasons why I love this movie is because I can relate a little. The kid loves video games, he loves making video games. (has an amazing setup that I'm kind of envying), but his dad wants him to play basketball. I, on the other hand, love playing video games, I have fun programming, but my mom wants me to do "useful stuff" in my life. My mom tries to get me off my computer, but just like lebron, she doesn't see that I'm really passionate about what I do. Just let people be themselves. Let them do what they want to do.Ok, now onto different stuff.Some people have said that this movie is bad because they just turned it into video games, but they're wrong. Get with the times, old people. Video games and the internet are what brings people together (and apart). Plus, making it a video game adds more possibilities. Powerups, stupid scoring system, special moves, so what? That just makes the game more fun.Adding unnecessary cameos? Sure, as long as it's for the laughs.I know I have more to say, but I just don't know how to say it. So, that's my review, and it's only 8/10 because there are some flaws.

Review title: Why do you guys hate it?
Review_body:
This movie is 1 million% a masterpiece. Although I personally don't mind Lebron James in this movie, there's just so many good things about it! The soundtrack, the exciting scenes, the epic moments, and I'm also surprised to see some emotional parts in this movie, such as the halftime scene and Lebron reuniting with his son. However, I have one complaint. Marvin the Martian getting a minor role in this movie was something I wasn't too happy about. Seriously, would it kill the director if we, oh I don't know, PUT HIM ON THE TUNE SQUAD?? Aside from that, the movie was really amazing. The ending where Bugs Bunny was dying was really sad and actually made me cry when I watched this in theaters. Who ever thought that a looney tunes movie would have such an emotional and tearjerking ending? I seriously cannot watch the death scene without crying...
Overall, I give this movie a 20/10 and 1 million stars. And for the toons, thank you for being apart of my life.

The movie was really really hard to get through, most of it is a basketball game in CGI.Ok...so I've seen so many movies in my lifetime and I have to say, I can probably only count on one hand the amount of movies worse than this. Since it is under the (Space Jam) line of movies, I will compare it to the original. The original if its on TV, I will watch and remember the memorable moments and funny lines from 1996. This movie Space Jam a new Legacy, I hopefully will never have to watch again, if its on TV I will make sure to skip the channel fast. You seriously could not pay me to watch this again.Saw reviews talking about LeBron's acting, and boy was it bad.In conclusion this was a money grab that was rushed together. There is no creativity, its not funny, the animation hurt my eyes and the acting was probably the worst ive ever seen in a movie. The studio will make a lot of money off a rushed movie, and you would have thought they would try to make a movie better than the original but this seemed like it was made to be worse. I wouldn't recommend this to families, adults, kids or athletes. Yikes.

Review title: IT IS A GOOD, ENTERTAINING MOVIE!
Review_body: This is an extremely entertaining movie. This movie brings everything that the first one did, except only in a new coat tailored for todays trends and kids, so they can adapt it and assimilate easier and fall in love with the world of Space Jam AND the forgotten Looney Tunes. Just like we did in the 90s.The Looney Tunes are really funny. LeBron does a pretty decent job playing along with other good actors. The graphics are mind blowing and the action is continuous, so the film doesn't feel like 2 hours. The Warner world also adds a great nostalgic feeling to the previous generations growing up watching those characters.This movie is supposed to be entertaining and IT IS! Don't expect a complex storyline from a comeback movie, which has to resemble to its original, which also did not have a deep and complicated story. This is a Loony Tunes movie with some real life action and some basketball. Just enjoy it and be entertained!LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT!

Review title: Trying to balance all the 1 star ratings
Review_body: It's not a 10/10 but people are trippin on here. It's not the worst movie ever, it's not the best. Its more like a 6.5/10 It's a decent family flick. Yes, Lebron isn't Robert DeNiro but he did an ok job. The movie is a family movie, it isn't trying to replace the movie you grew up on. The movie tried to do something different and I think it worked out well. Try to watch it objectively and you won't be terribly disappointed.
I admire LeBron as a smart business man but this demonstrates that nobody bats a thousand. BAD directing, Poor writing and the list goes on...

Review title: It's so bad, it makes the great Don Cheadle look bad.
Review_body: You have to respect Kobe Bryant for forging his own path with the Oscar-winning "Dear Basketball". I'm sure he must have gotten offers to star in a sequel to "Space Jam", and he probably would have done a better job of it than Jordan, but the man had pride. I can't say the same about LeBron after seeing this movie.No one saying the original was better is implying that Jordan could act. I am a fan of Jordan's game, but let's be real, acting wasn't his gift, to put it mildly. The difference was the writers were smart enough to play around it. However, seeing LeBron trying to act is cringeworthy in the purest sense of the word. It's actually stunning to see such a horrendous performance (if you can call it that) from someone who must have had the most expensive acting coaches money can buy.Probably that's why the filmmakers made the decision to have LeBron animated for a good portion of the film, a decision plagued by another confusing issue: the animated character is decidedly lighter-skinned than the real LeBron. I'm opposed to the whole woke culture, but this really seemed bizarre to me.In short, the sequel is not only unfunny and boring, it's also obnoxious and fatiguing. There are tons of gags piled one over the other, but damn near all of them fall flat and they do become tiring. Not to mention the final showdown, the actuall basketball game, is at least 30 minutes long.I would actually encourage everyone to see it. Rarely, if ever, have I chosen to willingly see something this bad. It's an unforgettable experience. My wife concurs.

Because that's exactly what this movie is about. The storyline added no substance. Just a completely narrow film with all aspects on how great James is. I believe the only he agreed to this was ego and nothing more. Growing up as a Looney Tune kid I appreciated the incorporation of all the WB characters. That's the only reason I gave it a 2 and not a 1. Boring, all over the place film. Over-all, this has potential but never was able to "slam dunk" that potential.
The only reason this has a low rating is LeBron James seems to trigger the real snowflakes of the world.

I am surprised at all the negative reviews. I am glad I watched it with my son before reading these reviews. He enjoyed it fully & I actually found it funny myself. I guess a lot of people forget how Warner Brother cartoons were when growing up. Yes a lot is predictable, but that was always the fun of them. Would watch it again myself.
Kids enjoyed all the characters, it was fun seeing all the Warner Brother movie characters too.
This is a guide of how to destroy an all time classic half animated movie and beloved by everyone back in 90's.Seriously this is a trash by any means.

Review title: Lazy humor, self obsessed Lebron, boring story
Review_body: It feels like the whole movie was created by the Lebron marketing department. I wasn't aware that Lebron was so insecure that he had to praise himself throughout the whole film. The "gags" were old, unfunny and so cringe... I was hoping for so much more.Wasted opportunity, what a shame.
This is the first time I walk out of a movie! Don't go, not worth your time and money.

Yes, Lebron can't act. Neither could Michael Jordan, but that didn't make me enjoy the original Space Jam any less. The movie is still fun! I loved the pop culture movie references, the fun soundtrack, and the animation. I fully enjoyed the film.

The whole movie feels like stitched together short clips, like writers were sitting at the table and thinking:
"What is this character gonna say in this scene, what about that one? People, we need a dialog here, think think."
There is absolutely no fluidity. And majority of the things make no sense. And making Looney Toon characters in 3d was as cringe as Sonic he Hedgehog the movie 3d character. I know everyone is about CGI these days, but here: NO. Would have worked fine with 2D characters.Basically a pure waste of time :(

Review_body: It's fun. Do people know how to have fun? Not every movie has to be perfect. This is finally a nice distraction from 2020. The Looney Tunes and the live action cast learn great messages on working together and self acceptance. The characters had so many great lines and jokes, especially Daffy. This basketball game was a treat to watch. Love the references to other WB characters and the soundtrack also!

The man simply cannot act in any sense of the word unless he's on the court trying to draw a foul. The only reason it gets a 2 instead of a 1 is some of the brief but mildly entertaining cameos that aren't enough to prop up the film to even watch it a second time through.I would even go as far as to say this movie solidifies Michael Jordan as the best of the 2 on court, AND on film.

Review title: One long marketing vehicle for Warner Bros
Review_body: This film lacks the heart and whimsy that made the original so loved. It's simply a way for Warner Brothers to "flex" and constantly flash the names and logos of all the intellectual properties they own. Abundant special effects don't make up for the lack of a strong plot. And the ending is heartbreaking and pointless.
Boring and poorly acted. Nobody will give you back the time spent on this. Think it twice before watching it.

Review title: It holds up to the original.
Review_body: The movie held my attention and my 5-year-old daughter's, too. She loves Bugs Bunny, video games, and basketball, so the movie really worked for her, We enjoyed munching on popcorn and watching this movie together. It's not deserving of such low ratings and LeBron hate.The original Space Jam had a ridiculous story line and some of the worst acting cameos from athletes, but it was still silly and fun to watch.The new Space Jam ups the stakes with a decent plot and a villain in Don Cheadle who nails his role. It's honestly right on par with the original, if not better and more polished. LeBron more than holds his own as an actor, and while WB drops a few too many of its own "Easter eggs," it actually makes sense within the plot. There's no gut busting moments, but I smiled, chuckled, and laughed plenty along with my daughter.We'll certainly watch it again.

Although the looney tunes seem to hold there own...Lebron is still chasing the ghost of Michael Jordon and falls short yet again. Movie does have some laughs provided by the tunes but a weak plot and villains that didn't measure up to the monstars of the original. This movie has just tried too hard to capture the magic of the previous movie and with Lebrons acting it's just a poor movie. Wait on this one.

Just a 2 hour long commercial for Warner Bros. Lebron delivers one of the worst performances of all time. It looks like the basketball game was being played at low rent comic con. Shameless cash grab.

The only thing I liked about this film were the references to other Warner bros stuff. I loved the scenes where they were recruiting the looney tunes, and they had to go into the other Warner bros properties, like DC, DC comics, casa Blanca etc. That was fun . The storyline was very bland. I honestly got bored with it real easily. The motivation for the characters wasn't very convincing. It was very one note and cliche. So this is more of a "play in the background, while you fold laundry/do chores" sort of movie.
Hey guys, this movie is not that bad, my kids got the jam! Maybe its not our era, but it's our kids era! Thank you warner bros!

I found this movie to be enjoyable with plenty of laughs. Probably one of the better movies I have seen recently. My kids even enjoyed watching it. Review title: Very fun for the whole family

Review title: Not as bad as everyone is saying
Review_body: Behold, the haters have arrived.It seems everyone reviewing this movie on here has either forgotten that this is a KIDS movie or just wants to hate on LeBron James. What did you expect going into this?Yes, lots of kids movies nowadays (especially PIXAR) do a good job of catering to adults as well. This is not one of those movies, though the average NBA fan will probably at least enjoy the easter eggs. It's cheesy, corny, and silly. Going in expecting this, I was pleasantly surprised. It's a fun, brainless movie. If you expect to see an Oscar-winning movie, you're in the wrong place.No, LeBron is not a good actor. But I actually thought they did a good job maneuvering around it. I know how hard it is dealing with an actor who is not good at acting, and trust me, this could have been A LOT worse.The animation and art direction in this movie was actually pretty good too. Toward the beginning, the 2D animation is really interesting and visually pleasing. Towards the end when they actually play the game, it kinda just becomes a CGI smorgasbord, as one would probably expect going into this movie.The ending is cute, and it's a nice message for kids. If you're not a kid or a basketball fan, this movie probably won't appeal to you.I'm summary, I don't think this movie is a true 1/10 like a lot of people are saying. No, it's not an amazing movie. The plot is only average. But it's really visually pleasing and did have a few good jokes and certainly lots of kids will get a kick out of it.

Review title: Both films are good. Don't listen to the hate, this isn't LeBRON vs Jordan. It's two great films
Review_body: Space Jam A New Legacy is well worth a watch.I'm giving this a 10 star cause I feel this is getting unnecessary hate. Almost as if it's LeBron vs Jordan, and only one person is winning that popularity contest and it's not Lenron.Both players are great just like these films.So glad I ignored the reviews. Growing up I didn't know anyone that didn't like Space Jam, but even the original got mixed reviews to start with, then it became a classic. What I'm trying to say is reviews are not always right.Have your own opinion.Kids today will love this film, in years to come it could become a classic for them.People need to stop hating on this film and enjoy it for what it is, a great kids film. If you don't like or grown out of kids films, don't hate, just don't watch it!I don't want to add any spoilers but I personally loved all the moments of nostalgia I got from this film.My point is, if you like the original don't be put off by the reviews for this, give it a try.That's all folks!

I went in trying not to compare this with the original. That was easy because this is easily the worst movie i have watched in 2021.. it is just terrible!The acting it horrendous and the whole thing feels like its just a big add for Lebron James.I really just wanted to enjoy the movie but sadly it fell way below the mark.

Review title: Only worth it for the Easter Eggs
Review_body: The two stars are purely for the Easter eggs and other movie references in this over hyped and over budgeted "All that" Nickelodeon skit.But then again, what else would you expect from a Warner brothers project. A studio that has no idea what it's doing in any genre they produce.This movie is centered around a terrible "actor" in Lebron James and that terrible acting stands out when his entire supporting cast acts circles around him. I've seen better acting from this guy on the court during one of his flops.As for the actual premise... well it doesn't make sense either. At least in the original, the tunes had a reason to be involved in this movie. This time, they were just thrown in there for nostalgic purposes catering to the fans of the original. I honestly found myself dying to do chores around the house, than watch this movie. If I wasn't a father with kids at home and didn't have HBOmax, I probably would've never seen this movie. I wish I hadn't now that I think about it.

Review title: Good movie for this generation's young ones

This film is excellent. I'm not sure what these folks are talking about "the kiddos not being on the same page". This film has it all: drama, suspense, tension, basketball. In terms of cinematography, this is the best looking film out there to date. The sets: oh man, the sets! They looked so real! It's almost as if it wasn't computerized!Stunning, emotional performances from LeBron James and his actual (real) son. They really tug at your heart strings at every turn. I will tell my family and friends about this performance for the rest of my life.I can't wait to see what the Space Jam Cinematic Universe (SJCU, for short) has in store for us in the near future! That's all, folks!

Review title: I know a 6/10 is extremely generous but hear me out...
Review_body: Space Jam 2 is not awful considering its primary audience is kids. Now this doesn't mean that we must encourage movies such as this. But, there seems to be too much hate for this movie as some people are trying to analyze it as a serious film. It's not. The plot seems more adapted to modern day and frankly has more weight than the original Space Jam. Although it feels like a long WB advert/SNL most of the time, it still stays true to the over the top wackiness of the original. For a Space Jam film, this is extremely creative in many areas. Especially when Bron enters the 2D Looney world. Some of the best parts of the film happen there. There are some genuine comedic moments here and there whilst also having an important message about doing what you want. In short, parts of it make more sense than the original Space Jam believe it or not.Could the movie have been better even for a kids film? Yes. Was the length of the film too long? Yes. A massive chunk of the basketball game could've been trimmed out by the editors. Nearly 20-30 mins can be trimmed out. Was there too many WB references? Yes. Almost gets repetitive at a point. But the whole concept of Space Jam was one corporate crown jewel by studio execs to make more money. Will your kids like it? Tbf if they can get beyond the first 20 mins of drama in the film, they will have an amazing time.Both the Space Jam films are not good by any means. The first Space Jam had more charm and better jokes. The second Space Jam captures more heart and has better CGI. New Legacy falls flat on the jokes. Older Looney Tunes fans will miss classic Looney humour. And Le Bron has too much screentime taking away the opportunity for the Tunes to truly shine. Despite all that it's still entertaining in some parts.An entertaining mess nonetheless. It's a Space Jam film with a slightly better plot. Feels like a film which should've come out 8 years ago. There is a much better story hidden somewhere in the film which felt unexplored. But it's not a 1/10 by any means considering it's a Space Jam film. We don't look at movie logic or WB property adverts. Nor do we look at a basketball superstar's poor acting. We look at the jokes and charm of our beloved Looney Tunes characters. Space Jam 2 falls a little short here compared to the original. That being said, WB YOU SHOULD REALLY MAKE A LOONEY TUNES BACK IN ACTION SEQUEL INSTEAD OF DIVERTING THE ATTENTION FROM THE MAIN CHARACTERS IN THEIR OWN FILM!!!!!!Final verdict of the film: Less Looney, less charm, That's all folks?!

You would think that in times like ours this movie would be more diverse. The original was WAY more diverse in a time when it didn't need to be. VERY DISAPPOINTING. Also, the original is a much better movie. Don't waste your time.

I very rarely write movie reviews because I feel that everyone should approach each film with a clean slate and open mind. What entertains some might not entertain others. And don't get me started on "critics" whose opinions I rarely agree with.However I felt compelled to help counter these downright hateful and biased reviews for Space Jam: A New Legacy. I had a ton of nostalgia and remember loving the original as a kid. When I go back to watch it as an adult it mediocre at best and not good acting. I had my children watch with me to get them excited for the new one and they hated it so much they couldn't sit through half of it.However they have watched A New Legacy at least ten times and I'm sitting here as it plays on the TV yet again. It's targeted for kids and it definitely succeeds in that way!Some great things about the movie:
All of the WB references and cameos that the whole family will love. Harry Potter, DC Heroes, Scooby-Doo, Lord of the Rings, Austin Powers, even Pennywise just to name a few.Family theme. The storyline highlights that everyone has different interests and talents and they should be celebrated. Even if they are different than what you want for them. This is a good lesson for parents. In the beginning LeBron is trying to force basketball on his son, but realizes that there's more to life than basketball in the end.Modernized story. Instead of villains who possess players in their sleep, this story chooses a plot that appeals to today's youth. Technology and video games gone wrong.Looney Tunes. The Toons are so well animated and so funny! Their shenanigans are just as good as the first movie, arguably even better. Lola is a strong and fearless female. Bugs is great. Granny is hilarious. Wile E Coyote and Roadrunner are still going at it. Every Looney Tunes character is in their element and adds great comedy and entertainment to the film.Comedy. Even if LeBron is not a trained and award winning actor, he does a fine job of delivering those comedic moments. There were a few times I giggled, and several times my kids always laugh out loud.Minority cast. All of the main characters in this film are black and that is something to be celebrated. Representation matters.Feel good ending. Who doesn't like a good happy ending? There are lessons to be learned about family, priorities, empathy, and individuality. I can get behind all of that.Overall this is not a 10 star film. More like 6-7 perhaps, as others have said. But I definitely can see that, as anticipated, LeBron's haters jumped on the opportunity to attack him via this film's reviews. Even that is hard to understand, since in real life he is a stand up guy, a family man, a good father, a faithful husband, and is doing countless acts of charity for his community. I don't watch basketball, ever. But stats are stats, he's one of the GOAT. I feel bad for the people who took time out of their day to trash talk a KIDS movie because of their own biases.To those of you trying to decide if you want to watch this film, I say ignore the haters, give it a chance and an open mind, and make your own judgements. If you are expecting an exact remake of the original, it's not that. It is modernized and adapted for current times. Give fun a chance, you might actually enjoy it!

The first 20 minutes of this film talk about how amazing Lebron is and the remainder is terrible acting by him. There's a scene where he needs to be emotional and I'm embarrassed for him and his acting. One of the worst heartfelt moments I've ever watched. The first 25 minutes we get a ton of majestic views of LeBron's house and hear him go on and on about how hard he worked to get to where he is. It's not done with any substance or charm. It's just shoved down our throats for the sole purpose of exalting LeBron James. It felt like a cash grab and yet another example of James trying to match up with the legacy of Jordan, but failing miserably, and I'm not even a fan of Jordan.

Review title: Should have been called Space Jam 2

Review title: Haters wanna hate (cause this is for kids)

I had a great time! I also gotta say the this movie is visually beautiful, the effects were amazing the looney tune look beautiful with the 3D animation style. It's not the best movie ever, it's not amazing an incredible but it was joyful it was fun! I had a lot of fun and to me, that makes for a good movie. There are movies that are meant to put a lot of focus on, movies that are well Oscar worthy, attention to the story but this isn't one of those films, this is a film where you can just sit back grab your snacks, lay back forget about all the crisis in this world and have a great time!

Review title: Writing this from the perspective of a Lakers fan,,, but cmon now
Review_body: Look, i will admit I am a Lakers fan and therefore I support LeBron, but regardless, I liked this movie as a basketball fan. I will add the disclaimer that I haven't seen the original Space Jam with MJ, but surely after this movie I enjoyed the hell out of it.If you go into this movie expecting a great story... thats on you, you're straight up stupid because this is Space Jam. Enjoy the movie for what it is. It has great elements for kids & adults to enjoy. All these other reviews don't have the brain power to realize that. They didn't expect Space Jam to be Space Jam.I'ma leave you with this... this movie made me laugh and cry... and it had nothing to do with me being a LeBron fan. Don't come into this movie with expectations of being Inception, but rather a run movie that you will enjoy.

Review title: I'm a diehard Jordan fanatic but this movie won me over!
Review_body: Screenplay is phenomenal and the plot has an appropriate depth for a kid's movie. Only negatives I can think of; LeBron isn't lead actor material (maybe just yet). Director seemed to overlook this while shooting the family-centered scenes. Where LeBron really excelled was bouncing his dialogues off seasoned veterans like Don Cheadle and Bugs. We've seen from the film "Trainwreck" LeBron is already a much better actor than Michael Jordan. Editing team could've done a better job on that small matter. If I'm being super picky maybe we deserved a game winning block since that's LeBron's signature play. Outside that I had a really pleasant time watching this movie. The CGI and music combination can only be described as euphoric. Movie embraced its corniness and dry humor. Even got a chuckle out of me with the expected Michael B. Jordan cameo. Eernie Johnson and Lil Rel "basketball commentary" was undoubtedly the movie's unsung hero. Daffy Duck referring to Al G Rhythm (Don Cheadle) as a "son of a glitch" is probably my favorite line. Innuendo jokes about LeBron's super team building skills are more endearing than you would expect. Goon squad characters even brought their own fun and uniqueness for each member (in particular Chronos/Dame was an epic character) unlike the original Space Jam Monster squad. The film's digital conscious theme is so appropriate for a 2021 release. You've got Porky Pig rapping, Tweety Bird dunking, Granny out-dueling father time and LeBron James being trolled by Bugs Bunny, what more could you ask for? Ending is logical and leaves you feeling warm, what more can you ask for? In conclusion, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a vibe.

Review title: I wanted to like it... but
Review_body: The original wasn't great.. but at least was watchable. I could even go back and watch it today and it isn't terrible.This movie is almost unwatchable. From about 10 mins in I felt like turning it off but I powered through it for my kids sake hoping maybe they saw something in the remake that I didn't. After they movie they agreed it was horrible...It wasn't even worth the free view on HBOMAX. I feel really bad for people who spent money watching this in a theater. The storyline was bad. The acting was bad. You had no connection with any of the characters. I almost felt bad for Don Cheadle that he put time and effort in this movie as much as I like his other work.
I think this film is simple and comfortable for children to watch. I dont excpect much with lebron acting because hes athlete.

Space Jam: A New Legacy was a fun movie that kept me entertained the whole way through. The movie wasn't trying to be anything more than a light-hearted, fun, entertaining movie for kids, and it accomplishes that goal.This movie never claimed to be the original Space Jam. Giving low reviews and being angry about it won't bring back your childhood or your wife/girlfriend that left you. Sorry :\

Review title: Y'all MF'ers need to lighten up
Review_body: I saw a review that gave this movie 1-star because it was "an unrealistic premise." REALLY? It's SPACE JAM. Of COURSE it's unrealistic. Does this movie match its predecessor? In tone, yes. In story beats, yes. In special effects, A New Legacy WAY outclasses the original.LeBron obviously had some big shoes to fill. LeBron is not an actor, and he knows it, and it shows. However, neither was Michael Jordan. I feel like nostalgia speaks for a lot of people who think Michael was a better actor than LeBron. They are equally bad, but considering the circumstances they both had to act under - alongside imaginary, animated characters - they didn't do a terrible job, either. Honestly, LeBron's acting was better alongside the Looney Tunes than with his fictional family.Does it mean it was a great movie? No. It was a 2-hour ode to Warner Bros. Studios and its many properties. It was a cookie-cutter plot taken straight from the original. But the movie did enough different to make it its own, and kept it relevant to the time it exists in. Space Jam: A New Legacy may not be for those seeking a "realistic premise," but it's fun enough that it holds its own and makes for a wild ride.

Horrible would be a understatement for this waste of cgi film. Michael Jordan himself couldn't save this. This era sucks! Bring me back to the 80s and 90s when movies had potential and heart. Basically the whole movie is just lebron glorifying himself. Id rather watch water going down a drain.

This movie was awesome. Don't get me wrong, growing up in the 90s I loved the original, and this movie not only makes it's own stance but brings accolades to its predecessor. This is not a reboot and does not pretend to b, but draws on the original and builds upon it. I see a lot of people criticizing this for not having heart like the original, however, rewatching the original and comparing to the sequel, I would argue this had a lot more heart to it.The original, was so focused on how great Michael Jordan thought he was, that he was the only one that could save the day. On this movie, it was not only about saving LeBron's family but also about being who you are and pursuing what you love.There were a lot of great throw backs and references to the first, not negating the first movie. But there were also a lot of great references to the WB universe as a whole. Anyone who enjoyed Ready Player One could relate to all of the Easter Eggs and could see past the anger for the sequel.I get that not everyone is a fan of LeBron like they were of Jordan, however, unlike the first movie, I didn't feel like this was a LeBron fan movie, like the first was a Jordan fan movie. This movie had a lot of heart and I enjoyed watching this with my son.

It's a little odd when the movie starts, it's difficult to grasp the 'why' but once the game starts it becomes clear and the plot comes together in the end. It wraps it all up well, and I think I will enjoy it even more a second time! The graphics are truly incredible.

Look...this isn't the best kids movie of all time, but it most certainly is not the worst! I am a 90s kid and 100% grew up on and LOVED the original. But honestly, I don't know anyone my age who didn't. We literally used to watch this in school! Please remember this was back in the day when movies (especially kids movies) were not so readily available and at our fingertips. And of course anything that included Michael Jordan at this time was an absolute home run (unlike his baseball career). See what I did there....I feel like there are more Lebron James haters than there are Space Jam 2 reviewers.Keep in mind, this is coming from a now, mid-thirties, Space Jam 1 enthusiast, but I really did enjoy this. Maybe it is because I was with my 6 year old daughter, who I constantly observed laughing and smiling from ear to ear while chomping on gummy bears, but I personally felt very entertained the whole time. The filmmakers really did a great job stuffing in "adult jokes" and throwbacks to the original. Not to mention the bright yellow suited 'Mask' character....what a fun treat.In summary, is it as good as Space Jam from 1996?? This "old man" says no. But is it worth checking out? You better believe it. Even if **SPOILER ALERT** sadly, there is no Bill Murray cameo :(

Review title: Let's be honest about the movie 🍿🎥
Review_body: Let's start with the elephant in the room. Most adults want this to reflect the original Space Jam and are comparing the new one to that. That's why most reviews say something to the respect of "Not as good as the original" or "Lebron is trash and not a role model". (Liking his basketball game is one thing, but there's a whole city of kids that will beg to differ on the second) When You do that, you're already preparing yourself to be disappointed. Take all reviews with a grain of salt and realize the hidden bias that is naturally engrained.I was fortune enough to catch a sneak peek courtesy of the I-Promise School and Warner Brothers. I gave it a 7/10 and I'll tell you why without getting drug down into the weeds with this review. The movie starts off slower than I would of liked, but it's important in setting the tone of the movie. Let's be honest though, who remembers the first part of the original Space Jam, it's all about the basketball game. This movie does not disappoint. The graphics are better, the game is entertaining and if you watch and judge this movie on its own merit, it's entertaining for adults and kids.Lebron isn't the best actor, and some of the early part seems stretched and forced, but the kids are charismatic and in the end, it's a story about family and dreams.Try not to compare this to the original film because nostalgia has a way if distorting your perception.

Review title: It's better for every reason that is not Lebron
Review_body: Lebron James cannot act at all, any scene he is in he overacts or he does not believe what he is saying enough, youtube actors are more believable than him. There isn't much else bad about this movie other than the name of their little Warnerverse being called a serververse, Warnerverse is a better name. The advertisements are barely even noticeable, but the way they talk about Warner brothers and the way it is a Warner brothers movie is just discomforting. The movie is unrealistic in the way that their bodies disappear when they go into a virtual world, and they are just sucked in through their simple phones camera. Other than those things the movie is mostly fine, a little cheesy in some parts but what movie isn't.
Literally just a two hour ego stroke of Lebron, lazy writing and bad acting. It's just a non-stop advertisement and a watered down and unlikable version of the original. Don't waste your time.

I wanted to give this a chance despite my reservations. Growing up with bugs and the gang as a kid I had to watch it out of curiosity and was optimistic it would be decent. Sadly, this is a perfect representation of the Hollywood regurgitation of trash. The viscous cycle of "we're out of fresh ideas let's remake this" this poor movie is 2 hours of "we didn't even try". WB Should have named it something else because it doesn't even stand in the shadow of the original.

The best part of this movie was the Looney Tunes, and they barely got any screentime in favor of LeBron. He was boring and not entertaining, and I just wanted to see more of the Tunes wrecking other Warner properties.

This movie sold products and movie franchises from beginning to end. Hardly a space jam movie. Mentioning Warner Brothers studios several times is a horrible look. WHO CARES... stop selling ads and create an actual movie. Only highlight was a Bobby Knight reference that I bet 1% of all viewers actually recognized. Horrible acting, subpar character development, and skimpy plot. So sad to see Space Jam fall so far.

Nothing I was expecting from a Space Jam movie! Don't waste your money to go to the cinema, if you want to watch it, download it from somewhere or watch it online. I'm so glad I didn't go to cinema to see it!
Nothing there. That's it. Should have never made this movie.

My 5 year old niece wanted to leave in the middle of the movie. That's how bad this is. It's been made purely to fleece families of their money and shamelessly promote Warner Brothers - which it does in the most cringeworthy way possible. Maybe its time for the final nail in the Looney Tunes coffin to be driven home. Desperate to become relevant again at some point this century, Looney Tunes totally flatlines here and it shows how bad WB is travelling at the moment. Oh and then there's LeBron, who posesses the acting chops of an actual chop...

Review title: You know this is a kids movie right
Review_body: I see a lot of grown adults who were children in the 90s acting like they expected an Oscar nomination from this movie?. Its not gonna have great acting and it's for the kids to enjoy it. If you enjoyed ready player one then you will like some of the things they did with this. I actually enjoyed all the call backs to other WB movies as I grew up watching them as a kid as well.
You know it's going to be bad when the director of the original Space Jam hated the movie.

Review title: This was the biggest load of trash yet
Review_body: Everything about this was bad. The acting, the graphics, the script, and especially Lebraun. The movie is bad that it is a waste for anyone to even see it. I know some people are fans of space jam but AVOID THIS.

Review title: Felt like it was half baked
Review_body: Film felt like it had no weight to it. More like they just went through the motions of it and That made it feel fake. I'm usually the one that gets sucked in even on the worst of movies and can enjoy them but this had cliche after cliche.
I was excited to revisit Space Jam with my children because I loved the original. This is absolutely be the worst movie I have ever seen.
Maybe don't take my advice considering I turned it off after 25 minutes. But IMO this is a disgrace to the greatness that was Space Jam.
It's still really bad, but you will enjoy it a whole lot more. Probably the only way you will. It does have a few legitimately funny scenes, but it's a bad movie.

Review title: Made me want to rip my eyes out
Review_body: This sucks. I hated every single second. My quality of life has decreased upon viewing.

Review title: Not as bad as reviews suggest
Review_body:
We enjoyed it
Lots of Easter eggs from Warner bros and a unique story line
Good family fun.

Review title: Did not live up to expectations
Review_body: Michael Jordan will always be the GOAT, along with the original Space Jam. My children wouldn't even watch this all the way through, which says a lot considering they will watch the original in its entirety, and have multiple times.

I gotta Say Lola Bunny in this Squeal as more Character development Which I like and she Represents the heart of a movie For the audience As well building a father and Son moment between Dom and LeBron Visual facts hands-down by Industrial light n magic ILM Do a very good job on the visual effects on the CG characters outstanding and also I do love the soundtrack as for Looney Tunes they do What they're know best for The jokes in the movie Are very clever as for the villains very creative the goon squad they look pretty cool and pretty scary and threatening on screen I give this movie All day son Best movie of July and Summer of 2021.
Lebron already said it in the movie, "it's the worst idea I've ever heard", but, you see, nobody believed him ...

Calling this a "new legacy" is a pure representation of what is wrong with media nowadays, this has no soul, no passion, absolutely horrid, this should be considered a slight against the looney tunes franchise as a whole. This is offensive beyond recognition. Another unnecessary sequel to a beloved classic masquerading as an obvious hollywood cash grab. Do yourself a favor and stay far from this "film"

Review title: I didn't wait 25 years for this...
Review_body: I loved the original Space Jam, it's not the greatest movie ever, but people of all ages can enjoy it, I loved the silly storyline, and it wasn't solely focused on Michael Jordan. For years after watching the original movie, I was hopefully they would make another sequel maybe with the next NBA superstar of our time.In the original we got to know Michael's family and friends. Michael was portrayed as a happy, humble and as a true family man. Lebron, although realistically, was not humble, not friendly, not happy, and not much of a family man despite the movie being about his son.In real life, Lebron James is the most unlikeable and egotistical basketball player of this generation. Unlike Michael Jordan who was genuine, charismatic, humble, and didn't let fame get to his head, the same can't be said about Lebron. Please don't waste your time watching this movie, the story line is ridiculously cheesy, Lebron gets his son kid kidnapped by the villain who comes from a different dimension, Lebron gets lost in the matrix, ending up in the Looney Tunes universe where he has to team up with the toons to play a game against his own son to get him back.The movie is filled with lots of homage and movie references like many things these days because there's not much creativity in movies it seems or at least people who have creative ideas aren't hitting the mainstream. The movie was boring. Lebron's acting was not very good, seemed like he hardly tried. The voice acting of the Looney Tunes characters were fine, but so much of their dialogue went to waste. Zendaya surpassed my expectations as Lola Bunny voice acting wise, it wasn't like the original or better but it sounded OK. All of the jokes I heard in the movie, in my opinion fell flat, there was no comedic timing whatsoever. The only good thing I could think about the movie was the good CGI and animation.I think this movie would have been better made if it was either made in the 2000s or even in the future with a different NBA player. Choosing Lebron was a mistake.

Look, I don't like what LeBron James has espoused politically or culturally. That being said, for the most part my son an I enjoyed this movie. I would have given this movie a higher rating if it weren't for the distracting background actors who just keep doing the same monotonous stuff over and over. The graphics were on point. LeBron was actually pretty good here (hard for me to give credit here). But, the background crowd doing the phony cheering (read: horrible acting) took me out of the movie. There is a "Michael Jordan" twist that hits its mark. Also, the father-son relationship was compelling. Don Cheadle nailed his part as the villian. I just wish the producers had paid attention to the little things. This is a first, in that, it got all of the big things right, but screwed the pooch on the little things. The background characters, a motley crue of WB characters, were terrible! So much so, that it was distracting. Same moves over and over, terrible "just act like you're cheering and we'll cut you a check" acting. This could have been a great movie had they paid attention to the little things. That being said, my son and I enjoyed it as a little "boy time" together. Also, and I can't stress this enough, Don Cheadle is a truly great actor. He is the best part of this movie!

Review title: I love MJ over LeBron in NBA but SPJ2 is a Worthy Sequel
Review_body:
I love MJ ...no doubt He's da GOAT,and Kobe,LeBron is next in line along w/Kareem,Wilt,Majic,Shaq,Bird,and so on.But I have to be honest and give a unbiased review that makes sense,'cause I'm a movie lover.LeBron might not get nominated for a Oscar but he did a great job considering its his first blockbuster Movie. I'm sure he took acting lessons and put hard work and committed his time to make the movie and it shows.MJ had Spike Lee making Air Jordan Commercials and that probably helped MJ's early acting career leading him to SJ.But Lebron's script was more challenging, it contained a serious scenes, serious role.The writers needed little more work to make the plot work.Most importantly I felt the heart of the movie was there and that's what I look for and it was definately there.Animation,2D,3D,SP. FX flawless.It was entertaining regardless what other's are saying, and I Loved the first SJ w/MJ but I don't wanna compare them, it's a totally different Movie.It really doesn't make sense doing that ....
we all have our opinions and that's what makes us unique right?I always watch the movie by myself first, make sure it's worthy...then watch it again with my kids.I'll do that tomorrow.So don't let some review/opinon ruin your movie, see it for yourself,
it's Bugs and da looney Toons w/bunch of Humor!And Don is always brilliant! Enjoy.

Review title: I wish I could give it a 0
Review_body: Lebron cannot act in a movie. He is better at flopping on a basket ball court.
Great movie. Lebron did alright for a athlete and also ignore some of the 1/10 reviews cause most of them are Lebron haters and you can clearly notice it.

I went into this movie with low expectations but it was even worse than I imagined. Terrible acting all around, including from Don Cheadle which I think says more about the writing and set vibe than him as he's usually good. I'm sure it was hard to act across from someone as flat as Lebron, who throughout looks and sounds like he doesn't want to be there. Michael Jordan was no Juaquine Pheonix but you at least got the sense he was having fun like a dad in a home movie. Lebron's "Looney Tunes" scream as he falls down a cliff is pathetic. If I was the director I would've wanted to ADR Lebron with a sound alike, or perhaps get an actor to play his role and deepfake Lebron's face onto him. No matter how bad this would look it would be a more human feeling character. After seeing Kevin Garnett in Uncut Gems "he's an athlete" isn't good enough to excuse a bad performance anymore. Story is absolutely nonsensical - and I mean nonsensical, not fantastical. I understand this story deals with stuff that doesn't happen in real life but the progress of that story is so all over the place it's barely even there. We don't even get any good slapstick from the Looney Tunes. Animation was stiff, with none of the kinetic flow and visual playfulness you get from the original shows. Colour and line work look like it was done in Flash. The voices are off but I think that would've been less annoying if the personalities were there. Constant references to other properties were shallow and eye-rolling. The "Server Verse" and enemy basketball players have the aesthetic of a phone game. Warner Bros. Character surrounding the basketball court was distracting as everyone looked like poor cosplay versions of themselves and the extras were clearly just told to move around and look busy constantly because the crowd doesn't react appropriately to what's happening in the game. Also, weird choice to have the gang from A Clockwork Orange in the background of a kids movie. I understand that ones "for the parents" but if you've seen that movie you know it's pretty jarring to be reminded of it while trying to enjoy Bugs Bunny.
My family and I loved it, better then part one. Did not disappoint and animation was amazing.

Review title: Big LeBron fan, not a fan of this Movie
Review_body: So many things showed up in this movie & just made ZERO sense. Matrix? Mad Max? LeBron being brought out as a bad parent? Terrible movie & I am sad because I was hoping it was a good one. We didn't even get into basketball until the last 40 minutes of the movie. The animation on cartoons.... I have seen better graphics in 2012 & it's 2021. All around an epic fail from what could have been a good movie. Upsetting because it should have been epic. Maybe they should have collaborated with Sony & Jumanji & figured some stuff out but it honestly seems like they just pushed this out knowing it was a terrible take but millions would watch.

So much potential, i loved SJ1 growing up, even this New Legacy I liked all the looney tones scenes, but OMG why why did Warner cast LeBron, he is horrible, this movie was doomed since the casting!! So sad.

They shouldn't have even labeled this movie space jam, it takes away from the original movie, the mixed cgi and lack of a story line made this probably one of the worst movies I've seen all year, lebron acts better when he flops, on the movie screen he's a robot.

Review title: Absolutely one of the worst movies I've seen in a while
Review_body: Please, for the sake of your time and sanity, don't watch this movie.

Review title: You ruined a perfect movie from my childhood
Review_body: Screenwriters. Please do note that they need to be recruited, hired an well paid. If the screenplay turns out as a piece of human excrement please discard it and do not lose the viewers time. Producers, please, please, oh please, never work in the movie industry again.

My two sons, both under ten years old, watched this with me in the theater. Halfway in, my nine-year-old asked if he could use my phone to play video games and my six-year-old fell asleep. This is absolutely the worst remake I've ever seen. Please don't waste your time.
